Headlines: 'Pain Relief Ball' Cuts Opioid Use After Gynecologic Surgery
Teaser: It may be the new standard of care for postoperative pain control.

Headlines: Intradiscal Electrothermal Therapy Benefits Low Back Pain
Teaser: The therapy is an effective alternative to spinal fusion or chronic pain management.

Headlines: CT Scan Catches Life-Threatening Problems in Patients With...
Teaser: All 7 of the patients who died in the study did not receive an early CT scan.

Headlines: Breast-feeding Is Analgesic in Healthy Newborns
Teaser: Breast-feeding also seemed to prevent the normal rise in heart rate that accompanies pain.

Headlines: Aseptic Meningitis Cases Linked to Rofecoxib
Teaser: Recovery followed drug discontinuation, and rechallenge led to relapse.

Headlines: New Guideline for Arthritis Pain Emphasizes Earlier Treatment
Teaser: COX-2 inhibitors are now to be considered the first-line choice for treating moderate to severe pain.

Headlines: Magnet Treatment Had No Beneficial Effect on Patients With Chronic Low...
Teaser: A small study using one variety of magnet for treatment of low back pain had no effect on patients' pain; however, the researchers say that additional studies are needed to verify the results of this pilot study, according to an article in the March 8 issue of  The Journal of the American Medical Association.

Headlines: New Standard of Care for Painful Bone Metastases
Teaser: For palliation, single-fraction radiotherapy was equally efficacious and less expensive than multiple-fraction therapy.

Headlines: Duct Ectasia Linked to Mastalgia Severity
Teaser: The degree of duct dilation is associated with the intensity of pain, and the site of duct dilation is positively correlated with the site of pain.

Headlines: Radiofrequency Ablation Effective for Pain Associated With Osteolytic...
Teaser: Fifty of the 62 patients achieved a high degree of pain relief and 45% had complete pain remission during the 6 month follow-up.

Headlines: End-of-Life Care: A Newsmaker Interview With Judith R. Peres, MSW
Teaser: First state-by-state 'report card' gives mostly bad grades on palliative care, as many dying patients and their families suffer needlessly.

Headlines: Patient-Controlled Sedation for Colonoscopy Safe, Effective
Teaser: Compared with standard IV sedation, this technique was as effective and slightly safer.

Headlines: Morphine Mouthwash Relieves Pain of Oral Mucositis
Teaser: Compared with magic mouthwash, it was better at reducing pain and shortening functional impairment with fewer adverse effects.

Headlines: Pregabalin Improves Pain and Fatigue Symptoms in Patients With Fibromyalgia
Teaser: Patients treated with pregabalin 450 mg/day showed significant improvement in their endpoint mean pain score and were more likely to experience a 50% reduction in pain from baseline.

Headlines: Extended-Release Tramadol Reduces Symptoms of Chronic Knee Pain
Teaser: Filing for FDA approval of the extended-release version of the analgesic is likely take place in mid-2003.

Headlines: Opioids, Tricyclics Helpful in Postherpetic Neuralgia
Teaser: Patients preferred opioids, but both classes of drugs relieved pain without much impairment of cognitive function.

Headlines: Implantable Intrathecal Drug Delivery System Fights Cancer Pain
Teaser: IDDS controls pain better than comprehensive medical management alone, with less toxicity and increased survival.

Headlines: Diabetic Neuropathy, Gastropathy Respond to New Treatments
Teaser: Isosorbide dinitrate spray reduces neuropathic pain and burning, and sildenafil improves gastric emptying.

Headlines: Dextromethorphan Improves Analgesia After Cancer Surgery
Teaser: The NMDA receptor antagonist reduces postoperative pain with less sedation and reduced need for morphine.

Headlines: Newborns Need Better Pain Management
Teaser: Repeated painful stimuli condition infants to anticipatory pain and hyperalgesia.

Headlines: Epidural Analgesia in Labor Not Linked to Postpartum Back Pain
Teaser: Function and mobility were similar to those in women given other forms of pain relief.

Headlines: Aerobic Exercise Reduces Fibromyalgia Symptoms
Teaser: It was observed to be better than relaxation/flexibility training.

Headlines: Patient-Controlled Analgesia Linked to GI Surgical Infections
Teaser: Infection rate was higher with the pump, but a causal relationship was not established.

Headlines: Heat Better Than OTC Medications for Low-Back Pain
Teaser: Effect lasts 2 days after the continuous heat-wrap treatment.

Headlines: Manual Therapy Best Alternative Treatment for Neck Pain Relief
Teaser: In a randomized trial, manual therapy was better than physical therapy or general practitioner care.

Headlines: New Guidelines for Pain Control in Older Patients
Teaser: AGS recommends aggressive management, not placebo.

Headlines: Massage Better Than Relaxation Therapy for Fibromyalgia
Teaser: Massage was found to decrease pain and substance P, and improve sleep.

Headlines: Laser-Assisted Penetration of Topical Anesthetic Safe, Effective
Teaser: In a double-blind trial in adults, the Er:YAG laser followed by lidocaine cream significantly reduced the pain of hypodermic needle insertion.

Headlines: Teriparatide Reduces Fracture-Related Back Pain Over Long Term
Teaser: In addition to less pain, significantly fewer women who had taken teriparatide had new vertebral fractures.

Headlines: Electro-Acupuncture Effective for Anesthesia During in Vitro Fertilization
Teaser: This alternative pain relief method during egg collection is more cost-effective and requires less recovery time than conventional medical anesthesia.

Headlines: Half of Elderly Patients With Painful Neuropathy Receive Inappropriate Meds
Teaser: Experts advise physicians to follow recommendations set forth by the American Geriatric Society.

Headlines: Continuous Combined Hormone Therapy May Control Endometriosis Pain
Teaser: A prospective, self-controlled trial showed that long-term continuous oral contraceptive use may be appropriate for women with pain refractory to cyclic therapy.

Headlines: Magnetized Insoles No Better Than Nonmagnetized for Heel Pain
Teaser: In a randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled study, both groups reported subjective improvements in their symptoms.

Headlines: Muscle Training No Better Than Relaxation Training for Chronic Neck Pain
Teaser: A randomized controlled trial of dynamic muscle training and relaxation training showed no significant difference between treatment groups.

Headlines: Transdermal Ketoprofen Reduces Delayed-Onset Muscle Soreness
Teaser: Systemic absorption of this NSAID was minimal in a small controlled trial, with no observed effects on postexercise function or reported adverse reactions.

Headlines: Osteopathic Manipulation No Better Than Sham Therapy for Chronic Back Pain
Teaser: In a randomized trial, both osteopathic manipulation and sham manipulation were better than no therapy, but there was no difference between actual therapy and sham therapy.

Headlines: Peripheral Neuropathy Underdiagnosed
Teaser: Findings point to a need for routine testing, researchers say.

Headlines: Radiographs as Good as MRI for Most Patients With Low Back Pain
Teaser: Magnetic resonance imaging increases the cost by increasing the number of spine operations, but the outcomes are the same for both imaging procedures.

Headlines: Spinal Manipulation Better Than Sham Therapies for Low Back Pain
Teaser: This technique is neither better nor worse than conventional treatments, and massage therapy may be the only manual therapy to lower healthcare costs.

Headlines: Manual Therapy Best for Neck Pain
Teaser: Low-velocity passive range of motion technique was both more effective and more cost-effective than traditional physiotherapy or general practitioner care.

Headlines: Capsaicin Patch Eases Postherpetic Neuralgia Pain
Teaser: A one-hour application reduced the pain by 33% for up to one month, according to a presentation at the American Academy of Neurology 55th annual meeting.

Headlines: Levorphanol Effective in Neuropathic Pain
Teaser: Countering the opinion that neuropathic pain is opioid-resistant, higher doses of this mu agonist are more effective, but the benefit is limited by more adverse effects.

Headlines: Gabapentin Plus Valacyclovir Effective for Management of Acute Zoster Pain
Teaser: Researchers report efficacy and tolerability at lower doses of gabapentin than has previously been seen.

Headlines: Pain is Undertreated in ESRD Patients
Teaser: Preliminary data show that one-third of ESRD patients are in "severe" pain.

Headlines: Alpha-Lipoic Acid Helpful in Diabetic Neuropathy
Teaser: This antioxidant rapidly and significantly reduced neuropathic sensory symptoms and pain in a double-blind trial.

Headlines: Synvisc and Corticosteroid Injections Equally Effective for Knee OA
Teaser: But both treatments received a significantly worse response in women compared with men.

Headlines: Steroid Injections Safe, Effective Long-term in Knee Osteoarthritis
Teaser: Over two years, this treatment for pain management had no apparent deleterious effects in a randomized, double-blind trial.

Headlines: Vioxx Pulled From Global Market
Teaser: Merck & Co., Inc., has announced a voluntary withdrawal of rofecoxib (Vioxx) from the U.S. and worldwide market due to safety concerns of an increased risk of cardiovascular events, including heart attack and stroke.

Headlines: Effectiveness of Topical NSAIDs in Osteoarthritis Limited to 2 Weeks
Teaser: Topical NSAIDs are less effective than oral NSAIDs in the first week, equal to placebo at one month.

Headlines: RF Ablation Followed by Bone Cement Injection Relieves Pain, Achieves...
Teaser: One week after radiofrequency ablation followed by vertebroplasty with bone cement, all patients with refractory pain reported reduced pain scores.

Headlines: Lidocaine Patch Safe and Effective for Diabetic Neuropathic Pain
Teaser: The patch reduces pain, improves quality of life, and may allow tapering of other pain medication.

Headlines: Pregabalin May Be Helpful in Postherpetic Neuralgia
Teaser: In a randomized trial, this drug reduced pain and improved sleep and mood disturbances; however, it is not yet approved by the FDA.

Headlines: Pain Control: A Newsmaker Interview With James N. Thompson, MD
Teaser: The Federation of State Medical Boards recommends that undertreatment of pain be considered a practice violation similar to overtreatment.

Headlines: Transdermal Analgesia Equivalent to IV Morphine
Teaser: A randomized trial demonstrates that patient-controlled analgesia (PCA) with fentanyl provides postsurgical pain control equivalent to that of a standard intravenous morphine PCA pump regimen.

Headlines: Steroid Injections No Better Than Placebo for Back Pain
Teaser: A Canadian study showed no difference in outcomes between the two groups at any time on any of the measures.

Headlines: Prosthetic Disc Replacement May Be Better Than Fusion
Teaser: At one year, patient satisfaction and range of motion in the prosthetic disc group were significantly higher, but commentators have reservations.

Headlines: Transdermal Fentanyl Not as Constipating as Other Long-Duration Opioids
Teaser: In a retrospective study, patients receiving this drug had a lower risk of developing constipation compared with those receiving oxycodone CR or morphine CR.

Headlines: Celiac Block Reduces Pain of Pancreatic Cancer
Teaser: In a randomized trial, this procedure did not improve quality of life or survival.

Headlines: Dexamethasone Offers Short-term Pain Relief in Mononucleosis
Teaser: Based on a randomized, double-blind trial, more than one dose may be needed to relieve sore throat pain, but this benefit may not surpass the potential risk.

Headlines: Valproic Acid Not Effective for Polyneuropathic Pain
Teaser: Total pain ratings in the valproic acid and placebo groups at week 4 were similar.

Headlines: Mepartricin Helpful in Chronic Pelvic Pain Syndrome
Teaser: In a randomized controlled trial, this drug significantly improved symptoms; the effect may be related to the drug's role in decreasing estrogen levels and their concentration in the prostate.

Headlines: IV Lidocaine Helpful for Mechanical Allodynia
Teaser: Modality-specific antihyperalgesic effects of this drug suggest that patients with pain from peripheral nerve injury may respond to local anesthetics and other sodium-channel blockers.

Headlines: Intrathecal Ziconotide Effective in Treating Pain From Cancer or AIDS
Teaser: In a randomized controlled trial, half of patients responded to this therapy compared with 17.5% of the placebo group.

Headlines: Self-Management Helpful for Low Back Pain
Teaser: In a randomized trial, group classes, exercise sheet handouts, and telephone follow-up helped inner-city patients manage their pain and improve function.

Headlines: Fire, Extreme Heat Potential Risks in Anesthesia Machines With...
Teaser: Use of a dessicated carbon dioxide absorbent is linked to fire or extreme heat in the respiratory circuit of anesthesia machines.

Headlines: Medium-Firm Mattress May Improve Low-Back Pain
Teaser: Results of a new study challenge the conventional wisdom that a firm mattress will improve back pain.

Headlines: Perioperative COX-2 Inhibitors Improve Outcome of Knee Replacement Surgery
Teaser: In a randomized controlled trial, rofecoxib significantly reduced pain, analgesic use, and sleep disturbances, and increased postoperative range of motion.

Headlines: Peri-articular Analgesia Injection Gives Significant Pain Control in...
Teaser: A randomized trial showed postoperative benefits for up to 24 hours.

Headlines: International Drug Alerts: COX-2 Inhibitors and Co-proxamol
Teaser: The European Union has restricted the use of celecoxib (Celebrex), valdecoxib (Bextra), parecoxib (Dynastat), lumiracoxib (Prexige), and etoricoxib (Arcoxia) in the European Union; the United Kingdom has approved the gradual withdrawal of a paracetamol plus dextropropoxyphene product (Co-proxamol) from the market.

Headlines: Three Pivotal Trials of COX-2 Inhibitors Released Early by NEJM
Teaser: The APPROVe trial led to the withdrawal of Vioxx, the APC trial led to modified warnings and use of Celebrex, and the third study showed similar harm for valdecoxib and parecoxib.

Headlines: First-Time Generic Approvals: Climara, Duragesic, Levaquin
Teaser: The FDA has approved first-time generic formulations of 0.025 mg/day and 0.075 mg/day estradiol transdermal systems (Climara); 25, 50, 75, and 100 mcg/hour fentanyl transdermal systems (Duragesic); and 750 mg levofloxacin tablets (Levaquin).

Headlines: FDA Approvals: Doxil, Lower-Dose Duragesic, Eloxatin
Teaser: The FDA has approved a revised indication for doxorubicin HCl liposome injection (Doxil), a lower-dose fentanyl transdermal system (Duragesic 12-mcg/hour), and an aqueous solution formulation of oxaliplatin for injection (Eloxatin).

Headlines: FDA Approvals: Procedur Syringes, 10" ON-Q Soaker, Genesis RC and  RC Dual
Teaser: The FDA has approved two specialty syringes (Procedur-10 and Procedur-SF), a 10-inch version of the ON-Q Soaker catheter, two rechargeable spinal cord stimulation systems (Genesis RC and Genesis RC Dual), and a more powerful version of the Freezor cardiac cryoablation catheter (Freezor MAX).

Headlines: Orthoses May Not Reduce Risk of Weight Bearing-Induced Back Pain
Teaser: The results of this randomized trial in infantry recruits do not support the use of orthoses, either custom soft or semirigid biomechanical, as prophylactic treatment.

Headlines: International Approvals: Once-Daily Tramadol, Enbrel, Freezor
Teaser: France has approved a once-daily formulation of tramadol; Japan has approved etanercept (Enbrel); and the People's Republic of China has approved a cryoablation system (Freezor).

Headlines: Rofecoxib Increases Risk for Acute MI; Higher Doses Further Increase Risk
Teaser: In a retrospective population study of more than 100,000 elderly persons, aspirin ameliorated the effect for lower doses of rofecoxib; celecoxib, naproxen, and other NSAIDs did not increase risk.

Headlines: More Evidence on Cardiovascular Risks of COX-2 Inhibitors, Other NSAIDs
Teaser: Four studies in the Archives of Internal Medicine shed new light on the cardiovascular risks of both groups of anti-inflammatory drugs.

Headlines: Delirium Often Accompanies Stem Cell Transplantation
Teaser: A study suggests that delirium occurs in about 50% of patients, and that presentations are atypical.

Headlines: Supplemental Carnitine May Be Helpful in Diabetic Neuropathy
Teaser: Two randomized trials suggests that this supplement can improve pain, vibratory perception and nerve regeneration.

Headlines: FDA Approvals: Prialt, Clolar, Nasonex, Eligard
Teaser: The FDA has approved ziconotide intrathecal infusion (Prialt), clofarabine (Clolar), a new indication for mometasone furoate monohydrate nasal spray (Nasonex), and a 6-month formulation of leuprolide acetate (Eligard).

Headlines: Surgery Might Benefit Patients With Migraine Responding to Botulinum Toxin
Teaser: Based on a randomized trial, surgical deactivation of migraine trigger sites may eliminate or significantly reduce migraine symptoms, although additional studies are needed.

Headlines: Bupivicaine Infiltrated Immediately After Laparoscopy May Reduce Pain
Teaser: In a randomized study, this intervention significantly decreased pain at 1 hourpostoperatively, but preoperative infiltration was ineffective.

Headlines: Back pain and brain changes
Teaser: Patients with chronic back pain lasting longer than a year show signs of atrophy in specific brain regions known to be involved in pain perception. The finding highlights the need for treating pain early and aggressively, say the researchers. (Apkarian AV et al. 2004; 24:10410-10415.)

Headlines: MPA Therapy Appears Effective in Alleviating Endometriosis Pain
Teaser: MPA is as effective as leuprolide therapy in relieving pain, with less decline in bone mineral density and fewer symptoms of hypoestrogenemia.

Headlines: Sustained-Release Morphine May Alleviate Chronic Pain in Refractory Patient
Teaser: Results of the KRONUS-MSP Trial showed that significant improvements were seen at week 4 in pain and sleep scores, among other outcomes.

Headlines: Half of Pediatric Discharge Analgesia Orders May Contain Errors
Teaser: In two studies, errors ranged from documentation problems to those likely to cause adverse drug events.

Headlines: Low-Dose Ketamine May Be Helpful for Chronic Regional Pain Syndrome
Teaser: In a retrospective review, infusion of subanesthetic doses was effective, but more studies are needed.

Headlines: FDA Safety Labeling Changes: Activella, Duramorph PF, Nutropin
Teaser: The FDA has approved revisions to the safety labeling for estradiol/norethindrone tablets (Activella), morphine sulfate preservative-free injection (Duramorph PF), and somatropin [rDNA origin] injection (Nutropin, Nutropin AQ).

Headlines: FDA Approvals: Diovan, Celebrex, Adderall XR
Teaser: The FDA has approved new indications for valsartan tablets (Diovan), celecoxib capsules (Celebrex), and mixed salts of a single-entity amphetamine product (Adderall XR).

Headlines: First-Time Generic Approvals: Nydrazid, Aclovate, Allegra
Teaser: The FDA has approved first-time generic formulations of isoniazid 100-mg/mL injection, USP, in 10-mL multiple-dose vials (Nydrazid), aclometasone dipropionate 0.05% cream, U.S. Pharmacopeia (Aclovate), and fexofenadine HCl 60-mg capsules (Allegra).

Headlines: FDA Approvals: Rozerem, Synera, Avelox IV
Teaser: The FDA has approved ramelteon 8-mg tablets (Rozerem), a lidocaine-tetracaine 70-mg/70-mg topical patch (Synera), and a new indication for moxifloxacin intravenous infusion (Avelox IV).

Headlines: FDA Investigates Deaths Linked to Fentanyl Patch
Teaser: Agency warns patients that safety instructions for patch use must be followed exactly.

Headlines: Palladone Suspended Because of Alcohol Interaction
Teaser: Hydromorphone HCl extended-release capsules can have fatal effects when taken with alcohol, according to the FDA.

Headlines: International Approvals: PTC 124, Nelarabine, Rectogesic
Teaser: Europe has approved orphan drug indications for PTC 124 and nelarabine; the U.K. has approved nitroglycerine 0.4% ointment (Rectogesic).

Headlines: FDA Approvals: Focalin XR, Merrem IV, Tramadol ODT
Teaser: The FDA has approved an extended-release formulation of dexmethylphenidate HCl (Focalin XR capsules), a new indication for meropenem injection (Merrem IV), and an orally disintegrating 50-mg tablet formulation of tramadol HCl (Tramadol ODT).

Headlines: Surgery vs rehabilitation for low back pain
Teaser: A randomized controlled trial comparing surgical stabilization with intensive rehabilitation concluded that there is no clear evidence that surgery was better and that at two years of follow-up, intensive rehabilitation was considerably more cost effective. (Fairbank J et al. Rivero-Arias O et al. ; published online before print May 23, 2005.)

Headlines: First-Time Generic Approvals: Clozaril, Ultracet, Sandostatin, Elocon
Teaser: The FDA has approved a first-time generic formulation and first-time 50-mg dosage strength of clozapine tablets (Clozaril) and first-time generic formulations of tramadol HCl plus acetaminophen 37.5-mg/325-mg tablets (Ultracet); octreotide acetate 0.2-mg/mL and 1-mg/mL injections (Sandostatin); and mometasone furoate topical solution, USP 0.1% (Elocon).

Headlines: Topical Lidocaine Shows Promise for Treating Chronic Dysmenorrhea
Teaser: All measures of chronic dysmenorrhea diminished in a cohort of women using a topical lidocaine vaginal gel, according to investigators.

Headlines: International Approvals: Plan B, Sativex, Aclasta
Teaser: Health Canada has approved over-the-counter levonorgestrel emergency contraceptive (Plan B) and Cannabis sativa L. extract oral spray (Sativex); the European Union has approved zoledronic acid (Aclasta).

Headlines: FDA Approvals: Restore, DuraSeal, AcrySof ReSTOR
Teaser: The FDA has approved a rechargeable neurostimulation system (Restore), a dural sealant system (DuraSeal), and a multifocal intraocular lens (AcrySof ReSTOR).

Headlines: Tamoxifen May Reduce Breast Pain, Gynecomastia Associated With Bicalutamide
Teaser: The authors of this randomized study suggest that antiestrogen treatment with tamoxifen may help patients with prostate cancer to tolerate the hypergonadotropic effects of bicalutamide.

Headlines: French Physical Therapy Technique Effective in Patients With Refractory...
Teaser: Souchard's global postural re-education restores most people to complete activities of daily living.

Headlines: Bextra Withdrawn From Market
Teaser: In addition, the FDA is requiring that all NSAID product labels include stronger warnings on cardiovascular and gastrointestinal adverse events.

Headlines: Buccal Oxycodone May Be Helpful in Children With Acute Abdominal Pain
Teaser: In a randomized study, this drug provided reasonable pain relief without obscuring the clinical diagnosis.

Headlines: FDA Approvals: Boniva, Baraclude, depo-subQ provera 104
Teaser: The FDA has approved a once-monthly formulation of ibandronate sodium tablets (Boniva), entecavir tablets and oral solution (Baraclude), and new indication for medroxyprogesterone acetate injectable suspension (depo-subQ provera 104).

Headlines: Valdecoxib, Parecoxib Use Not Associated With Increased Stroke or MI...
Teaser: But in a second study, use of the COX-2 inhibitors in coronary artery bypass graft patients found a significant increase in cardiovascular events.

Headlines: Virtual Reality May Help Manage Acute Pain in Children
Teaser: In a randomized pilot study, virtual reality games provided analgesia to burn patients with minimal adverse effects and little effect on the physical hospital environment.

Headlines: CT and Ultrasound Both Effective for Diagnosing Acute Pelvic Pain in Women
Teaser: Abdominal/pelvic computed tomography and pelvic ultrasound imaging were helpful in making the correct diagnosis in 80% of cases.

Headlines: International Approvals: MICRONAIL, MicroCan, Eon
Teaser: Japan has approved an intramedullary radius fixation device (MICRONAIL); the EU has approved a miniature retinal cannula (MicroCan) and an implantable pulse generator neurostimulation system (Eon).

Headlines: International Approvals: Tygacil, DepoDur, and Zyvox
Teaser: The EU has approved tigecycline injection (Tygacil); the United Kingdom has approved a single-dose sustained-release injectable formulation of morphine (DepoDur); and Japan has approved a new indication for linezolid 600-mg tablets and injection (Zyvox).

Headlines: First-Time Generic Approvals: Novantrone, Terazol 3, Norco
Teaser: The FDA has approved first-time generic formulations for mitoxantrone HCl 2-mg/mL injection (Novantrone), terconazole 80-mg vaginal suppositories (Terazol 3), and a new 7.5-mg/300-mg strength of hydrocodone bitartrate plus acetaminophen tablets (Norco).

Headlines: Fibromyalgia as neuropathic pain
Teaser: A number of new lines of research suggest that fibromyalgia is at least in part a neuropathic pain syndrome. (Martinez-Lavin M. 2006; 33:827-829.)

Headlines: New FDA Orphan Drugs: Ceflatonin, Valortim, TQ-1018
Teaser: The FDA has approved orphan drug status for homoharringtonine (Ceflatonin), MDX-1303 (Valortim), and a high-concentration topical capsaicin product (TQ-1018).

Headlines: First-Time Generic Approvals: Commit, Dynacirc, Norco
Teaser: The FDA has approved first-time generic formulations for nicotine polacrilex 2- and 4-mg lozenges (Commit); isradipine 2.5- and 5-mg capsules (Dynacirc); and hydrocodone bitartrate plus acetaminophen 5-mg/300-mg tablets (Norco).

Headlines: Inappropriate Use of Benzocaine Sprays Linked to Risk for Methemoglobinemia
Teaser: The FDA has issued a public health advisory regarding inappropriate use of benzocaine topical sprays and risk factors for methemoglobinemia.

Headlines: First-Time Generic Approvals: Xanax XR, Dostinex, Percocet
Teaser: The FDA has approved first-time generic formulations for alprazolam 0.5-mg extended-release tablets (Xanax XR); cabergoline 0.5-mg tablets (Dostinex); and oxycodone HCl/acetaminophen 2.5/300-mg, 5/300-mg, 7.5/300-mg, and 10/300-mg tablets (Percocet).

Headlines: First-Time Generic Approvals: Copegus, Tegretol, Roxicodone
Teaser: The FDA has approved first-time generic formulations for ribavirin (Copegus), carbamazepine (Tegretol), and oxycodone HCl (Roxicodone).

Headlines: First-Time Generic Approvals: Dilaudid, Cefzil, Zithromax
Teaser: The FDA has approved first-time generic formulations for hydromorphone HCl 2-, 4-, and 8-mg tablets (Dilaudid); cefprozil 250- and 500-mg tablets (Cefzil); and azithromycin 250-, 500-, and 600-mg tablets (Zithromax).

Headlines: COX-2 Inhibitors and Other NSAIDs Increase Mortality in Acute MI Patients
Teaser: Post-MI patients should not use COX-2 inhibitors and they should use nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs only at low doses, according to a large analysis of registry data.

Headlines: FDA Approvals: Q-CPR, VerifyNow P2Y12, Personal Therapy Manager
Teaser: The FDA has approved a real-time cardiopulmonary resuscitation monitoring and feedback device (Q-CPR), a blood test to measure the efficacy of clopidogrel therapy (VerifyNow P2Y12), and a patient-activated accessory device for an implantable morphine pump (Personal Therapy Manager).

Headlines: Botulinum Toxin Type A May Be Effective for Chronic Pelvic Pain, Muscle...
Teaser: In preliminary findings from a randomized controlled trial, one patient was pain-free three years after a single injection.

Headlines: Avinza Interaction With Alcohol May Be Lethal, FDA Warns
Teaser: Alcohol may trigger a rapid release of morphine from the extended-release capsules.

Headlines: Highlights From MMWR: CO Poisoning After Hurricane Katrina and More
Teaser: The CDC has reported on carbon monoxide poisoning after Hurricane Katrina; health risk behaviors and conditions in depressed adults; inadequate support for children with emotional, behavioral, or developmental problems; breast cancer screening rates and socioeconomic status; pain medication prescribing in emergency settings; and a decrease in the prevalence of leisure-time physical inactivity.

Headlines: FDA Approvals: Lipitor, Arimidex, Tramadol ER
Teaser: The FDA has approved new indications for atorvastatin calcium (Lipitor) and anastrozole (Arimidex), and an extended-release formulation of tramadol HCl.

Headlines: International Approvals: Precision SCS, DuraSeal, EP-4
Teaser: The EU has approved a spinal cord stimulation system (Precision) and a new indication for a surgical sealant system (DuraSeal); Canada has approved a computerized cardiac stimulator (EP-4).

Headlines: FDA Approvals: Nevanac, Sugar-Free Actiq, Quinine Sulfate
Teaser: The FDA has approved nepafenac 0.1% ophthalmic suspension (Nevanac), a sugar-free formulation of oral transmucosal fentanyl citrate (Actiq), and quinine sulfate 324-mg capsules.

Headlines: International Approvals: Bonviva, Once-Daily Tramadol, Mifepristone
Teaser: Switzerland has approved a once-monthly formulation of ibandronate sodium (Bonviva); use of once-daily tramadol HCl is now allowed in 22 European countries; and the EU has approved an orphan drug indication for mifepristone.

Headlines: Limited Success for Lumbar Epidural Steroid Injections in Stenosis
Teaser: A survival and cost analysis shows limited success of lumbar epidural steroid injections in patients with moderate and severe stenosis.

Headlines: Hydromorphone in Urine Drug Tests is an Indicator of Morphine Therapy
Teaser: Results of a new study confirm that hydromorphone is a minor metabolite of morphine and appears on urine drug testing, suggesting it may be used to determine whether patients are compliant with therapy.

Headlines: Pharmacogenomics and TDM May Decrease Adverse Drug Reactions
Teaser: Genotyping chronic pain patients in addition to use of therapeutic drug management may improve patient outcomes by reducing adverse drug reactions, a new study suggests.

Headlines: MEDAL GI Results Published
Teaser: Detailed gastrointestinal results from the trial, comparing MerckÂ’s new COX-2 inhibitor etoricoxib with diclofenac, show significantly fewer uncomplicated upper-gastrointestinal clinical events with etoricoxib, but no difference in complicated GI events, leading to questions about whether this benefit is clinically relevant.

Headlines: First-Time Generic Approvals: Inderal LA, Duragesic-12, DuoNeb
Teaser: The FDA has approved first-time generic formulations for propanolol HCl extended-release capsules (Inderal LA); a fentanyl transdermal system (Duragesic-12); and albuterol sulfate plus ipratropium bromide inhalation solution (DuoNeb).

Headlines: FDA Approvals: Ziana, Kadian, Polyphenon E
Teaser: The FDA has approved clindamycin phosphate 1.2% plus tretinoin 0.025% gel (Ziana), an 80-mg dose strength for morphine sulfate extended-release capsules (Kadian), and an herbal topical ointment (Polyphenon E, 15%).

Headlines: Pregabalin Effective for Neuropathic Pain After Spinal Cord Injury
Teaser: A placebo-controlled trial shows the anticonvulsant pregabalin effectively relieved central neuropathic pain and improved sleep and anxiety as well in patients with spinal cord injury.

Headlines: Methadone-Related Fatalities Underscore Need for Careful Dosing
Teaser: Inadvertent systemic accumulation of methadone (Dolophine) can increase the risk for respiratory depression and cardiac arrhythmias.

Headlines: Pregabalin May Relieve Fibromyalgia Pain
Teaser: In a double-blind study that followed an initial open-label washout period, time to loss of therapeutic response was significantly longer for patients treated with pregabalin compared with those receiving placebo.

Headlines: MEDAL: Etoricoxib and Diclofenac Have Same CV Risk
Teaser: Both drugs were similar in effectiveness against arthritis symptoms, but diclofenac was associated with more upper-GI and hepatic events, whereas etoricoxib showed more heart failure and discontinuations due to edema and hypertension. Discussion is focusing on whether diclofenac was the appropriate comparator drug, as it is also believed to carry an increased cardiovascular risk.

Headlines: International Approvals: Lyrica and Remicade
Teaser: The EU has approved expanded indications for pregabalin capsules (Lyrica) and infliximab injection (Remicade).

Headlines: Lacosamide Promising in Relief of Painful Diabetic Neuropathy
Teaser: Results of a multicenter randomized trial of a still-investigational anticonvulsant drug, lacosamide, suggests the drug is both most efficacious and well tolerated at a dose of 400 mg/day.

Headlines: International Approvals: Champix, Synvisc, Glivec
Teaser: The EU has approved varenicline tartrate 0.5- and 1-mg tablets (Champix), an expanded indication for hylan G-F 20 injection (Synvisc), and new indications for imatinib mesylate tablets (Glivec).

Headlines: International Approvals: Melody/Ensemble, Organ Care System, Eon
Teaser: The EU has approved a transcatheter pulmonary valve (Melody) with delivery system (Ensemble), and a maintenance system for donor organs (Organ Care System); Australia has approved an implantable pulse generator neurostimulation system (Eon).

Headlines: Vertebroplasty and Kyphoplasty Relieve Pain in Multiple Myeloma
Teaser: Assessing the safety and efficacy of the procedures, researchers have found that vertebroplasty and kyphoplasty represent treatments of choice in selected patients with severe refractory pain from pathologic compression fractures.

Headlines: Ibuprofen May Reduce Protective Effects of Aspirin
Teaser: According to the FDA, patients should be instructed on the appropriate timing of ibuprofen dosing if they are also taking aspirin for cardioprotective effects.

Headlines: Patients in a Specialized Oncology Unit Report Less Pain
Teaser: A new study suggests that cancer patients admitted to a dedicated oncology care facility may experience important benefits compared with those treated in general medical units.

Headlines: First-Time Generic Approvals: Mobic, Propecia, Zithromax
Teaser: The FDA has approved first-time generic formulations for meloxicam 7.5- and 15-mg tablets (Mobic), finasteride 1-mg tablets (Propecia), and azithromycin 100-mg/5-mL and 200-mg/5-mL oral suspension (Zithromax).

Headlines: NSAIDs Appear to Increase Blood Pressure More Than Celecoxib
Teaser: Although the effect was slight with celecoxib, both NSAIDs and celecoxib increased blood pressure more than did placebo.

Headlines: First-Time Generic Approvals: Colestid, Didrex, Percocet
Teaser: The FDA has approved first-time generic formulations for cholestipol HCl 5-g packet and scoopful for oral suspension (Colestid), benzphetamine HCl 50-mg tablets (Didrex), and oxycodone HCl plus acetaminophen 10-mg/650-mg tablets (Percocet).

Headlines: International Approvals: Ralivia, Rasilez, Avastin
Teaser: Canada has approved a once-daily, extended-release formulation of tramadol HCl tablets (Ralivia); Europe has approved aliskirin tablets (Rasilez) and a new indication for bevacizumab infusion (Avastin).

Headlines: Zolmitriptan Nasal Spray May Fill Treatment Void for Cluster Headache
Teaser: New research suggests zolmitriptan nasal spray provides rapid, effective treatment for cluster headaches, 1 of the most severe primary headache types.

Headlines: Ropivacaine Cuts Recovery Time Post Colorectal  Cancer Surgery
Teaser: A continuous infusion of 0.2% ropivacaine during the first 48 hours following open colorectal surgery appears to be an effective method for reducing pain and shortening recovery time.

Headlines: Combination Antithrombotic Therapy Linked to Greater Risk for GI Bleeds
Teaser: New research suggests there is a much higher increased risk for gastrointestinal bleeding when antithrombotic therapy is combined with aspirin or nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs.

Headlines: International Approvals: Sativex, Travatan Z, Eslax
Teaser: Canada has approved a new indication for a cannabis-derived buccal spray (Sativex); Japan has approved travoprost 0.004% ophthalmic solution (Travatan Z) and rocuronium bromide injection (Eslax).

Headlines: FDA Warns Against Codeine for Mothers of Nursing Infants
Teaser: Codeine may cause fatal adverse effects in infants of nursing mothers who are rapid metabolizers of codeine.

Headlines: International Approvals: Tasigna, Once-Daily Tramadol, Hexvix
Teaser: Switzerland has approved nilotinib (Tasigna), Canada has approved a once-daily formulation of tramadol HCl, and Italy has granted marketing authorization for a hexaminolevulinate product (Hexvix).

Headlines: Study of Treatment for Addiction to Prescription Opioids Begins Enrollment
Teaser: The Prescription Opioid Addiction Treatment Study has enrolled and treated about 200 of 648 planned participants at the study's 11 sites.

Headlines: FDA Device Clearances
Teaser: The US Food and Drug Administration has granted premarket approval for a neurostimulation lead, 510(k) clearance for power injectable ports and safety needles, and an automated blood testing instrument.

Headlines: First Treatment Approved for Fibromyalgia
Teaser: The FDA has approved pregabalin (Lyrica, Pfizer) as the first treatment for fibromyalgia.

Headlines: Phase 2 Results Show MK-0974 Significantly Improves Migraine Pain
Teaser: Results from a phase 2 clinical study indicate that MK-0974, an investigational oral calcitonin gene-related peptide-receptor antagonist, treats migraines in a majority of people.

Headlines: FDA Approvals: Kadian, Depocyt, Reclast
Teaser: The FDA has approved a 10-mg formulation for morphine sulfate extended-release capsules (Kadian), cytarabine liposome injection (Depocyt), and zoledronic acid 5-mg solution for infusion (Reclast).

Headlines: False Promotion of OxyContin Costs Purdue Frederick $600 Million
Teaser: According to the FDA, the company's salespeople illegally promoted the drug as less likely to cause addiction, abuse, tolerance, and withdrawal.

Headlines: International Approvals: Aerius, Sebivo, Rapydan
Teaser: Europe has approved desloratadine orodispersible tablets and oral solution (Aerius) and telbivudine 600-mg tablets (Sebivo); Sweden has approved a lidocaine/tetracaine 70-mg/70-mg local anesthetic patch (Rapydan)

Headlines: FDA Advisory Panel Votes 'No' to Etoricoxib
Teaser: Merck's new arthritis drug--another COX-2 inhibitor--was shut out 19-1 by the mixed FDA panel. Some members argued passionately that it was time to drop the class of drugs, due primarily to their cardiovascular risk profile.

Headlines: Occipital-Nerve Stimulation May Effectively Relieve Cluster Headache
Teaser: Two studies show promising results using occipital-nerve stimulation to treat intractable cluster headaches.

Headlines: Psychiatric Factors Linked to Increased Risk for Misuse of Opioid Meds
Teaser: A new study of patients with chronic noncancer pain suggests a history of psychiatric factors, such as mood disorders, psychological problems, or psychosocial stressors, is associated with an increased risk for misuse of prescription opioids.

Headlines: Spinal Cord Stimulation May Treat Axial Low Back Pain
Teaser: Researchers are reporting encouraging preliminary results with spinal cord stimulation to relieve axial back pain associated with failed back surgery syndrome.

Headlines: Botulinum To Injections Possible Treatment for Refractory Headache Syndrome
Teaser: A new study suggests that botulinum toxin A may be helpful in treating patients with refractory headache syndrome. A retrospective review showed reduction in the number and duration of headaches in patients with chronic migraines, daily headaches, and cervicalgia headaches who had failed conventional treatment.

Headlines: Cannabis Effectively Relieves HIV Sensory Neuropathy
Teaser: Cannabis is effective for the treatment of HIV-related sensory neuropathy, a condition that affects up to 30% of AIDS patients over their lifetime.

Headlines: Modest Exercise Helps Chronic Pain Patients
Teaser: Exercise improves mood and physical condition of chronic pain patients while also reducing their anxiety and depression.

Headlines: What Your Patients Are Reading
Teaser: Men who live well may live longer; the risk for schizophrenia may be increased for children whose mothers endured extreme stress during pregnancy; nicotine withdrawal may cause smokers to lose sleep; heparin may be in short supply; and although the cost of treating neck and back pain has risen, no increase in relief has been seen.

Headlines: FDA Takes Action to Stop Marketing of Unapproved Colchicine Injection
Teaser: The US Food and Drug Administration has received 50 reports of adverse events with colchicine injection, including 23 deaths, related to product use.

Headlines: Chronic Pain May Harm the Brain
Teaser: A new study indicates chronic pain has a widespread impact on overall brain function, a finding that may offer a possible explanation for many of the common cognitive and behavioral comorbidities seen in such patients.

Headlines: Patient-Controlled Analgesia Safe, Effective in Postcraniotomy Pain
Teaser: Intravenous, patient-controlled analgesia after a craniotomy has been shown to be both safe and effective compared with conventional as-needed therapy.

Headlines: International Approvals: Januvia, Synvisc-One, Eloxatin
Teaser: Europe has approved 2 new indications for sitagliptin tablets (Januvia) and a new formulation of hylan G-F 20 (Synvisc-One); Canada has approved oxaliplatin intravenous infusion (Eloxatin).

Headlines: What Your Patients Are Reading
Teaser: Recent news stories have examined the link between moderate caffeine intake and risk for miscarriage, the prevention of urinary tract infections with cranberries, use of NSAIDs for low back pain, the link between fitness levels and all-cause mortality, and use of prednisone for rheumatoid arthritis.

Headlines: Muscle Vibration May Retrain Abnormal SMO in Focal Hand Dystonia
Teaser: Muscle vibration applied to small hand muscles of patients with focal hand dystonia may help regain hand motor control, a new study suggests.

Headlines: Bisphosphonate Therapy Linked to Risk for Severe Musculoskeletal Pain
Teaser: Pain requiring interruption or discontinuation of therapy may occur after months or years of therapy.

Headlines: First-Time Generic Approvals: Combunox, Dilantin, Antizol
Teaser: The FDA has approved first-time generic formulations for oxycodone hydrochloride and ibuprofen tablets in 5 mg/400 mg strength, extended phenytoin sodium capsules in 30-mg strength, and fomepizole injectable in 1 g/mL strength.

Headlines: Deaths Related to Fentanyl Patch Misuse Spark Second Public Health Advisory
Teaser: FDA highlights important information to decrease the risk for fentanyl overdose.

Headlines: FDA Warns of Genetic Link to Carbamazepine Skin Reactions
Teaser: Patients of Asian ancestry should be screened for human leukocyte antigen allele before initiation of therapy.

Headlines: First-Time Generic Approvals: Trileptal, Vicoprofen, Exelon
Teaser: The FDA has approved first-time generic formulations for oxcarbazepine tablets in 150-, 300-, and 600-mg strengths; hydrocodone bitartrate and ibuprofen tablets in a 2.5-mg/200-mg strength; and rivastigmine tartrate capsules in 1.5-, 3-, 4.5-, and 6-mg (base) strengths.

Headlines: International Approvals: Oral-lyn, Abraxane, DepoDur
Teaser: India has approved a regular insulin oral spray (Oral-lyn) and albumin-bound paclitaxel particles for injectable suspension (Abraxane); Australia has approved a sustained-release liposome formulation of morphine sulfate injection (DepoDur).

Headlines: Pain Study Shows a "Window of Efficacy" for Smoked Cannabis
Teaser: A new study shows that while mid-range doses of smoked cannabis resulted in "modest" pain relief, high doses actually increased pain levels.

Headlines: Hypolipidemic Drug Effective for Adult Myopathic CPT2 Deficiency
Teaser: Bezafibrate is the first therapy to relieve muscle pain and improve quality of life for patients with a mitochondrial fatty acid oxidation disorder.

Headlines: New Peel-Away Topical Anesthetic Reduces Pain of Laser Resurfacing
Teaser: Lidocaine-tetracaine combination was more effective than lidocaine-prilocaine cream when applied 30 minutes before the procedure.

Headlines: Mirror Therapy Also Effective Against Lower-Limb Phantom Pain
Teaser: Results of a randomized sham-controlled study suggest that mirror therapy, already shown to help reduce phantom limb pain for those with upper-limb amputations, can also help lower-limb amputees.

Headlines: FDA Issues Public Health Advisory for Fentora
Teaser: The agency emphasizes that fentanyl buccal tablets should be used only for approved indications, and physicians should ensure appropriate dosing/titration to reduce the risk for respiratory depression.

Headlines: International Approvals: NovoRapid, Fentanyl, Atriance
Teaser: Europe has approved an expanded indication for insulin aspart subcutaneous injection (NovoRapid), Japan has approved an expanded indication for fentanyl citrate 0.1 and 0.25 mg injections, and Europe has approved nelarabine intravenous injection (Atriance).

Headlines: New Guideline on Diagnosis and Treatment of Trigeminal Neuralgia
Teaser: The American Academy of Neurology has published a new practice parameter on treatment of trigeminal neuralgia. The guideline recommends carbamazepine as first-line treatment but suggests surgery be considered for refractory cases.

Headlines: Low Vitamin D Levels Linked to Chronic Pain in Women
Teaser: A new study is questioning the possible influence of endocrine or immunological factors in the etiology of chronic pain.

Headlines: Smoking Cannabis May Reduce Neuropathic Pain in HIV
Teaser: A small study suggests that smoking marijuana while taking analgesic medications may help reduce pain.

Headlines: FDA Advisory Members Agree AEDs Pose Suicidality Risk, Nix Black Box
Teaser: Antiepileptic drugs pose an increased risk of suicidality, but the data do not warrant a black-box warning, advisory committee members told the FDA.

Headlines: Neonates in Intensive Care Endure Many Painful Procedures Without Analgesia
Teaser: During 2-week period, neonates in intensive care underwent a median of 10 painful procedures per day, 79% without analgesia, in a study from Paris.

Headlines: Cannabis Cigarettes May Reduce Neuropathic Pain
Teaser: Results of a double-blind crossover trial suggest that smoked cannabis relieved neuropathic pain and may be an alternative for those who cannot take other analgesics.

Headlines: Low Back Pain Guidelines Expanded to Include Interventional Procedures
Teaser: The American Pain Society presented draft revised guidelines on the management of chronic low back pain to include interventional procedures, underlining the lack of evidence for many of these commonly used approaches.

Headlines: FDA Panel Nixes 'Abuse-Proof' OxyContin
Teaser: Experts say special coating may not stop abuse of pain relief drug.

Headlines: New Guidelines From AAN on Botulinum Neurotoxin Issued
Teaser: Three new guidelines from the American Academy of Neurology review the use of botulinum neurotoxin in spasticity, movement disorders, and autonomic disorders and pain.

Headlines: 4-Item Assessment Provides Good Bedside Diagnosis of Delirium
Teaser: A new delirium assessment tool may help hospital healthcare providers more easily identify delirium in their patients.

Headlines: Long-Term Data Confirm Benefit of Vertebroplasty for Back Pain Relief
Teaser: One of the largest and longest case series to date suggests percutaneous vertebroplasty provides significant relief of back pain, increased mobility, and quality of life, without any signal of increased fracture rates or major complications.

Headlines: Recall of Medtronic's Intrathecal Infusion Pumps
Teaser: Guidelines issued by the FDA advise that use of the lowest effective dose and concentration of opioids may reduce the risk for granuloma formation.

Headlines: Cannabis Smoking Associated With Impaired Cognition in MS
Teaser: A case-control study suggests cannabis use is associated with impaired cognition and psychological disturbance in patients with multiple sclerosis.

Headlines: Marijuana-Based Drug May Ease Fibromyalgia Pain
Teaser: In a placebo-controlled 1-month trial, the marijuana-based synthetic drug nabilone showed promise for temporary pain relief for fibromyalgia patients.

Headlines: Fold-Over Defect Causes Another Recall of Fentanyl Pain Patches
Teaser: This time from Actavis, which has initiated a recall of 14 lots; direct exposure to fentanyl gel may lead to potentially fatal adverse events.

Headlines: Duloxetine Reduces Pain Severity in Fibromyalgia Patients
Teaser: Randomized trial results suggest that duloxetine hydrochloride treats fibromyalgia safely and effectively.

Headlines: Neuropathic Pain and Smoking
Teaser: A new study finds that the incidence of smoking is twice as high in those diagnosed with neuropathic pain as in those diagnosed with nociceptive pain.

Headlines: Fentanyl Buccal Tablets Safe, Well Tolerated in Cancer Patients
Teaser: A drug at the center of a recent FDA health warning is found to be safe and well tolerated for treatment of breakthrough pain in opioid-tolerant cancer patients, a new study shows.

Headlines: Fentanyl Gel Patches Recalled Due to Manufacturing Defect
Teaser: A cut edge in the drug reservoir may lead to direct exposure to fentanyl gel (Duragesic) resulting in potentially fatal adverse events.

Headlines: Spinal Cord Stimulation Givess Long-Term Relief in FBSS
Teaser: Randomized trial results show that spinal cord stimulation improves pain relief, health-related quality of life, and functionality in predominantly neuropathic pain patients with failed-back-surgery syndrome.

Headlines: Safety Guidelines Issued for Prescribing Methadone
Teaser: Safety recommendations regarding arrhythmia risk and QTc interval monitoring for clinicians prescribing methadone have been issued.

Headlines: Migraines, Tension-Type Headaches Respond to Acupuncture
Teaser: Acupuncture is at least as effective as prophylactic drugs for migraine and may also benefit some patients with frequent tension-type headache, 2 large reviews conclude.

Headlines: FDA MedWatch Issues Alert on Safety of Topical Anesthetics
Teaser: The FDA today released a public-health advisory to underline the potential risks associated with overuse of topical anesthetics. In particular, women undergoing mammography or others using the agents over large areas of the body may be at risk.

Headlines: FDA Approves Milnacipran for Fibromyalgia
Teaser: Forest Laboratories and Cypress Bioscience announced that the FDA has approved milnacipran, a dual serotonin- and norepinephrine-reuptake inhibitor, for the management of fibromyalgia.

Headlines: Antidepressants May Ease Fibromyalgia Symptoms
Teaser: Evidence from a meta-analysis of 18 trials of antidepressants in the treatment of fibromyalgia syndrome shows that these drugs can improve FMS-associated symptoms of pain, sleep disturbance, depressed mood, and health-related quality of life. However, effect sizes vary significantly between classes of antidepressants.

Headlines: Antioxidants Reduce Pain, Oxidative Stress in Chronic Pancreatitis
Teaser: In a randomized controlled trial, antioxidant supplementation was effective in relieving pain and reducing levels of oxidative stress in patients with chronic pancreatitis.

Headlines: FDA Approves Tramadol Extended-Release Formulation for Chronic Pain
Teaser: Labopharm, Inc announced the FDA has approved a once-daily extended release formulation of tramadol (Ryzolt) for the management of moderate to moderately severe chronic pain.

Headlines: Spinal Surgery Superior to Exercise, Medical Therapy at 4 Years
Teaser: A new analysis from SPORT at 4-year follow-up shows that spine surgery provides more rapid and greater relief of symptoms and improvement in function than nonsurgical options for lumbar disk herniation.

Headlines: FDA Requires Warnings About Suicidality Risk With Antiepileptic Drugs
Teaser: The US Food and Drug Administration will require the manufacturers of antiepileptic drugs to add a warning to their labeling that use of the drugs increases risk for suicidal thoughts and behaviors.

Headlines: New Guidelines on Evaluation of Distal Symmetric Polyneuropathy
Teaser: New practice parameters aim to give evidence-based guidance on the role of laboratory and genetic testing, autonomic testing, and nerve and skin biopsy in the evaluation of distal symmetric polyneuropathy.

Headlines: FDA Approves Tapentadol for Moderate to Severe Acute Pain
Teaser: The FDA has approved tapentadol, an immediate-release oral tablet, for the treatment of moderate to severe acute pain.

Headlines: Long-Term Study Shows Neurostimulation Relieves Leg Pain
Teaser: New 24-month results suggest that spinal-cord stimulation provides sustained leg pain relief, improved quality of life, and functional capacity in patients with failed-back-surgery syndrome.

Headlines: Five Generic Ethex Products Recalled Because of Overdose Risk
Teaser: Oversize tablets may contain up to double the amounts of the active ingredient.

Headlines: MRI Shows Relationship Between Depression and Pain Processing
Teaser: Functional magnetic resonance imaging shows a difference in both the processing and anticipation of pain in patients with major depressive disorder compared with nondepressed subjects.

Headlines: Pain Relief in Moderate to Severe Osteoarthritis
Teaser: A phase 2 trial of tanezumab showed improvements in pain, but adverse effects include paresthesia.

Headlines: Blind Technique Fails in Lumbar Epidural Steroid Injection
Teaser: Researchers report the loss-of-resistance technique along with an image intensifier and lopamidol injection should be the gold standard for patients with radiculopathy.

Headlines: Patients in Minimally Conscious State May Feel Pain, Need Analgesia
Teaser: Functional PET imaging results suggest that patients in minimally conscious states may feel pain and therefore require analgesics.

Headlines: Surgery for Intervertebral Disk Herniation Cost-Effective
Teaser: Standard open diskectomy is moderately cost-effective compared to nonsurgical treatment, a new study shows.

Headlines: Phase 3 Results Show Efficacy for Opioid Combined With Abuse Deterrent
Teaser: A phase 3 trial of ALO-01, an investigational formulation that combines extended-release morphine sulfate pellets with a core of naltrexone to deter abuse, showed that the drug was effective and safe for relief of chronic osteoarthritic pain.

Headlines: Methadone Dosages Correlate Poorly with Serum Levels
Teaser: A new study shows a poor correlation between dosages of methadone given to chronic pain patients and resulting serum levels. The findings, researchers say, complicate any cause-and-effect conclusions in the rising number of deaths associated with methadone use.

Headlines: FDA Warns Firms Selling Unapproved Drugs
Teaser: Nine prescription narcotics makers are the new target of FDA scrutiny.

Headlines: Expert Collaboration Helps Primary-Care Docs Improve Chronic Pain Outcomes
Teaser: A collaborative intervention with primary-care physicians produced "modest but statistically significant improvement" in chronic-pain treatment outcomes, VA researchers say.

Headlines: Chronic Pain Linked to Low Vitamin D
Teaser: Inadequate vitamin D may represent an underrecognized source of nociperception and impaired neuromuscular functioning, say researchers.

Headlines: Novel Treatment Relieves Metastatic Bone Pain
Teaser: Percutaneous osteoplasty appears to be a safe and effective option for relieving pain caused by bone metastases and benign lytic lesions in patients who to not respond to conventional therapies.

Headlines: Oxygen/Ozone for Herniated Disc Pain
Teaser: Oxygen/ozone injections into herniated lumbar discs are equal in efficacy to surgical discectomy, but the complication rate is considerably lower and the recovery time is significantly shorter.

Headlines: Sucrose May Be Helpful for Pediatric Analgesia
Teaser: A randomized controlled trial shows that when used to manage pain in infants, sucrose reduces the pain response to a subsequent routine caregiving procedure.

Headlines: Duloxetine May Be Helpful for Diabetic Peripheral Neuropathic Pain
Teaser: A meta-analysis suggests that duloxetine has comparable efficacy and tolerability vs gabapentin and pregabalin in the treatment of diabetic peripheral neuropathic pain.

Headlines: Acupuncture Has Minimal Analgesic Effect Over Sham Acupuncture
Teaser: Pain relief with acupuncture is only slightly better than that achieved with sham or "placebo" acupuncture, new research suggests.

Headlines: Specialists Study Brain Plasticity and Its Transformative Potent
Teaser: New research suggests the brain is a changeable organ that can alter its own structure and function.

Headlines: New Opioid Clinical Practice Guidelines Published
Teaser: The new guidelines, 2 years in the making, are now available.

Headlines: Specialists Confront Refractory Chronic Pain
Teaser: When pain control cannot be rapidly achieved using pharmacotherapy and interventional methods, behavioral or psychological approaches may help.

Headlines: Doctors Contend With Pain in War Vets
Teaser: From amputations to spinal cord injuries, burns, and the polytrauma triad of traumatic brain injury, posttraumatic stress disorder, and chronic pain, American doctors are bracing for an influx of new patients.

Headlines: FDA To Require REMS for Opioids
Teaser: The FDA announced today that it has contacted manufacturers of opioid pain medications, including fentanyl, morphine, and oxycodone, requiring them to have a risk evaluation and mitigation strategy to ensure that the benefits of these drugs outweigh the risks.

Headlines: Analgesic Effects of Acupuncture
Teaser: The efficacy and mechanisms underlying acupuncture are being studied in the treatment of chronic pain and addiction and are producing some convincing data.

Headlines: No Benefit to Routine Imaging for Low Back Pain Without "Red Flags"
Teaser: A new meta-analysis of randomized trials finds no benefit to routine lumbar imaging for low back pain on clinical outcomes without so-called "red flags," or indications of serious underlying conditions.

Headlines: AAPM 2009: Negative Emotions About Pain Raise Interleukin-6 Levels
Teaser: Patients who focus on their pain, feel helpless, and are generally pessimistic about outcomes have increased proinflammatory responses, a new study shows.

Headlines: AAPM 2009: Expert Outlines Complexities of Pain Care for Older Adults
Teaser: Only about 1% of pain studies explore the complexities of care for older adults, a leading expert on this population says. While degenerative pathology is normal as people age, she adds, pain is not.

Headlines: FDA Panel Urges Ban of Pain Drug
Teaser: Experts recommend stopping the sale of Darvon, Darvocet and other drugs containing propoxyphene.

Headlines: AAPM 2009: New Guidelines on Chronic Opioid Therapy Presented
Teaser: The new guidelines highlight patient selection, the importance of a therapeutic trial, and continuous reevaluation.

Headlines: AAPM 2009: Specialists Endorse Intrathecal Pain Therapies but Urge Caution
Teaser: Intrathecal therapies can relieve pain and improve long-term function, but there are risks that should be taken into consideration, report pain specialists.

Headlines: Diclofenac Liquid-Filled Capsules Approved for Pain Relief
Teaser: The FDA has approved diclofenac potassium liquid-filled soft gelatin capsules for the relief of mild to moderate acute pain in patients aged 18 years and older.

Headlines: Surgery May Relieve Pain of Degenerative Spondylolisthesis
Teaser: A study shows that patients choosing surgery for degenerative spondylolisthesis with spinal stenosis have substantially greater relief from pain with time vs those who do not have surgery.

Headlines: Depression, Pain Respond to Antidepressant Therapy, Pain Self-Management
Teaser: In a randomized trial, optimized antidepressant therapy followed by a pain self-management program led to marked improvement in depression and moderate reductions in pain severity and disability.

Headlines: Treating Pain and Pain Addiction
Teaser: Yvonne M. D'Arcy, MS, CRNP, CNS, a pain management specialist and palliative care nurse practitioner, provides expert commentary on new developments in pain management and treatment of pain addiction.

Headlines: FDA Approves Ibuprofen Injection to Treat Pain and Fever
Teaser: The FDA has approved an injectable formulation of ibuprofen (Caldolor) for the treatment of pain and fever. The product will be available for hospital use only.

Headlines: High-Concentration Capsaicin Patch Granted Orphan Drug Designation for PHN
Teaser: The FDA has approved orphan drug designation for a high-concentration capsaicin dermal patch (Qutenza) for the treatment of pain associated with postherpetic neuralgia.

Headlines: Stereotactic Radiosurgery Effective for Spinal Metastases
Teaser: A small study suggests the approach yields high 6-month and 1-year progression-free survival rates and reduces symptoms including pain.

Headlines: Tanezumab Investigated for Low Back Pain
Teaser: New phase 2 results suggest the anti-nerve growth-factor antibody may be useful in treating chronic pain.

Headlines: Tapentadol Evaluated for Low Back Pain
Teaser: New phase 3 results suggest the analgesic provides relief similar to oxycodone.

Headlines: Methylnaltrexone Shows Promise for Opioid-Induced Constipation
Teaser: Results from a phase 3 study suggest the peripherally acting mu-opioid receptor antagonist might be helpful in treating constipation.

Headlines: Managing Variability in Pain Responses
Teaser: Understanding the sometimes striking individual differences in pain response can be elusive, but pain specialists are working to provide an explanation.

Headlines: Opioid-Induced Constipation Highly Prevalent
Teaser: The numbers vary, but an estimated 40% to 80% of patients taking even a short course of opioids may become constipated, report researchers.

Headlines: Thorough Patient History Essential to Treat Pain
Teaser: Carefully interviewing patients and thoughtfully listening to their responses can provide clinicians a wealth of information, emphasize pain specialists.

Headlines: Short-Term Opioid Therapy in Older Adults
Teaser: Among older adults with chronic pain, short-term treatment with opioids is effective and rarely results in abuse, but it does decrease mental functioning, a new meta-analysis found.

Headlines: Vaccination Order for Pneumococcal Conjugate Vaccine May Affect Infant Pain Response
Teaser: Infants who receive pneumococcal conjugate vaccine after the combination vaccine for diphtheria, polio, tetanus, pertussis, and Haemophilus influenzae type b appear to have less pain than those who are immunized in the reverse order.

Headlines: Anxiety Increases Pain Intensity and Disability, Study Shows
Teaser: Patients with anxiety due to chronic pain may benefit from cognitive-behavioral approaches, report researchers.

Headlines: New Pain Assessment Tool May Help Separate Radicular From Axial Back Pain
Teaser: A new pain assessment tool to help distinguish radicular from axial back pain may facilitate diagnosis and improve targeted analgesic treatment of low back pain.

Headlines: Clinical Trial Supports Oxycodone for Acute Herpes Zoster Pain
Teaser: Researchers are emphasizing the importance of treating acute shingles pain, and they demonstrate that oxycodone is an option for select patients.

Headlines: Valproate During Pregnancy Impairs Cognitive Development
Teaser: Results of the Neurodevelopmental Effects of Antiepileptic Drugs study are in and suggest that valproate should not be used first line in women who may become pregnant.

Headlines: Long-Term Opioid Use May Increase Sensitivity to Pain
Teaser: Long-term use of opioids to manage chronic pain increases patients' sensitivity to certain types of pain, and similar hyperalgesia develops with methadone-maintained drug abusers, new research suggests.

Headlines: Elevated Saliva CGRP Levels During Migraine Predict Response to Rizatriptan
Teaser: A new study shows that patients who respond to rizatriptan have elevated saliva levels of calcitonin gene-related peptide during an attack, whereas nonresponders show no such rise.

Headlines: Inhaled DHE Offers Rapid and Sustained Efficacy for Acute Migraine
Teaser: Dihydroergotamine delivered through oral inhalation produced rapid and sustained efficacy for treating acute migraine. Patients tolerated it well, with a low incidence of adverse effects.

Headlines: Opioids Underused in Advanced COPD
Teaser: Opioids are less likely to be used for end-stage chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) than for terminal lung cancer, even though dyspnea is more prevalent in COPD than lung cancer.

Headlines: Management of Cancer Pain Less Than Optimal
Teaser: Treatment of cancer pain is suboptimal, according to a large European survey, and management guidelines need to be revised to improve the control of pain in cancer patients.

Headlines: LUNA May Not Be Helpful for Women With Chronic Pelvic Pain
Teaser: Compared with laparoscopy without pelvic denervation, laparoscopic uterosacral nerve ablation did not improve pain, dysmenorrhea, dyspareunia, or quality of life in women with chronic pelvic pain.

Headlines: Ibuprofen Effective for Outpatient Analgesia in Children With Arm Fractures
Teaser: In a randomized controlled trial, ibuprofen was at least as effective as acetaminophen with codeine for outpatient analgesia for children with arm fractures.

Headlines: FDA Issues Warning Letters to Illegal Marketers of Topical Ibuprofen
Teaser: Eight companies illegally marketing over-the-counter products containing topical ibuprofen have been warned by the FDA to stop, as the agency has not approved the topical application of ibuprofen.

Headlines: Pain Predicts Survival After Head and Neck Cancer Treatment
Teaser: Head and neck cancer survival may be predictable in part by the amount of pain a patient experiences posttreatment.

Headlines: Corticosteroids May Help Relieve Pain of Sore Throat
Teaser: A systematic review shows that when added to antibiotics, corticosteroids provide symptomatic relief of sore throat pain, primarily in patients with severe or exudative sore throat.

Headlines: FDA Approves Morphine/Naltrexone to Treat Moderate to Severe Pain
Teaser: The FDA has approved morphine sulfate and naltrexone HCl extended-release capsules for once- or twice-daily use in the management of moderate to severe pain for an extended period of time.The FDA has approved morphine sulfate and naltrexone HCl extended-release capsules for once- or twice-daily use in the management of moderate to severe pain for an extended period of time.

Headlines: Trial Results Raise Doubts About Vertebroplasty
Teaser: Two new clinical trials have found that control-group patients experienced similar improvements to those treated with vertebroplasty.

Headlines: Nonprescription Opioid Use Prevalent Among Older Teens
Teaser: Almost 50% of senior high-school students who use opioids without a prescription do so to relieve pain, a new study suggests.

Headlines: Lidocaine Reduces Pain and Anxiety From Peripheral IV Cannula Insertion
Teaser: According to a randomized, crossover study, Injected buffered lidocaine or lidocaine cream can reduce the pain and anxiety associated with intravenous cannula insertion.

Headlines: FDA Approves Ketorolac for Cataract Surgery Pain, Inflammation
Teaser: The FDA has approved a 0.45% ophthalmic solution of the nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug ketorolac tromethamine for the treatment of pain and inflammation after cataract surgery.

Headlines: FDA Approves Fentanyl Buccal Film for Breakthrough Cancer Pain
Teaser: The FDA has approved a fentanyl buccal film for the management of breakthrough pain in patients with cancer aged 18 years and older who receive around-the-clock opioid therapy.

Headlines: FDA Adds Stronger Warnings to Propoxyphene
Teaser: The FDA is adding stronger warnings to pain medications that contain propoxyphene, such as Darvon and Darvocet, because of new data on fatal overdoses linked to propoxyphene products.

Headlines: BMP in Spinal Fusion Surgery Linked to More Complications, Higher Costs
Teaser: A study shows that use of bone-morphogenetic protein in spinal-fusion surgery is associated with a higher rate of complications and higher hospital costs than surgeries where it was not used.

Headlines: Diclofenac Oral Solution Approved for Migraines in Adults
Teaser: The FDA has approved diclofenac potassium for oral solution for the acute treatment of migraine attacks with or without aura in adults aged 18 years or older.

Headlines: Oncology Nurses Can Play a Crucial Role in Pain Management
Teaser: Oncology nurses can play a crucial role in pain management for individual patients by changing their experience of pain, as well as in shaping policy and clinical practice.

Headlines: Pain Outcomes in Oncology Patients Not Optimal
Teaser: Pain outcomes in oncology patients are not optimal, despite more than a decade of nursing education efforts regarding assessment and management, because of barriers to implementation.

Headlines: Pain Control Recommended for Newborns
Teaser: In a prospective study, any method of pain control for newborns was better than none, and feeding and breast-feeding during heel-lancing were found to be the most effective methods of pain relief.

Headlines: FDA Safety Changes: DepoDur, Neoral, Lexiva
Teaser: The FDA has approved safety labeling revisions for morphine sulfate extended-release liposome injection, cyclosporine capsules and oral solution, and fosamprenavir calcium tablets and oral suspension.

Headlines: Pain Specialists Push for Funding of National Prescription Monitoring Program
Teaser: The American Society of Interventional Pain Physicians continues to look for the funding already approved, in theory at least, for a national electronic prescription monitoring program.

Headlines: Tai Chi May Help Reduce Pain of Knee Osteoarthritis in Older Patients
Teaser: In a randomized controlled trial, Tai Chi was associated with decreased pain and improved physical function, self-efficacy, depression, and health-related quality of life for knee osteoarthritis.

Headlines: Supervised Exercise Therapy May Be Helpful for Patellofemoral Pain Syndrome
Teaser: In a randomized trial, this intervention was associated with less knee pain and better function at short-term and long-term follow-up vs usual care in patients seen in general practice.

Headlines: Sodium Oxybate Reduces Fibromyalgia Pain and Fatigue
Teaser: Sodium oxybate, an investigational metabolite of gamma-aminobutyric acid, targets deep sleep disturbances common in fibromyalgia patients, reducing fatigue and pain.

Headlines: Morphine-Naltrexone Formulation Maintains Efficacy
Teaser: A combination of morphine sulfate and naltrexone hydrochloride provides effective analgesia with a low potential for abuse.

Headlines: Child's Genotype Determines Intensity of Postop Pain
Teaser: A gene encoding functional impairment of a central nervous system efflux transporter of opioids increases brain concentration of opioids; this genetic makeup protects against pain after surgery.

Headlines: Extended-Release Hydromorphone Safe, Effective for Sustained Pain Control
Teaser: A phase 3 study demonstrates significant improvement in lower back pain for prolonged periods with extended-release hydromorphone.

Headlines: Nontramadol Opioids Should Not Be Routinely Used for Osteoarthritis
Teaser: : In a review, small to moderate benefits of nontramadol opioids were outweighed by large increases in risk for adverse events; these should not be used routinely even if osteoarthritic pain is severe.

Headlines: IV Ibuprofen Reduces Postsurgical Opioid Use
Teaser: A dose-ranging study shows intravenous ibuprofen 800 mg reduces morphine use after surgery, thereby alleviating some gastrointestinal adverse effects.

Headlines: High-Dose Capsaicin Provides Durable Postherpetic Neuralgia Pain Relief
Teaser: Capsaicin patches containing a high concentration of the compound provide 3 months of pain relief for patients with postherpetic neuralgia.

Headlines: Tapentadol Extended Release Investigated for Low Back Pain
Teaser: Pain inventory results suggest 100 to 250 mg tapentadol twice daily may ease moderate to severe chronic low back pain.

Headlines: Ibuprofen Bests Acetaminophen/Codeine for Pediatric Arm Fracture Pain
Teaser: Although pain relief is comparable, ibuprofen is probably a better choice because of improved functional outcomes, fewer adverse effects, and higher patient and parental satisfaction.

Headlines: Up to One Quarter of Pain Patients Self-Medicate With Alcohol
Teaser: Clinicians should ask patients who take pain medications whether they also use alcohol for pain relief.

Headlines: Combination Gabapentin and Nortriptyline May Ease Neuropathic Pain
Teaser: Researchers are looking for new ways to treat refractory neuropathic pain and are studying the effects of combination therapy.

Headlines: Opioid Overdose Triples in the United States, CDC Report Shows
Teaser: A new report from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention reveals opioid-related deaths are rapidly rising.

Headlines: Chronic Pain May Cause Similar Disability Linked With Aging at Earlier Ages
Teaser: In a cross-sectional study, younger people with pain had disability similar to that of people who were 2 to 3 decades older without pain.

Headlines: FDA Panel Recommends Approval of Tamper-Resistant Oxycodone Formulation
Teaser: A new drug application for a novel formulation of "tamper-resistant" oxycodone, which is designed to reduce abuse of the drug, has been recommended for approval by an FDA advisory panel.

Headlines: Transdermal Sumitriptan Acts Rapidly and Provides Sustained Relief
Teaser: An iontophoretic transdermal delivery system of sumatriptan was superior to placebo in relieving symptoms of migraine, including headache pain, nausea, photophobia, and phonophobia.

Headlines: Usual Care for Low Back Pain Often Not in Sync With Clinical Guidelines
Teaser: Australian general practitioners often do not follow international evidence-based guidelines to manage their patients with low back pain, thus compromising outcomes.

Headlines: Deaths From Methadone Overdose Disproportionate to Number of Prescriptions
Teaser: A national review of opioid-related deaths finds that methadone plays a larger role than other drugs.

Headlines: Spinal Cord Stimulation Appears Effective for Secondary Hyperalgesia
Teaser: Stimulation of the spinal cord is effective in treating secondary hyperalgesia and is worthy of further study.

Headlines: What's Hot at AAPM 2010
Teaser: Specialists are heading to San Antonio for the academy's annual meeting, where new basic and clinical research will be unveiled.

Headlines: FDA Officially Approves Commonly Used Morphine Formulation
Teaser: The FDA has approved oral morphine sulphate 20 mg/mL for opioid-tolerant patients with severe acute or chronic pain.

Headlines: Sedatives, Analgesics and Adverse Neurodevelopment in Neonates
Teaser: Children who received sedatives and analgesics as neonates for cardiac surgery have normal neurologic development at 2 years of age, new study shows.

Headlines: Higher Doses of Opioids in Chronic Pain Patients Linked to Increased Overdose Risk
Teaser: Higher doses of opioids in  chronic pain patients have been associated with an increased risk for overdose.

Headlines: NSAIDs May Be More Effective Than Paracetamol for Menstrual Pain
Teaser: A Cochrane systematic review shows that nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs are an effective treatment of dysmenorrhea, but there is a significant risk for adverse effects.

Headlines: Little Risk for Addiction From Long-Term Opioid Use in Select Chronic Pain Patients
Teaser: Long-term opioid therapy is associated with little risk for addiction when given to select patients with chronic noncancer pain and no history of substance abuse.

Headlines: AAN Guideline Recommends Against TENS for Chronic Low-Back Pain
Teaser: Literature review shows no benefit for use of transcutaneous electric nerve stimulation, at least in chronic low-back pain, but good evidence data were found to support its use in diabetic neuropathy.

Headlines: Acetaminophen May Also Relieve Psychological Pain
Teaser: New research suggests acetaminophen may not only help physical aches and pains but may also reduce psychological distress caused by social rejection.

Headlines: Cytochrome P450 Gene Implicated in Need for High-Dose Pain Medication
Teaser: Genetic abnormalities in cytochrome P450 may cause accelerated opioid metabolism; patients with the defect appear to require unusually high doses for pain control.

Headlines: Alleviation of Opioid Withdrawal Symptoms Primary Driver of Illicit Buprenorphine Use
Teaser: Illicit use of buprenorphine is primarily driven by a desire to alleviate symptoms of opioid withdrawal and not to get high.

Headlines: Topical Diclofenac Labeling Updated to Match Oral Agents' Hepatotoxicity Warnings
Teaser: Treatment with all products containing diclofenac sodium, including Voltaren Gel, may increase liver dysfunction, resulting in severe hepatic reactions and liver transplantation or death.

Headlines: Percutaneous Disc Decompression Provides Long-Term Relief of Sciatica Pain
Teaser: In a randomized controlled trial, percutaneous disc decompression proved superior to conservative treatment, resulting in significant pain relief for the entire 2-year follow-up period.

Headlines: Low-Level Laser Therapy May Be Helpful for Chronic Neck Pain
Teaser: In a review and meta-analysis, low-level laser therapy alleviated both acute and chronic neck pain vs placebo.

Headlines: Chronic Pain Linked to Risk for Falls in Older Adults
Teaser: A study shows that chronic pain in 1 or more locations that is severe or that interferes with daily activities is associated with a greater risk for falls in older adults.

Headlines: FDA Approves Nonnarcotic Pain Patch for Postherpatic Neuralgia
Teaser: Each 1-hour application of capsaicin 8% dermal patch provides up to 3 months of localized pain relief.

Headlines: Infusion of Local Anesthetic Linked to Postsurgical Chondrolysis
Teaser: Chondrolysis has been reported in patients receiving continuous intra-articular infusions of local anesthetics with elastomeric infusion devices to control postsurgical pain.

Headlines: Chronic Pain May Persist for Years After Breast Cancer Surgery
Teaser: Nearly half of all breast cancer patients reported having persistent pain following surgery, even after several years, according to a large Danish study.

Headlines: Vertebroplasty Reduces Pain, Improves Mobility
Teaser: Patients with multiple myeloma and nonosteoporotic vertebral compression fractures have improved mobility, can reduce analgesia, and are better able to handle treatment after vertebroplasty.

Headlines: Young Women With Multiple Myeloma at Highest Risk for Nausea and Pain
Teaser: Being female, a diagnosis of multiple myeloma, and younger age are all risk factors for nausea and pain after stem cell transplantation.

Headlines: Vertebroplasty Provides Immediate Sustained Pain Relief
