Teaser: Contrary to recent studies, vertebroplasty significantly and immediately relieves pain from osteoporotic vertebral compression fractures.

Headlines: Severe Behavioral Problems in Childhood Predict Chronic Pain in Later Life
Teaser: Children with persistent, severe behavior problems are at increased risk for chronic widespread pain as adults.

Headlines: Regular Analgesic Use May Increase Risk for Hearing Loss
Teaser: Regular use of aspirin, acetaminophen, and nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs may increase the risk for hearing loss in men, particularly those younger than 60 years.

Headlines: FDA Approves Extended-Release Hydromorphone for Chronic Pain
Teaser: The FDA has approved hydromorphone HCl extended-release tablets for the management of pain in opioid-tolerant patients requiring continuous opioid analgesia for an extended period of time.

Headlines: CBT Significantly Improves Low Back Pain in the Short and Long Term
Teaser: Cognitive behavioral therapy improves moderately troublesome subacute and chronic low back pain in 1 year and is highly cost-effective.

Headlines: Cancer Pain is "Public Health Catastrophe" in Europe
Teaser: Opioid analgesics are critical to effective relief of cancer pain. However, in some European countries, opioids are either not fully available or their use is heavily restricted, says a new report.

Headlines: AAN Guideline Calls for Caution in Using Quinine to Treat Muscle Cramps
Teaser: The drug should be used only after other agents have failed and patients have been informed of adverse effects.

Headlines: Litigation in the Field of Pain Medicine
Teaser: In a mock trial to educate physicians about litigation issues, the "defendant" was accused of giving an injection that caused anoxic encephalopathy. The verdict from the jury was "not guilty."

Headlines: Carisoprodol Effective at Lower Dose of 250 mg
Teaser: Double-blind multicenter trials of carisoprodol show nearly equal pain relief with 250 mg and 350 mg, with a slightly lower rate of drowsiness with the lower dose.

Headlines: Opioids for Noncancer Pain a Subject of Hot Debate
Teaser: The use of opioids for noncancer pain is being hotly debated by pain-medicine specialists.

Headlines: Migraine Patients Get Results Using Interactive Web Site for Support
Teaser: The painACTION Web site shows promise in helping migraineurs cope with migraine headaches, although pain levels were not altered.

Headlines: Virtual Reality Helps Combat Burn Victims Through Wound Care Treatment
Teaser: A winter-themed virtual-reality program experienced by patients during painful wound care sessions significantly lowered pain scores during treatment.

Headlines: More Rapid Intervention in Pain by Anesthesiologists, Pain Specialists
Teaser: A review of commercial claims data also shows a high number of chiropractor diagnoses.

Headlines: Sodium Oxybate for Fibromyalgia Does Well in First International Trial
Teaser: A placebo-controlled study of sodium oxybate resulted in a clinically relevant reduction in pain of more than 30% and significant improvements in quality of life and sleep.

Headlines: Functional MRI Combined With a Support Vector Machine May Discern Pain
Teaser: The method made accurate predictions that a given stimulus was painful for subjects more than 80% of the time.

Headlines: Spinal Cord Stimulation: Good Long-Term Results for Visceral Abdominal Pain
Teaser: Chronic pancreatitis patients showed a big drop in opioid use a year after spinal cord stimulation.

Headlines: IVIG Improves Symptoms in Refractory Complex Regional Pain Syndrome
Teaser: Low-dose intravenous immunoglobulin reduces pain and improves autonomic limb symptoms in patients with long-standing CRPS.

Headlines: More Favorable Results With Tanezumab for Various Pain Types
Teaser: Trials found good results for osteoarthritis of the knee and interstitial cystitis pain, as well as chronic low back pain, but it also caused a higher number of abnormal peripheral sensation events.

Headlines: Tapentadol Sometimes Better Tolerated, But Opioids Still First Line
Teaser: A new post hoc analysis of 1-year safety data for tapentadol extended release in low back pain or osteoarthritis shows that the drug has a good safety profile.

Headlines: FDA Approves Nasal Formulation of Ketorolac for Short-Term Pain Management
Teaser: The FDA has approved an intranasal formulation of ketorolac tromethamine (Sprix Nasal Spray) for short-term management of moderate to moderately severe pain requiring analgesia at the opioid level.

Headlines: Oral Sweet Solutions May Reduce Pain of Infant Immunization
Teaser: A systematic review suggests that infants given sweet solutions before being immunized experience less pain and are more comfortable.

Headlines: Virtual Reality Programming Relieves Pain
Teaser: The computer-simulated environments appear to moderate the perception of pain by engaging visual and other senses.

Headlines: Returning Soldiers Require Integrated Care for Overlapping Symptoms
Teaser: Pain, posttraumatic stress, and mild traumatic brain injury have similarities that benefit from concurrent rather than independent treatment, say experts.

Headlines: FDA Recalls Specific GE Anesthesia Systems
Teaser: The FDA has issued a class 1 recall of specific lots of the Aisys and Avance anesthesia systems.

Headlines: New National Drug Control Policy Includes More Prescription Monitoring
Teaser: The White House made its new strategy tackling America's drug problem public Tuesday. The plan will expand prescription drug monitoring and link state systems.

Headlines: The Challenge of Treating Patients With Chronic Pain and Addiction
Teaser: Pain specialists describe how to strike that delicate balance between treating symptoms without fanning the flames of addiction in patients who are struggling.

Headlines: Opioid Prescribing Will Be Supervised Within the Year, Say Officials
Teaser: The FDA's controversial opioid risk evaluation and mitigation strategies known as REMS are nearing completion and will likely include mandatory education.

Headlines: Possible Genetic Mechanism for Chronic Pain Identified
Teaser: Chronic pain may induce reprogramming of numerous genes in the peripheral nervous system, new research suggests.

Headlines: FDA Approves Naproxen/Esomeprazole Combo for Arthritis
Teaser: Naproxen/esomeprazole magnesium delayed-release tablets have been linked to decreased risk for gastric ulcers.

Headlines: New Guideline Tackles Undertreatment of Chronic Pain, Growing Misuse of Opioids
Teaser: A new Canadian guideline for opioid use in chronic noncancer pain addresses several clinical questions including undertreatment of chronic pain and the growing misuse of opioids.

Headlines: Complex Operations for Spinal Stenosis Increasing Despite Complications
Teaser: Investigators report a nearly 15% increase in complex fusion procedures even though they have a higher risk of perioperative mortality, major complications, and rehospitalization.

Headlines: Risk Factors for Opioid Misuse Among Pain Patients Differ by Sex
Teaser: A large study of patients with chronic pain shows that women who misuse opioids are more likely to be anxious or depressed, whereas men are more likely to have behavioral or legal problems.

Headlines: Single Dose of Aspirin Effective in Relieving Migraine Pain
Teaser: Over-the-counter aspirin appears to be as effective as prescription medications in relieving migraine pain, a new Cochrane Database review article suggests.

Headlines: NSAIDs Significantly Decrease Pain Scores After Hip, Knee Arthroplasty
Teaser: Postoperative pain continues to be undertreated; implementation of American Pain Society guidelines would result in a decreased need for narcotics after hip and knee replacement surgery.

Headlines: Guidelines for Management of Vulvodynia Issued
Teaser: Evidence-based guidelines for management of vulvodynia were issued by the British Society for the Study of Vulval Diseases Guideline Group.

Headlines: New Chronic Pain Guidelines Published
Teaser: An American Society of Anesthesiologists task force has updated its chronic pain guidelines for the first time in more than a decade.

Headlines: Fibromyalgia Symptoms Eased by "Lifestyle Physical Activity"
Teaser: Gardening, walking, and other short bursts of activity curb pain, improve physical functioning, a new study suggests.

Headlines: Analgesic Use Linked to Lower Estrogen Levels in Postmenopausal Women
Teaser: If confirmed, this finding could potentially reduce the risk for breast and/or ovarian cancer in regular users of aspirin and other analgesics.

Headlines: Glucosamine No Better Than Placebo in Treating Low Back Pain
Teaser: A new randomized trial finds no benefit for low back pain or degenerative lumbar osteoarthritis with the popular supplement.

Headlines: Topical NSAIDs May Be Safe, Effective for Acute Musculoskeletal Conditions
Teaser: A Cochrane review suggests that topical NSAIDs can provide good pain relief for acute musculoskeletal conditions without the systemic adverse events of oral NSAIDs.

Headlines: New Immune System Clue to Low Back Pain
Teaser: Researchers identify a substance that may trigger inflammatory process for herniated and degenerated discs.

Headlines: For Acute Low Back Pain, Staying Active May Be Better Than Bed Rest
Teaser: Advice to stay active vs bed rest may offer small benefits in pain and function for patients with acute low back pain, but both approaches are comparable for sciatica.

Headlines: FDA Releases New REMS Proposal for Opioid Prescription Oversight
Teaser: The US Food and Drug Administration has announced a new proposed REMS that will include mandatory prescriber and patient education.

Headlines: Dramatic Increase in ED Visits Resulting From Prescription Opioid Use
Teaser: In a joint study, researchers from the CDC and SAMSHA find a 111% increase in ED visits involving nonmedical use of prescription opioid pain medications, especially oxycodone, hydrocodone, and methadone.

Headlines: Teriparatide Reduces Fractures, Back Pain in Women With Severe Osteoporosis
Teaser: There was a 73% reduction in fracture risk with teriparatide in postmenopausal women with severe osteoporosis, with risk beginning to drop after the first 6 months of treatment.

Headlines: Laparoscopic Approach Reduces Pain After Hysterectomy
Teaser: An Italian study shows that laparoscopic hysterectomy is less painful than vaginal hysterectomy, hospital stays are shorter, and blood loss is less.

Headlines: Naproxen Reduces Bone Pain Induced By Pegfilgrastim
Teaser: In cancer patients receiving chemotherapy, pegfilgrastim to support white blood cell counts can induce severe bone pain, but this can be reduced by naproxen.

Headlines: Psychological Aspects of Pain Management
Teaser: Current challenges in the field of pain management, with an emphasis on the psychological aspects, are discussed.

Headlines: Pain Remains a Significant Issue for Women With RA in Modern Treatment Era
Teaser: Pain is a significant issue for women with rheumatoid arthritis (RA), despite pain relief medication; pain management strategies to manage the social aspects of the disease is needed.

Headlines: Preop Ketorolac Cuts Breast Cancer Recurrence
Teaser: Ketorolac injected before the first incision reduced recurrence risk after mastectomy.

Headlines: Vasectomy Reversal Is Effective Treatment for Postvasectomy Pain
Teaser: Vasectomy reversal has a very high likelihood of relieving symptoms of postvasectomy pain, with 75% of patients experiencing complete symptom relief.

Headlines: Extended-Release Naltrexone Reduces Opioid Use
Teaser: A once-monthly injection of naltrexone is superior to placebo in reducing opioid use and cutting cravings in opioid-dependent patients.

Headlines: Psychosocial Factors May Predict Persistent Pain After Orthopaedic Trauma
Teaser: Psychosocial factors strongly predicted persistent pain, pain-related work disability, and pain severity 6 months after non-life-threatening acute orthopaedic trauma.

Headlines: Adalimumab May Be Helpful for Treatment of Sciatica
Teaser: In a randomized trial, adding a short course of adalimumab to usual treatment of acute and severe sciatica offered a small decrease in leg pain and in significantly fewer surgical procedures.

Headlines: FDA Warns of Suicide Risk for Tramadol
Teaser: The agency also is advising physicians that the opioid may be sought by patients with drug abuse and addiction problems or those with criminal diversion in mind.

Headlines: Balancing Sedation and Analgesia Concerns in the ICU
Teaser: Clinicians caring for patients in critical care units must balance concerns about sedation and analgesia with risks for respiratory suppression, inappropriate drug choice, and exacerbation of illness.

Headlines: Buprenorphine Treatment for Infants of Opiate-Addicted Mothers
Teaser: A large American study of the safety of buprenorphine in pregnancy finds that the drug results in lower neonatal abstinence scores than methadone, and shorter infant hospital stays.

Headlines: Suprapubic Aspiration More Painful Than Urine Catheterization in Preterm Infants
Teaser: Clinicians should take these findings under consideration when deciding on the appropriate method to rule out urinary tract infection, researchers say.

Headlines: Smoking Marijuana Eases Chronic Neuropathic Pain
Teaser: Smoking cannabis reduces chronic neuropathic pain and improves sleep, according to the results of a randomized controlled trial.

Headlines: Psychedelic Drugs May Reduce Symptoms of Depression, Anxiety, and OCD
Teaser: A new article argues that, based on recent behavioral and neuroimaging studies, low doses of psychedelics may provide relief for various mood disorders -- without the typical adverse effects.

Headlines: FDA Panel Says No to Sodium Oxybate for Fibromyalgia
Teaser: A joint FDA advisory committee has voted against approval of sodium oxybate for fibromyalgia.

Headlines: Botox Reduces Pain From Postmastectomy Reconstruction
Teaser: Botox helps patients tolerate breast reconstruction following mastectomy by significantly reducing the pain often associated with tissue expanders and breast implants.

Headlines: FDA Panel Gives Mixed Blessing to Duloxetine for Chronic Pain
Teaser: Eli Lilly's efforts to expand indications for duloxetine got a mixed response from an FDA advisory panel, who voted in favor of the drug for low back pain but against it for osteoarthritis.

Headlines: Blacks and Women at Risk of Receiving Inadequate Pain Care
Teaser: A new study suggests black people are prescribed fewer pain medications and women receive analgesics at insufficient strengths.

Headlines: Lilly Halts Development of Semagacestat for Alzheimer's Disease
Teaser: The action stems from preliminary results of 2 clinical trials finding no benefit and potential harm. Lilly's drug duloxetine goes to an FDA panel later this week for a new chronic pain indication.

Headlines: FDA Planning Final Opioid Recommendations by 2011
Teaser: The advisory committee vote against the agency's proposal was a blow to the plan, but regulators say they are working on a final decision.

Headlines: Vertebroplasty Gives Immediate Pain Relief for Acute Vertebral Fractures
Teaser: Vertebroplasty is safe, cost-effective, and provides superior pain relief than does conservative treatment for persistently painful acute osteoporotic vertebral compression fractures.

Headlines: Intranasal Medication Delivery for Children Reviewed
Teaser: A review highlights the most frequent pediatric indications for intranasal medication delivery: pain control, anxiolysis, and seizure control.

Headlines: Worse Mental Health Linked to Osteoarthritic Pain and Pain Flares
Teaser: A study showing an association between worsened measures of mental health and osteoarthritic pain suggests that general mental health is a modifiable component of health.

Headlines: Gene Variants Associated With Susceptibility to Postsurgical Chronic Pain
Teaser: A new study validates the role of genetic factors in individuals' differing perceptions of postsurgical pain.

Headlines: Better Adherence Improves Long-Term Exercise Therapy Outcome in Osteoarthritis
Teaser: In patients with hip and/or knee osteoarthritis, better adherence to home exercises and more physical activity improved long-term efficacy of exercise therapy.

Headlines: Acupuncture for Chronic Low Back Pain Reviewed
Teaser: A review summarizes recent evidence and management principles concerning the use of acupuncture for chronic low back pain.

Headlines: FDA Panel Rejects REMS for Opioids, Says Current Plan Inadequate
Teaser: Committee members voted overwhelmingly against the proposal, 25 to 10, saying safety measures are urgently needed, but the current approach doesn't go far enough to protect the public.

Headlines: New Pain Drug May Be Alternative to Oxycodone
Teaser: A study shows tapendatol has fewer side effects such as nausea or vomiting.

Headlines: Significant Increase in Prescription Pain Reliever Abuse, Subsequent Hospital Admissions
Teaser: In a new study, SAMSHA researchers found a 400% increase in substance abuse admissions due to the misuse of prescription pain relievers -- a finding that cuts across all ages, sexes, and ethnicities.

Headlines: "Telecare" Improves Cancer-Related Pain and Depression
Teaser: Pain and depression are the most common symptoms among cancer patients, but they can be reduced by telephone-based care management.

Headlines: Tylenol Recall Grows Again
Teaser: The recall of Tylenol and other over-the-counter medicines has grown once again, with Tylenol maker McNeil PCC Inc.

Headlines: FDA Approves 7-Day Buprenorphine Pain Patch
Teaser: The FDA has approved a once-weekly buprenorphine transdermal system for the management of moderate to severe chronic pain in patients requiring a continuous, around-the-clock opioid analgesic.

Headlines: Fentanyl Transdermal System Lots Recalled
Teaser: Eighteen lots of fentanyl transdermal 25 mcg/hour patches are subject to voluntary recall because of the accelerated release of fentanyl in 1 patch.

Headlines: Long-Term Use of Corticosteroid Injections for Tendinopathy May Be Harmful
Teaser: A meta-analysis of randomized trials suggests that corticosteroid injections only help tendinopathy in the short term and that they may cause harm if used longer.

Headlines: Tylenol Recalled Again Due to Musty Odor
Teaser: A musty odor spurs another recall of the J&J/McNeil Product.

Headlines: Once-Monthly Naltrexone Approved for Treatment of Opioid Addiction
Teaser: Naltrexone for extended-release injectable suspension (Vivitrol), already approved for alcohol dependence, now approved for opioid addiction.

Headlines: Buprenorphine Implants May Be Effective for Opioid Dependence, Phase 3 Study Suggests
Teaser: A large randomized controlled trial suggests a subdermal implant may be effective in treating opioid dependence.

Headlines: Sublingual Buprenorphine Relieves Symptoms of Neonatal Opioid Abstinence Syndrome
Teaser: A new phase 1 study suggests that sublingual buprenorphine is safe and more effective than oral morphine in treating infants with neonatal opioid syndrome.

Headlines: Pain of Herpes Zoster Significantly Affects Health-Related Quality of Life
Teaser: A prospective study supports the need for preventive strategies and other early interventions to reduce the burden of herpes zoster and postherpetic neuralgia.

Headlines: Study Reviews Faces Scales for Reporting Pain in Kids
Teaser: A new study systematically reviews faces scales for the self-report of pain intensity in children.

Headlines: New Clues to Chronic Pelvic Pain
Teaser: Conditions that cause chronic pelvic pain -- such as irritable bowel syndrome and overactive bladder -- often occur together, and now new research may have uncovered more information on why.

Headlines: Anger Linked to Pain in Women With and Without Fibromyalgia
Teaser: A study indicates that anger amplifies clinical pain in women with and without fibromyalgia, and another study shows that cognitive therapy is effective in the treatment of fibromyalgia.

Headlines: Simple Policy Change Can Help Prevent Much Fraudulent Reporting of Stolen Opioid Medication
Teaser: Requiring the alleged victim of stolen prescription medication to produce a verification letter from his or her physician can significantly decrease false reports of stolen opioids.

Headlines: Opioids Help Stabilize Depression, Anxiety in Patients With Chronic Low Back Pain
Teaser: Patients receiving opioid therapy for lower back pain or osteoarthritis had stable or slightly improved depression, anxiety, and positive outlook symptoms during 6 months to 1 year of observation.

Headlines: Trial Shows Safety, Efficacy of 7-Day Buprenorphine Patch in Opioid-Naive Patients
Teaser: A double-blind, 12-week, phase 3 study demonstrated the analgesic efficacy and safety of buprenorphine for the relief of moderate to severe chronic lower back pain in opioid-naive patients.

Headlines: Lidoderm Patch Helps Reduce Oral Opioid Treatment in Knee Replacement Patients
Teaser: A transdermal lidocaine 5% patch appears to result in a decrease in overall pain after unilateral knee replacement, which is important for a successful recovery.

Headlines: Pregabalin Not Effective in Chronic Prostatitis/Chronic Pelvic Pain Syndrome
Teaser: Pregabalin shows no benefit in the primary outcome of pain reduction, as measured by a 6-point decline in score, in chronic prostatitis/chronic pelvic pain syndrome.

Headlines: Ultrasound-Guided Corticosteroid Injections Relieve Chronic Lateral Hip Pain
Teaser: A peritendinous ultrasound-guided corticosteroid injection may be an effective treatment for gluteus medius tendinopathy.

Headlines: FDA Panel Recommends Naltrexone Extended-Release Injectable Suspension for Opioid Addiction
Teaser: An FDA committee supports the use of naltrexone for extended-release injectable suspension for the treatment of opioid dependence.

Headlines: Long-Term Opioid Use Linked to Increased ED Visits, Drug and Alcohol Problems
Teaser: Long-term use of opioids with a high potential for dependence and abuse may increase the risk for emergency department visits and drug and alcohol problems.

Headlines: FDA Approves Sublingual Film Formulation of Buprenorphine/Naloxone
Teaser: Previously only available in sublingual tablet form, buprenorphine/naloxone in the form of a sublingual film will become available in starting in October 2010.

Headlines: Oral Sucrose May Not Provide Effective Analgesia in Neonates
Teaser: A randomized trial suggests that the ability of sucrose to reduce clinical observational scores after noxious events in newborns may not reflect pain relief, but editorialists say it may be premature to draw that conclusion.

Headlines: Parents' Assessment of Earache Pain in Children May Be Unreliable
Teaser: Socioeconomic status might affect the interpretation of symptoms in preverbal children, so investigators question the utility of an overall pain score from a 1-item parent scale.

Headlines: Smoking May Worsen Pain for Cancer Patients
Teaser: Patients with cancer who continue to smoke despite their diagnosis experience greater pain severity than those who quit or who have never smoked.

Headlines: Methadone Exposure Tied to Poor Perinatal Outcome
Teaser: Women on methadone are at risk for a variety of perinatal problems, Irish researchers report. Moreover, neonatal abstinence syndrome was related to methadone intake in their study.

Headlines: Opioids Linked to More Adverse Events in Older Adults With Arthritis
Teaser: The comparative safety of nonselective NSAIDs, coxibs, and opioids varies depending on the safety event studied, with opioids showing increased mortality.

Headlines: Codeine Linked to Increased CVD Events, Mortality
Teaser: A large observational study links codeine and oxycodone to an increased risk for cardiovascular events and all-cause mortality after only 30 days among older adults treated for noncancer pain.

Headlines: Surgery Riskier for Redheads? Evidence Slim
Teaser: People with red hair may feel more pain, but there's little evidence of excessive bleeding.

Headlines: Intrathecal Ziconotide May Increase Risk for Suicide
Teaser: A recent suicide has raised the suspicion that ziconotide can pose a psychiatric threat to patients.

Headlines: Buprenorphine for Addiction in Pregnancy Reduces Symptoms of Neonatal Abstinence Syndrome
Teaser: Infants of opioid-dependent women who take buprenorphine during pregnancy have fewer symptoms of neonatal abstinence syndrome.

Headlines: Propoxyphene Withdrawn From US Market
Teaser: The move will include all propoxyphene-containing products, both brand-name and generic.

Headlines: Nurse-Practitioner-Led Spinal Clinic May Be Effective, Feasible
Teaser: A pilot study showed that a nurse-practitioner-led spinal clinic produced 100% concurrence with surgeon diagnoses, 95% concurrence with management plans, and shorter waiting times.

Headlines: Opioid Use Increases Seniors' Risk for Falls
Teaser: Seniors are more likely to experience falls during the first few weeks of opioid use than later on, and short-acting drugs appear to carry a greater initial risk than longer-acting ones.

Headlines: Ibuprofen/Famotidine Reduces Gastric Ulcer Incidence
Teaser: HZT-501, an ibuprofen-famotidine combination, is associated with a reduction in upper gastrointestinal ulcer incidence and in increased compliance relative to ibuprofen alone.

Headlines: Negative Social Encounters May Reduce Sensitivity to Physical Pain
Teaser: Mildly negative social encounters, of the kind that are often experienced in everyday living, are able to decrease sensitivity to physical pain.

Headlines: Rilonacept Prophylactic Against Gout Flares
Teaser: Rilonacept prevents gout flares during urate-lowering therapy but it is ineffective for relieving pain during flares, new research has found.

Headlines: FDA Approves Duloxetine for Chronic Musculoskeletal Pain
Teaser: The FDA has approved duloxetine for the once-daily treatment of chronic low back pain and osteoarthritis.

Headlines: Subpleural Infusion of Local Anesthetic Controls Pain After Lung Surgery
Teaser: A continuous infusion of local anesthetic just over the intercostal nerve substantially reduces pain and gets patients back to normal faster after thoracic surgery, according to a presentation yesterday afternoon in Vancouver at CHEST 2010, the annual international scientific assembly of the American College of Chest Physicians.

Headlines: FDA Approves First Intravenous Formulation of Acetaminophen
Teaser: The FDA has approved the first and only intravenous formulation of acetaminophen for the management of pain, the management of pain with adjunctive opioid analgesics, and the reduction of fever.

Headlines: Pain at the End of Life Is Common and Strongly Linked to Arthritis
Teaser: Pain is present in more than one quarter of elderly persons during the last 2 years of life; arthritis is strongly associated with pain at the end of life.

Headlines: Pharmacotherapy for Fibromyalgia, Pain, and Depression
Teaser: Two recent presentations covered pharmacotherapy of fibromyalgia and the often overlapping conditions of pain and depression.

Headlines: Opiate Replacement Treatment Reduces Mortality in Addicted Patients
Teaser: New research from Britain finds that opiate replacement treatment for at least a year by drug misusers can lead to a decrease in overall mortality of more than 85%.

Headlines: Buprenorphine, Collaborative Care Key to Success in Treating Opioid Addiction
Teaser: Study provides more evidence that office-based treatment of opioid addiction with buprenorphine is feasible and often successful in the primary care setting.

Headlines: Sucrose Better Than Lidocaine for Venipuncture Pain in Newborns
Teaser: Sucrose was more effective than liposomal lidocaine for reducing pain during venipuncture in newborns; there was no evidence of harm from either treatment.

Headlines: Morphine/Naltrexone Combo Temporarily Withdrawn
Teaser: King Pharmaceuticals notes that Embeda, a combination of morphine and naltrexone, has been voluntarily withdrawn because "a prespecified stability requirement was not met during routine testing."

Headlines: Ultrasound Survey May Help Athletes Prevent Tendon Damage
Teaser: Monitoring the Achilles and patellar tendons of elite athletes with ultrasonography might help predict and prevent damage progression.

Headlines: Pain Management in the Addicted Patient: A Problem in the ED
Teaser: Patients addicted to narcotics pose a problem to emergency department personnel.

Headlines: Ibuprofen Use Linked to Lower Parkinson's Risk
Teaser: A new analysis from the Nurses' Health Study and Health Professionals Follow-up Study show a lower risk with ibuprofen but not other analgesics.

Headlines: Nitric Oxide Ineffective Against Sickle Cell Pain Episodes
Teaser: Inhaled gas no better than placebo in resolving vaso-occlusive pain crisis in patients with sickle cell disease.

Headlines: Opioid Use in Pregnancy Linked to Birth Defects
Teaser: Opioid use just before conception or in early pregnancy is associated with a modest but nonetheless potentially serious risk for birth defects.

Headlines: Dr. Neal Slatkin Named One of America's Top Doctors for Cancer Pain
Teaser: Cancer pain specialist and palliative care physician Neal Slatkin, MD, has been voted one of America's top doctors in pain medicine by his fellow physicians.

Headlines: CBT and Exercise Therapy Safe, Effective for Chronic Fatigue Syndrome
Teaser: Cognitive behavioral therapy and graded exercise are safe and moderately effective in patients with chronic fatigue syndrome, a large randomized trial suggests.

Headlines: Warming Anesthetics Reduces Pain of Injections
Teaser: Warming injections to body temperature eases the pain of getting a shot, a study finds.

Headlines: Deep-Brain Stimulation May Relieve Refractory Hypertension
Teaser: In a case report, researchers found a patient's treatment-resistant hypertension responded to a deep-brain stimulation device implanted for chronic pain.

Headlines: Hydrocodone Bitartrate/Acetaminophen and Phenobarbital Tablets Recalled
Teaser: Mislabeled bottles may result in patients unintentionally taking one product instead of the other, with potentially serious harm.

Headlines: Physicians Say Good Riddance to 'Worst Drug in History'
Teaser: The opioid first approved by the US Food and Drug Administration in 1957 has been pulled from the market and many are happy to see it go.

Headlines: ACP Issues Guidelines for Diagnostic Imaging for Low Back Pain
Teaser: The American College of Physicians found strong evidence that routine imaging for low back pain with radiography or advanced imaging methods does not improve patient health.

Headlines: Chronic Pain Common in Cancer Survivors Needs to Be Addressed
Teaser: Cancer-related chronic pain is prevalent among survivors, and the pain experience is worse in female and black survivors.

Headlines: Do Psychiatrists Need Pain Training?
Teaser: A Perspectives article published in the January issue of Archives of General Psychiatry argues that pain education should be included in the core curriculum of psychiatric residency training.

Headlines: FDA Limits Acetaminophen in Prescription Analgesics
Teaser: The agency decision, which does not affect over-the-counter pain relievers, seeks to reduce the number of acetaminophen overdoses that result in severe liver injury.

Headlines: All Nonsteroidal Anti-Inflammatory Drugs Have Cardiovascular Risks
Teaser: A new study has put the well-known pain relievers back in the headlines, with data showing all NSAIDs increase the risk for cardiovascular events.

Headlines: FDA Approves Fentanyl Transmucosal Tablets for Cancer Pain
Teaser: The FDA has approved an immediate-release transmucosal tablet formulation of fentanyl for the management of breakthrough cancer pain in patients who receive around-the-clock opioid therapy.

Headlines: Prescription for Opioids Often Precedes Teen Addiction
Teaser: A single-center study shows teen addicts received a mean of 5 prescriptions for opiates during a 2-year period.

Headlines: Better for Infants When Addicted Moms Use Buprenorphine in Pregnancy
Teaser: A new analysis suggests buprenorphine for the treatment of opioid dependence during pregnancy produces more favorable neonatal outcomes.

Headlines: Age Predicts Outcome With Naltrexone for Opioid Dependence
Teaser: A new secondary analysis suggests patients younger than 30 years do best with injectable naltrexone for opioid dependence, but comparisons to existing treatments are lacking.

Headlines: Gabapentin May Help Prevent Postherpetic Neuralgia
Teaser: A study suggests that adding gabapentin to antiviral therapy in patients with acute herpes zoster reduces the incidence of postherpetic neuralgia.

Headlines: Cancer Pain in Spain: One Third Is Neuropathic
Teaser: The news comes from a screening of more than 8500 cancer patients.

Headlines: Muscle Tendon Injections for Persistent Back Pain?
Teaser: Results of a retrospective review showed that muscle tendon injections can provide long-term relief from pain in patients with failed epidurals, facet blocks, and spinal surgery.

Headlines: New AAN Guidelines on Painful Diabetic Neuropathy
Teaser: AAN has released new guidelines on best management of painful diabetic neuropathy.

Headlines: Novel Spinal Neuromodulation Device Eases Low Back Pain
Teaser: A new implantable spinal neuromodulation device delivers significant relief from low back pain without paresthesia.

Headlines: More to Poststernotomy Pain Than Intercostal Nerve Damage?
Teaser: Results from a study of poststernotomy patients showed that those who reported more sternal pain also reported more pain in the head, neck, back, and upper extremities.

Headlines: High-Dose Opioid Prescribing Directly Boosts Death Risk
Teaser: As overdose deaths in the United States continue to increase, a large national study shows that part of this increase may be directly related to high-dose prescribing.

Headlines: Topical Benzocaine Associated With Methemoglobinemia
Teaser: Benzocaine sprays, gels, and liquids may cause methemoglobinemia, a rare but serious and potentially fatal condition.

Headlines: Does Early Anesthesia for Combat Injuries Ease Pain Later?
Teaser: Ongoing study of combat-injured soldiers is expected to shed new light on the role of early regional anesthesia in reducing pain over time.

Headlines: Pain Relief Often Lacking in Inpatient Pediatric Procedures
Teaser: A Canadian study shows that less than one third of painful procedures for hospitalized children are associated with documented pain relief.

Headlines: Good Results Using Sympathetic Block for Phantom Pain
Teaser: Results from a case study of a patient with refractory phantom pain related to chronic preamputation pain showed that sympathetic block provided safe and effective relief.

Headlines: Efficacy, Safety of Topical Diclofenac Similar to Oral Form
Teaser: A pooled analysis of patients with arthritis showed that topical diclofenac produced comparable efficacy to the oral form and was associated with fewer adverse events.

Headlines: Percutaneous Spinal Surgery Gets High Marks at 1 Year
Teaser: A minimally invasive spine surgery technique has shown sustained improvements in pain and mobility at 1 year postoperatively, with no serious adverse events.

Headlines: Ziconotide May Be Effective Against Central Pain in MS
Teaser: Results from a case series study of 7 patients suggest that treatment with ziconotide may be an effective and safe way to manage MS-related central pain.

Headlines: Cannabis Use May Harm Cognitive Function in MS Patients
Teaser: A cross-sectional study suggests long-term heavy use of street cannabis may impair cognitive function in patients with MS.

Headlines: Patients With Intractable Pain Report Relief Using HCG
Teaser: A small study of patients with intractable pain reported reductions in symptoms after a year of treatment with human chorionic gonadotropin.

Headlines: Pretonsillectomy Local Anesthetic May Not Lower Post-Op Pain
Teaser: Pretonsillectomy injection of local anesthetics is not recommended to reduce pain after a tonsillectomy.

Headlines: Pain Specialists Back Plan for Opioid Education
Teaser: In the first national meeting on pain since the US Food and Drug Administration announced its long-awaited opioid plan, specialists supported the move, but they did so with reservations.

Headlines: Management of Acute Pain After Hip Fracture
Teaser: A systematic review found moderate-level evidence for beneficial effects of nerve blockade against acute pain and delirium after hip fracture.

Headlines: Clinical Trial of Virtual Reality Hypnosis Launched
Teaser: Testing for the innovative approach for depression and anxiety in chronic pain is scheduled to begin this summer.

Headlines: Pain Common in Multiple Sclerosis, Restricts Function
Teaser: More than half of MS patients in a new study reported moderate to severe pain that limited function.

Headlines: High-Dose Methadone Boosts Cardiovascular Risk
Teaser: Investigators are reporting a dose-dependent effect in patients taking more than 120 mg per day.

Headlines: Trigger Point Wand Eases Chronic Pelvic Pain
Teaser: Patient self-treatment using a therapeutic wand for myofascial trigger point release appears to be a safe, viable, and economic chronic pelvic pain management.

Headlines: Corticosteroid Injections May Relieve Pain of Hip Bursitis
Teaser: In a randomized controlled trial, corticosteroid injections were effective for greater trochanteric pain syndrome managed in primary care.

Headlines: Opioid Monitoring Lax and Inconsistent, Study Finds
Teaser: Physicians are not conducting consistent risk reduction for patients taking long-term opioids, report researchers.

Headlines: Even Short-Term NSAID Use Risky in Cardiac Patients
Teaser: A study indicates there is no apparent safe therapeutic window for NSAIDs in patients with prior myocardial infarction.

Headlines: WHO Finds Headache Disorders Neglected Worldwide
Teaser: An investigation by the World Health Organization reveals insufficient recognition, diagnosis, and treatment of headache disorders worldwide.

Headlines: Pacifier, Sucrose Relieves Nasogastric Tube Pain in Infants
Teaser: Use of a pacifier and 30% sucrose solution reduces pain related to the insertion of a nasogastric feeding tube in preterm infants.

Headlines: Naltrexone Effective for Opioid Addiction, but Concerns Linger
Teaser: A randomized controlled trial shows that once-monthly injectable extended-release naltrexone significantly increases abstinence and decreases cravings for those with opioid dependence.

Headlines: FDA's Long-Awaited Opioid Plan Calls for Education
Teaser: The new regulations will have implications for the close to 700,000 prescribers of long-acting and extended-release opioids.

Headlines: Federal Crack Down on Prescription Drug Abuse Gets Thumbs Up
Teaser: National psychiatry and addiction organizations are coming together to applaud and promote the federal government's new plan to stop abuse of prescription drugs.

Headlines: Patient Attitude Predicts Outcome of Neck Surgery for Pain
Teaser: Patients who preoperatively expected no arm or neck pain after cervical discectomy reported less pain and more satisfaction with the results compared with patients who expected some residual pain.

Headlines: Higher Opioid Dose for Nonmalignant Pain Linked to Mortality
Teaser: In patients given opioids for nonmalignant pain, the daily dose is strongly associated with opioid-related mortality, particularly at doses over thresholds recommended in recent clinical guidelines.

Headlines: Paracetamol Use in Pregnancy Linked to Childhood Asthma
Teaser: A meta-analysis of studies shows a 21% increase in the risk for childhood asthma associated with use of paracetamol at any time during pregnancy.

Headlines: Trial of Gene Therapy for Pain Finds Dose-Related Response
Teaser: Transfer of vector that contains preproenkephalin gene to dorsal root ganglion produces dose-dependent pain relief in patients with intractable cancer pain.

Headlines: Feds Launch Plan to Fight Prescription Drug Epidemic
Teaser: A new collaborative action plan for prescription drug abuse urges prescriber education on opioid risks and benefits, recommends expanded monitoring programs, and calls for new laws.

Headlines: Military Drug Abuse Linked to Prescription of Pain Meds
Teaser: A history of pain medication prescriptions strongly predicts subsequent drug misuse, new research suggests.

Headlines: Do Family Physicians Take Abdominal Pain Seriously?
Teaser: Family physicians rarely send patients off for referrals or further testing.

Headlines: Massage Therapy May Relieve Chronic Back Pain
Teaser: Massage therapy may be effective for treatment of chronic back pain, with benefits lasting at least 6 months and no clinically meaningful difference seen between relaxation and structural massage.

Headlines: NSAID Use Associated With Risk of Atrial Fibrillation or Flutter
Teaser: Study adds evidence that these arrhythmic risks should be added to the overall CV risks when considering prescribing NSAIDs, say researchers.

Headlines: Pain Common but Undertreated, Experts Say
Teaser: Despite a greater understanding of the pathophysiologic process of pain and its management, chronic pain remains inadequately treated, experts say.

Headlines: FDA Approves First Fentanyl Nasal Spray for Cancer Pain
Teaser: The FDA has approved the first fentanyl nasal spray to treat breakthrough pain in cancer patients who are opioid tolerant.

Headlines: Institute of Medicine Issues Blueprint for Pain in America
Teaser: The institute is calling for coordinated national efforts to reduce risks while ensuring access to pain relief for those who need it.

Headlines: Nation's Prescription Drug Abuse Problem Continues to Grow
Teaser: Two new SAMHSA reports show treatment admissions for substance abuse is increasing significantly in the United States, as are ED visits for drug-related suicide attempts by men.

Headlines: New Tylenol Recall Due to Musty Odor
Teaser: Johnson and Johnson recalls about 60,000 bottles of Tylenol Extra Strength Caplets.

Headlines: Medtronic's FDA Data on Infuse Contradict Published Studies
Teaser: The Senate Finance Committee is investigating whether Medtronic failed to report adverse effects seen in trials with rhBMP-2 in spinal fusion surgery.

Headlines: Endo Recalls Two Lots of Pain Drug
Teaser: Endo Pharmaceuticals Holdings Inc said it voluntarily issued a nationwide recall of two lots of its pain drug Endocet as the bottles may contain incorrect tablets that have a higher dose of, acetaminophen.

Headlines: Recall of Pain, Headache Meds Because of Label Mix-Up
Teaser: Patients who accidentally take a tablet containing butalbital could experience sedation, lightheadedness, dizziness, and nausea, according to the US Food and Drug Administration.

Headlines: Sleep Deficiency Linked to Increased Pain
Teaser: Sleep deficiency among healthcare workers was associated with increased musculoskeletal pain and resulted in limitations at work and home.

Headlines: FDA Approves New Drug for Chronic Anal Fissure Pain
Teaser: The FDA has approved Rectiv for the treatment of pain associated with chronic anal fissures; the ointment has been in use in Europe and 34 other countries for some years.

Headlines: Effect of Pruritus Similar to Chronic Pain in Reducing QoL
Teaser: A cross-sectional study shows that individuals with chronic pruritus appear to have a similar reduction in quality of life as do individuals with chronic pain.

Headlines: FDA Approves Tamper-Resistant Oxycodone
Teaser: Pfizer announced today approval for Oxecta, an immediate-release oxycodone formulation with a tamper-resistant technology.

Headlines: Analgesic Effect of Sucrose in Preemies Enhanced With EMLA
Teaser: For preterm infants undergoing venipuncture, oral sucrose and application of EMLA cream (lidocaine and prilocaine) has a greater analgesic effect than sucrose alone, according to a new report.

Headlines: New Imaging Agent Pinpoints Source of Chronic Back Pain
Teaser: The newly approved F-18 sodium fluoride PET/CT imaging agent highlights areas of high bone turnover and inflammation previously unidentified by magnetic resonance imaging or clinical exam.

Headlines: Chronic Opioid Use Shortens Kidney Transplant Survival
Teaser: Chronic opioid use before kidney transplantation was associated with an increased risk for early graft loss and higher mortality posttransplant. Smoking also raised the risk for graft loss.

Headlines: Pictorial Scale Measures Severity of Pediatric Nausea
Teaser: A pictorial scale was found effective for assessing pediatric nausea and was able to detect change after treatment.

Headlines: Physicians Often Can't Predict Who Will Misuse Pain Meds
Teaser: Prescribers trying to gauge who will abuse pain medications are wrong about half the time, a new study shows.

Headlines: Oxycodone No Safer Than Codeine While Breast-Feeding
Teaser: Postpartum pain prescriptions need to change again, warn investigators.

Headlines: Cochrane Review Tackles Acute Postoperative Pain
Teaser: The work includes results from about 350 studies spanning some 45,000 patients comparing single-dose oral analgesics.

Headlines: Class I Recall of Certain Medtronic Infusion Pumps
Teaser: Film formation in the pumps' batteries has been linked to reduced performance and loss of therapy.

Headlines: Parental Kangaroo Care Reduces Pain in Preterm Neonates
Teaser: In a randomized crossover trial, paternal kangaroo care was only slightly less effective than maternal kangaroo care for reducing procedural pain in preterm neonates.

Headlines: Scientists Find Gene That Controls Neuropathic Pain
Teaser: British scientists have identified a gene responsible for regulating chronic pain, called HCN2, and say their discovery should help drug researchers in their search for more effective painkillers.

Headlines: Chondroitin Sulfate Shows Efficacy for Hand Osteoarthritis
Teaser: The supplemental therapy reduced hand pain, function, and stiffness.

Headlines: 14 Florida Physicians Indicted in 'Pill Mill' Bust
Teaser: The "nation's largest criminal organization" in the pain medication racket posted security guards in its fight-prone waiting rooms and took its cash to the bank in garbage bags.

Headlines: Texas Court Overturns Vioxx Decision in Merck's Favor
Teaser: The Texas Supreme Court has overturned a $32 million judgment against Merck & Co, saying there was insufficient evidence to show the drug Vioxx caused the plaintiff's fatal heart attack.

Headlines: Deaths From Prescription Opioids on the Rise
Teaser: Deaths from opioids prescribed for noncancer pain tripled in the United States between 1999 and 2007 and are increasing in other countries, including the United Kingdom.

Headlines: Top-Line Results With Novel Chronic Pain Drug Positive
Teaser: A pivotal phase 3 study of an acetaminophen-free formulation of hydrocodone bitartrate for chronic moderate to severe pain meets the primary study end point.

Headlines: FDA Approves Tapentadol for Chronic Pain
Teaser: Tapentadol extended release, already approved for acute pain, has now been given the go ahead for chronic pain.

Headlines: Vagus Nerve Stimulation Shows Early Promise in Fibromyalgia
Teaser: A pilot study finds stimulation of the vagus nerve is safe and effective in patients with treatment-resistant fibromyalgia.

Headlines: No Evidence to Restrict Buprenorphine for Opioid Addiction
Teaser: Medicaid has no reason to ration substance abuse treatment with buprenorphine; in the long run, the drug is neither more costly nor less safe than other therapies, but some experts beg to differ.

Headlines: New Initiative to Make Long-Term Opioid Use Safer
Teaser: An individualized treatment plan that outlines treatment goals, medication regimens, and refill details aims to make long-term prescription opioid use safer.

Headlines: Few Differences Between Chronic and Acute Lower Back Pain
Teaser: Although chronic low back pain is more intense, more likely to be bilateral, and less likely to fluctuate than subacute low back pain, little else differs, a new study shows.

Headlines: Buprenorphine Implant Effective for Opioid Dependence
Teaser: New data suggest treatment with an investigative buprenorphine implant significantly reduces opioid dependence.

Headlines: Curry Spice Offers Hope for Tendinitis Pain
Teaser: Curcumin, which gives the curry spice turmeric its bright yellow color, could be helpful in treating painful inflammatory conditions, such as tendinitis and arthritis.

Headlines: Rosiglitazone Investigated for Neuropathic Pain
Teaser: The controversial diabetes drug is now being explored as a pain medication.

Headlines: Guided Self-Help May Benefit Unexplained Pain, Fatigue
Teaser: Self-help workbook coupled with brief nurse-led guidance sessions shows promise in the initial treatment of patients with unexplained functional neurologic symptoms.

Headlines: Sacral Neuromodulation Benefits in Pelvic Pain Ill-Defined
Teaser: Some patients may gain pelvic pain relief via sacral neuromodulation but others won't, Dutch researchers report.

Headlines: More Deaths From Opioids Than Cocaine, Heroin Combined
Teaser: A CDC report shows that America's prescription drug problem has reached epidemic proportions.

Headlines: Ultrasound-Guided Nerve Blocks Blunt Leg Fracture Pain
Teaser: For patients with painful femur fractures, particularly children, nerve blocks with ultrasound guidance significantly improve pain control while reducing adverse effects and nurses' workload.

Headlines: Yoga Improves Back Function in Patients With Low Back Pain
Teaser: The largest and longest-running trial of yoga for low back pain finds improvement in back function, but similar back pain and general health scores, compared with usual care.

Headlines: Slow-Release Nanoparticles Enhance Drugs for Knee Joint OA
Teaser: Injectable nanoparticles help OA drugs remain in the knee joint after intraarticular injection and might reduce the need for repeat injections.

Headlines: FDA Okays Exparel for Postoperative Pain
Teaser: The FDA has approved Pacira Pharmaceuticals' nonopioid bupivacaine extended-release liposome injection.

Headlines: Yoga, Stretching Ease Chronic Low Back Pain
Teaser: Results of a comparative effectiveness study show that both yoga classes and conventional stretching classes help relieve chronic low back pain and improve function.

Headlines: 'Doctor-Shoppers' Get Pain Meds at Medicare's Expense
Teaser: One patient amassed almost 5 years' worth of oxycodone in 2008 with prescriptions from 58 clinicians. Experts testifying in a recent Senate hearing on the problem reveal how to spot such fraudsters.

Headlines: Preoperative Multimodal Analgesia Guidelines Seldom Used
Teaser: A survey of anesthesiology providers finds that only 25% prescribe the recommended multimodal regimens in the preoperative setting, regimens that are designed to minimize postop pain.

Headlines: Novel Gene Implicated in Neuropathic Pain
Teaser: A new study suggests that the psychosocial factors that are most prominent should be considered when developing pain treatments.

Headlines: Pain Coping Strategies Differ in Depression, Anxiety
Teaser: Eastern European countries face economic, political, and other barriers to adequate pain management.

Headlines: Disparities in Pain Treatment Dividing Europe
Teaser: This approach was among a number of promising approaches to phantom pain discussed at the recent European pain meeting.

Headlines: Virtual Reality May Help Treat Phantom Limb Pain
Teaser: SIS patients report improvement in pain scores with the lidocaine/tetracaine patch.

Headlines: Patch May Take Pinch Out of Shoulder Impingement Syndrome
Teaser: Excipients make the drug unpleasant for nasal abuse.

Headlines: Oxycodone Pill Effective in Deterring Intranasal Abuse
Teaser: Allocating patients with low back pain in primary care to treatment based on their risk for disability is more effective and less costly than a 1-size-fits-all approach, a new study shows.

Headlines: Stratified Care Promising for Low Back Pain
Teaser: A single intravenous dose of ibandronate was similarly effective in providing pain relief, but there was a slight trend in favor of radiotherapy.

Headlines: Single-Dose Radiation Standard Remains for Bone Metastases
Teaser: Topical diclofenac sodium 1% gel improved pain scores related to knee osteoarthritis and is well-tolerated in younger and older patients alike.

Headlines: Topical NSAID Safe, Effective Regardless of Patient Age
Teaser: Long-term, high-dose opioids suppress FSH and testosterone production, and cortisol levels are elevated, indicating that endocrine response to pain is not resolved with the narcotics.

Headlines: Endocrine Screening Recommended With Long-Term Opioid Use
Teaser: Very few patients with postherpetic neuralgia actually achieve the optimal recommended dose of gabapentin, new research shows.

Headlines: Few Patients With Neuralgia Receive Optimal Gabapentin Dose
Teaser: Slow uptake of the investigational opioid NKTR-181 in the central nervous system reduces the euphoria and sedation that attracts opioid abusers.

Headlines: FDA Approves New Fentanyl Sublingual Spray
Teaser: Insys Therapeutics has announced FDA approval of Subsys, a fentanyl sublingual spray for breakthrough cancer pain.

Headlines: Long-Acting Bupivacaine Effective for Hemorrhoidectomy Pain
Teaser: A randomized trial of bupivacaine extended-release in patients undergoing hemorrhoidectomy showed increased pain relief and decreased opioid use compared with placebo.

Headlines: FDA Approves Class REMS for Immediate-Release Fentanyl
Teaser: With the shared REMS, the agency hopes to decrease misuse while reducing the burden on the healthcare system of separate risk strategies.

Headlines: J&J Pulls 12 Million Motrin Bottles From Shelves
Teaser: Johnson & Johnson said it is voluntarily asking retailers to remove about 12 million bottles of Motrin pain relievers from store shelves.

Headlines: Mindfulness Training Reduces Stress of Rheumatic Disease
Teaser: A mindfulness-based approach reduced psychological distress, pain, and symptoms in patients with inflammatory rheumatoid joint diseases.

Headlines: MRI Before Epidural of Scant Benefit in Back Pain
Teaser: Magnetic resonance imaging before epidural steroid injections for lower back pain does not improve patient outcomes or guide treatment decisions.

Headlines: Cannabis Augments Analgesic Effect of Opioids
Teaser: Results of a new study suggest that patients on chronic opioid therapy may get by with lower doses if combined with a cannabinoid.

Headlines: FDA Approves Tamper-Resistant Oxymorphone Formulation
Teaser: Endo Pharmaceuticals has announced the approval of Opana ER, a formulation of oxymorphone with a proprietary crush-resistant technology.

Headlines: Sublingual Buprenorphine Effective for Acute Fracture Pain
Teaser: For adults with acute bone fracture, a sublingual dose of buprenorphine relieves pain as effectively as intravenous morphine, according to a report from Iran.

Headlines: Clinician's Guide to the Best Adult Pain Measures
Teaser: Reviewers recommend the Numeric Rating Scale for Pain (NRS Pain), the Short Form-36 Bodily Pain Scale (SF-36 BPS), and the Measure of Intermittent and Constant Osteoarthritis Pain (ICOAP) for clinical use.

Headlines: FDA Approves Adaptive Neurostimulation Device
Teaser: A new device to relieve chronic pain has been approved by the US Food and Drug Administration.

Headlines: Phone Therapy, Exercise Helpful in Chronic Widespread Pain
Teaser: Telephone-based cognitive behavioral therapy and exercise, alone or combined, improve global health in patients with fibromyalgia, new research suggests.

Headlines: TMD Appliances Found Effective in Meta-Analysis?
Teaser: A meta-analysis of appliances for temporomandibular disorder showed that these appliances were more effective than placebo treatment, but critical review says the evidence is weak.

Headlines: Painful Jaw Condition Linked to Nervous System Dysregulation
Teaser: Patients with temporomandibular disorders exhibit a dysregulation of their automatic nervous system that probably contributes to their dysfunctional perception and regulation of pain.

Headlines: Drug Treatment Cuts Prescription Opioid Dependence
Teaser: Buprenorphine-naloxone may decrease dependence in patients addicted to prescription opioids, but only after extended and/or ongoing treatment.

Headlines: Plans to Curb Prescription Misuse Only Scratch Surface
Teaser: The American Pain Society applauds efforts to halt the mounting death toll from prescription drug overdoses, but warns there is more to be done.

Headlines: More Narcotic Use, Falls, Fractures After Rofecoxib Recall
Teaser: The recall of rofecoxib (Vioxx) led to more prescribing of narcotic analgesics for the treatment of pain in the elderly, which in turn increased the falls and fractures in this group.

Headlines: Diet and Exercise Reduce Pain in Osteoarthritis
Teaser: Intensive diet and exercise can slash pain and improve function and walking speed in older adults with osteoarthritis of the knees.

Headlines: FDA Opens Opioid Education 'Blueprint' for Comment
Teaser: The blueprint outlines 'core messages' for education modules aimed at opioid prescribers. The draft document is posted on the FDA site for community feedback.

Headlines: No Imaging Needed for Most Low Back Pain in Teens
Teaser: Most of the time, low back pain in adolescents will resolve with conservative management. Save the x-rays and CT for cases that donâ€™t get better after 6 weeks.

Headlines: Confirmation: Low-Dose Naltrexone Eases Fibromyalgia Pain
Teaser: The opioid antagonist likely works by suppressing microglial function.

Headlines: CDC Hosts Live Chat on US Prescription Drug Epidemic
Teaser: During a live chat session on Twitter, members of the CDC discussed the growing problem of prescription opioid abuse and ways clinicians and patients can fight back.

Headlines: Cancer Patients Who Smoke Report Worse Pain, Symptoms
Teaser: A causal relationship is not clear, but quitting is advised, researchers say.

Headlines: Education, Access to Naloxone May Reduce Opioid Deaths
Teaser: Education about symptoms of opioid overdose and access to a fast-acting drug that reverses potentially fatal respiratory depression may help prevent opioid-related deaths.

Headlines: Elderly Patients With Abdominal Pain: Tricky in the ED
Teaser: Elderly patients presenting with abdominal pain can be difficult to diagnose in the emergency department (ED), says expert Joseph P. Martinez, MD.

Headlines: US Senate Addresses Chronic Pain in First Hearing
Teaser: The first-of-its-kind meeting tackled the growing health epidemic that affects 116 million Americans at an annual cost of $635 billion.

Headlines: 'Unacceptable' Pain Levels Common After Knee Arthroplasty
Teaser: Opioids and systemic adjuvants are called "lousy," and local infiltration analgesia "only slightly better," by researchers reporting results of a meta-analysis.

Headlines: Buprenorphine Implant Safe for Opioid Dependence
Teaser: Topline results show that a buprenorphine implant is safe and well-tolerated for opioid dependence.

Headlines: Dog Therapy in Waiting Rooms Calms and Eases Pain
Teaser: Even brief canine encounters may set the tone for a positive doctor's visit.

Headlines: Cognitive Behavioral Therapy Aids Long-Term Pain Management
Teaser: Patients who received CBT as part of their pain management program maintained long-term improvement.

Headlines: FDA Panel Votes Against New Indication for Capsaicin Patch
Teaser: An advisory panel recommends against expanding the indication for 8% capsaicin patch to include treatment of the pain associated with HIV neuropathy.

Headlines: Muscle Relaxants Fail, Neuromodulators May Help in RA Pain
Teaser: Cochrane systematic reviews of muscle relaxants and neuromodulators in RA found little pain relief from the former, but some benefit from topical capsaicin.

Headlines: Cyberknife Surgery Another Option for Trigeminal Neuralgia
Teaser: Cyberknife radiosurgery gave partial or complete relief to 14 of 16 patients with trigeminal neuralgia and may be a viable alternative to more invasive treatment.

Headlines: Obesity and Daily Pain Linked, Study Finds
Teaser: The 1 million-person Gallup poll suggests excess weight makes Americans prone to higher rates of pain.

Headlines: Parasagittal Lumbar Steroid Injection Safest, Most Effective
Teaser: A new study finds that the parasagittal approach combines the safety of a midline approach and the efficacy of transforaminal techniques.

Headlines: Pain Negatively Affects Cognition in Fibromyalgia
Teaser: Pain decreased mathematical abilities and attention control more than depression, anxiety, fatigue, sleep complaints, or medication use.

Headlines: Spinal Cord Stimulation Effective for HIV Neuropathy
Teaser: This approach should be "a first-line therapy once individuals are identified with this peripheral neuropathic pain process," says researcher.

Headlines: Be Aware of Potential Dosing Errors With IV Acetaminophen
Teaser: Some dosing errors have been seen with the use of intravenous acetaminophen, most involving calculating dosage in milligrams but administering the drug in milliliters.

Headlines: FDA Issues Public Health Advisory on Certain Pain Meds
Teaser: The agency warns of a potential manufacturing problem with opioid products from Endo Pharmaceuticals that could lead to a stray pill of 1 medicine ending up in the bottle of another product.

Headlines: Spinal Manipulation, Exercise Trump Drugs for Neck Pain
Teaser: Spinal manipulation therapy and exercises that patients can do at home are more effective than drugs for relieving neck pain, a new study shows.

Headlines: No Link Seen Between Painkillers, Enlarged Prostate
Teaser: In contrast to some recent research, a new study finds no evidence that aspirin or ibuprofen protects against benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH).

Headlines: Opioid Rotation Practices Linked to Fatalities
Teaser: A new literature review cites evidence that dose conversion ratios may be at the root of increasing opioid-related deaths and near misses.

Headlines: FDA Approves EMG-Guided Injection System
Teaser: The US Food and Drug Administration approves an electromyographic (EMG) Guided Injection System for delivery of targeted injections.

Headlines: Ketamine-Propofol Similar to Propofol Alone for ED Sedation
Teaser: The combination of ketamine with propofol offers little advantage over propofol alone for emergency department procedural sedation and analgesia.

Headlines: Rare Birth Defects Linked to Prenatal Pain Medication Use
Teaser: A new study has identified an association between commonly used nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs and a wide range of birth defects.

Headlines: Opioids After Minor Surgery Linked to Long-Term Use
Teaser: Patients receiving a prescription within a week of surgery were 44% more likely to be opioid users a year later than those not receiving a prescription.

Headlines: FDA Panel Gives the Green Light for More Anti-NGF Testing
Teaser: The Arthritis Advisory Committee has unanimously agreed to let clinical trials with anti-nerve-growth-factor drugs continue, despite safety concerns about joint destruction associated with their use.

Headlines: FDA Turns Down Capsaicin Patch for Painful Neuropathy in HIV
Teaser: The US Food and Drug Administration issued a complete response letter for capsaicin 8% patch for HIV-related peripheral neuropathy.

Headlines: Should Addicted HCPs Return to Work While on Buprenorphine?
Teaser: Given buprenorphine's potential to cause cognitive problems, abstinence-based recovery should be recommended for opioid-abusing healthcare professionals, a new report suggests.

Headlines: Exercise and Rest Both Effective for Some Patients With Back Pain
Teaser: A new study finds daily rest and lumbar support is just as effective as regular exercise in relieving pain and disability in patients with low back pain and Modic changes.

Headlines: Veterans With Mental Illness More Likely to Receive Opioids
Teaser: Iraq and Afghanistan veterans with pain and post-traumatic stress disorder are more likely to be prescribed opioids than their counterparts without PTSD.

Headlines: Preemptive Ibuprofen Lessens Pain in Medical Abortion
Teaser: Researchers have found that compared with placebo, preemptive use of ibuprofen before medical abortion significantly reduced the need for additional analgesia.

Headlines: Experts Propose Urine Drug Test Guidance for Opioid Therapy
Teaser: All patients receiving long-term therapy have "a degree of risk for misuse."

Headlines: Pain Docs Have Highest Ratio of Patient Deaths to Opioid Rx
Teaser: The findings raise some hackles and prompt some theories.

Headlines: Substance Abuse, Comorbid Pain Treated Simultaneously
Teaser: Both high- and low-risk patients taper off pain meds and substances of abuse.

Headlines: Scans Show Altered Brain Connectivity in Chronic Back Pain
Teaser: Baseline connectivity abnormalities are further disrupted with pain exacerbations.

Headlines: Sacroiliac Steroid Injections Do Not Predict Ablation Relief
Teaser: One quarter of patients who might respond to radiofrequency ablation may be disqualified based on poor criteria.

Headlines: Is Procedural Pain Prognostic in Lumbar Epidural Injection?
Teaser: Studies are divided on the optimistic indication of concordant procedural pain.

Headlines: Hypogonadism Risk Higher With Long vs Short-Acting Opioids
Teaser: New findings provide the first evidence of a safety difference between opioid formulations.

Headlines: Can Vitamin D Treat Pain?
Teaser: A new study shows that a single high dose of vitamin D not only reduces menstrual pain but also eliminates the need for pain medication.

Headlines: Pregabalin Fails to Improve Diabetic, HIV Neuropathy
Teaser: Two trials, 1 in inadequately treated diabetic neuropathy and 1 in HIV neuropathy, showed no benefit for pregabalin over placebo.

Headlines: Misuse of Prescription Pain Killers Peaks in Mid-Adolescence
Teaser: The extramedical use of prescription pain relievers among youth peaks at age 16, suggesting prevention programs that start in the senior year of high school are "too little, too late."

Headlines: Number of Infants Born Addicted to Opiates Triples
Teaser: A new study shows that the annual rate of maternal opiate use at delivery has increased 5-fold and that rates of neonatal abstinence syndrome have almost tripled over the past decade.

Headlines: Pregabalin Treats Neuropathic Pain in Spinal Cord Injury
Teaser: Study shows pregabalin is superior to placebo in treating neuropathic pain, among the most difficult to treat types of pain in patients with spinal cord injuries.

Headlines: New Data Support Paracervical Block for Induced Abortion
Teaser: Paracervical block is effective in decreasing pain during a first-trimester surgical abortion, a randomized trial in Portland, Oregon, has confirmed.

Headlines: Spinal Fusion on Top of Laminectomy Benefits Quality of Life
Teaser: Lumbar spinal fusion plus laminectomy appears a better option than laminectomy alone in terms of quality of life for patients with degenerative grade I spondylolisthesis with lumbar spinal stenosis.

Headlines: Buprenorphine Implant Effective in Opioid Addiction
Teaser: Buprenorphine Implant Effective in Opioid Addiction

Headlines: Smoking Thwarts Positive Outcomes In Opioid Addiction
Teaser: A study of opioid-addicted patients suggests that smoking cessation improves responses to methadone treatment.

Headlines: FDA Extends Review for Drug to Treat Post-Opioid Constipation
Teaser: Salix Pharmaceuticals Ltd and Progenics Pharmaceuticals said U.S. health regulators had extended by three months the review date for an additional indication of their constipation drug.

Headlines: Pain Management Still Misses the Mark for Cancer Patients
Teaser: Many cancer patients are still not receiving adequate pain management. This shortfall is particularly prevalent in minority populations.

Headlines: Race and Perioperative Pain, Opioid Adverse Events in Children
Teaser: Children of different races have unequal burdens of perioperative pain and risks of opioid-related adverse effects, according to a report today in Pediatrics.

Headlines: Buprenorphine, Methadone Equal for Chronic Pain in Addiction
Teaser: A randomized trial indicates that buprenorphine may be comparable to methadone for analgesia in chronic pain patients with comorbid opioid addiction. However, buprenorphine has the edge in safety.

Headlines: Opioids Underprescribed for Refractory COPD, per Small Study
Teaser: Patients report better life quality when opioids are prescribed for refractory dyspnea.

Headlines: More Codeine Fatalities After Tonsillectomy
Teaser: Codeine and possibly other opioids metabolized by the CYP2D6 pathway cannot be considered safe for young children after tonsillectomy for obstructive sleep apnea, researchers warn.

Headlines: Morphine Lot Recalled Due to Excessive Injection Volume
Teaser: Manufacturer initiates recall of a morphine sulfate injection lot that may contain more than the intended fill volume.

Headlines: FDA Issues Warning on Fentanyl Patches
Teaser: The new warning reiterates appropriate use of the patches to prevent life-threatening accidental exposure to the drug, particularly in children.

Headlines: CNS Drugs Most Often Prescribed Off-Label
Teaser: Anticonvulsants, antipsychotics, and antidepressants are most likely to be prescribed off-label, a new study finds.

Headlines: Opium Use Linked to Increased Death From Cancer, CVD
Teaser: Long-term opium use, even in relatively low doses, is associated with an increased risk for all-cause mortality, particularly from cancer and cardiovascular disease.

Headlines: Physical Intervention Eases Vaccination Pain in Infants
Teaser: The "5 S" physical intervention is as effective as sucrose water in alleviating postinjection pain in 2- and 4-month-olds.

Headlines: RA Pain: New Recommendations for Treatment
Teaser: Recommendations from the multinational 3e Initiative include 11 evidence-based recommendations and a new algorithm for pharmacological management of pain in inflammatory arthritis.

Headlines: Duloxetine Useful in Chemo Neuropathy, But Avoid ALC
Teaser: The antidepressant alleviated chemotherapy-induced neuropathy in what is described at a practice-changing trial, but patients with breast cancer should avoid acetyl-L-carnitine (ALC) supplements.

Headlines: FDA Approves Gabapentin Enacarbil for Postherpetic Neuralgia
Teaser: Already approved for restless legs syndrome, gabapentin enacarbil extended-release tablets are now approved to manage postherpetic neuralgia in adults.

Headlines: NSAIDs Curb Uteric Stent Removal Pain
Teaser: A single dose of a non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) is effective in preventing pain after ureteric stent removal, Oregon-based researchers reported last month.

Headlines: Early Imaging of Low Back Pain Unnecessary, Harmful
Teaser: A literature review and cost analysis justifies recent initiatives to limit early imaging of acute back pain unless red flags are present.

Headlines: Scientists Unlock Gene Secrets of Opium Poppy Drug
Teaser: Scientists have unraveled exactly how opium poppies produce a non-addictive compound that can both suppress coughs and kill tumor cells, paving the way for improved production of the medicine.

Headlines: Telephone Advice Provides Long-Term Back Pain Relief
Teaser: APS 2012: Patients can get long-term back pain relief by getting instructions on the phone for managing their condition.

Headlines: Cancer Patients Fare Well on High-Dose Sublingual Fentanyl
Teaser: A study to assess the titration of sublingual fentanyl for breakthrough cancer pain showed patients satisfied on high doses.

Headlines: Massage and Swaddling Reduce Pain in Infants
Teaser: Massaging infants and swaddling them can both significantly reduce pain associated with  needle sticks, 2 separate studies show.

Headlines: Providers Underestimate Patients' Pain During IUD Insertion
Teaser: ACOG 2012: A study of 200 women finds that clinicians misjudge the pain of undergoing intrauterine device (IUD) insertion.

Headlines: Once-Daily Gabapentin Effective in Postherpetic Pain
Teaser: A once-daily formulation of gabapentin G-GR will relieve postherpetic neuralgia within 4 days -- or will not work at all, researchers say.

Headlines: FDA Advises Checking Prefilled Syringes for Overfilling
Teaser: The US Food and Drug Administration has advised healthcare providers to visually inspect Hospira Carpuject prefilled cartridges to check for overfill.

Headlines: Oral Methylnaltrexone for Opioid-Induced Constipation
Teaser: DDW 2012: Half the patients responded to daily dosing.

Headlines: Yoga Shows Promise in Rheumatoid Arthritis
Teaser: A new study shows benefits for young rheumatoid arthritis patients who practice Iyengar yoga.

Headlines: Experimental Drug Reduces Opioid Constipation
Teaser: An experimental drug, CB-5945, reduced opioid-related constipation in a phase 2 trial.

Headlines: Drop in Oxycodone Abuse After Reformulation
Teaser: The abuse of OxyContin (oxycodone) has dropped after the prescription opioid drug was reformulated to make it harder to snort, smoke, and inject.

Headlines: Nano-Formulated Diclofenac Found Effective in Phase 2 Trial
Teaser: Diclofenac in a fine powder relieves pain in low doses, a new study shows.

Headlines: Extended-Release Hydromorphone Fails in Osteoarthritis Trial
Teaser: Extended-release hydromorphone could not relieve osteoarthritis pain any better than placebo in a phase 3 trial.

Headlines: US Senate Investigates Pain Management Groups
Teaser: US senators have launched an investigation examining ties between pain management specialist organizations and companies that make opioid drugs.

Headlines: Look Away From Needle Prick to Lessen Pain, Suggests Study
Teaser: Common advice to look away from the needle prick really does reduce pain, a new study shows.

Headlines: Elderly Receive Higher Than Recommended Doses of Anesthesia
Teaser: Higher doses are linked to more hypotension after induction, but the in-hospital mortality rate was higher in patients receiving lower doses.

Headlines: FDA REMS for Opioids: A 'Flawed' Plan?
Teaser: The FDA's plan to curb opioid abuse is a reasonable first step, but it's not perfect and challenges await, particularly for psychiatrists, experts say.

Headlines: Vulvodynia Ups Chances of Other Chronic Pain Conditions
Teaser: Women with vulvodynia are 2 to 3 times more likely than their peers to be affected by other chronic pain conditions, such as interstitial cystitis, irritable bowel syndrome, or fibromyalgia.

Headlines: FDA Declines New Indication for Methylnaltrexone
Teaser: The FDA has issued a complete response letter for Relistor in the treatment of opioid-induced constipation in chronic, noncancer pain.

Headlines: Regional Pain Block Fails After Laparoscopic Hysterectomy
Teaser: A transversus abdominis plane (TAP) block did not reduce pain after laparoscopic hysterectomy in a study from MetroHealth Medical Center in Cleveland.

Headlines: Tighten Opioid Label Restrictions, Physicians Tell FDA
Teaser: The group's goal is to prevent drug companies from marketing opioids as safe and effective for long-term treatment of moderate, noncancer pain.

Headlines: Older Patients' Pain Care Lags in Emergency Departments
Teaser: Patients aged 75 years and older receive less pain medication in EDs than all other adults.

Headlines: Depressive Symptoms Raise Risk for Opioid Misuse
Teaser: Depressed patients on chronic opioid therapy may use opioids for non-pain symptoms and use more than prescribed, new research shows.

Headlines: Oxycodone Formula Change Blamed for Rise in Heroin Use
Teaser: A change in a formula of the prescription opioid oxycodone to prevent abuse has had the unintended consequence of doubling heroin use among addicts.

Headlines: Gene Therapy Fails in Cancer Pain Trial
Teaser: A novel gene therapy did not reduce cancer pain any more than the placebo in a phase 2 randomized controlled trial.

Headlines: FDA Approves REMS for Extended-Release, Long-Acting Opioids
Teaser: The FDA has approved a new Risk Evaluation and Mitigation Strategy for extended-release and long-acting opioid analgesics; education is still voluntary for physicians, but that may change.

Headlines: PCA for Pain Relief After Vaginal Reconstructive Surgery
Teaser: Women having vaginal reconstructive surgery have less pain the day afterward if they receive patient-controlled analgesia (PCA).

Headlines: Anesthesia Systems Recalled Over Software Glitch
Teaser: The manufacturer began upgrading the unit's software in February to fix a problem with the switch for manual vs automatic ventilation.

Headlines: FDA Calls for Halt to Unapproved Drugs Containing Oxycodone
Teaser: Companies that continue to market these products will be subject to enforcement action, including seizure, injunction, or other judicial proceedings.

Headlines: Methadone Accounts for One Third of Pain Med Overdose Deaths
Teaser: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention reports methadone now contributes to almost 1 in 3 prescription painkiller deaths.

Headlines: Chronic Abuse of Prescription Pain Meds Up Sharply
Teaser: A new study finds a 75% increase since 2002 in the number of Americans engaging in the long-term use of prescription pain medications for nonmedical reasons.

Headlines: Nonmedical Use of Prescription Pain Relievers Increasing
Teaser: The number of people who regularly use prescription pain relievers for nonmedical purposes has  significantly increased during the last several years in, especially among men.

Headlines: No Increase in Miscarriage Risk With Nonprescription NSAIDs
Teaser: A prospective trial of more than 2700 pregnancies suggests that use of over-the-counter nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs during early pregnancy posed no increased risk for spontaneous abortion.

Headlines: Pregabalin Approved for Neuropathic Pain in Spinal Injury
Teaser: This FDA approval for management of neuropathic pain associated with spinal cord injury brings to 5 the approved indications for pregabalin in the United States.

Headlines: College Kids May Abuse Painkillers to Ease Distress
Teaser: College students who use painkillers and other prescription drugs may be depressed and/or suicidal, new research shows.

Headlines: Mental Illness in Teens Linked to Long-term Opioid Use
Teaser: Among adolescents and young adults with chronic pain, the presence of mental health disorders appears to increase the risk for long-term opioid use.

Headlines: Inhaled Analgesia Seems Effective for Early Labor
Teaser: Nitrous oxide alleviates the pain of early labor but has more adverse effects than fluranes.

Headlines: Acupuncture Superior to Placebo, Usual Care for Chronic Pain
Teaser: Meta-analysis shows that acupuncture is better than usual care and sham acupuncture for patients with chronic pain.

Headlines: Submicron NSAID Data Mixed
Teaser: Lower-dose submicron particle diclofenac and naproxen produced good pain relief in a clinical trial, but not better than similar doses of standard formulations of naproxen.

Headlines: Smoking Linked to More Pain, Depression in Pain Patients
