Teaser: The guideline gives some support to cannabis products but emphasizes there is little evidence for most complementary and alternative medicine in multiple sclerosis.

Headlines: Low Back Pain Top Cause of Disability Worldwide
Teaser: A Global Burden Study has found that low back pain is the top cause of disability worldwide; a substudy found that occupation-related low back pain increases with population increases.

Headlines: FDA Clears Apremilast (Otezla) for Psoriatic Arthritis
Teaser: In clinical trials, the oral PDE-4 inhibitor improved signs and symptoms of PsA, including tender and swollen joints and physical function.

Headlines: FDA Clears Miltefosine (Impavido) for Leishmaniasis
Teaser: The action follows endorsement of the drug by an advisory panel in October 2013; miltefosine is first FDA-approved drug for cutaneous and mucosal leishmaniasis.

Headlines: Joint Replacement Improves Cardiovascular Fitness
Teaser: Physical inactivity is a major risk factor for cardiovascular disease, but when you get people moving again by replacing their arthritic hip and knee joints, you also reduce that risk.

Headlines: Outpatient Knee Arthroplasty Has High Readmission Rates
Teaser: Performing total joint arthroplasty (TJA) for knees as a same-day procedure comes with relatively high readmission rates.

Headlines: Dramatic Rise in Emergency Department Opioid Scripts
Teaser: During the past decade, there has been a dramatic rise in opioid prescribing in US emergency departments but only a modest increase in pain complaints.

Headlines: Limit Food Allergy Panels, AAP Says in Choosing Wisely List
Teaser: AAP Choosing Wisely recommendations now total 10 tests or treatments to question before use when treating children.

Headlines: Oxytocin a Promising New Treatment for Anorexia
Teaser: Two studies by the same group of researchers suggest that oxytocin, the so-called 'love hormone,' may be a promising new treatment for anorexia nervosa.

Headlines: Patient Cracks Her Own Mysterious Dual Diagnosis
Teaser: A woman with arrhythmogenic right ventricular cardiomyopathy and a progressive degenerative muscle disease has discovered the genetic cause of her illness and helped design her own treatment plan.

Headlines: Bills to Ban Zohydro Introduced in House and Senate
Teaser: The FDA Commissioner defends the agency's decision to approve the powerful opioid painkiller against rising pressure to keep the drug off the market.

Headlines: Wait Times for Spinal Cord Stimulation Vary by Specialty
Teaser: Delays significantly reduce the therapy's success rate, but they're much more common with referrals by anesthesiologists, orthopedic surgeons.

Headlines: Hormone Combo Reduces Pain, Opioid Dose in Intractable Pain
Teaser: A combination of oxytocin and human chorionic gonadotropin reduced pain in a preliminary study.

Headlines: Ability to Drive a Critical Concern in Opiate Prescribing
Teaser: Patient's motor skills, alertness should be monitored, well documented before the patient is sent out on the road with a prescription.

Headlines: No Increases in Pain Seen With Opioid Dose Reductions
Teaser: Patients receiving high-dose opioids show similar pain and aberrant behavior scores after significant dose reductions as patients with normally managed pain -- including those who had increased doses.

Headlines: Interdisciplinary Fibromyalgia Treatment Benefits Sustained
Teaser: Clinical improvements from an intensive interdisciplinary approach still maintained at 12 months.

Headlines: Bupivacaine Effective for Knee Replacement Pain
Teaser: Long-acting bupivacaine can reduce treatment cost and be as effective as a femoral nerve block for pain relief from knee replacement surgery, according to 2 retrospective studies.

Headlines: Eliquis Approved for DVT/PE Prophylaxis Post-op
Teaser: The new indication for the oral direct factor Xa inhibitor is supported by the ADVANCE 1, 2, and 3 clinical trials that enrolled nearly 12 000 patients.

Headlines: Allergies to Joint Replacement Implants Problematic
Teaser: Allergic reactions could account for patient discomfort after some joint replacements, a new study suggests.

Headlines: Abuse-Deterrent Hydrocodone Passes Phase 3
Teaser: Topline study results show that a new extended-release, single-entity, abuse-deterrent hydrocodone formulation significantly reduces back pain compared with placebo.

Headlines: U.S. Federal Judge Sentences Florida Pill Mill Doctors
Teaser: A federal judge sentenced a South Florida doctor to more than six years in prison on a money-laundering conviction related to prescriptions she wrote for thousands of painkillers to addicts and drug dealers.

Headlines: Old Antibiotic for Uncomplicated Urinary Tract Infection
Teaser: Fosfomycin leads to excellent cure rates in hospitalized patients with urinary tract infections, even if the patient is colonized with resistant organisms.

Headlines: Moderate Pneumonia Protection With PCV-13 in the Elderly
Teaser: The 13-valent pneumococcal conjugate vaccine (PCV-13) offers moderate protection against pneumococcal community-acquired pneumonia for older recipients, a new study shows.

Headlines: Experts Applaud Rapid FDA Approval of Opioid Overdose Device
Teaser: Experts from SAMHSA and NIDA applaud the FDA's approval today of a handheld autoinjector for administering a single dose of naloxone to combat opioid overdose.

Headlines: Psoriatic Arthritis Foot Pain Linked to Inflammation, Structure
Teaser: Foot pain in psoriatic arthritis was associated with synovitis, erosion, metatarsophalangeal subluxation, obesity, and female sex but was not predicted by increased plantar pressure.

Headlines: FDA Okays Handheld Autoinjector for Opioid Overdose
Teaser: The FDA has approved a handheld device designed for use by family members or caregivers to deliver a single dose of naloxone to reverse suspected opioid overdose.

Headlines: Tobacco Industry 'On the Run': But E-cigs Opening a Door?
Teaser: While 'tremendous strides' are being made in the war against cigarettes, with resultant decreases in lung cancer, are e-cigarettes opening a new gateway?

Headlines: Medical Marijuana: What the Research Shows
Teaser: Dustin Sulak, DO, is a doctor on the front lines of medical marijuana.

Headlines: Legalize Medical Marijuana, Doctors Say in Survey
Teaser: A majority of doctors say that medical marijuana should be legalized nationally and that it can deliver real benefits to patients, a new survey by WebMD/Medscape finds

Headlines: Medical Marijuana State Action in 2014
Teaser: Medical marijuana moved up the legislative agenda in many states this year -- even in the most conservative parts of the country.

Headlines: HEAT-PPCI: Heparin Bests Bivalirudin in STEMI, Amid Heated Debate
Teaser: UPDATED // The HEAT-PPCI took heat like no other trial on the last day of the ACC 2014 meeting, with panelists and other observers protesting the unexpected results     and the ethics of the unique study design.

Headlines: Methotrexate Decreases Pain, Improves Function in Knee OA
Teaser: Methotrexate, which is widely used for rheumatoid arthritis, also reduced pain and improved function in patients with knee osteoarthritis in a randomized controlled trial.

Headlines: Parental Addiction a Risk Factor for Arthritis in Offspring
Teaser: Early adversity, including parental addiction, may induce biological changes in the way children react to stress and contribute to an increased risk for arthritis.

Headlines: Massachusetts to Ban FDA-Approved Zohydro ER
Teaser: The governor declares a public health emergency, announces actions to address opioid addiction epidemic, including banning the prescription and sale of the new controversial hydrocodone-only opioid.

Headlines: TMS Benefits Quality of Life in Fibromyalgia
Teaser: Repetitive transcranial magnetic stimulation appeared to affect the emotional impact of the condition without reducing pain in a new study.

Headlines: AHA/ASA Guideline on Palliative Care in Stroke
Teaser: The 'first of its kind' statement emphasizes the importance of a well-coordinated medical team to personalize care, optimize quality of life, and minimize suffering for patients with a major stroke.

Headlines: Gout Risk High in Those With Psoriasis, Psoriatic Arthritis
Teaser: Patients with psoriasis or psoriatic arthritis had significantly elevated risk for gout and might benefit from routine uric acid blood level monitoring.

Headlines: Culture Change Needed to Combat ICU Delirium
Teaser: A new study underscores the role of sedatives in delirium in the ICU, but surprisingly, no link was seen between sleep quality and delirium risk.

Headlines: Posterior Capsular Release With Anterior Release for Shoulder Stiffness
Teaser: Arthroscopic posterior capsular release does not improve outcomes of anterior-inferior release surgery for shoulder stiffness, researchers from South Korea report.

Headlines: Mutations Linked to IBS, May Lead to Treatment
Teaser: About 2% of patients with irritable bowel syndrome have a SCN5A mutation that disrupts sodium channel function, suggesting a new pathogenic mechanism and possible treatments.

Headlines: In a Cloning First, Scientists Create Stem Cells From Adults
Teaser: Scientists have moved a step closer to the goal of creating stem cells perfectly matched to a patient's DNA in order to treat diseases, creating patient-specific cell lines out of the skin cells of two adult men.

Headlines: US District Court Overturns Zohydro Ban in Massachusetts
Teaser: Zogenix has won a preliminary injunction against the state ban on their single-entity hydrocodone after a judge found the ban is preempted by federal law.

Headlines: European PREVAIL Data Uphold Enzalutamide for Prostate Ca
Teaser: In European men with prostate cancer, the benefit from the androgen-receptor antagonist enzalutamide is similar to that in North American men.

Headlines: Take-Home Induction of Buprenorphine Feasible, Safe
Teaser: Starting opioid-addicted patients on buprenorphine treatment without putting them under close observation appears to be safe and may lower barriers to care.

Headlines: Novel Nonopioid Approach Promising for Opioid Dependence
Teaser: The combination of a muscle relaxant, an antihistamine, and an anticonvulsant may be a better way to detox opioid-dependent patients than a protocol that involves buprenorphine/naltrexone.

Headlines: Shock Therapy Shows Promise in Treating Tendinitis
Teaser: Extracorporeal shockwave therapy decreases pain and improves function in patients with chronic calcific shoulder tendinitis.

Headlines: As Novice Runners Hit the Open Road, Experts Say Take It Slow
Teaser: As the days lengthen and the weather warms and novice runners cast an eye outdoors, fitness experts suggest they take a slow start to find their outdoor rhythm and pace to avoid injuries.

Headlines: NSAIDs Double Bleeding Risk With Anticoagulants for DVT/PE
Teaser: Patients taking anticoagulants for deep vein thrombosis or pulmonary embolism should not take NSAIDs or aspirin for pain and should instead reach for     acetaminophen, researchers caution.

Headlines: Dual Nerve Stimulation Helps Chronic Migraine
Teaser: A new study shows that stimulating both the occipital and supraorbital nerves provides better relief of migraine than occipital stimulation alone.

Headlines: Fifty Years On, Half As Many Americans Now Smoke, butâ€¦
Teaser: Half as many Americans are smoking now as they were 50 years ago, but too many are still dying prematurely from preventable and avoidable smoking-related causes.

Headlines: Common Tests May Miss Pediatric Diabetic Neuropathy
Teaser: Noninvasive methods for screening pediatric patients with type 1 diabetes for peripheral diabetic nephropathy are not very sensitive, according to a new     review.

Headlines: PRAC Reviewing Safety of Codeine for Cough/Colds in Kids
Teaser: The EMA committee will review available evidence on the benefit-risk balance of codeine-containing medicines when used for cough and cold in children.

Headlines: Overweight/Obese Youth May Not Receive Needed Lab Screening
Teaser: A study has shown that Maryland Medicaid/Children's Health Program providers are inadequately coding overweight/obesity in youth and insufficiently screening them for obesity-related conditions.

Headlines: Trauma-Focused CBT Effective for Pediatric PTSD
Teaser: Trauma-focused CBT is an effective treatment for young patients suffering from PTSD and warrants insurance coverage, a new evidence-based review suggests.

Headlines: Studies Cast Doubt on Need to Stockpile Influenza Drugs
Teaser: Systematic reviews of neuraminidase inhibitor studies based on internal clinical trial documents lead researchers to question the utility of drug stockpiles.

Headlines: Intranasal Ketamine Delivers Rapid Antidepressant Effect
Teaser: Intranasal ketamine, a longtime FDA-approved anesthetic, appears to deliver a rapid antidepressant effect in patients with treatment-resistant major depression.

Headlines: Zogenix Files Suit Against State Ban on Zohydro ER
Teaser: After a decision by Massachusetts to ban the controversial single-entity hydrocodone, the company has filed for a restraining order, saying FDA regulatory authority 'simply should not be usurped by individual states.'

Headlines: NSAIDs Linked to Higher Atrial Fibrillation Risk
Teaser: The mechanism tying use of NSAIDs to atrial fibrillation should be a target of future research, researchers say.

Headlines: Stereotactic Radiosurgery for Sarcomas Spread to Spine
Teaser: Conventional radiotherapy provides mediocre local control in this setting. A new study indicates that stereotactic radiosurgery is much better.

Headlines: Long-Paralyzed Patients Move Legs With Epidural Stimulation
Teaser: Researchers report that 4 men with chronic complete motor paralysis all recovered some voluntary movement after receiving epidural stimulation from an implanted unit.

Headlines: Asymptomatic Carotid Stenosis Linked to Cognitive Impairment
Teaser: A new study links asymptomatic carotid stenosis to cognitive impairment. Given the prevalence of asymptomatic stenoses, the public health implications are significant, researchers say.

Headlines: 'Low-Risk' Kidney Stone Removal May Be Risky and Costly
Teaser: After low-risk procedures to remove urinary stones, patients often need an unplanned emergency visit at substantial cost, suggesting a need for interventions to identify and reduce complications.

Headlines: New AAN Review of Medical Marijuana in Neurologic Disease
Teaser: A comprehensive review of the evidence supporting use of medical marijuana in neurologic diseases finds a role for some symptoms of MS, but not enough evidence to take a position with other conditions.

Headlines: AAP Guidelines Address ACL Tear Management in Adolescentsâ€
Teaser: The AAP has issued clinical guidelines on diagnosing, treating, and preventing anterior cruciate ligament tears in adolescentsâ€, emphasizing education in neuromuscular training.

Headlines: Appendicitis: Surgery Safely Avoided in Some Children
Teaser: A nonrandomized prospective trial has found a high success rate using medical management alone to treat children with acute uncomplicated appendicitis.

Headlines: Novel Agents for Migraine Prevention Look Good in Phase 2
Teaser: Two new agents representing a novel mechanism of action for the prevention of migraine are generating much interest after showing promising results in phase 2 studies.

Headlines: Greater Use of Meds to Halt Opioid Overdose Epidemic Urged
Teaser: Mortality from prescription opioid overdose in the US has reached epidemic levels, prompting addiction experts to advocate greater use of medications designed to prevent opioid-related deaths.

Headlines: After-Hours Clinic a Health-Care David and Goliath Partnership
Teaser: Unlikely collaboration provides weekend and after-hours care for patients who in the past had turned to hospital emergency rooms.

Headlines: Health IT Biggest Threat to Patient Safety, Report Says
Teaser: The ECRI Institute has found that IT-related safety hazards outstrip all others, partly because of the rapid growth of EHRs.

Headlines: Nurses Offer Quicker Fix for Radial-Head Subluxation in Children
Teaser: Although nurses aren't as good as physicians in emergency department reduction of radial-head subluxation in children, there's less of a wait, and in high-volume settings it's a useful skill, according to Canadian researchers.

Headlines: Marijuana Use Linked to Rising Cardiovascular Events
Teaser: The latest research to look at the potential cardiovascular dangers of cannabis use found a high rate of fatal events and suggests the rate may be rising.

Headlines: Spinal Corticosteroids Run Risk of Severe Neuro Effects
Teaser: The FDA has announced that injections given to treat neck and back pain and radiating pain in the arms and legs may result, on rare occasions, in blindness, stroke, paralysis, and death.

Headlines: FDA Panel Gives Combo Opioid Thumbs Down
Teaser: An FDA advisory committee determines that the evidence is insufficient to conclude Moxduo is safer or more effective than its component parts of morphine and oxycodone.

Headlines: Spinal Cord Stimulation Data Show Low Conversion Rate
Teaser: A national survey of spinal cord stimulation for chronic neuropathic pain showed that the stimulation is effective only 41% of the time.

Headlines: ER Trips for Kids' Pain and Coughs Often End With Codeine
Teaser: Despite recommendations against the use of codeine in children, a new study found many emergency room doctors still use it liberally in young patients.

Headlines: Is Anxiety From a False-Positive Mammogram Small, Transient?
Teaser: A new study indicates that false-positives only increase short-term anxiety, but a critic questions the measurement tools.

Headlines: Celiac Disease Screening Should Focus on Kids With IBS
Teaser: Prevalence of celiac disease among children with IBS is 4 times higher than in the general pediatric population. Targeted screening may be most effective tool and help control costs.

Headlines: Effective Treatment for Fibromyalgia May Now Be Possible
Teaser: A review has found that fibromyalgia and other 'centralized' pain states are much better understood now than previously, and effective treatment is now possible.

Headlines: FDA Wants Stronger Warning Labels for Long-Acting Opioids
Teaser: - The U.S. Food and Drug Administration is requiring labels of all long-acting opioids to say they should be used strictly for patients in severe pain, a response to surging overdoses and deaths each year from the widely used pain medicines.

Headlines: Ketamine: New Potential as Rapid PTSD Treatment
Teaser: In addition to a headline grabber as a rapid treatment for major depression, the anesthetic agent ketamine shows promise as a novel and fast-acting therapy for chronic PTSD.

Headlines: Nobel Economists, Others Urge End to 'War on Drugs'
Teaser: Global efforts to thwart the drugs trade have failed and the time has come for a radical rethink, according to a group of Nobel-prize winning economists, a former U.S secretary of state, the deputy prime minister of Britain and others.

Headlines: Oxycodone Particles Promising for Patients With Dysphagia
Teaser: An extended-release form of oxycodone that can be sprinkled over pudding, apple sauce, or other soft food shows promise for patients with chronic pain who have difficulty swallowing.

Headlines: NSAID Monotherapy Prevents Postsurgery Cystoid Macular Edema
Teaser: Bromfenac monotherapy prevented cystoid macular edema after cataract surgery better than a steroid plus an NSAID, in a 5-year analysis.

Headlines: Doctors Have 'Knowledge Gaps' About Opioid Abuse
Teaser: A survey of physicians attending last year's PAINWeek meeting finds a large number don't know that most of the prescribed opioids being abused come from friends or family.

Headlines: Pain Physicians Have High Rates of Burnout
Teaser: Physicians reportedly have the highest rates of burnout of any US workers, and pain physicians are no exception.

Headlines: Reserve Expensive Cancer Drugs for Younger Patients?
Teaser: In a controversial commentary, a British oncologist argues that age should be taken into consideration when deciding on the use of expensive cancer drugs.

Headlines: High Doses of Opioids Linked to NSC Lung Cancer Recurrence
Teaser: Increased perioperative opioid administration is associated with greater incidence of non-small cell lung cancer recurrence.

Headlines: Inverse Link Between Marijuana Use and Stroke Risk?
Teaser: Researchers have found an inverse relationship between prior marijuana use and the risk for ischemic stroke in adolescents and young adults but say it is unlikely this means the drug is protective.

Headlines: American Pain Society Sets Up Own Research Fund
Teaser: The American Pain Society is turning to the kindness and generosity of private donors to obtain desperately needed money to fund research on ways to treat chronic pain.

Headlines: Novel Hydrocodone: 24-Hour Analgesia, Less Abuse Potential
Teaser: Once-daily, extended-release hydrocodone bitartrate provides persistent pain relief in patients with chronic nonmalignant and nonneuropathic pain and also comes with abuse-deterrent properties.

Headlines: Topical Eye Gels Do Not Inhibit Povidone-Iodine Antisepsis
Teaser: Despite concerns, topical lidocaine gels applied prior to cataract surgery do not compromise the antibacterial effect of povidone-iodine, new research shows.

Headlines: Connecticut Becomes 18th State to Allow NP Independence
Teaser: Passage of the bill, which the governor promises to sign, brings the number of states with NP independent practice to 18, along with Washington, DC. However, a similar bill was vetoed in Nebraska.

Headlines: Glucantime Side Effects in Leishmaniasis Not Worse in Children
Teaser: Cutaneous leishmaniasis treatment with systemic meglumine antimoniate (Glucantime, Sanofi Aventis) is generally fairly well tolerated in children and the rate of adverse events is similar to that seen in adults.

Headlines: Up to 39% of Premature Deaths Preventable, CDC Says
Teaser: A CDC report has detailed state-by-state rates of potentially preventable deaths from 5 leading causes.

Headlines: FDA Panel Hears Horror Stories of Shock Treatments
Teaser: Last week an FDA advisory panel heard horrendous stories of the misuse of electrical stimulation devices that are currently approved to 'treat' unwanted behaviors in mentally disabled patients.

Headlines: Lyme Disease Update for Maine Healthcare Providers
Teaser: The Maine CDC is providing general information on Lyme disease, reminding clinicians to report cases of Lyme disease, and more.

Headlines: Pain Perception Linked to Genes
Teaser: Researchers have identified genes linked to higher pain perception among patients with chronic pain taking opioids.

Headlines: Fibromyalgia Symptoms Respond to Parathyroidectomy, in Some
Teaser: The finding of improvement in fibromyalgia symptoms following parathyroid surgery in some suggests that people should be screened for hyperparathyroidism     before a diagnosis of fibromyalgia is made.

Headlines: Topical Lidocaine Makes Sex Less Painful
Teaser: In cancer survivors, pain associated with vaginal atrophy can be effectively treated with self-administered topical lidocaine to the vulvar vestibule.

Headlines: Migalastat for Fabry Disease Shows Promise
Teaser: Amicus Therapeutics Inc today announced positive 12- and 24-month data from a phase 3 study of its experimental drug migalastat as monotherapy for Fabry disease.

Headlines: Teen Marijuana Use Linked to Earlier Psychosis Onset
Teaser: Preliminary results of a new study show that in those with psychosis, marijuana use between the ages of 15 and 17 was linked to earlier age of onset.

Headlines: Does Eye Color Predict Response to Pain?
Teaser: A pilot study presented at the American Pain Society suggests that eye color can predict a person's sensitivity to pain stimuli.

Headlines: US Life Expectancy Up, Prescription Drug Use Widespread: CDC
Teaser: The CDC says in its annual health in the US report that nearly half of all Americans take at least 1 prescription drug and life expectancy continues to rise.

Headlines: Heroin-Assisted Tx Superior to Methadone for Heroin Addiction
Teaser: Patients who are severely addicted to heroin may respond better to a treatment practice incorporating pharmaceutical heroin vs methadone.

Headlines: Intensive Pain Rehab Improves Kids' Mental Health
Teaser: An intensive interdisciplinary pain rehabilitation program that focuses on the individual needs of each child improves psychological functioning in kids with a variety of pain conditions.

Headlines: Low-Value Services Given to Many Medicare Patients
Teaser: Potentially wasteful tests, such as cervical cancer screening for women aged 65 years and older, added up to $1.9 billion for Medicare in 2009, study authors say.

Headlines: New Tool May Help Psych Patients Manage Finances
Teaser: Researchers are proposing a new tool to help identify psychiatry patients in need of help managing their disability income.

Headlines: Chronic Migraine Responds to OnabotulinumtoxinA
Teaser: OnabotulinumtoxinA maintains its efficacy for the treatment of migraine headache when given long term, a retrospective study shows.

Headlines: Impact of Fibroids on Pregnancy Outcomes Varies by Location
Teaser: Various fibroid characteristics affect pregnancy outcomes in different ways, new research suggests.

Headlines: Parents Can Learn to Help Relieve Pain During Vaccinations
Teaser: Mothers-to-be who learned strategies to relieve vaccination pain were very likely to use them when it came time to have their baby vaccinated, according to a new Canadian study.

Headlines: Tomosynthesis Shows Promise for Bone Healing Images
Teaser: Tomosynthesis is better than conventional x-ray, and safer and cheaper than CT, in assessing bone healing, a new study shows.

Headlines: Oxycodone/Naloxone an ADF Option for Chronic Low Back Pain
Teaser: Oxycodone/naloxone extended-release tablets show promise as an abuse-deterrent option in the treatment of patients with chronic low back pain who have used opioids in the past.

Headlines: Cannabis Abuse Rife in College Kids With Mental Illness
Teaser: Almost 25% of college students being treated for a mental illness also abuse cannabis, which is linked to significant functional impairment and a greater likelihood of medical leave from school.

Headlines: Natalizumab Improves Walking and Physical Abilities in MS
Teaser: Post hoc analysis of the AFFIRM study shows natalizumab improves performance on a walking test in patients with MS; new results with prolonged-release fampridine on walking from the MOBILE study.

Headlines: Prophylaxis Prevents Some Pediatric UTI Recurrences
Teaser: Antimicrobial prophylaxis led to a 50% reduction in future urinary tract infections (UTIs), but had no effect on renal scarring, new research shows.

Headlines: Novel Drug for Celiac Disease Reduces GI and Non-GI Symptoms
Teaser: Larazotide acetate, a novel tight-junction regulator, reduced gastrointestinal (GI) and other symptoms in the first large therapeutic trial in celiac disease to meet its primary end point.

Headlines: Combination Drug Shown to Prevent Miosis in Ocular Surgery
Teaser: The compound could offer an FDA-approved alternative to inexact off-label combinations.

Headlines: Online Firms Bring Concierge Medicine to the Middle Class
Teaser: Online firms offer concierge medical services to middle-class subscribers including speedy referrals and a helping hand through the red tape.

Headlines: Lawmakers Propose Incentives for End-of-Life Planning
Teaser: If you are one of the estimated 70% of Americans who have not documented your end-of-life healthcare preferences, Republican Senator Tom Coburn of Oklahoma hopes a cash incentive will prompt you to do the paperwork.

Headlines: Recombinant Growth Factor Reduced Cartilage Loss in Knee OA
Teaser: Recombinant human fibroblast growth factor 18 missed the primary efficacy endpoint of a randomized, placebo-controlled study but slowed cartilage loss in some parts of the osteoarthritic knee.

Headlines: Botulinum for Migraine Reaches Pain Receptors via Sutures
Teaser: Botulinum toxin injected in the scalp can prevent migraines. A new study finds meningeal nociceptors project through sutures in the calvaria, giving the drug access to these pain receptors.

Headlines: Sedative Abuse Sends More Patients to Emergency Department
Teaser: Misuse of the antianxiety drug alprazolam sent more than 123,000 US adults to emergency departments in 2011.

Headlines: Choosing Wisely: Good Communication Skills Are Key
Teaser: Clinicians should ask about the value systems of patient and caregiver before embarking on a conversation about the evidence backing a treatment option.

Headlines: Rheumatoid Arthritis: Worse Disease Control With Higher BMI
Teaser: Overweight or obese patients with rheumatoid arthritis were half as likely as normal-weight patients to achieve good control of early RA in response to DMARD treatment.

Headlines: Morphine May Delay Onset of New Antiplatelets in Primary PCI
Teaser: Investigators only have pharmacodynamics data to back up their claims, but they say there are plausible reasons why morphine use may blunt the effects of     ticagrelor and prasugrel.

Headlines: Patients Lose When Doctors Can't Do Good Physical Exams
Teaser: Reviving bedside medicine is becoming a new priority at some medical schools after technology has hurt some doctors' abilities to use physical exams to make accurate diagnoses.

Headlines: Update on Lyme Disease and Other Tick-borne Diseases: An Alert for New Hampshire Clinicians
Teaser: New Hampshire continues to have one of the highest rates of Lyme disease in the nation. The New Hampshire Division of Public Health Services provides recommendations for healthcare providers.

Headlines: Foreign Doctors, Nurses in Saudi Arabia Could Take MERS Global
Teaser: The biggest risk that Middle East Respiratory Syndrome will become a global epidemic, ironically, may lie with globe-trotting healthcare workers.

Headlines: Drug Reactions More Likely in Kids With Complex Conditions
Teaser: Children with complex chronic conditions were 4 times as likely to visit the emergency department for an adverse drug event as other children.

Headlines: High Dropout Rate in Active Surveillance for Prostate Cancer
Teaser: A real-world study of men with prostate cancer indicates that more than one third of men who undergo active surveillance drop out.

Headlines: Ultrasound Matches CT for Kidney Stone Imaging
Teaser: Patients presenting to the ED with acute flank pain can be safely spared from radiation exposure during the initial evaluation, investigators of a randomized trial say.

Headlines: Use of 'Legal Highs' Rising in European Youth
Teaser: Use of novel psychoactive substances, including "spice," "bath salts," and Salvia divinorum, as well as binge drinking, is a growing trend among European Youth.

Headlines: Activity Cuts Chronic Neck Pain Risk in Sedentary Workers
Teaser: People working at physically inactive jobs who do not do physical exercise outside of work were more likely to develop chronic neck pain than workers who did some physical activity during their leisure time.

Headlines: Obesity Boosts Risk for Persistent Pain After Car Crash
Teaser: Obesity increases the risk for neck pain that persists 6 months to a year after a motor vehicle collision.

Headlines: Novel Agent Shows 'Dramatic' Responses in PVNS
Teaser: Preliminary results show that a targeted therapy has 'profound activity' in the treatment of pigmented villonodular synovitis (PVNS).

Headlines: Depression Top Cause of Illness, Disability Among Teens: WHO
Teaser: In a new report, the World Health Organization has called for a stronger focus on the physical and mental health of the world's adolescents.

Headlines: College Kids More Likely to Drive After Toking Than Drinking
Teaser: In a new study, college freshmen were less likely to smoke marijuana than to drink alcohol - but they were much more likely to drive after smoking pot or to ride in a car with a driver who had.

Headlines: Therapy Dogs in Pediatric Oncology: Measuring the Impact
Teaser: An ongoing clinical trial is examining the impact of dogs on the quality of life of children with cancer.

Headlines: New Glatiramer Dosing Convenient, Possibly Safer, in MS
Teaser: Patients with relapsing-remitting multiple sclerosis who inject glatiramer acetate 3 times a week instead of daily experience fewer injection site reactions and may, over time, avoid lipoatrophy.

Headlines: New Research Questions Pathogenicity of Parasite D fragilis
Teaser: Rates of the intestinal parasite Dientamoeba fragilis are higher in healthy control subjects than in patients with gastrointestinal symptoms.

Headlines: Myofascial Release Effective for Short-term Flexibility
Teaser: Myofascial release creates at least as much short-term flexibility as static stretching, whereas contract-relax stretching appears to weaken muscles even more, new research shows.

Headlines: FDA Approves Omidria for Cataract Surgery, Lens Replacement
Teaser: The FDA has approved Omidria (phenylephrine and ketorolac injection) 1%/3% to maintain pupil size during cataract surgery or intraocular lens replacement and to reduce postoperative pain.

Headlines: Generic Celebrex (celecoxib) Gets FDA Okay
Teaser: Teva Pharmaceutical Industries will market capsules in strengths of 50 mg, 100 mg, 200 mg, and 400 mg. Mylan Pharmaceuticals received approval to market a 50-mg capsule.

Headlines: Exercise Benefits of Caffeine Might Be Genetic
Teaser: Caffeine helps sedentary people become more active, but genetic differences could determine who will get an athletic boost, a pair of studies suggest.

Headlines: Restless Legs Syndrome: New Evidence of Peripheral Mechanism
Teaser: A new study has shown a strong correlation between symptoms and peripheral hypoxia.

Headlines: Acute Radiation Skin Toxicity Possible With BRAF Inhibitors
Teaser: Five cases point to a potential unanticipated interaction between BRAF inhibitors and ionizing radiation, leading to acute skin toxicity.

Headlines: Legal Marijuana Making Roads Less Safe?
Teaser: Since Colorado legalized medical marijuana, there has been an increase in the number of drivers involved in fatal motor vehicle crashes who test positive for marijuana.

Headlines: Patient Perceptions of Vaginal Mesh From YouTube and TV
Teaser: Patients who learn about vaginal mesh from YouTube or the 'boob tube' might be exposed to bias or incomplete information, according to 2 studies.

Headlines: Sphincterotomy Ineffective for Postcholecystectomy Pain
Teaser: Endoscopic sphincterotomy was no better than a sham procedure in reducing postoperative pain after gallbladder removal.

Headlines: Physical Therapy May Not Be Helpful for Osteoarthritis
Teaser: Physical therapy for patients with hip osteoarthritis was associated with mild temporary increases in pain in the hip or back that tended to resolve over time.

Headlines: Most Juvenile Arthritis Can Be Tamed With Current Treatments
Teaser: Kids with JIA who begin current best care within 6 months of diagnosis have a 70% to 90% chance of attaining inactive disease within 2 years and a 46% to 57% chance of remission within 5 years.

Headlines: Screening for Intimate Partner Violence Has Only Small Yield
Teaser: Screening women for intimate partner violence may identify more victims, but those victims will represent just a small fraction of affected women, a new review and meta-analysis suggests.

Headlines: Parachute Reshapes Post-MI Ventricle, Ups LVEF at One Year
Teaser: Echo measures of remodeling and hemodynamics, symptoms, and exercise capacity improved after a year in patients implanted with a percutaneous         alternative to surgical ventricular reconstruction.

Headlines: Botox Ok for Some Patients With OAB, but Not All
Teaser: Botox A may be a second-line treatment for select patients with OAB, provided trained practitioners and educated patients jointly weigh the benefits and risks.

Headlines: Few Hospices Providing CAM Services to Patients
Teaser: Only 29% of hospices in the United States employ complementary and alternative medicine (CAM) therapists for massage, music, or art therapy, despite the growing interest in these services.

Headlines: CHMP Endorses Peginterferon-Beta-1a, Not Laquinimod, in MS
Teaser: After a second look at laquinimod, the EMA panel maintains that the benefits don't outweigh the potential risks of the drug.

Headlines: Experts Debate Use of Cannabis to Control Seizures
Teaser: A new series of articles in Epilepsia examine the potential use of cannabidiol and medical marijuana in young patients with epilepsy.

Headlines: Response to Social Alcohol Use May Predict Future Abuse
Teaser: Twenty-something heavy social drinkers who report greater stimulation and 'liking' of the substance's effects are more likely to develop alcohol use disorder in their 30s.

Headlines: Medical Marijuana OK'd in More States in 2014
Teaser: More than half the states in the country now have laws that in some way permit medical marijuana -- even in the most conservative states.

Headlines: New APS Guideline on Safe Use of Methadone
Teaser: To address soaring numbers of methadone overdose, the guideline advises individualized risk assessment and patient counseling about safe use, plus ECG monitoring to identify patients at high risk for cardiac problems.

Headlines: Baby Boom for Ticks, Lyme Disease Carriers in New England
Teaser: Large numbers of ticks, the parasites that carry Lyme disease, are expected to emerge in New England in the coming weeks, experts said on Friday.

Headlines: 'Bionic Pancreas' Works for 5 Days in Outpatient Settings
Teaser: In studies of adolescents and adults, a wearable, automated, bihormonal "closed-loop" system improved blood glucose control and reduced hypoglycemia     compared with usual insulin-pump therapy.

Headlines: Gout Patients Should Be Screened for Erectile Dysfunction
Teaser: Erectile dysfunction is common in patients with gout and may signal the presence of silent cardiovascular disease.

Headlines: Is Celiac Screening for Kids With Type 1 Diabetes Adequate?
Teaser: A new study suggests that current recommendations for celiac-disease screening in pediatric patients with type 1 diabetes may miss a significant proportion     of asymptomatic cases.

Headlines: Europe  Starts Cardiac Safety Review of Higher-Dose Ibuprofen
Teaser: The EMA will evaluate the cardiovascular risks associated with high doses of ibuprofen taken over long periods of time.

Headlines: FDA Panel Debates CV Safety of Opioid Constipation Drugs
Teaser: An FDA advisory committee agreed that cardiovascular outcomes trials aren't necessary for an emerging class of drugs that decrease the gastrointestinal adverse effects of opioids without reducing analgesia.

Headlines: Dorsal Sural Nerve Test Sensitive to Oxaliplatin Neuropathy
Teaser: Dorsal sural nerve conduction testing is a moderately sensitive and very specific test for early detection of oxaliplatin-induced peripheral neuropathy and beats sural nerve testing.

Headlines: Marijuana Tied to Addiction, Long-term Cognitive Dysfunction
Teaser: Marijuana use is linked to several adverse effects, including addiction and long-term cognitive dysfunction.

Headlines: Reduced Activity Raises Cautions in Older Men Using Statins
Teaser: Physical-activity levels were "modestly" lower among statin users compared with nonusers independently of other cardiac medications and of medical history, but activity wasn't further inhibited over time.

Headlines: FDA Approves Bunavail for Opioid Addiction
Teaser: The FDA has approved a new drug for the maintenance treatment of opioid dependence.

Headlines: High-Dose TMS May Rapidly Reduce Suicidal Thoughts
Teaser: An intense schedule of multiple, high-dose daily treatments of TMS is safe and effective for inpatients in suicidal crisis.

Headlines: Many Lyme Tests Unnecessary, Experts Say
Teaser: Most Lyme disease serologic tests were done according to diagnostic recommendations, but only 288,000 of the 2.4 million patients tested were infected; the estimated testing cost was $492 million.

Headlines: Insufficient Evidence for Moxduo Approval, FDA Says
Teaser: The FDA indicates there's insufficient evidence to support approval of the combination morphine-oxycodone agent.

Headlines: Second-Stage Labor Longer Than 2 Hours Linked to Risksâ€
Teaser: Prolonged second stage of labor has been associated with small increases in maternal and serious neonatal morbidity, as well as perinatal mortality in childbirths with an epidural.

Headlines: Naloxegol Reduces Opioid-Induced Constipation
Teaser: A new study shows naloxegol, a member of a class of agents that decreases gastrointestinal adverse effects without affecting analgesia, increases bowel movements.

Headlines: Impact of Poor Sleep Equal to Binge Drinking, Marijuana
Teaser: Poor sleep is on par with binge drinking, marijuana use in predicting academic problems on college campuses, yet it is largely ignored.

Headlines: IV Theophylline Quickly Reduces Lumbar Puncture Headache
Teaser: A small study shows that the pain common after lumbar puncture or spinal anesthesia quickly resolves with IV theophylline, with the greatest relief in the first 30 minutes but continuing out to 60 minutes.

Headlines: History of Marijuana Use Related to Sleep Problems
Teaser: Despite its 'relaxing' reputation, marijuana may actually impair sleep, not improve it.

Headlines: Tapentadol is 'Third-Tier' Drug for Diabetic Neuropathic Pain
Teaser: Tapentadol improves the quality of life of patients with painful diabetic peripheral neuropathy, but because it is a narcotic and expensive, it is     relegated to a third-tier treatment, says one expert.

Headlines: Replica Skeleton Shows King Richard III Had Scoliosis
Teaser: UK researchers have used CT image data and 3D printing to create a replica skeleton of King Richard III of England, which shows he had moderate to severe adolescent-onset idiopathic scoliosis.

Headlines: Add SLNB to Unfortunate List in Breast Cancer
Teaser: Black women are less likely to have a minimally invasive sentinel lymph node biopsy (SLNB) than white women.

Headlines: Death or Immobility Often Follows Hip Fractures in Nursing Homes
Teaser: Half of nursing home residents who have a hip fracture either die or lose the ability to walk on their own in the six months after the injury, according to a new study.

Headlines: Hip Surgery Mortality Unaltered by Anesthesia Choice
Teaser: Regional anesthesia had no effect on 30-day hip surgery mortality but cut length of stay by half a day.

Headlines: Positive Results With Combo Tx for Opioid Dependence
Teaser: Orexo AB announced new topline results of 2 clinical trials with a combination of buprenorphine and naloxone for buprenorphine induction and plans to pursue approval of an expanded label in the US.

Headlines: 'Silently Suffering': Breast Cancer Before 40 and Sexuality
Teaser: A new study identifies factors associated with sexual dysfunction in young women who undergo treatment for breast cancer, including chemotherapy.

Headlines: Arboviral Disease in New Hampshire: Preparation for the 2014 Season
Teaser: The state reminds its clinicians to consider mosquito-borne diseases, including West Nile virus and Eastern equine encephalitis, in patients with compatible clinical features.

Headlines: Detecting Marijuana Use: Which Test Is Best?
Teaser: The first study to compare the ability of saliva tests to detect occasional and frequent marijuana use sheds light on which test is best.

Headlines: Reader Poll: Should Medical Marijuana Use in Clinicians Be Prohibited?
Teaser: A physician assistant in New Mexico has sued her former employer after they fired her for testing positive for marijuana use; she said she was prescribed marijuana for medical reasons.

Headlines: Aerobic Exercise 'Most Effective Weapon' for Fibromyalgia
Teaser: A fibromyalgia expert provides evidence-based advice on how to manage patients with this often frustrating-to-treat disorder.

Headlines: No Hospital Stay After Enema Reduction for Intussusception
Teaser: Children who undergo successful enema reduction for intussusception don't need to stay overnight in the hospital because the risk of recurrence within 24 to 48 hours is low, researchers said.

Headlines: Aberrometry-Based Refraction: Enough for Surgical Planning?
Teaser: Intraoperative wavefront aberrometry may not provide consistent results and should not be relied on as the sole guidance for intraoperative surgical planning during cataract surgery.

Headlines: Insurers Push Back Against Growing Cost of Cancer Treatments
Teaser: In a pair of stories, the Associated Press reports on how insurers in New Hampshire and Kentucky that did not participate in the health law's online insurance marketplaces during the first enrollment period are now indicating their interest for the next open season. In addition, news outlets in Oregon and Minnesota report on developments related to state exchanges

Headlines: New England States Joining Forces to Take On Heroin Crisis
Teaser: The governors of 5 New England states said they would begin to share data on prescriptions to cut down on â€˜doctor shopping,â€™ with heroin addiction and overdose deaths on the rise as a result of prescription painkiller abuse.

Headlines: Clinician Sues Hospital Over Medical-Marijuana Firing
Teaser: New Mexico permitted physician assistant Donna Smith to treat her PTSD with medical marijuana, but she was fired by a hospital citing federal law that requires a drug-free workplace.

Headlines: Choosing Wisely:  ASAâ€™s List of Top 5 Procedures to Avoid
Teaser: The ASAâ€™s top 5 list of tests and procedures for anesthesiologists to avoid is  part of the national Choosing Wisely campaign.

Headlines: Alice Brandfonbrener, MD, Medical Pioneer, Dies at 83
Teaser: A "true pioneer" in treating the unique medical issues of performing artists, Dr. Brandfonbrener understood their "special medical needs."

Headlines: Psychiatrists Plagued by Job Stress
Teaser: Psychiatrists are at high risk for occupational stress, with higher rates of job dissatisfaction and patient-related stress than those in other medical specialties.

Headlines: Joint Commission Issues Alert on Unsafe Injection Practices
Teaser: Mishandling of injectable drugs, including reuse of single-dose vials, is a significant contributing factor to outbreaks of blood-borne or bacterial infections.

Headlines: Multiple Myeloma Compound Gets Orphan Drug Status
Teaser: KRN5500 is a spicamycin derivative that exhibits antimyeloma effects by impairing both myeloma cells and osteoclasts.

Headlines: 'Project Lazarus' Making Headway on Opioid Overdoses
Teaser: A community-based opioid overdose prevention program has dramatically cut overdose deaths in Wilkes County, North Carolina.

Headlines: Acetazolamide, Low-Cal Diet Help Intracranial Hypertension
Teaser: Acetazolamide plus a low-calorie diet may benefit patients with idiopathic intracranial hypertension.

Headlines: Dark Chocolate Eases Walking in Peripheral Artery Disease
Teaser: Older people with peripheral artery disease (PAD) may be able to walk a little longer and farther after eating dark chocolate, according to a new small Italian study.

Headlines: Steroid Epidural Injections No Benefit in Spinal Stenosis
Teaser: Epidural injection of glucocorticoids plus lidocaine offered minimal or no short-term benefit in the treatment of lumbar spinal stenosis.

Headlines: Hand Hygiene Compliance Infeasible for Anesthesia Providers
Teaser: Anesthesia providers had high numbers of hand hygiene opportunities in the operating room per hour, but low levels of compliance, according to a new study.

Headlines: Dark Chocolate May Relieve Walking Pain in PAD
Teaser: In a small pilot study, patients with peripheral arterial disease could walk slightly farther and longer soon after eating a small amount of dark, but not     milk, chocolate.

Headlines: Grim Stats for Opioid-Related Deaths, Prescribing in US
Teaser: A new report paints a grim picture of opioid prescribing and overdose deaths in the US.

Headlines: No Sign of QoL Benefits With Chelation in TACT
Teaser: Investigators for the controversialâ€”and ultimately positiveâ€”trial of chelation therapy in stable CAD had no preconceived notions as to what QoL data         might show at two years. Turns out, not much.

Headlines: Appropriate Antibiotic Prescribing? Some Clinicians Resistant
Teaser: One in 10 clinicians who prescribe antibiotics without clinical certainty said the drug 'won't hurt if not needed' in a WebMD/Medscape survey. Such a belief helps promote antibiotic resistance.

Headlines: Number of Pain Sites in Older Adults Linked to Quality of Life
Teaser: The more musculoskeletal pain sites an older person has, the lower their health-related quality of life, according to researchers.

Headlines: Local Infiltration Analgesia Relieves Pain in Some Joint Surgeries
Teaser: Local infiltration analgesia (LIA) provides effective analgesia early after total knee arthroplasty but has limited efficacy after total hip arthroplasty, according to results of a systematic review.

Headlines: Oral Lidocaine for Teething Pain May Cause Harm, FDA Says
Teaser: Oral viscous lidocaine solution is not approved to treat teething pain, and use in infants and young children can cause serious harm, including death, the FDA has warned.

Headlines: Chronic Migraine Puts Heavy Burden on Families
Teaser: Patients report feeling angry and guilty, avoiding sexual intimacy, and missing vacations and other important family events.

Headlines: FDA Panel Votes Against Accelerated Approval for Olaparib
Teaser: An FDA advisory committee recommends waiting for phase 3 data before considering approval for olaparib as maintenance therapy for recurrent ovarian cancer.

Headlines: Early Trial Shows New Hydrogel Promising for Weight Loss
Teaser: If ongoing development is successful, the manufacturer intends to market the hydrogel as a medical device that may be a particularly helpful weight loss     product for individuals with prediabetes.

Headlines: Adding CBT Improves School Function in Kids With Migraine
Teaser: Combining cognitive-behavioral therapy with amitriptyline not only reduced headache frequency but improved quality of life and school functioning in children and adolescents with chronic migraine.

Headlines: Personality and Stigma Linked in Headache Patients
Teaser: Certain personality characteristics, such as being overly worried or anxious, may worsen the sense of stigma that patients with headache feel, a new study has found.

Headlines: Headaches Increase During Perimenopause
Teaser: A new survey confirms what many headache specialists see in their clinics all the time among perimenopausal women; the increase may relate to falling estrogen levels.

Headlines: Drug Lessens Psoriatic Plaques While Reversing Baldness
Teaser: Tofacitinib reversed baldness in a 25-year-old man with plaque psoriasis and alopecia universalis.

Headlines: IDSA: Skin and Soft Tissue Infections Guidelines Updated
Teaser: The Infectious Diseases Society of America has updated its guidelines for the diagnosis and treatment of skin and soft tissue infections, which have increased because of the spread of MRSA.

Headlines: Ketamine Metabolite Has Promise in Depression
Teaser: Hydroxynorketamine may treat symptoms of depression without ketamine's unwanted side effects and also shows potential in neurodegenerative diseases such as Alzheimer's and Parkinson's.

Headlines: FDA Panel Grapples With 'Weak' Data on Morcellation Risk
Teaser: An FDA advisory panel yesterday heard 2 vastly different estimates for the risk for an unsuspected malignancy in women undergoing uterine fibroid surgery.

Headlines: Steroids in Advanced Cancer Don't Help Pain But Boost QOL
Teaser: Adding steroids to opioid therapy did not change pain intensity or reduce the consumption of opioids, but it did improve appetite, fatigue, and satisfaction with treatment.

Headlines: OR Briefings Reduce Surgical Errors, Improve Outcomes
Teaser: Most effective operating room briefings and debriefings are tailored to specialties and are compatible with hospital culture and scheduling practices, investigators have found.

Headlines: Most IUD Insertions Uneventful in Nulligravid Women
Teaser: Almost IUD insertions are uneventful in women who have not borne children, although they are significantly more painful in women prone to difficult periods.

Headlines: HEAT-PPCI Questions? More Answers from Dr Rod Stables
Teaser: The HEAT-PPCI trial was published last week. In an in-depth interview, the study's senior investigator tackles the many questions that have been raised     about the study's design and results.

Headlines: ADHD 'Inextricably' Linked to Substance Abuse
Teaser: A new report offers practical strategies for reducing the risk for substance abuse and suggestions for safe stimulant prescribing in patients with ADHD.

Headlines: Algorithm Cuts Pediatric CT Use in Suspected Appendicitis
Teaser: A simple algorithm including components such as physical exam and ultrasound can help diagnose appendicitis in children and reduce the need for computed tomography (CT), researchers say.

Headlines: Heart Failure May Share Etiology With . . . Osteoporosis?
Teaser: That's what a population-based study suggests, raising a lot of risk-stratification and treatment possibilities related to bone-mineral-density screening     that, for now, are all speculation.

Headlines: Update on Tamper-Proof Hydrocodone Products
Teaser: Purdue and Zogenix report their progress in gaining approval for formulations of single-entity hydrocodone bitartrate that are difficult to misuse or abuse.

Headlines: Novel Eye Measure Finds Neuropathy in Prediabetes
Teaser: Corneal confocal microscopy detected evidence of small-fiber neuropathy in patients who don't even have diabetes yet but who have impaired glucose     tolerance.

Headlines: Opioid Use Putting 'America's Fighting Force' at Risk
Teaser: Prevalence rates of chronic pain and/or opioid use by military personnel after deployment have ballooned, especially when compared with the general population.

Headlines: Painful Diabetic Neuropathy Linked to 'Nondipping' BP
Teaser: A small study demonstrates "novel" association between peripheral diabetic neuropathic pain and the absence of a drop in nighttime systolic blood pressure,     suggesting high cardiovascular risk.

Headlines: Naproxen CV Safety vs Ibuprofen Challenged in WHI Analysis
Teaser: Common perceptions about the CV safety of NSAIDs took a hit in a Women's Health Initiative study, but not everyone agrees with it.

Headlines: Waiting to Do an Appendectomy Does Not Lead to More Perforations
Teaser: The time a patient spends in the hospital prior to having an appendectomy has no impact on the incidence of perforated appendicitis, according to a large retrospective study from the state of Washington.

Headlines: Hookah Smoking Increasing Among Adolescents
Teaser: Hookah smoking risk was greater among adolescents with higher socioeconomic status, urban students, white students, boys, and those who earn at least $50 a week.

Headlines: Are a Third of Knee Replacements 'Inappropriate?'
Teaser: One third of total knee replacement surgeries in the United States may be 'inappropriate.'

Headlines: New Data on Peripheral Nerve Blocks for Headache
Teaser: Study shows combination nerve blocks are common and patients are generally satisfied with the degree of pain relief.

Headlines: The Latest in Medical Convenience: ER Appointments
Teaser: Hospitals around the country are allowing patients to wait at home rather than endure hours in crowded emergency rooms.

Headlines: Monoclonal Antibodies Promising for Migraine Prevention
Teaser: Now at the phase 2 trial stage, these agents, which block activity of the calcitonin-gene-related peptide, are generating excitement among headache specialists.

Headlines: Infant Colic May Be Early Migraine
Teaser: Results of a new meta-analysis tighten the link between baby's episodes of fussing and crying and migraine headache.

Headlines: Postpartum Depression: Epidural During Birth May Reduce Risk
Teaser: New research linking epidural anaesthesia during childbirth to reduced risk for postpartum depression suggests pain control during labor and delivery may be a key factor.

Headlines: No Effect of Acetaminophen in Acute Low Back Pain
Teaser: The universal recommendation to provide acetaminophen (paracetamol) as a first-line treatment for low-back pain needs to be reconsidered, the authors say.

Headlines: EU Agency Endorses Suspension of Oral Methadone Products
Teaser: An EU regulatory agency has officially endorsed recommendations to suspend methadone oral solutions that contain high-molecular-weight povidone.

Headlines: Doctor Found Guilty of Manslaughter After Overdose Deaths
Teaser: Prosecutors said the New Jersey anesthesiologist prescribed painkillers in a weekend practice to high-risk patients despite evidence of drug abuse and addiction, diversion, and prior overdoses.

Headlines: FDA Approves Abuse-Deterrent Oxycodone/Naloxone Combo
Teaser: The FDA has approved an abuse-deterrent extended-release formulation of oxycodone (Targiniq ER, Purdue Pharma LP), a combination of oxycodone hydrochloride and naloxone hydrochloride.

Headlines: Brodalumab Doubled Psoriatic Arthritis Responses
Teaser: Brodalumab increased ACR 20 responses from 18% to 37% and 39% in patients with psoriatic arthritis; response rates continued to rise to week 24.

Headlines: New HIV Guidelines Released by WHO
Teaser: The recommendations target marginalized groups reportedly responsible for much of the global HIV epidemic.

Headlines: African Americans With Cancer Pain More Likely to Receive Morphine
Teaser: African Americans with cancer pain are more likely than similar white patients to receive morphine, with 3- and 6-glucuronide neurotoxic metabolites that accumulate in chronic kidney disease (CKD), and less likely to receive oxycodone.

Headlines: Psychiatrist Fired as 'Payback' for Marijuana Research?
Teaser: Psychiatrist and researcher Sue Sisely claims the University of Arizona fired her as 'payback' for her pursuit of research into marijuana as a potential treatment for PTSD.

Headlines: New European Clinical Practice Guidelines for Anal Cancer
Teaser: Three European Societies have jointly issued anal cancer clinical practice guidelines, which pretty much align with other evidence-based international guidelines.

Headlines: Unusual Case of a 20 Pound Tumor
Teaser: An unusually large tumor, of which the patient was unaware, turned out to be a liposarcoma also containing some bone and cartilage tissue.

Headlines: Sjogren's: Hydroxychloroquine No Better Than Placebo
Teaser: The commonly prescribed agent did not relieve symptoms of dryness, fatigue, or pain in a randomized controlled trial, but efficacy criteria may have been too tough, investigators say.

Headlines: Telecare Intervention Improves Chronic Pain for VA Patients
Teaser: A telecare intervention at a VA medical center has lead to improvement in chronic musculoskeletal pain in 126 patients.

Headlines: IL-17 Inhibition May 'Change Paradigm' of Psoriasis Treatment
Teaser: The selective interleukin-17 (IL-17) inhibitor secukinumab (Novartis) produced rapid, robust and, with continued treatment, long-lasting relief of moderate to severe plaque psoriasis in two phase 3 studies.

Headlines: Testicular Cancer Increasing in Young Hispanic Americans
Teaser: The incidence of testicular germ cell tumors has risen substantially in Hispanic adolescents and young adults in recent years in the United States.

Headlines: Weather May Not Affect Low Back Pain
Teaser: Weather factors such as temperature, relative humidity, air pressure, and precipitation did not increase the risk for a low back pain episode; higher wind and wind gust speed had a minimal effect.

Headlines: Moxibustion May Alleviate Arthritis Knee Pain
Teaser: Moxibustion, an Eastern medicine technique, may alleviate osteoarthritis-associated knee pain and improve physical function for weeks after therapy, according to a new study.

Headlines: Celecoxib May Reduce Pain After Face-lift
Teaser: The COX-2 inhibitor does not have the considerable adverse effects of opioids, but the cost is high, and insurance may not cover it.

Headlines: Utah Doc Loses License to Prescribe Narcotics by Telemedicine
Teaser: A Utah physician who practices telemedicine from an island in the western Pacific Ocean was said to be "threat to public safety."

Headlines: PRAC Wants Some Methadone-Containing Povidone Off Market
Teaser: The committee has recommended suspension of methadone containing high-molecular-weight povidone and changes to product information on methadone products that contain low-molecular-weight povidone.

Headlines: Morcellation Isolation Bag: Expert Questions Technique
Teaser: Using an isolation bag during morcellation is feasible and could potentially improve safety during minimally invasive gynecologic surgery.

Headlines: Electroacupuncture Improves AI-related Symptoms
Teaser: Electroacupuncture reduced fatigue, anxiety, and depression associated with aromatase inhibitors (AIs) in breast cancer patients.

Headlines: Patients Seeking Cheaper Care Getting Online Bids From Doctors
Teaser: Medibid, a four-year-old Internet service, can help people get non-emergency medical services outside of costly hospitals, but critics note that the service provides no guarantee of quality or safety.

Headlines: Injections and Physical Therapy Equal for Treating Shoulder Pain
Teaser: Physical therapy and corticosteroid injections work equally well for shoulder impingement syndrome, according to a new study.

Headlines: Laparoscopic vs Open Hepatectomy: Similar Short-term Results
Teaser: The results of a new study comparing outcomes after laparoscopic or open hepatectomy have shown that these outcomes are similar in the short-term (ie, 30 days).

Headlines: Fibromyalgia Includes Cognitive Symptoms
Teaser: A study has confirmed that 'fibro-fog' is real, measurable, and independent of depression.

Headlines: Surgery for Heel Fractures Doesn't Improve Outcome
Teaser: In a randomized controlled trial, surgery by open reduction and internal fixation in patients with typical fractures of the heel bone didn't improve outcome compared with non-operative care.

Headlines: FDA Expands Approval of Pompe Disease Drug
Teaser: On the basis of new data available since the approval of Lumizyme, the FDA has expanded approval to include patients younger than 8 years, as well as eliminating the REMS program attached to the drug.

Headlines: Boston Scientific Wins Trial Over Transvaginal Mesh Device
Teaser: A Massachusetts jury has cleared Boston Scientific Corp of selling dangerous and defective transvaginal mesh devices, in the first out of more than 20,000 lawsuits waiting to go to trial.

Headlines: More in New York, New Jersey Infected With Chikungunya: CDC
Teaser: Cases of chikungunya virus, a painful, mosquito-borne disease that has spread rapidly through the Caribbean in recent months, spiked higher in New York and New Jersey in the past week, according to new federal data.

Headlines: Musculoskeletal Pain on Stopping Imatinib: Should We Worry?
Teaser: A first report on a withdrawal syndrome documents patients with chronic myelogenous leukemia with musculoskeletal pain after imatinib withdrawal.

Headlines: Hot Flashes: 2 Drugs Have No Effect on Sexual Function
Teaser: Estradiol and venlafaxine have no effect on overall sexual function for midlife women with hot flashes.

Headlines: Neonatal Abstinence Syndrome: Stringent Weaning Protocol Best
Teaser: Use of a stringent protocol to treat neonatal narcotic abstinence syndrome reduces the duration of opioid exposure as well as the length of hospital stay.

Headlines: Three Screening Tools Help Identify Psoriatic Arthritis
Teaser: Three screening tools can help identify psoriatic arthritis (PsA) so patients can receive timely treatment, new research suggests.

Headlines: Cyclosporiasis: Health Alert for New Hampshire Providers
Teaser: Compared with those who didn't run, investigators observed a significantly reduced risk of mortality among those who ran as little as six miles per week     and among those who ran slower than six miles per hour.

Headlines: A Little Running Provides Big Mortality Benefit
Teaser: The controversial approach during operative vaginal delivery significantly reduces the risk for injury, according to a large Dutch database study.

Headlines: Mediolateral Episiotomy Reduces Obstetrical Injury
Teaser: A graft system creates tiny blisters for epidermal harvesting and allows for foot ulcer treatment without the need for surgery.

Headlines: System Offers Surgery Alternative for Diabetic Foot Ulcers
Teaser: Women who participate in triathlons have high rates of urinary and anal incontinence and pelvic girdle pain, a new survey suggests.

Headlines: Female Triathletes at Risk for Pelvic Floor Disorders
Teaser: Fears that ketamine increases intracranial pressure come from outdated studies and are 'likely overblown,' researchers say.

Headlines: Extreme Medicine: The Search for New Antibiotics
Teaser: Pampering leafcutter ants with fragrant rose petals and fresh oranges may seem an unlikely way to rescue modern medicine, but scientists at a lab in eastern England think it's well worth trying.

Headlines: Doctor-Shopping Common After Orthopedic Trauma
Teaser: After orthopedic trauma surgery, approximately 1 in 5 patients obtains narcotic prescriptions from more than 1 doctor; those patients also tend to use more pain killers and for a longer period.

Headlines: Family Doctors in Driverâ€™s Seat for Cancer Survivor Care
Teaser: Dr. Lisa Diller summarizes the best approach for internists with childhood cancer survivors as patients.

Headlines: Sclerosis: Autologous Cell Transfers May Help Patients
Teaser: A new study has found that injections of adipose-derived stromal cells into the fingers of patients with systemic sclerosis decreased pain and increased function.

Headlines: Overdoses Related to Synthetic Marijuana: Alert for New Hampshire Providers
Teaser: The City of Manchester, New Hampshire, has noted an increase in overdoses possibly related to a synthetic marijuana product.

Headlines: Insomnia Drug Linked to Doubling of ED Visits
Teaser: Overmedication with the insomnia drug zolpidem led to a near doubling of emergency department visits between 2006 and 2010 and is especially problematic for women.

Headlines: NSAID Use May Reduce Breast Cancer Recurrence in Obese
Teaser: Postmenopausal women treated with hormone therapy for estrogen-receptor-positive breast cancer who are overweight or obese had a lower recurrence rate if they also took NSAIDs.

Headlines: More Evidence Cocaine Use Increases Stroke Risk
Teaser: A systematic review suggests that cocaine use significantly increases stroke risk.

Headlines: Bacterial Spores Provoke Robust Antitumor Responses
Teaser: Injecting bacteria spores directly into tumors induces significant antitumor responses; promising results in dogs led to 1 patient being treated.

Headlines: Neurostimulation for Pain: Earlier May Be Better
Teaser: Stimulation of the spinal cord, peripheral nerves or areas of the brain is clinically effective and cost-effective and in many cases should be done earlier in the treatment course.

Headlines: Malnutrition Common Among Elderly in Emergency Departments
Teaser: Emergency physicians have a pivotal role in identifying at-risk seniors and providing appropriate referrals.

Headlines: Kidney Stones: New Tool May Predict Recurrence
Teaser: Knowing which patients are most at risk could help physicians focus recommendations for medications, tests, and diet.

Headlines: Laparoscopic Cholecystectomy: Safe for Children
Teaser: No bile duct injuries occurred in a recent review of more than 200 cases.

Headlines: Space Oddity: Use of Sleep Aids in Astronauts Astronomical
Teaser: Sleep deficiency is pervasive among astronauts before and during space flight, and the reported incidence sleep-promoting medication use is 20 times greater than the proportion of Americans estimated to use hypnotic drugs at any time in a given year.

Headlines: For Pro-Soccer Players, Concussion Raises Risk of Other Injuries
Teaser: Professional soccer players who sustain a concussion are more likely to suffer another injury over the next year than players with other injuries, like groin strains or hamstring pulls, according to a new study from Sweden.

Headlines: New Kennedy Book Calls for Thimerosal-Free Vaccines
Teaser: A new book about the safety of thimerosal in vaccines attempts to reopen a question that public health authorities consider settled. Robert Kennedy Jr. is the editor. But who are the authors?

Headlines: Lessons From Free Cancer Screening for Poor US Women
Teaser: A huge national program that provides free breast and cervical cancer screening for low-income and underinsured women in the US offers up lessons for improving screening across the healthcare system.

Headlines: ED Visits for Drug-Related Suicide Attempts Double
Teaser: Two new reports show a dramatic upturn in visits to emergency departments due to drug-related suicide attempts, with the biggest increase in those 45-64 years of age.

Headlines: FDA Warns Against Off-Label Use of Hyaluronic Acid Product
Teaser: The FDA has learned of adverse events associated with the unapproved use of Enhancement Medical's Expression injectable intranasal splint as a dermal filler.

Headlines: Best Treatment for Shoulder Pain?
Teaser: Physical therapy is just as effective as corticosteroid injections in alleviating pain and disability and improving quality of life, and may be less costly.

Headlines: Third Patient With Ebola Returning to US
Teaser: A physician who is the third American infected with Ebola will be coming back to the United States, although it is not yet known when that will be, according to the CDC.

Headlines: Cabozantinib Bombs in Prostate Cancer
Teaser: The tyrosine kinase inhibitor had shown dramatic effects on bone scans in an earlier trial, but has now failed to show a survival benefit in a pivotal study.

Headlines: RA: Effect of 'Complete Disease Control' on Pain, Function
Teaser: Patients with rheumatoid arthritis who have more complete disease control had better outcomes than those who did not.

Headlines: Increasing Rates of Acute HCV Among Young Americans
Teaser: The incidence of acute hepatitis C infection is rising rapidly among Americans aged 30 years and younger, especially those living in non-urban areas, according to U.S. data.

Headlines: IV Lidocaine an Option for Critical Limb Ischemia Pain
Teaser: Intravenous lidocaine proved better than IV morphine in alleviating pain due to critical limb ischemia in a randomized double-blind controlled trial conducted in Iran.

Headlines: Colchicine 'Useless' for Postop Pericardial Effusion: POPE-2
Teaser: In yet another trial, colchicine did not reduce complications after cardiac surgery; specifically, the drug failed to decrease postoperative pericardial     effusion volume or prevent cardiac tamponade.

Headlines: Severe Acne in Teen Years Linked to Increased Endometriosis Risk
Teaser: Women with a history of severe acne in their teenage years are at significantly greater risk of endometriosis, new research shows.

Headlines: 'Strikingly Effective' Approach for Depression in Cancer Pts
Teaser: A new integrated program for treating depression in cancer patients was 'strikingly more effective' than current standard of care.

Headlines: Health Law Spurs Focus on Faster Drug Development
Teaser: The Cures Acceleration Networkâ€™s mission is to fund research that can be speedily transformed into treatments and to streamline the drug-approval process.

Headlines: Ketamine May Curb Suicidal Thoughts
Teaser: Ketamine administered to patients expressing suicidal thoughts was associated with an increased wish to live and a decreased wish to die independently of the drug's rapid antidepressant effect.

Headlines: Rinse Eases Symptoms of Oral Mucositis in Cancer Patients
Teaser: The first randomized controlled trial of products for oral mucositis suggests that an oral rinse improves many symptoms of oral mucositis, compared with placebo.

Headlines: Knee Surgery: No Benefit for Those With Mild Osteoarthritis
Teaser: No benefit has been found for arthroscopic surgery for middle-aged patients with degenerative meniscal tears and mild or no osteoarthritis when compared with nonoperative management.

Headlines: Doctors in Developed Nations Must Know How to Spot Ebola
Teaser: Doctors in the United States, Europe and around the world need to stay current on the ongoing Ebola outbreak in West Africa and know how to recognize it and the steps to take to protect themselves and others.

Headlines: Medical Marijuana Laws Linked to Fewer Opioid Deaths
Teaser: A new study finds lower rates of death from accidental overdose of analgesic opioids in states where laws provide access to medical marijuana.

Headlines: FDA Okays Submicron Diclofenac (Zorvolex) for Osteoarthritis
Teaser: Zorvolex is now indicated for the management of mild to moderate acute pain and osteoarthritis pain.

Headlines: Knee Replacement May Go Poorly When Thinking Life Isn't Fair
Teaser: People who tend to blame others for their suffering and think setbacks in their lives are irreparable tend to report more pain after knee replacement surgery.

Headlines: Spiritual Needs of Cancer Patients Important Part of Care
Teaser: The spiritual needs of cancer patients need to be acknowledged and addressed, and can be an important component of care.

Headlines: DEA Further Restricts Hydrocodone Combination Products
Teaser: The US Drug Enforcement Administration has voted to move forward with rescheduling hydrocodone combination products from schedule III to schedule II drugs, an act that will take effect in 45 days.

Headlines: Joint Commission Issues Alert on Tubing Misconnections
Teaser: The commission urges organizations to begin planning for the transition beginning in October to new tubing connector standards, which will introduce changes and new risks into the healthcare environment.

Headlines: Cancer Screening Is Losing 'Luster,' Says Critic
Teaser: The 'age of wonder' for cancer screening has been replaced by a time of skepticism, argues one expert, and American clinicians need to ensure that the merits of screening continue to be recognized.

Headlines: FDA Okays Naloxegol (Movantik) in Opioid-Induced Constipation
Teaser: Approval comes following results of 2 studies showing the drug is safe and effective.

Headlines: Back-Related Leg Pain: Spine Manipulation Helps
Teaser: Spine manipulation plus exercise and home advice provided more short-term relief for patients with back-related leg pain than exercise and home advice alone, according to a recent study.

Headlines: New Guidelines Address Hip Fractures in Older Adults
Teaser: The American Academy of Orthopaedic Surgeons has issued new guidelines on hip fracture management in older adults, including a recommendation for preoperative regional analgesia to reduce delirium.

Headlines: Avoiding Pain Management Prosecutions
Teaser: The key to staying out of court, says an attorney with years of experience in the field, is keeping up-to-date documentation.

Headlines: WHO Mandates New Single-Use Syringe
Teaser: A British inventor's syringe and lab tests that get quick results with only a drop of blood are among the low-cost innovations broadening access to healthcare globally.

Headlines: Sickle Cell Treatment Guideline Released
Teaser: A guideline for treating individuals with sickle cell disease has been developed by an NHLBI expert panel.

Headlines: Virus May Predispose People to Appendicitis
Teaser: The adenovirus was found in 14% of patients who had an appendectomy, say researchers.

Headlines: Drug Use Up Among U.S. Pilots Killed in Crashes
Teaser: Tests on pilots killed in plane crashes in the United States since 1990 have found a four-fold increase in the use of legal and illegal drugs, according to a study released on Tuesday by the National Transportation Safety Board.

Headlines: Opioid-Induced Adverse Effects Hit Social Media
Teaser: Social media analysis reveals patients are talking about constipation and other opioid-induced adverse effects, and about lack of communication with doctors.

Headlines: Pain and Depression Treatment Possible in Fibromyalgia
Teaser: A new study shows that patients with fibromyalgia who have comorbid depression can be treated with pregabalin for pain relief while remaining on antidepressants.

Headlines: The Opioid Constipation 'Disconnect'
Teaser: Doctors and patients have differing views on the impact of opioid-induced constipation and use of laxatives to relieve this adverse effect.

Headlines: Physician Donated Kidney to Patient She Hadn't Met
Teaser: Physician says she can't describe the immediate happiness she felt knowing that an organ she can live without brought new life to a 33-year-old man.

Headlines: The Changing Face of Opioid Addiction
Teaser: The 50- to 69-year-old age group represents the fastest growing subpopulation of opioid addicts in the United States.

Headlines: Updated 'Tool Kit' to Prevent Opioid Overdose
Teaser: In a new overdose tool kit from SAMHSA, doctors are being encouraged to prescribe the opioid antagonist naloxone, use prescription drug monitoring programs, and properly execute prescription orders.

Headlines: New Screening Tool for Chronic Migraine
Teaser: A new questionnaire has a high degree of accuracy for identifying patients with chronic migraine.

Headlines: Opioid Prescription Should Include Risk Assessment
Teaser: An expert presenting at PAIN Week believes physicians should assess all patients for their risk for opioid misuse and take advantage of available tools to tackle the problem of abuse.

Headlines: Vagal Nerve Blockade for Obesity?
Teaser: A new randomized trial, dubbed ReCharge, missed the primary endpoint vs sham stimulation, but this novel approach was associated with more weight loss than seen in the control group.

Headlines: Marijuana Compound a Novel Treatment for Alzheimer's?
Teaser: Very low levels of THC, the active compound in marijuana, may offer a novel and viable treatment approach for Alzheimer's disease, preliminary research suggests.

Headlines: Presurgery Quality-of-Life Score May Predict Complications
Teaser: Patients awaiting colon cancer surgery who rated their quality of life as low were 2 and a half times more likely to experience serious surgical complications.

Headlines: Methadone Treatment Reduces Sex Hormone in Men Only
Teaser: Treating opioid dependence with methadone can dramatically lower testosterone levels, but only in men.

Headlines: Coalition Fighting Opioid Epidemic Calls for New FDA Head
Teaser: Without new leadership at FDA, the opioid crisis will continue unabated, the FED UP! coalition writes in a letter to Health and Human Services.

Headlines: NICU Private Rooms Improve Outcomes
Teaser: NICU private rooms were associated with better neurobehavioral and medical outcomes, which were mediated by increased developmental support and maternal involvement.

Headlines: NSAIDs Linked to Increased Venous Thromboembolism Risk
