Teaser: Regular NSAID use has been linked to nearly double the risk for venous thromboembolism, according to a new meta-analysis.

Headlines: 'Polyherbacy' a Common Challenge in Pain Patients
Teaser: With chronic pain patients the leading drivers of the multi-billion-dollar dietary supplement industry, clinicians are put to the test to place things in perspective.

Headlines: First Clinic for Child Victims of Female Genital Mutilation
Teaser: Britain's first specialist clinic for child victims of female genital mutilation (FGM) opened in London as part of a push to eradicate the illegal ritual in the country.

Headlines: MS Spasticity Responds to Marijuana Extract
Teaser: In patients with MS, a randomized trial shows relief on objective spasticity measures with Sativex, a marijuana extract approved in Europe, without corresponding changes in corticospinal excitability.

Headlines: Imaging Reveals Neural Patterns of Pain, Addiction
Teaser: Functional MRI shows brain network activity associated with disease severity and response to behavioral therapy in patients with low back pain and opioid addiction.

Headlines: HEATed Debate: Stone, Stables Spar Over Best STEMI Strategy
Teaser: For the first time since HEAT-PPCI burst onto the radar of interventional cardiologists, the two nimble orators at opposite ends of this controversy faced     off in a public debate. It got hot.

Headlines: Stopping HF Meds Can Be Safe After Heart-Toxic Cancer Chemo
Teaser: Researchers shared their protocol for withdrawing ACE inhibitors and beta-blockers, without hurting LVEF, from selected cancer survivors who had taken them     for chemotherapy-induced cardiomyopathy.

Headlines: Medical Grade Honey Not Effective in Radiation Esophagitis
Teaser: Pain from radiation esophagitis not more effectively reduced with daily liquid or lozenge-containing honey than standard supportive care.

Headlines: Bullying Increases Risk for Nightmares, Depression, Self-Harm
Teaser: New studies show that being bullied increases the risk of having nightmares and night terrors, and that sibling bullying increases risk for depression and self-harm in adulthood.

Headlines: Synthetic Marijuana Now a Worldwide Problem
Teaser: Consumption of synthetic cannabinoids, aka K2 or Spice, has increased all over the world - despite law enforcement and regulatory control measures, reports a new NIDA-led study.

Headlines: FDA Approves Once-Weekly Dulaglutide for Type 2 Diabetes
Teaser: The glucagon-like peptide-1 receptor agonist was evaluated in 6 clinical trials involving more than 3000 patients.

Headlines: In Onscreen Dramas, Health Experts Inject Dose of Reality
Teaser: The questions from producers run the gamut:  Could a body be stolen from a hospital? What do infectious disease specialists wear during an outbreak? Do surgeons really say â€œStat!â€?

Headlines: 'Dying in America' IOM Report Calls for Major Reform
Teaser: The US health system needs major reform to meet end-of-life care needs of most Americans, says a new report from the Institute of Medicine.

Headlines: Eye-Tracking Technology Shows Concussion Severity
Teaser: A neuroscientist seeks FDA approval for a system that can track pupil movement to assess brain injury, and give results in minutes.

Headlines: What's Hot at AAPM 2014?
Teaser: The American Academy of Pain Management meeting this week continues to explore the 'science and art' of pain management.

Headlines: Mindfulness May Benefit Migraine
Teaser: A pilot study suggests that a mindfulness-based stress reduction program has a beneficial effect on headache duration and disability.

Headlines: Fibromyalgia: Patients Hypersensitive to Nonpain Sensations
Teaser: The brains of patients with fibromyalgia processed visual, auditory, and tactile stimuli differently than the brains of control patients in a new study.

Headlines: PFO Closure Fails Anew in Migraine: PRIMA
Teaser: PRIMA set out to assess reduction in migraine among people with migraine with aura after PFO closure and in fact did see benefit for this outcome. The     problem? That wasn't the trial's primary end point.

Headlines: Intracervical Anesthesia for Pain Relief During IUD Insertion
Teaser: Intracervical anesthesia does not reduce the pain associated with insertion of levonorgestrel-releasing intrauterine devices (IUDs) in women without a previous vaginal delivery.

Headlines: Evaluating Patients for Ebola: CDC Recommendations for Clinicians
Teaser: Clinicians are advised to increase their vigilance in inquiring about a history of travel to West Africa in the 21 days before illness onset, among other recommendations.

Headlines: Drug Reactions Largest Factor in Fatal Anaphylaxis
Teaser: Drugs, foods, and venom accounted for most deaths from anaphylaxis.

Headlines: Heroin Death Rate Doubles in 28 States in 2 Years
Teaser: Heroin overdoses soared as the death rate from prescription opioid overdose declined slightly from 2010 through 2012.

Headlines: Enterovirus, Neonatal Diseases Showcased at AAP Conference
Teaser: The conference will focus on a range of issues, from clinical trials in pediatric populations to new guidelines for asthma and the immunoprophylaxis of respiratory syncytial virus in infants.

Headlines: Autism Linked to Increased Hip Fracture Risk
Teaser: Children and adults with autism show a significantly higher risk for hip fracture. The findings add to previous evidence showing the disorder is associated with reduced bone mineral density.

Headlines: Bad News, Good News for Fibromyalgia Drug
Teaser: A new sublingual drug that targets nonrestorative sleep failed to lessen daily pain in fibromyalgia patients but did improve sleep quality and lessen overall symptomatic burden.

Headlines: Acupuncture Falls Short in Chronic Knee Pain
Teaser: Acupuncture did not significantly improve pain and function better than sham acupuncture in chronic knee pain; both modalities were modestly better than no acupuncture in the short term.

Headlines: FDA Okays Methylnaltrexone (Relistor) for Opioid Constipation
Teaser: The makers of Relistor announced approval of an expanded indication for this previously approved drug in treatment of opioid-induced constipation.

Headlines: Peripheral Neuropathy Treatment Taps Into Quantum Theory
Teaser: Peripheral Neuropathy Treatment Taps Into Quantum Theory

Headlines: Tonix Pharma's Pain Drug Fails Mid-Stage Study
Teaser: Tonix Pharmaceuticals Holding Corp said its lead pain drug failed the main goal of a mid-stage study.

Headlines: Spinal-Cord Stimulation 'Last Resort' for Diabetic Nerve Pain
Teaser: Implanted neurostimulation system produced pain relief in 59% of patients with severe refractory lower-limb pain, but the modality carries risk.

Headlines: New AAN Position Statement on Opioids for Noncancer Pain
Teaser: In a new position paper, the American Academy of Neurology responds to an urgent public health problem, suggesting that for many pain conditions the risks likely outweigh the benefits.

Headlines: Musculoskeletal Pain Relief With Stem Cell Injections
Teaser: The evidence is still very preliminary, but clinicians report some success with bone marrow and adipose-derived stem cell injections for chronic musculoskeletal pain.

Headlines: Afatinib Shows Modest Benefit in Head and Neck Cancer
Teaser: Afatinib, already approved for lung cancer, showed an improvement in progression-free, but not overall, survival, in head and neck cancer.

Headlines: CHMP Backs Naloxegol (Moventig) in Opioid-Induced Constipation
Teaser: On the heels of its US approval, European regulators have recommended approval of naloxegol for opioid-induced constipation in adults who fail laxatives.

Headlines: Laquinimod in MS: Latest Safety Data 'Reassuring'
Teaser: The latest pooled data from the extension phases of the major phase 3 studies show no new adverse effects and no signal of any type of cancer.

Headlines: Remission of One Addiction Linked to Lower Risk for Another
Teaser: A large study shows that patients with substance use disorder who manage to quit their addiction do not go on to become addicted to another substance.

Headlines: Stepwise Stages Critical When Tapering Pain Meds
Teaser: Go slow, give encouragement, and consider the substantial neuroplastic changes that occur as patients break free from a pain management regimen based solely on medication, a new withdrawal approach suggests.

Headlines: Adalimumab (Humira) Gets FDA Nod for Children With Crohn's
Teaser: Adalimumab is indicated for children aged 6 years and older with Crohn's disease that is inadequately controlled with conventional therapy.

Headlines: Emory Anesthesiologists Offer Insight on Bracing for Ebola
Teaser: Anesthesiologists at Emory University Hospital trained a core group of providers and changed how they did certain things.

Headlines: Chronic Pain Malpractice Claims on the Rise
Teaser: More claims are now associated with chronic pain management, especially for certain procedures, such as cervical neuraxial injections, device implantations, and opioid prescriptions.

Headlines: Synthetic Marijuana Emergency Visits More Than Double
Teaser: The number of ED visits involving synthetic marijuana products has risen exponentially.

Headlines: Breathing and Awakening Trials Cut Ventilator Complications
Teaser: For patients in intensive care, ventilator-associated events can be avoided with spontaneous awakening and breathing trials, say researchers.

Headlines: Broccoli Extract May Improve Autism Symptoms
Teaser: A compound found in broccoli sprouts may improve core symptoms of autism, including social interaction, communication skills, irritability, and hyperactivity.

Headlines: Early Epidural Analgesia Does Not Up Cesarean Delivery Risk
Teaser: Early initiation of epidural analgesia did not increase the risk for cesarean delivery, instrumental birth, or low Apgar scores, according to a meta-analysis studying the timing of epidural analgesia.

Headlines: Don't Blame Epidural Analgesia for Inpatient Falls
Teaser: Inpatient accidents and falls have doubled in a 4-year period, according to an analysis of a national database, but epidural analgesia is not an independent cause.

Headlines: New Overuse Injury Identified in Young Baseball Pitchers
Teaser: Young baseball players who threw more than 100 pitches per week ran the risk for a newly identified injury, acromial apophysiolysis, according to a new study.

Headlines: Psoriatic Arthritis: HLA Genotype Tracks With Severity
Teaser: Specific HLA allele combinations predicted severe or mild psoriatic arthritis.

Headlines: Extreme PTSD Responds to Stellate Ganglion Block
Teaser: Veterans with severe post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD) were reportedly helped by stellate ganglion block, which also eased symptoms of depression.

Headlines: Intravenous Ibuprofen Reduces Childhood Fever
Teaser: Previously untested in pediatric populations, an IV formulation of ibuprofen could be an effective alternative for children who can't take oral medication.

Headlines: Conference to Headline 'Remarkable Success' in GI Medicine
Teaser: Innovations in the treatment of hepatitis C will be highlighted at the meeting.

Headlines: Diabetic Neuropathy Pain: Mirogabalin Promising in Pilot Study
Teaser: The first serious look at mirogabalin by "top notch" investigators offers food for thought in the treatment of painful peripheral diabetic neuropathy.

Headlines: Sleep Linked to Disability and Depression in Osteoarthritis
Teaser: Patients with trouble sleeping had greater disability and depression at follow-up, independent of pain.

Headlines: Surgeons Face Challenges in Trying to Limit Ebola 'Collateral Damage'
Teaser: 'Ebola collateral damage' is a term coined by Dr. Thaim B. Kamara, the Chief of Surgery at Connaught Hospital in Freetown, Sierra Leone. He defines it as the disruption of routine patient care by Ebola.

Headlines: NSAIDs May Boost Risk of Venous Thromboembolism
Teaser: Pooled data from observational studies show a significantly increased risk of venous thromboembolism (VTE) among NSAID users versus nonusers, according to U.S. and Thai researchers.

Headlines: The Weaker Sex: Men With Osteoporosis Are Neglected
Teaser: Care for men with osteoporosis is inadequate when it comes to osteoporosis, says a new report aiming to draw attention to poor diagnosis and treatment     rates in this patient population.

Headlines: Fibromyalgia: Memantine Reduced Pain in Small, Blinded Trial
Teaser: Memantine, an agent primarily used to treat patients with Parkinson's or Alzheimer's disease, may provide pain relief and improve the quality of life of patients with fibromyalgia.

Headlines: 'Medical Food' Bests Ibuprofen in Chronic Low Back Pain
Teaser: Study showed theramine, an amino acid blend, alone or combined with ibuprofen is better than ibuprofen alone in patients with chronic low back pain.

Headlines: Brain Stimulation Techniques All Target Same Network
Teaser: New research could eventually lead to noninvasive replacements for deep-brain stimulation that has become so effective in Parkinson's and other diseases.

Headlines: Half of Biopsies for Bladder Cancer Inadequate for Staging
Teaser: A study suggested that about half of biopsies for bladder cancer are inadequate for proper staging, and low-quality biopsies are linked to higher mortality.

Headlines: European OK for Olaparib in Ovarian Cancer
Teaser: The first ever PARP inhibitor is inching closer to approval, after Europe issued a positive opinion for its use in ovarian cancer

Headlines: Long-Acting Anesthetic Effect Achieved With Neosaxitoxins
Teaser: The novel site 1 sodium channel blocker, which belongs to the class of paralytic shellfish toxins, significantly prolonged time to partial and complete recovery.

Headlines: Initial Data on 'Pharma Grade' Cannabidiol in Epilepsy
Teaser: New data suggest that extracts of marijuana are effective for treatment-resistant epilepsy but may not be the 'miracle cure' some reports have suggested.

Headlines: Abortion, Guns Addressed at AAFP Congress of Delegates
Teaser: Among many hot-button issues, the AAFP Congress of Delegates voted to remove restrictions on abortion providers and to more closely align its stance on firearms with those of other medical societies.

Headlines: An Outpatient Drug Error Occurs Every 8 Minutes in Kids
Teaser: Between 2002 and 2012, the proportion of errors linked to analgesics and antihistamines rose, whereas those associated with cold medicines declined.

Headlines: Avoid Buprenorphine Detox for Prescription Opioid Addiction
Teaser: Patients with prescription opioid dependence are less likely to be abstinent with tapering of buprenorphine therapy than with ongoing maintenance, US researchers demonstrate.

Headlines: Smart Technology Helps Cancer Pts and Caregivers in Hospice
Teaser: An innovative telephone-based symptom monitoring and coaching system improved symptoms for both patients and their caregivers in a home hospice setting.

Headlines: Bariatric Surgery Linked to Intracranial Hypotension
Teaser: Weight loss or micronutrient deficiency may set the stage for spinal fluid leaks causing a unique type of headache.

Headlines: By Reducing Pain, Topical Lidocaine Improves Sexual Function
Teaser: New data suggest that the reduction in pain from self-administered topical lidocaine in postmenopausal breast cancer survivors with dyspareunia leads to better sex overall.

Headlines: California Prop. 46, Inspired by Tragedy, Pits Docs Against Lawyers
Teaser: Opponents wage costly campaign, eroding public support.

Headlines: 'Co-Rounding' Cuts Inpatient Oncology Stays, Readmissions
Teaser: In a new study, palliative care specialists and medical oncologists shared responsibility for cancer patients on a hospital floor, and good things happened.

Headlines: Debilitating Chikungunya Virus Hits the US
Teaser: The virus has spread rapidly in the Americas, causing debilitating acute disease and persistent pain. Symptoms overlap with the Dengue virus, but severe joint pain is a hallmark of Chikungunya.

Headlines: Anti-inflammatories May Help Ease Depression
Teaser: Results of a new meta-analysis provide preliminary support for using anti-inflammatories as an adjunctive treatment for depression.

Headlines: No Added Benefit of Capnography in Colonoscopy
Teaser: The device required to monitor patients for early signs of hypoxemia while sedated during colonoscopy did not detect the problem, the first randomized controlled trial evaluating the technology shows.

Headlines: FDA Approves Opioid's New Abuse Deterrent Labeling
Teaser: The FDA has approved updated labeling for the opioid analgesic Embeda, to reflect the drug's abuse-deterrent properties.

Headlines: Cure Rates Remain High With Fecal Transplant for C difficile
Teaser: High and sustained cure rates continue to be reported after fecal microbiota transplant for patients with recurrent, refractory C difficile, with a few exceptions.

Headlines: Chronic Fatigue: NIH Literature Review Faulted
Teaser: The draft document highlighted the difficulty in defining myalgic encephalomyelitis/chronic fatigue syndrome and the dearth of good data, but some critics find bigger faults with the draft itself.

Headlines: Joan Rivers' Cause of Death Revealed
Teaser: Comedian Joan Rivers, who passed away last month at the age of 81, died of a complication during a medical procedure, the New York Chief Medical Examiner's Office said.

Headlines: Implant-Related Chronic Allergic Dermatitis May Promote Skin Cancer
Teaser: Allergic contact dermatitis (ACD) associated with implantable medical devices can promote skin cancer development, according to a new case report and experimental findings.

Headlines: COX-2 Inhibitors for Rheumatological Manifestations of IBD
Teaser: The jury is out on the tolerability and safety of selective cyclooxygenase 2 (COX-2) inhibitors for treatment of rheumatological manifestations of inflammatory bowel disease (IBD), according to a new Cochrane review.

Headlines: CDC Issues Guidelines for Possible Ebola Cases in ED
Teaser: Although clinicians should completely cover their skin for confirmed cases, some skin can show when ED patients have a suspected infection, but are clinically stable, the CDC says in new guidelines.

Headlines: Emergency Physicians Aren't to Blame for Opioid Abuse
Teaser: Opioid analgesics are prescribed less often in emergency departments and at lower doses than in office-based practices, according to the results of a new study.

Headlines: New Index Identifies Risk From Joint Replacement
Teaser: A frailty index can identify the patients least likely to survive a total joint replacement, a new study has shown.

Headlines: PV-10 in Metastatic Melanoma: Rapid Responses Led to Phase 3
Teaser: The product is injected directly into cutaneous melanoma lesions, but also improves noninjected lesions by an immunologic effect.

Headlines: Lyme Carditis Can Cause Sudden Cardiac Death
Teaser: Lyme disease might be a cause of cardiac symptoms in patients living in or visiting high-incidence areas and might contribute to sudden cardiac death, the CDC has warned healthcare providers.

Headlines: ACL Reconstruction May Go Better With Pre-, Postop Rehab
Teaser: Delaying reconstruction to strengthen the joint before surgery may improve outcomes for patients who undergo ACL reconstruction.

Headlines: Ebola Fatality Rate 74% in Sierra Leone; Bleeding Is Rare
Teaser: Preexisting research capacity in a local hospital enabled investigators to analyze presentation and progression in 106 patients with Ebola.

Headlines: Prescription Opioids Involved in Most Overdoses in the ED
Teaser: Prescription opioids, including methadone, are involved in more than two thirds of opioid overdose cases seen in US emergency departments.

Headlines: Decision Support Algorithm Leads to Symptom Improvements
Teaser: Six-month trial shows improvements in quality of life and symptom management when clinicians see tailored patient information.

Headlines: Men and Women Respond Differently to Angina Symptoms
Teaser: Men and women react similarly to chest painâ€”with uncertainty, denialâ€”before deciding on seeking medical care, but women are much more likely to delay     seeking treatment.

Headlines: Implant Eliminates External Pump in Pulmonary Hypertension
Teaser: The programmable device delivers prostanoid treprostinil to patients with severe pulmonary arterial hypertension, freeing them from cumbersome medical equipment.

Headlines: Computerized Template May Improve Care for Patients With OA
Teaser: Use of a computerized point-of-care template improved OA care in the primary care setting, but inconsistencies in its use by clinicians remained, according to a new study.

Headlines: Experimental Plug Aids Recovery From Cataract Surgery
Teaser: The novel approach is a reasonable alternative to medicated eye drops, early research suggests.

Headlines: Psoriasis Severity Linked to Uncontrolled Hypertension
Teaser: Patients with psoriasis had a greater  risk for uncontrolled hypertension, with higher risks seen among patients with moderate to severe psoriasis.

Headlines: CHMP Backs Afamelanotide, First Drug to Prevent Phototoxicity
Teaser: The European Medicines Agency has recommended marketing approval of Scenesse to prevent phototoxicity in people with erythropoietic protoporphyria.

Headlines: EMA Panel Backs Duavive for Menopausal Symptoms
Teaser: The drug is a combination of conjugated estrogen with an estrogen agonist/antagonist.

Headlines: TARGET 3: Rifaximin Safe to Reuse for Irritable Bowel
Teaser: Retreatment with rifaximin is safe and effective, report TARGET investigators. And long-term use of linaclotide is well tolerated.

Headlines: Ibuprofen Better Option for Kids With Fracture
Teaser: For uncomplicated pediatric fracture, ibuprofen and morphine control pain equally, but ibuprofen causes fewer adverse effects.

Headlines: Seizure-Related Injuries Relatively Low in Children
Teaser: Study of injuries over 27 years showed that 12% of patients with epilepsy had at least one significant injury, most occurring during normal daily activities.

Headlines: Mental Health, Headache Advances Lead to 2014 WebMD Health Heroes
Teaser: WebMD's first annual Health Hero Awards Gala paid tribute to the activists, visionaries, and pioneers in healthcare, including Michael J. Fox, Harold S. Koplewicz, MD, and Frank Papay, MD.

Headlines: Arthritis Affects One Quarter of US Veterans: CDC
Teaser: A CDC analysis of survey data from 2011 to 2013 showed that 25.6% of veterans had arthritis, with higher prevalence among veterans than nonveterans across most sociodemographic categories.

Headlines: Top 10 Most Prescribed Generic Drugs Through September
Teaser: The pain medication hydrocodone/acetaminophen was the most prescribed generic drug for the 12 months ending September 30, 2014, followed by the blood pressure drug lisinopril, according to a new report.

Headlines: Ramucirumab/Paclitaxel Combo Approved for Gastric Cancer
Teaser: The new antiangiogenesis agent ramucirumab (Cyramza) is now approved for use in combination with paclitaxel in advanced or metastatic gastric cancer.

Headlines: Marijuana for Pediatric Seizures?
Teaser: As new studies get under way, child neurologists hope to provide children with epilepsy and their anxious parents more solid information about who might benefit from medical marijuana.

Headlines: COX-2 Inhibitors Linked to Stroke Mortality
Teaser: New data show the previously reported increased risk for cardiovascular events with these pain meds includes increased stroke death; risk was driven by older drugs, such as etodolac and diclofenac.

Headlines: Ultrasound Accelerates Skin Graft Healing
Teaser: Noncontact low-frequency ultrasound helps heal split-thickness skin grafts and reduces pain and itching, according to a new study.

Headlines: Voters Reject Doc Drug Tests, Medical Marijuana in State Races
Teaser: Ballot measures supported by abortion opponents failed in two states but passed in a third in yesterday's midterm election.

Headlines: Surgery Cheaper Than Antibiotics for Appendicitis
Teaser: Surgery is a more cost-effective treatment for acute appendicitis than antibiotics, a controversial new study has shown.

Headlines: Push in Emergency Medicine to Cut Back on Unnecessary CT
Teaser: The American College of Emergency Physicians held off on joining the national Choosing Wisely campaign to reduce inappropriate tests and treatment, but is now making recommendations.

Headlines: Postop Radiation Improves Prognosis in Later-Stage NSCLC
Teaser: Postoperative radiation therapy, as used in a modern radiation setting, improves overall survival beyond any benefit gained with chemotherapy alone.

Headlines: Intragastric Dual Balloon Induces Weight Loss in US Trial
Teaser: Could a balloon device placed endoscopically and filled with saline bridge the gap between conventional weight-loss with drugs/behavioral programs and     surgery?

Headlines: New WHO Guidelines Recommend Expanded Access to Naloxone
Teaser: New guidelines recommending expanded access to the drug naloxone to reduce the number of opioid-related deaths globally have been released by the World Health Organization.

Headlines: Legal Marijuana Gets Major Test in OR, AK, and DC Ballots
Teaser: In a test for broader marijuana legalization efforts across the United States, voters in the U.S. capital and two West Coast states were casting ballots during national midterm elections on Tuesday to decide whether to legalize cannabis.

Headlines: Second-Look Endoscopy and Post-endoscopic Submucosal Dissection Bleeding
Teaser: Second-look endoscopy (SLE) after gastric endoscopic submucosal dissection (ESD) may not help prevent bleeding, new research from Japan suggests.

Headlines: Lyme Misdiagnosis Can Divert Patients From Correct Treatment
Teaser: In three cases  Lyme misdiagnosis led to delayed diagnosis and treatment for cancers.

Headlines: Recurrent Kidney Stones: ACP Issues New Guidelines
Teaser: New evidence-based guidelines from the American College of Physicians for recurrent kidney stone prevention include dietary recommendations such as increased fluid intake.

Headlines: Rheumatoid Arthritis: TNF Inhibitors Linked to Less Fatigue
Teaser: Patients with rheumatoid arthritis report substantial improvement of fatigue after beginning anti-tumor necrosis factor alpha therapy.

Headlines: Up in Smoke: Waterpipe Tobacco Not a Safer Alternative
Teaser: Waterpipe tobacco smoking, an 'insidious,' rapidly growing alternative form of tobacco use, appears to be strongly associated with the nonmedical use of prescription drugs in youth.

Headlines: PTSD Common in Patients With Intraoperative Awareness
Teaser: About 15% of surgical patients in a new study developed post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD); this rate was 3 times higher in patients who were aware of what was going on during their procedure.

Headlines: School EpiPen Stocks Save Lives in First-Time Anaphylaxis
Teaser: A policy in Chicago Public Schools of stocking spare epinephrine autoinjectors resulted in 38 emergency doses being administered in a 1-year period.

Headlines: NSAIDs Raise Bleeding, Thromboembolic Risk in Treated AF
Teaser: Even short-term use of nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs may increase the bleeding and thromboembolic risk in patients with atrial fibrillation receiving antithrombotic treatment.

Headlines: Cyber Dating Abuse Common Among Teens
Teaser: Cyber dating abuse, the use of technology to harass a dating partner, is a common and growing problem among teens that is linked to other types of physical, sexual, and psychological abuse.

Headlines: ODYSSEY ALTERNATIVE: PCSK9 Inhibitor for Statin Intolerance
Teaser: Many patients in the small trial who had been "statin-intolerant" managed to stay on low-dose atorvastatin; for those who can't, alirocumab could prove to     be a good alternative, it suggested.

Headlines: Smoking May Increase Risk for Dysmenorrhea
Teaser: Young women who start smoking early have a substantially increased risk for dysmenorrhea compared with nonsmokers.

Headlines: Empathy Can Fuel Aggression
Teaser: Empathy can fuel aggression, say US scientists who found that oxytocin and vasopressin mediate the link between the two emotions.

Headlines: Lower-Dose Diclofenac Improves Pain in Osteoarthritis
Teaser: A new formulation of diclofenac, created with fine-particle technology, reduces osteoarthritis-related pain and improves physical functioning at lower drug doses.

Headlines: FDA Approves First Customized Spinal Rod
Teaser: The new product eliminates the need to manually contour a rod during surgery by providing surgeons with a precisely aligned rod before the procedure.

Headlines: Care Bundle Reduced Mortality After Emergency Laparotomy
Teaser: Mortality fell by more than a third after implementation of the quality improvement bundle.

Headlines: Recreational Runners Don't Need to Fear Knee Osteoarthritis
Teaser: Recreational running at any stage in life does not increase the risk of developing knee osteoarthritis, a cross-sectional study has shown.

Headlines: FDA Approval for Alemtuzumab (Lemtrada) in MS
Teaser: Alemtuzumab (Lemtrada) has received long-awaited FDA approval in relapsing multiple sclerosis.

Headlines: Prices Soar for Off-Patent Drugs as Competition Thins
Teaser: Short of proof of anticompetitive practices by drug makers, however, the Federal Trade Commission cannot intervene.

Headlines: Keratitis From Poor Contact Lens Care a Huge Burden in US
Teaser: Eye infections, often resulting from improper contact lens storage and wear, are highly common and costly in the United States, affecting almost 1 million people a year, the CDC says.

Headlines: Ebola: Aggressive Hydration Key to Effective Treatment in US
Teaser: Two patients with EVD were transferred from Liberia to the United States for care; aggressive hydration and electrolyte correction coincided with clinical improvement and reduction in viral load.

Headlines: No Clear Winner for Relief of Diabetic Neuropathy Pain
Teaser: Which is the best drug for painful diabetic neuropathy? A new systematic review has generated some interesting observations.

Headlines: YouTube a 'Poor Source' of Asthma Info for Teens
Teaser: The best quality asthma videos don't make it to the average teen's most-watched list, say researchers, who want to develop new options for young people.

Headlines: ACE Inhibitors to Prevent ALS?
Teaser: In a new case-control study, ACE inhibitors, commonly used antihypertensive drugs, were associated with a significant reduction in the risk for amyotrophic lateral sclerosis.

Headlines: Early Marijuana Use: A More Harmful Impact on Brain Structure
Teaser: Age at first marijuana use and duration of use have been linked to alterations in brain structure.

Headlines: Better Outcomes With Local Anesthesia for Stroke Treatments
Teaser: Local beats general anesthesia in terms of functional outcomes for endovascular procedures to treat acute ischemic stroke, a retrospective study shows.

Headlines: Prescribe Naloxone and Save Lives: An Alert for Maryland Clinicians
Teaser: The Department of Health and Mental Hygiene is encouraging healthcare providers to write prescriptions for naloxone to all patients who are at risk for opioid overdose.

Headlines: CDC: Advise Hetero Men, Boys, on HIV Benefit of Circumcision
Teaser: Proposed guidance for clinicians states that the procedure evidently reduces the risk for HIV infection in heterosexual males, but not for men having sex with men.

Headlines: New Approach Reduces Pain of Mammogram
Teaser: A relatively small upgrade to the mammography compression paddle can decrease the pain some women experience without compromising image quality.

Headlines: Management and Transport of Persons Under Investigation (PUIs) for Ebola Virus Disease (EVD): Alert for Utah Clinicians
Teaser: Utah public health has worked with many partners to develop this plan for initial management of persons under investigation on site and rapid transfer of them to locations where they can get a higher level of care if needed.

Headlines: Celiac Disease Showing Up in Many Forms and at All Ages
Teaser: A classical set of celiac disease symptoms no longer reflects the profile of most newly-diagnosed patients, according to a new study from Italy.

Headlines: FDA Panel Warns Against Certain Back Pain Injections
Teaser: Because of possibly catastrophic neurological risks, an FDA committee has recommended contraindication of particulate corticosteroid injections in the cervical spine, using a transforaminal approach.

Headlines: Herpes Vaccine Safe in Patients With Arthritis on Biologics
Teaser: Patients with autoimmune and inflammatory diseases are more prone to getting herpes zoster than the general population, but these patients can be safely vaccinated, a new study has suggested.

Headlines: One IV Dose of Zoledronate Good for 6 Years in Paget's Disease
Teaser: The US Endocrine Society has issued its first ever guidance on the treatment of Paget's disease of the bone, recommending a one-off intravenous infusion of a bisphosphonate as the treatment of choice.

Headlines: Depression, Pain More Common in Dry Eye Than Tear Film Flaw
Teaser: Symptoms of dry eye are more closely aligned with nonocular pain and mental health problems than tear parameters, report researchers.

Headlines: MRIs May Be Too Painful With Cochlear Implants
Teaser: Magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) may displace the magnets of cochlear implants or cause extreme discomfort for some wearers, according to a new study.

Headlines: Hyperbaric Oxygen No Better Than Sham After Concussion
Teaser: A study of military service members has shown that both hyperbaric oxygen and sham air compression improved postconcussion symptoms, possibly because of a strong placebo effect.

Headlines: Another Step Forward for Migraine Biomarker
Teaser: A new study has found that levels of adiponectin, an adipose cytokine, are higher in older people with migraine, particularly men.

Headlines: Young Climbers Injured as Often as Kids in Other Sports
Teaser: Rock-climbing teens suffer about as many injuries as young ice hockey or soccer players, most often straining or spraining their hands and fingers and developing tendonitis, says a new study from Canada.

Headlines: Nonsteroidal Anti-Inflammatory Eyedrops and Cystic Macular Edema
Teaser: The nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory eyedrops ketorolac and nepafenac do not prevent cystoid macular edema after phacoemulsification, researchers from Brazil report.

Headlines: Improving Care: New UK Guidance
Teaser: Guidance for UK general practitioners on identifying and referring patients suspected of having cancer has been updated for latest draft consultation.

Headlines: Postoperative Delirium Guideline for Older Adults Issued
Teaser: The American Geriatrics Society recommendations cover both what to do and what not to do to prevent and treat delirium in postoperative patients.

Headlines: CKD: Exercise May Improve Pain, Physical Function
Teaser: Patients with  chronic kidney disease improved on fitness tests and quality-of-life measures after  completing a 12-week exercise program.

Headlines: Symptoms of Chikungunya Virus Mimic Rheumatoid Arthritis
Teaser: Chikungunya virus is often accompanied by joint pain that can persist for months or years and has a serum cytokine profile similar to that of patients with seronegative rheumatoid arthritis.

Headlines: FDA Clears Hydrocodone With Abuse-Deterrent Properties
Teaser: The physical and chemical properties of single-entity Hysingla ER (Purdue Pharma) are expected to make abuse difficult, the FDA says.

Headlines: False Allergy Reports Prompt Needless Penicillin Substitutes
Teaser: Testing patients with a history of penicillin allergy can reduce the unnecessary use of alternative medications, say researchers.

Headlines: Bleeding Risk Highest in Kidney Disease When Warfarin Starts
Teaser: Patients with chronic kidney disease experience the greatest risk for major bleeding in the first 30 days after starting warfarin.

Headlines: ASH Unveils Second Choosing Wisely List
Teaser: As part of the Choosing Wisely initiative, the American Society of Hematology (ASH) has released five more tests and treatments that should be questioned.

Headlines: Medical Marijuana May Worsen PTSD Symptoms, Increase Violence
Teaser: Rather than improving symptoms of PTSD, medical marijuana may actually increase symptom severity as well as violent behavior.

Headlines: Gout Attacks Twice as Likely at Night
Teaser: Nocturnal acute gout attacks were 2.36 times more common than daytime attacks, and researchers recommended timing preventive drug therapy accordingly.

Headlines: Opioid Prescriber Monitoring May Increase Overdose Deaths
Teaser: Opioid prescriber surveillance may actually be linked to more overdoses by patients because of prescriber fears of sanctions.

Headlines: Healing Tunes: What Surgeons Should and Shouldn't Play at Work
Teaser: Almost three quarters of surgeons' operating theaters are thronging, or throbbing, with music when patients go under the knife, according to study in the December 10 Christmas edition of the British Medical Journal (BMJ).

Headlines: California Supreme Court to Review Malpractice Cap Law Again
Teaser: Voters there just rejected a ballot proposition that would have raised the limit on noneconomic damages from $250,000 to $1.1 million.

Headlines: Pain Med Linked to Hypoglycemia
Teaser: Tramadol, an opioid analgesic, was associated with an increased risk for hospitalization for hypoglycemia, especially in the first month of use, in a new study.

Headlines: Risks Exceed CV, Cancer Gains from Primary-Prevention ASA: WHS
Teaser: Doubts about such aspirin therapy were for healthy middle-aged women overall, but aspirin may be warranted in at least one subgroup, suggests an analysis based on the randomized Women's Health Study.

Headlines: Remote Islet-Cell Isolation 'Feasible' After Pancreatectomy
Teaser: Isolating pancreatic islet cells from patients undergoing pancreatectomy at a location remote from the surgery and returning them for autotransplant is     feasible, a small study indicates.

Headlines: Cancer Diagnosis Delays 'Not Due to Poor Clinical Care'
Teaser: Delays in diagnosing patients with suspected cancer may reflect diagnostic difficulties and the heterogeneity of cancer, not just poor clinical performance.

Headlines: New Deadly Class of Synthetic Hallucinogens Mimics LSD
Teaser: NBOMe, a novel class of synthetic hallucinogens, which is being sold as a cheaper and more readily available substitute for LSD, is emerging as a particularly lethal drug.

Headlines: Several Treatment Options May Improve Nail Psoriasis
Teaser: Treatment of nail psoriasis poses a clinical challenge and may ultimately require more than one approach, according to new best practice recommendations.

Headlines: AstraZeneca, Nektar Constipation Drug Wins European Approval
Teaser: AstraZeneca's new drug for the treatment of opioid-induced constipation, which was developed with Nektar Therapeutics, has been approved in the European Union.

Headlines: Anxiolytics, Sleep Meds Boost Abuse Risk in Teens
Teaser: Adolescents prescribed anxiolytics or sleep medications are substantially more likely to misuse these medications for either sensation-seeking or self-treating reasons.

Headlines: Morcellation: Even With Benign Disease, Problems May Follow
Teaser: Case reports from Johns Hopkins have suggested that even with benign disease, morcellation may necessitate more extensive surgery later.

Headlines: Ebola Patient's ED Doc Calls Care 'Appropriate' Based on Data
Teaser: Joseph Meier, MD, also said he didn't notice a temperature of 103 degrees in Ebola victim Thomas Eric Duncan's digital chart during his first trip to a Dallas ED, according to the Dallas Morning News.

Headlines: Pain Conditions, Meds Prevalent in Epilepsy Patients
Teaser: A new study finds that pain conditions and use of opioids are higher than in the general population and raises the question of whether people with epilepsy are more sensitive to pain.

Headlines: What's Hot at American Epilepsy Society 2014
Teaser: Medical marijuana, SUDEP, and generic equivalents and are just some of the topics neurologists and others are expected to discuss at the American Epilepsy Society annual meeting.

Headlines: FDA Okays Injectable Stimulation Device for Back, Leg Pain
Teaser: The FDA has approved an injectable microchip neuromodulation device for relief of chronic back and leg pain.

Headlines: Marijuana Smoke as Damaging to Arteries as Tobacco Smoke
Teaser: It's the smoke from weed, not the THC in weed, suggests a small animal study set up to show that a marijuana effect on endothelial function wasn't caused     by its main psychoactive ingredient.

Headlines: Childhood Emotional Abuse Linked to Adult Migraine
Teaser: Researchers suggest clinicians treating migraine introduce a validated questionnaire into their practice to help identify abuse.

Headlines: Questions About Safety of Outpatient Surgery Centers
Teaser: Wendy Salo was alarmed when she learned where her doctor had scheduled her gynecologic operation: at an outpatient surgery center.

Headlines: AAN: Still Too Early to Green-Light Medical Marijuana
Teaser: American Academy of Neurology wants to see more research on benefits and safety but calls for loosening of access to medical marijuana products for research purposes.

Headlines: Cessation Program Works for Smokers With SUD, Mental Illness
Teaser: Stage-tailored interventions can successfully help long-term smokers with co-occurring psychiatric and substance use disorders quit - despite 'squeamishness' from the field, researchers find.

Headlines: PsA: TNF Inhibitors May Reduce Disease Activity Long-term
Teaser: More than two thirds of patients with psoriatic arthritis who were receiving tumor necrosis factor alpha blockers  achieved a state of minimal disease activity in a recent study.

Headlines: Physician Receives Long Prison Sentence in Overdose Deaths
Teaser: In his sideline pain management practice, anesthesiologist Stan Li, MD, prescribed to as many as 100 patients a day, ignoring signs of addiction, abuse, overdoses, and drug trafficking, prosecutors said.

Headlines: Two Prostate Cancer Tests 'Not Clinically Useful,' Says NICE
Teaser: The UK healthcare watchdog says that two prostate cancer tests for use in inconclusive cases do not improve diagnosis enough to justify use in clinical practice.

Headlines: Feds Can No Longer Raid State Medical Marijuana Dispensaries
Teaser: A provision tucked into the $1.1 trillion appropriations law for 2015 prohibits spending federal funds on anything that will keep states from implementing their own laws that legalize medical marijuana.

Headlines: Fantastic Voyage: Tiny Sensors May Soon Monitor Seniors' Medicines From Inside
Teaser: Tiny sensors may help patients better monitor their medication compliance.

Headlines: First-Ever Stem Cell Therapy Recommended in EU
Teaser: Stem cell treatment for a severe eye condition has been given special regulatory consideration, but marketing would be conditional.

Headlines: FDA Approves Olaparib (Lynparza) for BRCA Ovarian Cancer
Teaser: The approval follows a resubmission of new data after an advisory committee recommended against approval earlier this year.

Headlines: Five Dead, Dozens Sickened by Listeria Linked to Caramel Apples
Teaser: Five people have died and 21 others have been hospitalized in recent weeks in a listeria outbreak linked to caramel apples, health officials said on Friday.

Headlines: NSAIDs May Protect Against Common Skin Cancer
Teaser: Nonaspirin NSAIDs reduced the risk of developing squamous cell carcinoma by 15%, and all NSAIDs reduced risk by 18%, according to a meta-analysis.

Headlines: Pharmacists Charged With Murder in Fungal Meningitis Outbreak
Teaser: Federal prosecutors have accused them of recklessly distributing steroid pain medicine while knowing it was made in an unsafe manner at the notorious New England Compounding Center.

Headlines: Nitrous Oxide Explored for Resistant Depression
Teaser: A new proof-of-concept study suggests 'laughing gas' improves depression even after the drug's sedative effects wear off.

Headlines: Insomnia in Cancer Patients: CBT-I Is a Mainstay
Teaser: A study in cancer survivors found that adding a wakefulness-promoting drug did not improve on cognitive behavior therapy for insomnia (CBT-I) alone.

Headlines: Indoor Tanning Can Lead to Burns, Fainting, Eye Injuries
Teaser: Indoor tanning can send people to the emergency room for burns, eye injuries and fainting, according to U.S. health officials.

Headlines: Teen Drinking, Drug Use Down; e-Cigarette Use a Concern
Teaser: Smoking prevention efforts appear to be having an effect, with more US teenagers turning away from drugs and alcohol.

Headlines: Cannabis-Related ED Visits Rise in States With Legalized Use
Teaser: Cannabis-related emergency department visits increased significantly between 2007 and 2012 in states that have legalized marijuana for recreational and/or medical use.

Headlines: Brace May Not Be Needed for Spinal Compression Fractures
Teaser: Among those with compression fractures, outcomes of disability, back pain, and progression of anterior body compression were similar among those treated without a brace or with soft or rigid braces.

Headlines: Tapentadol Toxicity in Children
Teaser: Most pediatric patients exposed to this novel analgesic (Nucynta) had no major effects, but there were 2 cases with life-threatening events, poison center reports show.

Headlines: Meniscal Lesions May Help ID Patients With Severe Knee OA
Teaser: Magnetic resonance imaging diagnosis of meniscal lesions and neuropathic pain may redirect physicians to personalized targeting of therapy.

Headlines: Oscar Wildeâ€™s Wife, Constance, May Have Had MS
Teaser: New documents suggest that Constance Wilde, wife of the colorful playwright Oscar Wilde, may have had multiple sclerosis.

Headlines: FDA Approves Novel Implanted Device for Treating Obesity
Teaser: The VBLOC vagal blocking therapy delivered via the Maestro System is expected to be available this year through selected bariatric surgery centers.

Headlines: Exercise Has Benefits in Parkinson's Disease
Teaser: Exercise can improve balance, mobility, fear of falling, and quality of life in patients with PD, and it's best to start sooner rather than later, new research shows.

Headlines: Scant Evidence for Long-Term Opioid Therapy in Chronic Pain
Teaser: A new review found insufficient evidence that long-term opioid therapy improves chronic pain outcomes, but data showed that serious opioid-related harms, such as overdose, are apparently dose dependent.

Headlines: Expert Panel Final Report on Opioids in Chronic Pain
Teaser: An independent expert panel convened by NIH has published a final report identifying knowledge gaps and calling for more research into various aspects of chronic pain management and long-term opioid use.

Headlines: Acceptance of HF Linked With Better Quality of Life, Study Shows
Teaser: Knowing whether or not a patient has come to terms with their heart failure might be a clinically useful measurement for improving quality-of-life metrics,     say researchers.

Headlines: FDA Urges Continued Caution for Pain Meds in Pregnancy
Teaser: The FDA has reviewed the safety of prescription and over-the-counter pain medicines during pregnancy but has found inadequate information to revise current recommendations.

Headlines: Rural Doctor Launches Startup to Ease Pain of Dying Patients
Teaser: Dr. Michael Fratkin travels by plane to rural California to take care of dying patients.

Headlines: Hysterectomy Overused for Benign Conditions
Teaser: Alternatives to hysterectomy are underused in women with abnormal uterine bleeding and other benign conditions, with 18.3% having unsupportive pathology at hysterectomy.

Headlines: Reader Poll: Is Cancer the Best Way to Die?
Teaser: A physician says the best death is from cancer â€” "achievable with love, morphine, and whisky."

Headlines: Knee Osteoarthritis: Acetaminophen Least Effective Choice
Teaser: A meta-analysis of treatments for knee osteoarthritis supported intraarticular injections and found acetaminophen to be the least effective treatment option.

Headlines: Stricter Controls Needed After Surge in Marijuana Ills: U.S. Anti-Pot Group
Teaser: The number of children treated annually for accidental pot consumption in Colorado has reached double-digits and a drug treatment chain has seen a surge of teens treated for cannabis abuse, a leading U.S. anti-marijuana group said on Monday.

Headlines: Maternal Depression Linked to Risky Behavior in Kids
Teaser: Children of mothers with depression are at significantly increased risk of engaging in delinquent behaviors and substance abuse in adolescence.

Headlines: Fentanyl-Laced Heroin Deaths on the Rise Once Again
Teaser: The deadly practice of lacing heroin with fentanyl appears to be on the rise again, with nearly 60 people in Philadelphia dying from fentanyl overdoses in the first half of 2014.

Headlines: Arthritis: Self-directed Exercise Program Shows Benefits
Teaser: A new study has shown that a self-directed exercise program can improve the symptoms of arthritis.

Headlines: Who's Better at Telling Operating Time?
Teaser: Orthopedic surgeons are best, and anesthetists worst, at predicting operating theater time, according to orthopedic surgeons from New Zealand.

Headlines: FDA Expands Use of Ivacaftor (Kalydeco) for Cystic Fibrosis
Teaser: The agency has approved the CFTR potentiator for use in children aged 6 years and older with cystic fibrosis who have the R117H mutation.

Headlines: FDA Okays Diclofenac Injection (Dyloject) for Pain
Teaser: The injectable version of diclofenac is indicated for management of mild to moderate pain, and for moderate to severe pain alone and in combination with opioids.

Headlines: Plan Fails to Cut Ventilator Use in Critically Ill Children
Teaser: Although a sedation protocol resulted in some improvements, the primary outcome of reduced time on mechanical ventilation was not met in a large multicenter trial.

Headlines: 'Strongest Evidence Yet' Links Anticholinergic Drugs, Dementia
Teaser: A new study shows a strong link between commonly used anticholinergic drugs and later dementia, with even sporadic use linked to cumulative risk.

Headlines: Morphine Unsafe for Some Children After Tonsillectomy
Teaser: Ibuprofen in combination with acetaminophen is safe and  effective analgesia for children after tonsillectomy.

Headlines: FDA Clears First Generic Esomeprazole for GERD
Teaser: Ivax Pharmaceuticals, Inc, a subsidiary of Teva Pharmaceuticals USA, will market esomeprazole in 20- and 40-mg capsules.

Headlines: Headache-Related Imaging, Referrals Almost Doubled
Teaser: Contrary to guidelines, orders for imaging tests increased significantly over a 10-year period while counseling about lifestyle modifications, such as diet and exercise, has dropped, a new review finds.

Headlines: FDA Okays Senza Spinal Cord Stimulation System for Pain
Teaser: Nevro Corp has received an 'approvable' letter from the FDA for neurostimulation system for treatment of chronic pain.

Headlines: 'No Legal Marijuana,' Pediatricians Say
Teaser: A policy statement from the American Academy of Pediatrics warns of harms to child and adolescent health.

Headlines: Heavy Soccer Playing Before Age 12 Tied to Later Hip Deformities
Teaser: In a study of Dutch professional footballers, a bone deformity at the hip was much more common among men who started playing the sport at least four times a week before age twelve.

Headlines: Hospitals Win Quality Bonuses, But Most Will Never Collect
Teaser: Medicare is giving bonuses to a majority of hospitals that it graded on quality, but many of those rewards will be wiped out by penalties the government has issued for other shortcomings.

Headlines: CDC Urges Caution on Opioid Prescribing in Young Women
Teaser: A new report shows widespread use of opioids among women of childbearing age, which federal officials are calling a public health concern because of the risk for birth defects.

Headlines: ASCO: 'High-Risk' Project 'Must Be Done'
Teaser: The organization has been claiming that CancerLinQ will revolutionize cancer care for months. Now they have a technology partner to help them.

Headlines: Prescription Opioid Abuse Waning
Teaser: After increasing substantially for 8 years, abuse of opioid analgesics in the US appears to have plateaued and even decreased slightly between 2011 and 2013.

Headlines: Postop NSAID Use May Increase Risk for Anastomotic Leak
Teaser: Among patients undergoing nonelective colorectal surgery, use of postoperative NSAIDs may increase the risk for anastomotic complications, according to a new study.

Headlines: Tailored Sedation Fails to Cut Ventilator Time in Children
Teaser: An individualized sedation protocol didn't lead to shorter time on mechanical ventilation in children with acute respiratory failure enrolled in a cluster randomized trial.

Headlines: New AHS Review of Acute Migraine Treatments
Teaser: The assessment, which will form the basis of new US clinical practice guidelines, represents the first update to treatment recommendations in 15 years.

Headlines: Thyroid Disease: 10 Questions Patients Should Ask
Teaser: Thyroid patients should be asking 10 questions of their physicians and pharmacists to help them better understand their condition and its treatment, says     the American College of Endocrinology.

Headlines: Addressing Fear of Exercise Cuts Chronic Fatigueâ€¦Perhaps
Teaser: New data from a controversial study on chronic fatigue syndrome suggest that overcoming fear of exercise improves outcomes, but experts fault the original study's patient selection criteria.

Headlines: Pain With Sexual Intercourse Linked to Mode of Delivery
Teaser: Obstetric intervention has been linked to persistent postpartum dyspareunia, or pain during or after sexual intercourse, according to a prospective cohort study.

Headlines: Obama Pushes Genomic Research in State of Union Speech
Teaser: "I want the country that eliminated polio and mapped the human genome to lead a new era of medicineâ€Š," the president said.

Headlines: Clinical Cancer Advances in 2014: CLL Is the Winner
Teaser: This year in its annual review of clinical cancer advances, the American Society of Clinical Oncology has, for the first time, announced a winner.

Headlines: Fibromyalgia Prevalence Varies Widely by Diagnostic Criteria
Teaser: The prevalence of fibromyalgia varied by as much as fourfold, depending on which of three American College of Rheumatology diagnostic criteria sets was used.

Headlines: Cognitive Behavioral Therapy Improves Sleep, Pain in Knee OA
Teaser: A new study has found that cognitive behavior therapy helped improve the sleep patterns of patients with knee osteoarthritis and may help attenuate arthritis-related pain.

Headlines: Time and Activity Linked to Back Pain Risk
Teaser: Factors that can trigger pain in the lower back include working in awkward positions, being distracted, and being physically or mentally tired, a new study shows.

Headlines: More Americans Using Yoga, Fish Oil, Probiotics for Health
Teaser: A new National Institutes of Health survey showed that herbal supplements are still the most popular complementary therapy, but that yoga practice has doubled.

Headlines: IOM Gives Chronic Fatigue Syndrome a New Name and Definition
Teaser: In a report, the Institute of Medicine defines 'systemic exertion intolerance disease' and calls on physicians to make the diagnosis based on the new criteria.

Headlines: Fibromyalgia Imaging Study Shows Unique Brain Connectivity
Teaser: An fMRI study shows connectivity between the somatosensory cortex and the anterior insula, the region that assigns salience to stimuli.

Headlines: Squeezing a Stress Ball and Other Distractions Reduce Patients' Anxiety During Surgery
Teaser: Squeezing a stress ball, talking to a nurse or watching DVDs can distract patients enough to relieve their anxiety during surgery, a new study from the UK has found.

Headlines: Hypnotherapy, Cognitive Therapy Help Pediatric Abdominal Pain
Teaser: Fiber supplementation did not show a marked benefit in improving symptoms of pediatric abdominal pain-related functional gastrointestinal disorders in a systematic review.

Headlines: Common Gynecologic Issues Linked to Chronic Fatigue Syndrome
Teaser: Menstrual abnormalities, endometriosis, pelvic pain, hysterectomy, and early/surgical menopause have been associated with chronic fatigue syndrome, but experts caution against assuming causality.

Headlines: Dogs Give Love, Improve Outcomes in Cancer Study
Teaser: Man's best friend is a friend even in the worst of times.

Headlines: Do Psychedelics Prevent Suicide?
Teaser: Psychedelic drugs, including LSD, may help prevent suicidality, adding support to the view that their restricted status should be changed to facilitate research into their therapeutic potential.

Headlines: End-of-Life Picture Grows Bleaker
Teaser: Pain, depression, and confusion have become more prevalent in end-of-life care, concludes a 1998 to 2010 survey of dying patients and their families.

Headlines: No Good Evidence Pharmacological Interventions Relieve Achilles Tendinopathy
Teaser: There is no convincing evidence that any of the pharmacological interventions for Achilles tendinopathy work, according to a systematic review.

Headlines: FDA Okays Abuse-Deterrent Zohydro ER
Teaser: The controversial single-entity hydrocodone formulation will use BeadTek technology to provide abuse-deterrent properties without changing the release properties.

Headlines: 'Practice Changing' MRI Recommendations in Multiple Myeloma
Teaser: New recommendations on the use of MRI in the management of multiple myeloma and related disorders are practice changing for one set of patients.

Headlines: Consent for Biobank Donations High in US Survey
Teaser: Donors want the simple courtesy of knowing how their tissues are being used, says the author of 'The Immortal Life of Henrietta Lacks.'

Headlines: Chondroitin-Glucosamine Reduced Pain in Knee Arthritis in RCT
Teaser: A chondroitin sulfate/glucosamine product provided as much relief as celecoxib for patients with moderate to severe knee OA pain in a randomized trial, but some experts were unconvinced.

Headlines: Saying No to Cannabis Improves Bipolar Outcomes
Teaser: Bipolar patients with mania/mixed episodes who quit using cannabis do better than their counterparts who continue using the drug, new research shows.

Headlines: Deaths Higher With Methadone vs Morphine in Chronic Pain
Teaser: Out-of-hospital deaths were higher with methadone even at low doses. Researchers stress that methadone should not be first-line therapy to patients with noncancer pain.

Headlines: Overdose Death Risk Rises Dramatically as Opioid Users Age
Teaser: The largest ever study of opioid users shows the risk for death from drug overdose rises dramatically with age.

Headlines: Work-Related Pain Common Among Staff in Cath Labs
Teaser: More than half of personnel working in the interventional lab experience some sort of work-related musculoskeletal pain, report investigators. Many of     these individuals even sought medical care for their injuries.

Headlines: Probiotic May Boost Oral Immunotherapy for Peanut
Teaser: Immunotherapy for peanut allergy could be improved with the addition of a probiotic, new research has shown.

Headlines: Craig Spencer's Fight With Ebola and Political Expedience
Teaser: Instead of using a doctor's infection to educate the public, media and politicians added to the panic, says a doctor who recovered from Ebola in New York.

Headlines: C difficile Infected Almost Half a Million in Single Year
Teaser: Clostridium difficile caused nearly half a million infections and was associated with about 29,000 deaths in 2011, according to new data released by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention.

Headlines: Lenalidomide Now for Newly Diagnosed Multiple Myeloma Patients
Teaser: The FDA has expanded the indication for lenalidomide to include newly diagnosed multiple myeloma patients.

Headlines: Oral Treatment for Muscle Cramps May Help Patients With MS
Teaser: The idea behind a possible new treatment for spasticity in multiple sclerosis patients came serendipitously -- in a boat on the open sea.

Headlines: Chronic Pain, Misuse of Pain Meds Common in Kidney Disease
Teaser: Although chronic pain is common in end-stage renal disease, less is known about pain in predialysis CKD; researchers found safety may be an issue.

Headlines: New Risk Score for Amputation in Infected Diabetic Foot Ulcers
Teaser: European researchers have developed a new risk score to help predict likelihood of amputation in patients with infected diabetic foot ulcers, which may be     better than the IWGDF classification system.

Headlines: Gene Variant Linked to Increased Toxicity of Vincristine
Teaser: A previously unknown gene variant has been linked to increased risk and severity of vincristine-induced peripheral neuropathy in children with acute lymphoblastic leukemia.

Headlines: Bourbon Virus Case History Released
Teaser: After 11 days of worsening symptoms, a previously healthy farmer died after infection with a novel virus.

Headlines: CBT, Hypnotherapy, Probiotics May Ease Kids' Tummyaches
Teaser: Several non-pharmacological treatments may be effective for children with functional abdominal pain disorders, according to a systematic review published February 9 in Pediatrics.

Headlines: FDA Warns Endoscopes May Spread Drug-Resistant Bacteria
Teaser: The FDA has issued a safety alert on the potential for reprocessed duodenoscopes to harbor bacteria because of the difficulty of cleaning the devices, and makes recommendations to minimize the risk.

Headlines: Alternative to Overall Survival in Prostate Cancer Trials?
Teaser: Radiographic progression-free survival correlates with overall survival in patients with metastatic castration-resistant prostate cancer.

Headlines: First Vaginal Insert for Fecal Incontinence Clears FDA
Teaser: The Eclipse System includes an inflatable vaginal balloon that puts pressure through the vaginal wall onto the rectal area, thereby reducing fecal incontinence episodes.

Headlines: Long-Acting Opioids Related to Unintentional Overdose Risk
Teaser: Patients receiving long-acting opioids were 2.3 times more likely to experience an unintentional overdose overall, and 5 times more likely in the first 2 weeks of treatment.

Headlines: General Anesthesia May Negate Endovascular Benefit in Stroke
Teaser: Subgroup analysis of the MR CLEAN trial has shown that patients who underwent endovascular clot retrieval under general anesthesia did not show the benefit seen overall in the trial.

Headlines: Sucrose Plus Radiant Warmth Relieves Newborns' Pain
Teaser: Giving infants a 24% sucrose solution and exposing them to radiant warmth shortly before vaccination led to a 50% reduction in time the newborns spent crying and grimacing after the inoculation.

Headlines: Panel Recommends Steps for Safer Epidural Injections
Teaser: Adherence to 17 recommended practices can reduce the incidence of serious neurologic injuries during spinal pain interventions, working group members say.

Headlines: Antipsychotic-Related Weight Gain Explained?
Teaser: The brain's cannabinoid system appears to mediate weight gain seen in schizophrenia patients treated with an atypical antipsychotic, early results suggest.

Headlines: Concierge Medicine Firm Found Liable for Doctor's Negligence
Teaser: The nation's largest concierge medicine practice takes a big hit.

Headlines: EMA Panel Recommends Codeine Restriction for Cough in Kids
Teaser: A committee of the European Medicines Agency has recommended restricting the use of codeine for cough and cold in children because it can cause serious adverse effects, including breathing problems.

Headlines: Drug Monitoring Programs: Time Consuming, Hard to Access
Teaser: Most physicians are aware of state-level prescription drug monitoring programs, but many don't use them because they are time consuming and hard to access.

Headlines: French Parliament Debates 'Deep Sleep' Bill for End of Life
Teaser: France's parliament will debate a bill on Tuesday allowing patients on the brink of death to stop treatment and enter a "deep sleep" until they die, a move some critics say amounts to euthanasia in disguise.

Headlines: Ocular Therapeutix Eye Drug Meets Goal in Late-Stage Study
Teaser: Ocular Therapeutix Inc said its lead eye drug reduced pain and inflammation in patients following cataract surgery in a late-stage trial.

Headlines: Promising Celiac Disease Therapies on the Horizon
Teaser: New drugs in clinical trials, as well as more in the pre-clinical phase, may one day allow people with celiac disease to enjoy gluten again.

Headlines: Surgery, Sling Similar for Displaced Humerus Fractures
Teaser: A randomized controlled trial showed no significant differences in outcomes for surgical vs nonsurgical treatment of displaced fractures of the proximal humerus involving the surgical neck.

Headlines: First Therapy for High-Risk Neuroblastoma Approved by FDA
Teaser: Dinutuximab, an antibody targeting glycolipids on the neuroblastoma cell, used in combination with other therapies has been shown to improve survival.

Headlines: CDC Investigates Rise in Opioid-Addicted Newborns
Teaser: Surveillance data from three Florida hospitals identified 242 babies born with neonatal abstinence syndrome during a 2-year period.

Headlines: Image-Guided Lidocaine Injections for Headache
Teaser: Lidocaine injections into part of the trigeminal nerve near the brain under fluoroscopic guidance improved migraine and cluster headaches, a new study shows.

Headlines: ECT for Depression: Older Age Linked to Rapid Response
Teaser: Older age stands out from other demographic and clinical characteristics in predicting rapid remission of depression with ECT.

Headlines: Vulvovaginal Atrophy Symptoms Improve With Prasterone Treatment
Teaser: Prasterone treatment has parallel beneficial effects on the three main symptoms of vulvovaginal atrophy (VVA), regardless of which symptom a patient finds the most troubling, a new phase III open-label study shows.

Headlines: Preanesthesia Sedative Unnecessary, RCT Data Suggest
Teaser: Sedation does not improve patient satisfaction with the perioperative experience; in addition, it prolongs recovery.

Headlines: New York e-Prescribing Mandate May Go Into Effect This Month
Teaser: Legislature mulls 1-year delay, but state medical society regards mandate as a done deal; vendors scramble to get software DEA certified.

Headlines: New US Data on Opioid Use
Teaser: A new report shows that although overall use of opioid analgesics in the US has remained stable over the past decade, use of stronger forms is increasing significantly.

Headlines: Acetaminophen Risks May Have Been Underestimated
Teaser: Acetaminophen (paracetamol) may have more risks than originally thought, but an independent expert, and even the study author, say the new data should be taken with a grain of salt.

Headlines: Peanut Patch to Treat Allergy in the Works
Teaser: Epicutaneous immunotherapy delivered daily with a patch could be a simple and safe alternative for peanut allergy, new research has shown.

Headlines: Younger Women Not in Tune With Heart Health
Teaser: Women in their 30s, 40s and 50s don't seek preventive care for heart disease, aren't very good at gauging their risk for heart attack and often delay seeking treatment for symptoms of acute myocardial infarction (MI), a new study shows.

Headlines: The Opioid-Free ED: Coming Soon to a Hospital Near You
Teaser: The emergency department (ED) can sometimes be the birthplace of opioid addiction, which is reason enough to find alternative effective nonopioid analgesics.

Headlines: Online Petition to Lower Cancer Drug Prices in US
Teaser: Leukemia expert and outspoken critic of the high prices now being charged for many new cancer drugs is moving on to invoke 'people power.'

Headlines: New Call for Infection Control in Wake of HCV Transmissions
Teaser: The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention report two separate cases of transmission of hepatitis C virus (HCV) via breaches of infection prevention practices during surgery.

Headlines: Schizophrenia Drug Deaths Inconclusive, FDA Says
Teaser: An animal study suggests that much of the increase in olanzapine bloodstream levels occurred after â€” not before â€” the deaths of two patients in 2013.

Headlines: Cosyntropin Shows Efficacy for Postdural Puncture Headache
Teaser: The gold standard treatment, epidural blood patch, isn't always effective, and an alternative could be beneficial when there are contraindications.

Headlines: High-Frequency SCS Raises Bar on Chronic Pain Relief
Teaser: Randomized trial results show double the pain relief and remission with an investigational high-frequency spinal cord stimulation device of those with conventional, lower-frequency SCS.

Headlines: Celiac Disease: Which Children Should Be Tested?
Teaser: Many children with celiac disease remain undiagnosed; research points toward the establishment of a more systemic approach to testing children for celiac disease.

Headlines: Study Found Nine Modifiable Triggers for Low Back Pain
Teaser: Being distracted increased risk for low back injury by 25-fold.

Headlines: Phase 3 Results Positive for Prasterone for Menopause-Related Pain
Teaser: Daily use of an experimental treatment, prasterone, may ease pain from vaginal intercourse in postmenopausal women, according to a study sponsored by the maker of prasterone, EndoCeutics.

Headlines: Early Imaging Unhelpful in Older Adults With New Back Pain
Teaser: A new study provides more evidence that early routine imaging for new-onset back pain in the elderly is costly and provides no benefit.

Headlines: New Market for Liver Disease Spawns Race for Better Testing
Teaser: As drugmakers develop new medicines to battle a liver disease epidemic, they have created an urgent need for better diagnostics to select patients for treatment and assess their drugs' effectiveness.

Headlines: Light and Sound Sensitivity in Migraine Explained?
Teaser: Functional MRI shows heightened connectivity of the anterior insula that may explain why some patients with migraine are exceedingly sensitive to light and noise.

Headlines: Stepped-Care Approach to Chronic Pain Improves Function
Teaser: A two-step program combining analgesics, self-management strategies, and cognitive-behavioral therapy yields lasting improvement in chronic pain and function in a trial of US veterans.

Headlines: Race, Social Class Biases Do Not Dictate Clinical Decisions
Teaser: Although clinicians showed evidence of unconscious biases in a survey, they did not appear to affect the quality of care minority patients would receive in the trauma center.

Headlines: Watch for Doctor-Shopper Red Flags, Group Warns
Teaser: When four patients from out-of-state arrive in a car at a medical practice and request the same painkiller, something's up, says a coalition representing physicians, pharmacists, and pharmacies.

Headlines: Gene Variant Not a Predictor of Naltrexone Response
Teaser: A variant of the mu-opioid receptor gene was not associated with response to the opioid antagonist naltrexone in alcohol-dependent patients in a prospective study.

Headlines: Aspirin Protection for Colorectal Cancer Depends on Genetics
Teaser: The reduced risk for colorectal cancer risk seen in people taking aspirin or related NSAIDs appears to be linked to genetic variations in two common SNPs.

Headlines: Fentanyl: DEA Sounds Nationwide Alarm on Drug's Dangers
Teaser: The US Drug Enforcement Agency has issued a nationwide alert about the dangers of the narcotic fentanyl its analogues/compounds, which are often laced with heroin.

Headlines: French Parliament Passes 'Deep Sleep' Bill for End of Life
Teaser: France's lower house of parliament passed a bill on Tuesday allowing patients near the end of their lives to stop medical treatment and request deep sedation until they die, a move that critics say is effectively a form of euthanasia.

Headlines: NCCN Guidance on New Castration-Resistant Prostate Therapies
Teaser: A better understanding of prostate cancer biology is paying off in new therapies that promise to extend survival in men with castration-resistant tumors. The guidelines reflect the new data.

Headlines: GAO Report Claims DEA to Blame for Many Drug Shortages
Teaser: Data show increasing shortages of prescription drugs containing controlled substances, often related to the DEA's quota system; medical societies say patients suffer as result.

Headlines: Abuse-Deterrent OxyContin Won't Solve US Opioid Epidemic
Teaser: Abuse-deterrent opioid formulations curtail abuse but alone won't mitigate the US opioid abuse problem and may contribute to more heroin use, new research shows.

Headlines: Efforts to Instill Empathy Among Doctors Is Paying Dividends
Teaser: Empathy is considered essential to establishing trust, the foundation of a good doctor-patient relationship.

Headlines: Rectal Cancer: Outcomes Similar for Laparoscopic vs Open Surgery
Teaser: Three-year results from the COLOR II trial suggest recurrence and survival rates are similar for laparoscopic compared with open surgery.

Headlines: Keeping RA in Check May Lower CV Risk Over Time
Teaser: Each 10-point drop in rheumatoid arthritis disease activity was reducing disease activity associated with a 21% relative drop in cardiovascular risk, independent of the type of treatment used, a new study has found.

Headlines: Acetaminophen Ineffective for Back Pain, Knee/Hip OA
Teaser: Experts were of a mixed opinion on whether treatment guidelines recommending acetaminophen as first-line therapy for back pain and osteoarthritis pain should be reconsidered.

Headlines: FDA Finalizes Roadmap for Development of Abuse-Deterrent Opioids
Teaser: The FDA pledges to work with industry to support the development of new opioid formulations that are difficult to abuse but effective and available when needed.

Headlines: Lower Pitch Counts in Best Little Leaguers to Spare Injury
Teaser: Young baseball players who are tall, pitch fast, or play for more than one team run an increased risk for injury, a new study has shown.

Headlines: Abiraterone Before Chemo Improves Survival: Label Update
Teaser: The FDA has updated the labeling on abiraterone acetate to reflect its expanded indication, and clinical trials results on which the indication was based have now been published.

Headlines: PBS Documentary Champions Patient-Centered Care
Teaser: Airing on April  2, 'Rx: The Quiet Revolution' turns aside from the usual discontents of medicine to show how reviving the physician-patient relationship can help Americans cope with chronic illness.

Headlines: Complexities of Opioid-Induced Hyperalgesia Poorly Understood
Teaser: Despite its high profile in the national discussion about opioid addiction, the 'incredibly complicated' underpinnings of hyperalgesia continue to leave many dazed and confused, an expert says.

Headlines: Reader Poll: Can You Spot Doctor-Shoppers?
Teaser: More signals of opioid drug abuse have been identified to help clinicians spot abusers and pushers.

Headlines: Knee OA: Corticosteroid Shot Does Not Boost Exercise Benefit
Teaser: Adding an intra-articular corticosteroid injection before exercise in patients with painful osteoarthritis of the knee provided no extra benefit in a randomized controlled trial.

Headlines: Intranasal SPG Block Reduces Chronic Migraine Pain
Teaser: The first randomized controlled trial of its kind shows benefits in long-term treatment with the intranasal SPG block.

Headlines: Platelet-Rich Plasma for Pain: Evidence Still Lacking
Teaser: Research on the controversial and costly treatment for musculoskeletal pain continues, but evidence remains inconclusive, experts say.

Headlines: Naproxen Lowers Ossification Risk in Hip Arthroscopy
Teaser: The effect was so powerful that the Data Safety and Monitoring Board stopped the trial, report researchers.

Headlines: Ketorolac Similar to Corticosteroid for Knee Osteoarthritis
Teaser: Intra-articular ketorolac shows efficacy similar to that of corticosteroid injections in the treatment of knee osteoarthritis, a new study shows.

Headlines: Coordination of Care Matters Most to Patients With Chronic Pain
Teaser: A survey shows patients rank coordination of chronic pain management above the relationship with their healthcare provider, and outcomes correlate with the quality of coordination.

Headlines: Feds Move to Stop Opioid- and Heroin-Related Overdose, Death
Teaser: A targeted initiative aimed at reducing prescription opioid- and heroin-related overdose, dependence, and death has been announced by the US Health and Human Services Secretary.

Headlines: Stellate Ganglion Block No Better Than Placebo for PTSD
Teaser: Case reports have raised interest in the treatment in military service members with PTSD, but a randomized controlled trial shows no improvement over a saline injection.

Headlines: Intradiscal Biacuplasty Bests Standard Back Pain Therapy
Teaser: The minimally invasive radiofrequency therapy shows significantly higher rates of pain relief compared with conventional therapy approaches after 6 months in a randomized study.

Headlines: EAS Offers Advice on Statin-Induced Muscle Pain
Teaser: The EAS stresses that statins are the first, second, and third treatment course in patients with muscle pain, and all efforts should be made to get the     patient back on the lipid-lowering medication.

Headlines: Hip Osteoarthritis Linked to Increased Mortality
Teaser: Radiographic hip osteoarthritis was associated with increased mortality, perhaps as a result of decreased physical activity. Hip replacement provided some protection.

Headlines: Six Subgroups of Obesity Invite Targeted Management
Teaser: Obese patients can be divided into six groups based on health, behavioral, and demographic characteristics, suggesting the need for a more targeted     approach to management, says a new study.

Headlines: Physician Charged With Conspiring to Murder Ex-Colleague
Teaser: They practiced together for 20 years in Great Neck, New York. Then came a split-up, an arson attempt, and a murder-for-hire plot that was never pulled off.

Headlines: What's Hot at AAN 2015?
Teaser: A rundown of changes to the program and expected highlights of the American Academy of Neurology 67th Annual Meeting, beginning this weekend in Washington, DC.

Headlines: Pay-for-Delay Drug Deals: Do They Hurt or Help Patients?
Teaser: Do pay-for-delay deals increase costs and delay generic drug entry into the market, or do they actually lower costs and make generics available sooner?

Headlines: Precision Medicine Needs 'Precision Genomics'
Teaser: In half of all cancer patients, tumor-only gene sequencing is not enough to guide therapeutic decisions on the use of precision cancer agents.

Headlines: Marijuana Compound May Reduce Seizures in Severe Epilepsy
Teaser: The largest open-label study of its kind to date shows seizures were reduced by more than 50% in patients with Dravet or Lennox-Gastaut syndromes.

Headlines: Increased CV Risk With High-Dose Ibuprofen: EMA
