Teaser: The increased risk is observed in doses at or exceeding 2400 mg/day. Given the risk, the European reviewers recommend assessing a patient's CVD risk     factors before starting high-dose ibuprofen.

Headlines: Hot Yoga Cools Anxiety, Relieves Depression
Teaser: Women with high stress levels who were randomly assigned to receive Bikram yoga showed significant decreases in anxiety, depression, and stress after 8 weeks.

Headlines: Pregnant Women Pass on Opioid Addiction to Infants
Teaser: Almost 30% of women have filled an opioid pain reliever prescription during pregnancy, significantly increasing the risk for infant withdrawal syndrome.

Headlines: Surgeons Say 'We Can Fix It,' Patients May Misunderstand Risks
Teaser: When surgeons prepare patients for an operation by describing how it can fix a problem, patients may agree to procedures without fully understanding the risks, a small study suggests.

Headlines: Long-Term Pain Outcomes With DBS in Parkinson's
Teaser: Overall, pain improved in patients with Parkinson's 8 years after having deep brain stimulation, but new pain, mostly musculoskeletal, developed.

Headlines: Drug Overdose Sending More Americans to the ED
Teaser: Intentional and unintentional drug overdoses of analgesics, antipyretics, and antirheumatics, as well as sedatives, hypnotics, tranquilizers, and other psychotropic agents are behind a substantial portion of ED visits.

Headlines: Genital Involvement Worsens Sexual Health, QoL in Psoriasis
Teaser: More than one-third of psoriasis patients have current genital involvement, which severely affects their quality of life and sexual health, according to new findings from two referral centers.

Headlines: Shift From IV to Oral Sedation for Pain Procedures?
Teaser: One pain center reports benefits from a policy shifting from intravenous sedation to oral anxiolysis, but some argue IV sedation is often important.

Headlines: Government Payments for Medicare Advantage Plans to Rise in 2016
Teaser: Payments to health insurers operating Medicare Advantage plans for the elderly and disabled will increase by 1.25 percent in 2016, the U.S. government said, in response to expected growth in health spending.

Headlines: Spinal Stenosis: Similar Results With PT and Surgery
Teaser: Physical therapy or surgery provided similar improvements over the course of 2 years, a new study suggests; first-line treatment should start with a standardized PT regimen, an expert suggests.

Headlines: Point-of-Care H. Pylori Testing Feasible
Teaser: Testing for Helicobacter pylori in patients who present to the emergency department with abdominal pain, and treating those who test positive, is feasible and may improve patient outcomes.

Headlines: FDA to Investigate Bayer's Essure Contraceptive Device
Teaser: Petitioners allege that Bayer falsified medical records from clinical trials, failed to report adverse events, misled the public and the FDA about the device, and used defective materials in the device.

Headlines: Ebola Vaccine Safe, Immunogenic in Phase I Trials
Teaser: A genetically engineered Ebola vaccine was safe and induced a significant immune response in multiple phase 1 trials, researchers reported.

Headlines: Adult Sinusitis Guidelines Updated
Teaser: The American Academy of Otolaryngology-Head and Neck Surgery Foundation has updated a clinical practice guideline on adult sinusitis, with a greater focus on patient education and patient preference.

Headlines: Hydroxyurea Underused in Sickle Cell Pain Crises
Teaser: At least 75% of adults with sickle cell anemia do not use hydroxyurea, despite recommendations to do so to reduce the frequency of pain crises.

Headlines: Shortfall in Operations Causes a Third of Deaths Worldwide
Teaser: An abbreviated protocol can shorten MRI exam times, report researchers.

Headlines: Rapid MRI Valuable in Those at High Risk for Stress Fracture
Teaser: The case against Dr. Alwin Lewis started with a patientâ€™s complaint about his unorthodox diet plan.

Headlines: California High Court to Consider Limits on Access to Prescription Database
Teaser: Federal prosecutors said a corrupt cop taught Joseph Mogan III, MD, how to write illegal prescriptions for narcotics without tipping off law enforcement. For 10 years, that advice apparently paid off.

Headlines: Louisiana 'Pill Mill' Physician Receives 8-Year Prison Term
Teaser: Heroin use in the US is up significantly from 2002 rates, but its use is still uncommon.

Headlines: Heroin Use Rising in the US
Teaser: A simple intervention markedly improved co-prescription of folate and AEDs in women of childbearing age, potentially reducing risk for poor cognitive outcomes and congenital malformations in offspring.

Headlines: Intervention Triples Folate Prescription in Women on AEDs
Teaser: Once again, the agency urged clinicians to talk to patients about all pain-management options, and not just prescription analgesics, which can be dissolved and injected illicitly.

Headlines: CDC Warns of HIV, HCV Outbreaks Among Injection Drug Users
Teaser: A dexamethasone-eluting hydrogel punctum plug can reduce the pain and inflammation related to cataract surgery, a new study shows.

Headlines: Extended-Release Dexamethasone Promising for Cataracts
Teaser: A ketoprofen gel applied on the face over transgeminal nerve endings is effective in migraine treatment and an alternative to those who can't take oral NSAIDs.

Headlines: Topical Gel Promising in Migraine
Teaser: New studies admonish cancer survivors to keep moving, as they show that moderate physical exercise improves mood, reduces fatigue, and reduces the adverse effects of chemotherapy.

Headlines: Walking Improves Mood, Boosts Energy in Cancer Survivors
Teaser: For the first time, ultrasound has been used to detect treatment response after platelet-rich plasma or prolotherapy injection in patients with tennis elbow.

Headlines: Imaging Detects Treatment Response in Epicondylosis
Teaser: CT scans are not accurate enough on their own to direct treatment decisions for patients with acute cholecystitis, researchers warn.

Headlines: Cholecystitis on CT, Check Ultrasound Before Treating
Teaser: Research backs ultrasound for its lack of radiation, lower cost, and reliable results, but CT is often the go-to choice.

Headlines: Ultrasound First, Not CT, for Women's Pelvic Pain
Teaser: Heroin-assisted therapy is the best way of avoiding relapse in opioid addicts who have failed conventional therapies, argues an expert.

Headlines: Heroin Best Tx for Resistant Opioid Addiction, Expert Says
Teaser: The FDA has approved an expanded indication for Botox for the treatment of adults with upper limb spasticity.

Headlines: FDA OKs Botox for Adults With Upper Limb Spasticity
Teaser: The radiation doses received by patients with suspected kidney stones undergoing diagnostic CT vary widely in the United States, and are often inappropriately high.

Headlines: CT Radiation Doses Still Too High in Most US Centers
Teaser: After the introduction of abuse-deterrent formulations of oxycodone and the withdrawal of propoxyphene from the market, there has been a drop in opioid prescriptions and prescription opioid overdose.

Headlines: National Drop in Opioid Prescriptions, Overdose
Teaser: Patients should be aware that pets can become sick or die after inadvertent exposure to topical pain medications containing the nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug flurbiprofen, the FDA warns.

Headlines: Let Patients Know Flurbiprofen Cream May Be Deadly for Pets
Teaser: Tendon injuries are common in sports, and there are many schools of thought on how to avoid them. But a new analysis of past research finds that stretching doesn't help and might even raise the risk of injury for some.

Headlines: Nitrous Oxide Improves Satisfaction With IUD Insertion
Teaser: Women who inhaled nitrous oxide during intrauterine device (IUD) insertion reported greater satisfaction with the procedure, although pain scores remained unchanged, according to new research.

Headlines: HRS Sessions Celebrate Innovation in the 'Athens of America'
Teaser: At the party: a tip of the hat to the ICD on its FDA-approval pearl anniversary and 2 days of late-breaking trials with poisoned epicardial fat pads,     wireless CRT electrodes, and other fascinations.

Headlines: Ebola Virus Persists in Eyes Months After Clearing Blood
Teaser: Survivors need ophthalmological follow-up for eye disease, but the incidence of ocular complications is unknown.

Headlines: Substance Abuse Fuels Rise in HCV in Four Eastern States
Teaser: Acute HCV infections increased from 2006 to 2012 among young people in Kentucky, Tennessee, Virginia, and West Virginia and were strongly correlated with opioid abuse and injection drug use.

Headlines: Cannabis Use Linked to Memory Dysfunction
Teaser: Long-term cannabis use increases the likelihood of false memories, with accompanying alterations in brain activity, that persist even after abstaining.

Headlines: Lyme Disease and Other Tickborne Diseases in New Hampshire
Teaser: New Hampshire continues to have one of the highest rates of Lyme disease in the nation; the state's Department of Health and Human Services provides four things clinicians should know about Lyme and other tickborne diseases.

Headlines: SWOG Study: 2 Effective Pills for AI-Related Pain Relief
Teaser: Investigators can't account for the strong showing of a soybean and corn oil capsule in a randomized trial of omega-3 fatty acids for aromatase-inhibitor-linked joint aches.

Headlines: How to Treat Side Effects of New Cancer Immunotherapies
Teaser: A new review article details the major side effects of immunotherapies for cancer and provides advice on how to treat them.

Headlines: Primary Care at Apex of Deliberations Over Vaccines
Teaser: Physicians are the guardians of public health, but recent measles outbreaks have shown that renewed vigilance is needed.

Headlines: Hope for 'Suicide Headache'
Teaser: A minimally invasive implantable device that facilitates on-demand patient treatment may help ease the crippling pain and psychosocial burden of so-called suicide headaches.

Headlines: Lariat for LAA Closure in AF Needs Lassoing, Say Experts
Teaser: The device, cleared for use without clinical-trial scrutiny, needs more rigorous testing if its use in left-atrial-appendage closure is to continue in AF, say researchers based on their analysis.

Headlines: Opioids Gateway Drug for Many High-Risk Patients
Teaser: Safer opioid prescribing requires screening patients for drug or alcohol abuse risk, informed consent, and compliance monitoring of those receiving ongoing therapy.

Headlines: FDA OKs First Patient-Controlled Patch for Postop Pain
Teaser: Ionsys is the first needle-free, patient-controlled, preprogrammed fentanyl delivery system for management of acute postoperative pain.

Headlines: Opioids Blamed for Spike in Withdrawal Cases in the NICU
Teaser: Increasing rates of neonatal abstinence syndrome are leading to increases in the use of pharmacotherapy and neonatal intensive care unit (NICU) resources, new research has shown.

Headlines: ED-Initiated Buprenorphine Helps Opioid Addicts Recover
Teaser: Opioid-dependent patients who start buprenorphine in the emergency department with referral to primary care are more likely to still be engaged in addiction treatment 30 days later.

Headlines: Two Congressmen Turn Up Heat on Power Morcellators
Teaser: A physician couple waging an often lonely campaign to ban power morcellators and toughen safety standards for all medical devices has gained some influential allies.

Headlines: FDA Approves Raplixa to Help Control Bleeding During Surgery
Teaser: Raplixa is the first spray-dried fibrin sealant approved for use in adult surgery patients when standard hemostatic measures are ineffective or impractical.

Headlines: First Study of Neural Cells for Stroke Shows Promise
Teaser: The first study of human neural stem cells delivered directly to the brain of stroke patients shows no major harmful effects for up to 4 years, with some suggestion of improved function.

Headlines: Physician-Issued Opioids Associated With Higher ED Use
Teaser: Survey data reveal the increasing size and scope of the nonmedical use of opioids, and its effect on healthcare resources.

Headlines: Displaced Bony Fragment Signals Tendon Tear
Teaser: Patients with acute pain and a displaced enthesophyte probably have an underlying tendon tear that requires clinical attention, report researchers.

Headlines: Buprenorphine Buccal Film Reduces Chronic Low Back Pain
Teaser: A new study has shown that buprenorphine delivered through a buccal film can reduce chronic low back pain with few adverse effects.

Headlines: ACP Offers Advice for 'Wiser' Cancer Screening
Teaser: It is time to find the right balance between screening benefits and harms, the American College of Physicians said in new clinical guidelines.

Headlines: Experimental Kappa Opioid Appears Safe and Effective
Teaser: New phase 2 trials show that an experimental kappa opioid agonist, CR845, can reduce pain with few adverse effects and without much potential for abuse.

Headlines: Minnesota Jury Convicts Final Exit Group of Assisting 2007 Suicide
Teaser: The province of Quebec, Canada, becomes the first in the world to launch a registry for users of medical marijuana.

Headlines: World's First Medical Cannabis Registry Launched
Teaser: Results from the phase 3 TRAFFIC and TRANSPORT trials suggest the oral combination of lumacaftor and ivacaftor improves lung function and curbs exacerbations.

Headlines: Drug Combo Targets Common Cystic Fibrosis Gene Abnormality
Teaser: The two-drug combination is more expensive than codeine for reducing headaches in pregnant women, but is more effective and worth the cost, say researchers.

Headlines: Metoclopramide and Diphenhydramine Blunt Pregnancy Headaches
Teaser: CVS Health Corp, the second-largest U.S. drugstore operator, will pay $22 million to resolve a federal probe into whether two of its pharmacies in central Florida sold powerful, potentially addictive painkillers that were not prescribed for legitimate medical purposes.

Headlines: CVS Pays $22 Mln to Resolve Florida Painkiller Probe
Teaser: Earlier this week the federal government clarified that insurers canâ€™t charge people for anesthesia administered during a free colonoscopy to screen for colorectal cancer.

Headlines: Anesthesia Comes With No Charge in Screening Colonoscopies, Feds Say
Teaser: Reports of ketoacidosis requiring hospitalization in patients with type 2 diabetes taking sodium-glucose cotransporter-2 inhibitors prompts FDA drug safety communication.

Headlines: SGLT2 Inhibitor Diabetes Drugs May Cause Ketoacidosis: FDA
Teaser: The drug is the first combination prescription treatment to be approved for migraine in children 12 years of age and older.

Headlines: FDA Okays Sumatriptan/Naproxen (Treximet) for Migraine in Teens
Teaser: A new study shows that a system for identifying which patients are most likely to abuse opioids could affect how physicians prescribe these drugs.

Headlines: Abuse Risk Evaluation Changes Opioid Prescribing
Teaser: Psychiatrists from around the world will head to the Great White North (aka Canada) this weekend to attend the American Psychiatric Association's annual meeting in Toronto.

Headlines: What's Hot: Your Guide to APA 2015 Annual Meeting Highlights
Teaser: The bill bans abortions at 20 weeks of gestation based on the premise that fetuses that young can experience pain â€” a premise that the American College of Obstetricians and Gynecologists calls untrue.

Headlines: House Passes Abortion Ban at 20 Weeks
Teaser: Antibiotic-resistant typhoid fever has spread globally, driven by a single strain of Salmonella Typhi called H58, according to a large international study.

Headlines: Drug-Resistant â€˜Superbugâ€™ Strain of Typhoid Spreads Worldwide
Teaser: A new nitinol intrauterine device causes less discomfort during insertion than a copper device, and women are more likely to continue using it, a new study has shown.

Headlines: Experimental Nitinol IUD May Cause Less Pain
Teaser: A study for the first time shows an association between migraine and carpal tunnel syndrome, but experts urge caution in interpreting the results.

Headlines: Migraine Linked to Carpal Tunnel Syndrome
Teaser: Regional anesthesia of the transversus abdominis plane (TAP) curbs pain in patients undergoing laparoscopic ventral hernia repair (LVHR), according to New York-based researchers.

Headlines: Transversus Abdominis Plane Blocks Curb Hernia Repair Pain
Teaser: The FDA has approved the Senza spinal cord stimulation system, the first such system to relieve pain without paresthesia.

Headlines: FDA Okays Senza SCS System Without Tingling for Chronic Pain
Teaser: Patients with tension-type headache have weaker neck extension muscles and a lower extension/flexion ratio than healthy controls, a case-control study shows.

Headlines: Acupuncture Causes Brain Changes in Patients With Hand Pain
Teaser: Acupuncture appears to increase cortical thickness while alleviating pain in idiopathic hand pain, providing evidence that this condition is distinct from carpal tunnel syndrome.

Headlines: Feldenkrais Method Exercise Promising for Parkinson's
Teaser: A new study shows that the Feldenkrais Method of somatic education can improve the mood and quality of life among people with Parkinson's disease.

Headlines: New Sodium Channel Blocker Dampens Radiculopathy Pain
Teaser: A phase 2 trial shows that a new sodium channel blocker is safe and effective for neuropathic pain from lumbosacral radiculopathy.

Headlines: Cannabis Smoking Common, Affects Cognition in MS
Teaser: Cannabis smoking is common among patients with MS, who use it to control pain and spasticity, but the downside is that it may have lasting effects on memory and other cognitive functions.

Headlines: Acetaminophen-Linked Liver Failure Varies Widely in Europe
Teaser: A case-population study in seven European countries found a 50-fold difference in rates of liver failure linked to paracetamol overdose.

Headlines: FDA OKs Eluxadoline and Rifaximin for IBS With Diarrhea
Teaser: The drugs from two separate companies relieve pain and improve stool consistency for patients with IBS along with diarrhea.

Headlines: Prepare for Questions on Cannabis as an Analgesic
Teaser: Cannabis is becoming increasingly important in pain control, and clinicians must prepare to answer patients' questions about it, according to a leading researcher.

Headlines: EU Regulators Approve Omidria for Lens Replacement Surgery
Teaser: The recommendation comes roughly 1 year after the FDA approved phenylephrine and ketorolac injection to prevent intraoperative miosis and relieve postoperative pain.

Headlines: Green Light for Cancer Immunotherapies in Europe
Teaser: The EU authorities have recommended for approval pembrolizumab for melanoma, nivolumab for lung cancer, and dinutuximab for neuroblastoma.

Headlines: Exercise Stimulates Pain Modulation in Fibromyalgia
Teaser: Exercise activates areas of the brain associated with pain modulation, suggesting it could be an effective treatment for fibromyalgia.

Headlines: Pill-Mill Bust in South Nets 22 Clinicians and Pharmacists
Teaser: The Drug Enforcement Administration said 282 individuals in all have been arrested in four states in "Operation Pilluted," the agency's largest-ever crackdown on opioid trafficking.

Headlines: Computer-Assisted Propofol Hailed by Gastroenterologists
Teaser: The sedation system, used instead of an anesthesiologist to deliver propofol during routine endoscopy, led to shorter recovery times and overall physician satisfaction, according to a clinical report.

Headlines: Mindfulness as Effective as CBT in Pain Catastrophizing
Teaser: Mindfulness-based stress reduction may be as effective as cognitive-behavior therapy in countering the catastrophizing thought patterns of people with chronic back pain.

Headlines: Gastric Balloon Fills Stomach, Leads to Weight Loss
Teaser: Weight loss was significantly better when an intragastric balloon system was added to lifestyle intervention, and was maintained out to 12 months.

Headlines: Marijuana Doesn't Curb Agitation, Aggression in Dementia
Teaser: However, the absence of major adverse effects in a study of low-dose oral tetrahydrocannabinol leaves room for testing a higher dose, researchers say.

Headlines: Intra-abdominal Infection: Short-Course Antibiotics Effective
Teaser: For patients with complicated intra-abdominal infections and adequate source control, an antibiotic course of about 4 days was as effective as an antibiotic course of up to 10 days.

Headlines: Hospira Infusion Pumps at Risk for Hacking, FDA Says
Teaser: The FDA warns of "security vulnerabilities" with Hospira LifeCare PCA3 and PCA5 infusion pumps.

Headlines: Oral Steroids Have Little Effect in Patients With Sciatica
Teaser: A short course of prednisone has been linked to slight functional improvement, but no pain benefit in patients with acute lumbar radiculopathy.

Headlines: Nurse-Led Team Improves Delirium Outcomes in ICU
Teaser: Coordinating care among nurses, physicians, pharmacists, and exercise physiologists who are guided by a bundle gets patients off sedation faster and speeds mobility.

Headlines: Stellate Ganglion Block a Potential Lifesaver in Severe PTSD
Teaser: Mounting evidence suggests that SGB may significantly improve PTSD symptoms and reduce or eliminate suicidal ideation in patients with severe PTSD.

Headlines: Smartphone Overuse May Affect Hand Function
Teaser: A new study shows frequent smartphone users have an enlarged median nerve, as well as impaired hand function and pinch strength compared with those who use their phone less often.

Headlines: Widespread Borrelia miyamotoi Tick-borne Fever Found in US
Teaser: A new, and potentially more severe, infection transmitted by the same ticks that carry Lyme disease was much more common in the United States in 2013 than expected, especially in the Northeast.

Headlines: Arthritis Magnifies Effect of Other Chronic Conditions
Teaser: Social life and work ability were more negatively affected by arthritis than other chronic health problems; in combination with one or more other health issues, it worsened the effect of all of them.

Headlines: Analgesics Linked to Increased Homicide Risk
Teaser: Psychotropic drugs, particularly opiate and nonopiate analgesics, are associated with a significantly increased risk for homicide.

Headlines: New NINDS Director Named
Teaser: Dr Walter Koroshetz's 'deep grounding in clinical neurology and basic neuroscience research makes him the ideal candidate to lead NINDS into the future': Francis Collins, MD, director, NIH.

Headlines: Synthetic Marijuana an Urgent Public Health Threat
Teaser: Calls to poison control centers related to synthetic marijuana jumped 229% in the first 5 months of 2015, prompting calls to get the products off the market.

Headlines: Improved Survival in Sarcoma for First Time With Eribulin
Teaser: Survival benefit was 2 months, but there was no reduction in tumor burden, and there was significant toxicity and cost. The results contrasted with those for trabectedin.

Headlines: Seniors Need Multicomponent Prevention of Postop Delirium
Teaser: The new American Geriatrics Society clinical practice guideline for postoperative delirium in older adults emphasizes preventive and nonpharmacologic strategies.

Headlines: Higher Fees Could Offset Care Benefits of Physician Mergers
Teaser: A study has found that arthroplasty fees rose by 7% per procedure in the most concentrated orthopedic markets.

Headlines: Cannabis Harms Brain, Imaging Shows
Teaser: Heavy chronic cannabis use is associated with lower dopamine release in the associative striatum and the sensory motor striatum, according to an imaging study using a highly specific radiotracer.

Headlines: Anesthesia Before Age 4 May Affect IQ, Language Comprehension
Teaser: Early exposure to general anesthesia has been associated with lower IQ and language comprehension scores, although test scores remained within population norms.

Headlines: Low Vitamin D Levels Common in Painful Diabetic Neuropathy
Teaser: Results from a study of 45 people suggest that low vitamin D levels may play a role in the pathogenesis of painful diabetic peripheral neuropathy and that     vitamin D supplementation could lead to improvement.

Headlines: Bringing Doctors to Patients Who Need Them Most
Teaser: Jennifer Vargasâ€™ path toward becoming a doctor took her from UCLA to Guadalajara before it ultimately led back home, to Californiaâ€™s vast Inland Empire east of Los Angeles.

Headlines: How Many Patients With MS Are Using Marijuana?
Teaser: A survey of more than 5000 patients with MS shows 16% are current marijuana users. Having progressive forms of the disease, more disability, and spasticity increases the likelihood of using the drug.

Headlines: Unprecedented Responses With Daratumumab in Multiple Myeloma
Teaser: The novel anti-CD38 agent produced 'unprecedented overall responses' in heavily pretreated multiple myeloma patients.

Headlines: Calming Dementia Patients Without Powerful Drugs
Teaser: Being attentive to the cues people give and trying to understand what is bothering them even if they canâ€™t communicate it directly may be the alternative to sedatives for dementia patients.

Headlines: ADA: Two Big Trials and Special 75th Anniversary Celebration
Teaser: Results from two major cardiovascular-outcomes trials will be presented at the 2015 American Diabetes Association Scientific Sessions, as speakers mark 75     years of progress and move the field forward.

Headlines: Ethnic Disparities in Pain Rx Persist at Qualified Center
Teaser: A new study shows that a Connecticut federally qualified health center provides less opioid treatment for black and Hispanic patients than for white patients.

Headlines: More Could Return to Work After Joint Surgery, Experts Say
Teaser: The number of patients who undergo total hip or knee arthroplasty and do not return to work after their procedure is concerning and perhaps unnecessary, according to new research.

Headlines: Reader Poll: Ready to Answer Cannabis Questions From Patients?
Teaser: Clinicians need to learn about current research on medical marijuana so that they can counsel patients regarding its risks and benefits.

Headlines: Kids With Migraine Not Receiving Optimal Treatment
Teaser: Two studies reveal that half of kids with migraine or probable migraine aren't receiving any treatment, very few are receiving evidence-based treatment, and one in six are given opioids.

Headlines: Medical Marijuana Laws Don't Encourage Teen Use
Teaser: A multiyear nationwide survey suggests that introducing state medical marijuana laws does not lead to an increase in marijuana use in adolescents, although those states have higher overall usage.

Headlines: Migraine Patients Skip Triptans in 40% of Attacks
Teaser: A study has found that patients with migraine are not taking their prescribed triptans in a large proportion of attacks, but those who do take them at the first signs of migraine do best.

Headlines: Europe Approves Nivolumab for Advanced Melanoma in First Line
Teaser: The PD-1 immune checkpoint inhibitor is also indicated for patients with previously treated advanced melanoma.

Headlines: After DKA Warning, Avoid SGLT2-Inhibitor Use in Type 1 Diabetes
Teaser: A case series finds 13 episodes of euglycemic diabetic ketoacidosis associated with SGLT2-inhibitor use in both types of diabetes; the authors advise avoiding     these agents in those with type 1 diabetes.

Headlines: Too Many Patients With Migraine Receiving Opioids, Barbiturates
Teaser: A new survey reveals that half of patients with migraine are receiving medications that are not recommended as first-line and that may lead to overdose, addiction, and more frequent headaches.

Headlines: First Success With CAR T-Cells in a Solid Tumor
Teaser: Dramatic results with chimeric-antigen receptor (CAR) T-cells have been seen in hematologic malignancies, and now the first proof-of-concept success is reported for pancreatic cancer.

Headlines: Does Appendicitis Have to Be Treated With Surgery?
Teaser: A new study has questioned the previously unquestionable and revealed that antibiotics without surgery may be an effective treatment option for patients with uncomplicated appendicitis.

Headlines: Physician Got $439K in Kickbacks for $5K 'Investment'
Teaser: Spinal surgeon Aria Sabit, MD, pleaded guilty to receiving kickbacks for using implant hardware from a company he co-owned, a conflict of interest the government has warned about for years.

Headlines: Arthroscopic Knee Surgery Shows No Long-term Benefit
Teaser: After arthroscopic knee surgery, small pain relief effects lasted less than 2 years, and patients reported no functional improvement; harms included deep vein thrombosis, infection, and death.

Headlines: Migraine: Zolmitriptan Nasal Spray Cleared for Kids 12 and Up
Teaser: Zomig is the first nasal-delivered prescription medicine approved for the treatment of acute migraine attacks in pediatric patients.

Headlines: Drug Overdose Now Leading Cause of Injury-Related Deaths
Teaser: Drug overdose deaths continue to increase in the US and are now the leading cause of injury deaths in the US, a new report shows.

Headlines: Colorado High Court Upholds Firing of Workers for Medical Pot Use
Teaser: Medical marijuana patients in Colorado could lose their jobs for using cannabis because the drug remains illegal under federal law, the state's highest court ruled on Monday, upholding the firing of a quadriplegic who tested positive for pot.

Headlines: Stimulant Medication Misuse 'Starts Earlier Than Thought'
Teaser: Surveys of more than 250,000 adolescents show the peak age of initiating misuse of stimulant medications is earlier than expected, with higher rates in females.

Headlines: Car Seat Screening Finds 5% Failure Rate in LBW Babies
Teaser: Nearly 5% of full-term low-birth-weight babies failed a car seat tolerance screen, and the biggest risk factor was the presence of opiates in the mother's urine at the time of hospital admission.

Headlines: NSAIDs Dramatically Reduce Ovulation With Consistent Use
Teaser: When taken during the luteal phase of the menstrual cycle, NSAIDs can inhibit ovulation and could significantly impair fertility in women trying to get pregnant.

Headlines: Adult Dental Coverage Expanding Slowly in Medicaid
Teaser: Federal law requires state Medicaid programs to include dental care for children, and the Affordable Care Act extended that requirement to private insurers.

Headlines: Medicare Favors Generic Opioids Over Abuse-Deterrent Formulations
Teaser: The abuse of prescription painkillers is a growing problem for seniors, as it is for other age groups.

Headlines: 'Silent' Celiac Disease Found in Kids at Rheumatology Clinic
Teaser: Celiac disease was twice as common in children presenting for rheumatology evaluation as in the general population, and musculoskeletal symptoms in those with the disease resolved with a gluten-free diet.

Headlines: Shingles Vaccination Helps Some Who Later Develop the Virus
Teaser: Adults who developed herpes zoster despite having received the herpes zoster vaccine had a reduced risk for painful complications compared with their unvaccinated counterparts.

Headlines: Trauma Flagged as Trigger for Arthritis in Psoriasis Patients
Teaser: In patients with psoriasis, trauma, in particular bone and joint trauma, has been identified as a robust risk factor for the development of psoriatic arthritis.

Headlines: Midurethral Sling Helpful for Stress Urinary Incontinence
Teaser: Midurethral sling operations for stress urinary incontinence in women have a good safety proï¬le and are highly effective in the short and medium term, with increasing evidence for long-term efficacy.

Headlines: ICD Recruited for Paddle-Free AF Cardioversion in Small Study
Teaser: "This method is less time-consuming and does not necessitate deep anesthesia compared with external   cardioversion," says the lead author. But advantages     over the standard method remain hypothetical.

Headlines: FDA Reviewing Safety of Codeine for Cough in Kids Under 18
Teaser: The FDA is investigating the safety of using codeine-containing medicines to treat coughs and colds in children younger than 18 years because of the potential for serious adverse effects.

Headlines: Hydroxychloroquine Not Effective in Hand Osteoarthritis
Teaser: For patients with symptomatic osteoarthritis of the hand, pain and functional outcomes were no different whether they were treated with hydroxychloroquine or placebo for 24 weeks.

Headlines: ACOG Expands Substance Abuse Guidelines
Teaser: Recommendations for universal screening now also apply to prescription drug abuse.

Headlines: SPG Stimulation Alleviates Cluster Headache
Teaser: An implanted device on the market in some European countries and in clinical trials in the United States provided 2-year pain relief in two thirds of patients with refractory cluster headache.

Headlines: Anesthesiologist Loses Lawsuit for Mocking Sedated Patient
Teaser: The physician's disparaging comments came back to haunt her because while the patient was out - his cellphone was on.

Headlines: Moderate Treatment Not Enough to Curb Moderate Arthritis
Teaser: Patients with rheumatoid arthritis need more than just standard DMARD therapy to decrease the risk for major joint surgery in the first 5 years after disease onset, researchers report.

Headlines: Another PFO Closure Study Yields Mixed Migraine Results
Teaser: The latest trial to investigate patent foramen ovale closure as potential treatment for refractory migraine has again yielded overall negative results but suggests possible benefit for those with aura.

Headlines: UK Reform Empowers PCPs to Improve Cancer Diagnoses
Teaser: Guidance on symptom-led cancer diagnosis in primary care and early referral could help curb the thousands of excess cancer deaths in the UK every year, claims health watchdog.

Headlines: Essure Adverse Events Ballooned Since Late 2013, FDA Says
Teaser: However, the agency said that one postapproval study of the permanent contraceptive device did not reveal any new safety problems since it was approved in 2002.

Headlines: Plugging the Tear Ducts Helps Some With Dry Eyes
Teaser: Tiny plugs inserted into the tear duct may safely curb the annoying and damaging effects of dry eyes, according to a new analysis of previous research.

Headlines: Half of Athletes at Top of Game After Repeat Knee Surgery
Teaser: Many athletes can continue to play sports after multiple surgeries to fix a damaged knee ligament, but only about half of them perform as well as they did before their injury, an analysis of previous research suggests.

Headlines: Tonsillectomy Guidelines Improve Processes but Not Outcomes
Teaser: After publication of tonsillectomy guidelines, dexamethasone use increased and antibiotic use fell among children, in line with the guidelines, but revisits within 30 days increased because of pain.

Headlines: New Data on CGRP Monoclonal Antibodies for Migraine Prevention
Teaser: Phase 2 data on calcitonin gene-related peptide monoclonal antibodies show efficacy and safety as potential novel migraine preventives, but experts say larger and longer studies are needed.

Headlines: Many Psoriasis Patients Have Undiagnosed Arthritis
Teaser: Up to 15% of people with psoriasis have undiagnosed arthritis that's related to the skin condition, according to a new review.

Headlines: Consensus Criteria for Refractory Chronic Cluster Headache
Teaser: The European Headache Federation has developed a consensus statement on what constitutes refractory chronic cluster headache.

Headlines: Novel, Powerful Tool Pinpoints Veterans at Suicide Risk
Teaser: A predictive model developed from hundreds of suicide risk factors accurately identified at-risk veterans, with findings that could point to novel suicide prevention strategies.

Headlines: Sumatriptan Less Effective in Migraine With Aura
Teaser: A large-database analysis reveals reduced efficacy for sumatriptan in migraines with aura, but the drug still works for some.

Headlines: Anti-NGF Therapy for Cancer Pain: More Research Needed
Teaser: Terminally ill cancer patients receiving fulranumab show a high responder rate and improved BPI-SF scores, despite the lack of significant improvement in pain.

Headlines: Stem Cells Show Promise as Type 2 Diabetes Treatment
Teaser: Mesenchymal precursor cells, which have anti-inflammatory properties, appeared safe and showed glucose-lowering efficacy in a small pilot study.

Headlines: California, Oregon to Allow OTC Hormonal Contraceptives
Teaser: California and Oregon will be the first states in the nation to allow women to get birth control pills and other hormonal contraceptives directly from their pharmacists â€“ without a doctorâ€™s prescription.

Headlines: FDA Approves First-of-Kind Leg Prosthesis
Teaser: This is the first prosthesis for above-the-knee amputations that does not rely on a conventional socket fitting over the stump of a patient's leg.

Headlines: Low-Level Laser Therapy Ameliorates Radiation Dermatitis
Teaser: Patients with breast cancer who develop radiation dermatitis after radiotherapy reported high ratings of patient satisfaction and stable skin toxicity following  low-level laser therapy.

Headlines: Antidepressant/NSAID Combo Linked to Brain Bleed Risk
Teaser: The GI bleeding risks associated with NSAIDS and antidepressants are well documented, but a new study is the first to show the drugs also increase the risk for intracranial hemorrhage.

Headlines: Guidelines Updated on Care for Women With Genital Mutilation
Teaser: Physicians treating women with FGM in the UK need to address both its physical and psychological effects, especially in pregnancy, and need to ensure they fully understand the law relating to FGM.

Headlines: Safety Profile of HPV Vaccines Under Review in Europe
Teaser: The European Medicines Agency is reviewing the safety profile of human papilloma virus vaccines but says there should be no change in their use at this time.

Headlines: Physician Who Gave Unneeded Chemo Gets 45 Years in Prison
Teaser: Farid Fata, MD, 'practiced greed and shut down whatever compassion he had,' said US District Judge Paul Borman, who called the oncologist's crimes 'horrific.'

Headlines: Questions Surround Death of Controversial Autism Physician
Teaser: Dr Jeff Bradstreet was labeled a saviour by some and a risk to others for his fringe beliefs and treatments.

Headlines: Topical NSAIDs Show No Visual Benefit After Cataract Surgery
Teaser: Topical NSAIDS plus or minus concomitant corticosteroid drops do not affect long-term visual outcomes after cataract surgery; the decision to use these drops should be discussed with the patient.

Headlines: FDA Strengthens NSAID Warning for Heart, Stroke Risks
Teaser: The stronger warning follows a comprehensive review of new safety information by the FDA.

Headlines: Communication Lacking in Chronic Migraine Encounters
Teaser: A study of recorded neurologist-patient conversations suggests that questions aren't being asked in a way to elicit responses that would lead to accurate diagnosis and appropriate treatment.

Headlines: How Work Restriction Letters Can Harm Pregnant Patients
Teaser: A poorly written or poorly timed note from a provider can jeopardize a patient's job and salary. Requesting a ban on lifting, for example, is likely not necessary and could introduce conflict.

Headlines: CBT Effective for Comorbid Insomnia
Teaser: New research provides further evidence supporting cognitive-behavior therapy for insomnia when difficulty sleeping occurs with another medical or psychiatric condition.

Headlines: 'Alarming' New Stats on US Heroin Epidemic
Teaser: Heroin use has increased 63% across the US, with the biggest jump in groups with historically lower rates of use, prompting calls for a widespread societal response.

Headlines: Pinaverium Effectively Treats IBS Symptoms in RCT
Teaser: Patients with irritable bowel syndrome who took pinaverium had significant improvement in abdominal pain and stool consistency compared with patients who took placebo in the double-blind trial.

Headlines: Spinal Cord Stimulation Benefit Ongoing in Diabetic Neuropathy
Teaser: Most patients treated with spinal cord stimulation (SCS) because of painful diabetic peripheral neuropathy maintain effective pain relief in the long term, according to Dutch researchers.

Headlines: Gaza Children â€˜Emotionally Shatteredâ€™ One Year After Conflict
Teaser: The majority of children living in areas of Gaza hardest-hit during last year's conflict are showing signs of severe emotional distress and trauma, including frequent bed wetting and nightmares, a global children's charity said on Monday.

Headlines: Medical Marijuana: Where's the Evidence?
Teaser: Two new reviews highlight the lack of evidence to support the use of medical marijuana for most indications, leading to questions about the legal implications for doctors prescribing such products.

Headlines: Transcutaneous Stimulation Helps Paralyzed Men Move Legs
Teaser: Electrical stimulation to the spinal cord delivered noninvasively through the skin helps paralyzed men move their legs. Recovery of function is maintained after stimulation ends.

Headlines: APA, AMA Join Forces to Combat Opioid Abuse Crisis
Teaser: The American Psychiatric Association has joined forces with the American Medical Association and more than two dozen other medical organizations to address the growing epidemic of opioid abuse.

Headlines: Lidocaine Eases Pain, Improves Sex in Breast Cancer Patients
Teaser: Topical lidocaine makes intercourse more comfortable in postmenopausal breast cancer patients with severe dyspareunia.

Headlines: First US Guideline for Vertebral Osteomyelitis Released
Teaser: Persistent severe back pain may indicate vertebral osteomyelitis, a rare spine infection that must be diagnosed and treated correctly to prevent serious complications, states a new IDSA guideline.

Headlines: Ankle Injury: Simple Rule Reduces X-ray Use, Costs in Kids
Teaser: Following the Low Risk Ankle Rule in emergency departments saved almost $40 Canadian per case and reduced radiography use by 22.9%.

Headlines: Novel Drug 'Remarkable' in Tenosynovial Giant Cell Tumor
Teaser: A novel drug shows promise in the treatment of a rare tumor that attacks joints and leaves patients disabled and in pain, and is usually treated with surgery.

Headlines: Early Mobilization May Be Replacing Plaster for Elbow Dislocations
Teaser: Early mobilization should be the standard of care for simple elbow dislocations, according to a multicenter team in the Netherlands.

Headlines: IOM Report on Noninvasive Neuromodulation: State of the Art
Teaser: The Institute of Medicine has released a report on a workshop focusing on regulatory, ethical, safety, and other issues surrounding the growing use of noninvasive neuromodulation devices.

Headlines: CHMP Says Yes to Ferric Citrate for CKD
Teaser: The EMA committee recommended approval of ferric citrate (Fexeric) for hyperphosphatemia in adults with chronic kidney disease on or off dialysis.

Headlines: FDA Approves ReShape Dual Balloon Device to Treat Obesity
Teaser: The pair of balloons are temporarily implanted in the stomach endoscopically and then filled with saline solution to induce satiety and aid weight loss.

Headlines: FDA Approves Sonidegib (Odomzo) for Basal Cell Carcinoma
Teaser: The drug is indicated for use in locally advanced disease

Headlines: Sufentanil Hybrid Receives CHMP Nod for Post-Op Pain
Teaser: The new product, Zalviso, is similar to another sufentanil-containing anesthetic-analgesic that has been available in the Netherlands for decades.

Headlines: Smoking a Cause of Psychosis?
Teaser: A meta-analysis shows high rates of smoking at first onset of psychosis and earlier onset among smokers, prompting authors to suggest a role of smoking that extends beyond the self-medication hypothesis.

Headlines: Inhaled Cannabis Promising for Painful Diabetic Neuropathy
Teaser: A new study has shown that inhaled cannabis can blunt the pain of diabetic neuropathy without impairing cognitive function.

Headlines: Calmangafodipir May Reduce Chemo-Induced Neuropathy
Teaser: In colorectal cancer patients treated with the FOLFOX regimen, calmangafodipir reduced the incidence of chemotherapy-induced peripheral neuropathy.

Headlines: Hand-Foot Syndrome Prevention With Atorvastatin, Polyprenol
Teaser: Breast cancer patients receiving capecitabine had a lower incidence of hand-foot syndrome after prophylactic treatment with atorvastatin and polyprenol.

Headlines: New Syndrome Links Anxiety and Physical Disorders
Teaser: Anxiety disorder may be linked to a series of physical conditions that represent a novel syndrome that may have previously been missed.

Headlines: Opioid Substitution Saves Lives of HIV-Positive Drug Users
Teaser: In British Columbia, opioid agonist therapy dramatically reduced both HIV- and drug-related mortality in HIV-positive injection drug users.

Headlines: Women With MCI Decline Twice as Fast as Men
Teaser: Women with mild cognitive impairment decline twice as fast as men with MCI, and also have a much higher risk for cognitive problems after surgery and general anesthesia.

Headlines: Illicit Use of 'Bath Salts' in Teens Much Lower Than Expected
Teaser: A survey of high school seniors has found that just a small minority report using bath salts, but the researchers caution more might be using the psychoactive recreational drug without knowing it.

Headlines: Symptoms Linger, Palliative Care Is Rare After HF Discharge
Teaser: Clinicians may be ill-prepared to treat pain, anxiety, and depression in their patients with heart failure, whose recovery "continues well after hospital discharge," researchers say.

Headlines: Sex for Opioids: A Hidden Epidemic
Teaser: 'Alarming' survey results show opioid users are often victims of sexual violence.

Headlines: Music Improves Some Postoperative Outcomes
Teaser: Listening to music before, during, or immediately after surgery was linked to reduced pain, anxiety, and analgesia needs in a UK study.

Headlines: Irritable Bowel Syndrome: Little Evidence for FODMAP Diet
Teaser: A review has found evidence to be lacking for a diet low in fermentable oligosaccharides, disaccharides, monosaccharides and polyols (FODMAPs) for irritable bowel syndrome.

Headlines: FDA Okays OxyContin for Some Pediatric Patients
Teaser: The opioid is indicated for children aged 11 to 16 years with pain severe enough to require daily, around-the-clock, long-term opioid treatment for which alternative treatment options are inadequate.

Headlines: Knee Replacement May 'Turn Back the Clock' for Arthritis Pain
Teaser: Knee replacement surgery may significantly ease pain and improve leg function and quality of life in patients with osteoarthritis or rheumatoid arthritis (RA), a new study suggests.

Headlines: FDA Endorses Flow Restrictors on Kids' Liquid Acetaminophen
Teaser: In a "guidance to industry" document, the FDA encourages adoption of safety devices on pediatric liquid acetaminophen to reduce dosing errors that may lead to liver damage.

Headlines: Pain a Common Problem in America
Teaser: Over 25 million Americans experience daily pain, a new survey has found.

Headlines: Fitness Experts Warn of the Pitfalls of Going to Exercise Extremes
Teaser: With challenging workouts from ultra-marathons to endurance events on obstacle courses all the rage, fitness experts say more and more weekend warriors are leaping into extreme activities before looking into the perils of overdoing it.

Headlines: Botulinum Toxin Helpful in Painful Cutaneous Leiomyomas
Teaser: Botulinum toxin A may improve skin-related quality of life in patients with cutaneous leiomyomas, according to Maryland-based researchers.

Headlines: Teen Marijuana Use Not Harmful?
Teaser: In stark contrast to previous research, a new study suggests teen marijuana use is not associated with later development of physical or mental health issues.

Headlines: Ankylosing Spondylitis Linked to Cardiovascular Mortality
Teaser: Patients with ankylosing spondylitis had a 60% higher risk for cerebrovascular mortality and a 35% higher risk for cardiovascular mortality than non-AS comparators.

Headlines: Cincinnati Hospitals Test Mothers, Newborns for Drugs
Teaser: Bubbly and athletic, Heather Padgett, raised in a loving family in the Cincinnati suburbs, would not fit the stereotype of a heroin addict.

Headlines: Blood Pressure Drug May Help Prevent Opioid Relapse
Teaser: A drug used to treat hypertension appears to be an effective adjunctive therapy in reducing relapse in opioid-dependent patients.

Headlines: Thousands of Ebola Survivors Face Pain, Possible Blindness
Teaser: Thousands of West Africans who were infected with the Ebola virus but survived it are suffering chronic conditions such as serious joint pain and eye inflammation that can lead to blindness, global health experts said.

Headlines: Reduced Access to Meds After Crackdown on Illegal Rx Drug Trade
Teaser: An unintended side effect of a crackdown on prescription drug abuse affects chronic pain patientsâ€™ access to medication.

Headlines: 'Mounting Evidence' for Hypofractionation in Breast Cancer
Teaser: Two studies add support for hypofractionation of radiation following surgery for early-stage breast cancer.

Headlines: Teriparatide Manages Surgical Hypoparathyroidism
Teaser: Use of teriparatide (parathyroid hormone 1-34) in patients with postsurgical hypoparathyroidism showed rapid increase in serum calcium and a decrease in     phosphate, despite reduced calcium and vitamin D supplementation. Quality of life also improved.

Headlines: Drug Needle Exchanges Gain Ground After Indiana HIV Outbreak
Teaser: Since Indiana opened its first state-run needle exchange last spring, Tara Burton, 25, has made weekly visits to turn over needles she used to shoot Opana, a prescription painkiller, up her track-marked arm.

Headlines: Four Dead, 65 Sick in New York City Legionnaires' Disease Outbreak
Teaser: A deadly outbreak of Legionnaires' disease, a severe type of pneumonia, has now killed four people and sickened 65 in the Bronx section of New York City since July 10, New York City health officials said on Saturday.

Headlines: UK Cuts Cancer Drugs; 'Hammer Blow', 'Stupid,' Say Critics
Teaser: In the United Kingdom, the number of available cancer drugs will be decreased after a fund set up to allow access to unproven drugs once again exceeded its projected budget.

Headlines: FDA Staff Flag Likely Dosing Errors With Purdue's Opioid Painkiller
Teaser: U.S. Food and Drug Administration staff have expressed concerns over likely errors in administering Purdue Pharma's fast-acting oxycodone painkiller that could result in inadequate relief.

Headlines: Acupuncture Cools Breast Cancer Hot Flashes
Teaser: A randomized controlled trial with four treatment groups suggests that acupuncture is effective in this setting.

Headlines: Japan Scheme for Managing Symptoms After HPV Vaccine
Teaser: Japanese authorities have issued a guideline and designated health centers for managing symptoms, including chronic pain, after HPV vaccination.

Headlines: SCOT: Good Risk/Benefit Trade-Off With Celecoxib, Other NSAIDs
Teaser: Criticized for its limitations, the trial's researchers say low rates of side effects and CV events in the trial should reassure that celecoxib and     standard NSAIDs can be acceptable chronically in such patients; not all agree.

Headlines: PsA Remission, Response Cutoffs Identified for DAPSA Tool
Teaser: Criteria for disease activity states and therapeutic response have been developed with the Disease Activity Index for Psoriatic Arthritis, but some question the validity of using only joint activity.

Headlines: Red Flags in Pregnant Women With Headache
Teaser: A new study points to clues indicating underlying diagnoses in pregnant women presenting with severe headache.

Headlines: e-Prescribing Controlled Substances Now Legal Nationwide
Teaser: Vermont is the last state to allow clinicians to electronically send scripts for all controlled substances, including common painkillers, to the pharmacy.

Headlines: DPP-4 Inhibitors Can Cause Severe Joint Pain, FDA Says
Teaser: However, the pain associated with dipeptidyl peptidase-4 inhibitors for type 2 diabetes goes away once patients stop taking the medicine, according to the agency.

Headlines: Group Offers Guidelines to Lessen Vaccination Pain
Teaser: Clinicians can shuffle the order of vaccine injections, leverage the calming influence of parents and breast-feeding, and routinely apply topical anesthetic to ease vaccination pain for patients.

Headlines: Marijuana and the Brain: More Research, More Questions
Teaser: New research finds no marked effect of cannabis use on brain volume, but turns up structural differences in young men at high genetic risk for schizophrenia who use the drug.

Headlines: Human Plague Cases Up in the United States
Teaser: Clinicians should consider human plague in any patient with compatible symptoms and risk factors, according to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention.

Headlines: Ibandronate Similar to Radiation for Prostate Cancer Bone Pain
Teaser: Customers reported discovering a black particle that caused superficial eye injury, pain, swelling, and blurred vision.

Headlines: Allergan Recalls Contaminated Eye Ointments
Teaser: Intensive physical and behavioral therapy for up to 6 hours a day, much more than in other pain programs, was key to treating fibromyalgia in teenaged children.

Headlines: Juvenile Fibromyalgia: Intensive Therapy Relieves Pain
Teaser: Awareness of radiation exposure and advances in modalities such as MRI and ultrasound may be behind the shift. Change may affect children's lifetime cancer risk.

Headlines: Fewer CTs, More MRI and Ultrasounds for Kids
Teaser: One third of contact lens wearers in a national survey sought care for preventable eye problems.

Headlines: Contact Lens Wearers Engage in Risky Eye Care Behavior
Teaser: Florida's legislative efforts to reduce abuse and diversion of prescription opioids have led to modest declines in opioid prescribing and use, a new study finds.

Headlines: Drug Monitoring, 'Pill Mill' Laws Reduce Opioid Scrips
Teaser: The new drug is approved for patients with locally advanced basal cell carcinoma who are not amenable to curative therapy or radiation.

Headlines: Sonidegib (Odomzo) Approved for Basal Cell Carcinoma in EU
Teaser: As hospitals chase better patient ratings and health outcomes, an increasing number are rethinking how they function at night â€” in some cases reducing nighttime check-ins or trying to better coordinate medicines â€” so that more patients can sleep relatively uninterrupted.

Headlines: Case Reports of 'Syndrome' Appearing After HPV Vaccination
Teaser: Clinicians are reporting a syndrome of pain, fatigue, and autonomic dysfunction appearing after human papillomavirus (HPV) vaccination.

Headlines: Treatment, Not Error, Is Biggest Risk to Elderly
Teaser: Most of the harm comes from medication injuries, and antibiotics are the biggest cause of those. AAFP's president-elect says New Zealand data have global implications.

Headlines: Drug Diversion and What Doctors Can Do
Teaser: An expert in fighting drug diversion and abuse updated physicians on the state of the problem in 2015 and provided tips on how they can be part of the solution.

Headlines: Wearable Nerve Stimulator Improves Chronic Pain
Teaser: A new study showed that a wearable intensive nerve stimulator approved by the US Food and Drug Administration, now available over the counter, significantly improved chronic pain.

Headlines: Is Migraine a Lipid Disorder?
Teaser: New research has suggested migraine may be linked to irregularities in the metabolism of certain lipids, opening new avenues for research into new possible treatments and biomarkers for the condition.

Headlines: New Risk Tool for Opioid-Induced Respiratory Depression
Teaser: Researchers are working on a tool to weigh risks of developing opioid-induced respiratory depression following surgery, with the aim of more closely monitoring patients at highest risk.

Headlines: Racial Gap in Management of Pediatric Appendicitis Pain
Teaser: There are marked racial disparities in analgesia administration, and particularly opioid administration, in children with appendicitis treated in US emergency departments, a new study has suggested.

Headlines: New Book, Documentary on the 'Painful Truth' of Chronic Pain
Teaser: A leading pain expert launches a book and upcoming documentary on chronic pain that sheds light on why this condition should matter to everyone.

Headlines: Number Using Opioids and Marijuana on the Rise
Teaser: A new study shows use of these two drugs together is increasing, which could signal a worrisome trend, researchers say.

Headlines: New Tamper-Proof Pain Products in the Pipeline
Teaser: An uncrushable opioid and a morphine product that can't be injected are some of the new abuse-deterrent pain medications being tested.

Headlines: Promising New Opioid Has Novel Mechanism
Teaser: Results of a double-blind, phase 2 study of TRV130 showed that it was superior to placebo in reducing pain, with a rapid onset.

Headlines: FDA Panel Recommends Approval of ER Abuse-Deterrent Oxycodone
Teaser: The advisory committee was not concerned about the need for patients to take the extended-release, abuse-deterrent opioid (Xtampza ER) with food.

Headlines: Botulinum Toxin Injection Pain Is Less With Smaller-Gauge Needles
Teaser: Injection of botulinum toxin type A through 32-gauge needles is slightly less painful than injection through 30-gauge needles, according to a randomized trial.

Headlines: Chronic Pain Linked to Attention-Deficit Disorder
Teaser: A small new study shows a high proportion of ADD in patients with centralized pain, which may contribute to high nonadherence with pain meds in this group.

Headlines: FDA Clears Adalimumab (Humira) for Hidradenitis Suppurativa
Teaser: The TNF blocker becomes the first and only FDA-approved agent for treatment of moderate to severe hidradenitis suppurativa.

Headlines: Senators Seek Inquiry Into Pediatric OxyContin Approval
Teaser: The group of nine senators alleges the FDA failed to take into account the potential to worsen the ongoing opioid epidemic.

Headlines: FDA Panel Recommends Against First IR Antiabuse Oxycodone
Teaser: The panel recommended the FDA decline approval based on concerns that delayed analgesia due to the antiabuse technology may lead to increased overdose risk.

Headlines: Opioid Switch to Buccal Buprenorphine May Limit Withdrawal
Teaser: Patients taking morphine or oxycodone for pain can be safely switched to buccal buprenorphine without tapering and without causing significant withdrawal, a new study suggests.

Headlines: Stratospheric Rise of Medical Marijuana in Epilepsy
Teaser: An 'interesting mix of science, politics, and social phenomena' has moved medical marijuana to the forefront of treatment for severe drug-resistant epilepsy, says the author of a new review article on the topic.

Headlines: Steroid Shots Offer Little Relief for Some Low Back Pain
Teaser: Corticosteroid injections are commonly and increasingly used to treat radiculopathy and spinal stenosis, but their value is limited, a meta-analysis suggests.

Headlines: Metformin Intolerance Increased by Genes, Other Meds
Teaser: In two studies, certain gene variants and medications that inhibit the action of a metformin transporter in the gut increased the likelihood of drug     gastrointestinal side effects.

Headlines: Make it Easier to Give Lifesaving Naloxone, AAFP Urges
Teaser: To save lives, family physicians support making naloxone, an antidote to opioid overdose, widely accessible.

Headlines: FDA Okays Juvederm Ultra XC for Lip Augmentation
Teaser: The dermal filler is now indicated for injection into the lips and perioral area for lip augmentation in adults older than 21 years.

Headlines: ED Induced by Prostate Biopsy Likely 'Underestimated'
Teaser: A study of men with elevated PSA indicates that there is a loss of erectile function (ED) in the weeks and months after needle biopsy.

Headlines: Injuries Cost the United States $671 Billion in 2013
Teaser: Fatal and nonfatal injuries cost the United States $671 billion in 2013, with a doubling of deaths by drug poisoning, including prescription drug overdose and heroin.

Headlines: US Opioid Epidemic Fueled by Prescribing Practices
Teaser: The US opioid abuse epidemic -- the worst in the history of modern medicine -- is being fueled by inappropriate prescribing practices among medical practitioners.

Headlines: EMA Panel Backs Fentanyl Patch Ionsys for Acute Postop Pain
Teaser: Ionsys is a needle-free, patient-controlled, pre-programmed fentanyl delivery system for use in patients requiring short-term opioid analgesia after surgery.

Headlines: Opioid Agreement Ethics Challenged
Teaser: Increasingly mandated but questioned on ethical grounds, opioid agreements appear to be here to stay; experts weigh in on the pros and cons.

Headlines: Health Alert From the Ohio Department of Health
Teaser: Fentanyl is significantly contributing to the rise in Ohio drug overdose deaths.

Headlines: Adiponectin:  A Biomarker for Migraine?
Teaser: A longitudinal, ictal study of migraine shows that adiponectin and resistin levels rise along with increasing migraine severity and decline with treatment response.

Headlines: Chronic Back Pain May Be Arachnoiditis
Teaser: A small survey of patients with MRI-confirmed arachnoiditis show a common symptom of severe pain with prolonged standing; the condition may often be overlooked in chronic pain.

Headlines: DNR After In-Hospital Cardiac Arrest May Not Match Prognosis
Teaser: Do-not-resuscitate orders did not always agree with a patient's predicted likelihood of being discharged with favorable neurologic status after surviving     an in-hospital cardiac arrest, researchers report.

Headlines: Ankylosing Spondylitis Tied to Increased All-Cause Mortality
Teaser: The first large population-based study of ankylosing spondylitis found increased mortality in both male and female patients.

Headlines: One Fifth of Kids Have Complication After Tonsillectomy
Teaser: Nineteen percent of children had a postoperative complication after adenotonsillectomy, with 9.4% having respiratory compromise, the most frequent complication, and 2.6% having secondary hemorrhage.

Headlines: SCD: Algorithm Improves Veno-occlusive Episode Care in Kids
Teaser: A quality improvement algorithm using specific interventions improved ED care for vaso-occlusive episodes in children with sickle cell disease, a new study has shown.

Headlines: Fibromyalgia Linked to Deficiencies in RBC Magnesium, IGF-1
Teaser: A small study shows deficiencies in red blood cell magnesium and insulin-like growth factor 1 in patients with fibromyalgia and reflects growing interest in the role of hormones and endocrine factors in chronic pain.

Headlines: Celecoxib Use Linked to Higher Pancreatitis Risk
Teaser: Use of celecoxib is associated with an increased risk of acute pancreatitis, according to Taiwanese researchers.

Headlines: Immersive Program Shown to Help Reduce Pain, Opioid Use
Teaser: An integrative program combines therapies for physical and mental wellness, including CBT and exercise, encouraging patients to self-manage their own pain.

Headlines: FDA Reviewing Risk With Off-Label Tramadol Use in Children
Teaser: The FDA is investigating the risk for respiratory problems in children aged 17 years and younger treated with the pain medication tramadol.

Headlines: Capsaicin Patch Approved in EU for Diabetic Neuropathy Pain
Teaser: A capsaicin patch has been approved in the EU for use in diabetic neuropathy; a study reported at the EASD meeting showed the patch relieved pain and     improved sleep among such patients.

Headlines: Hip Surgery Safe, Effective in Psoriatic Arthritis
Teaser: Outcomes after hip replacement surgery are as good in patients with psoriatic arthritis or cutaneous psoriasis as in patients with OA; surgeons should not avoid offering replacement surgery as needed.

Headlines: Patients Who Feel Ready to Leave the Hospital Are More Satisfied
Teaser: In a small study of hospitalized patients, those who felt ready to go home when they were discharged were more satisfied with the hospital and their caregivers than those who didn't feel ready to go.

Headlines: Hepatocyte Growth Factor Shows Benefit for Diabetic Pain
Teaser: The nonviral gene therapy shows higher efficacy in pain relief among patients not taking pregabalin or gabapentin.

Headlines: Combined Stimulation Improves Pain, Not Outcome, in Migraine
Teaser: Combined stimulation alleviated pain for patients with chronic migraine but did not improve long-term functional outcomes, a new study shows.

Headlines: New Guidelines for Primary Palliative Care in Oncology
Teaser: The new guidance statement comes from the American Society of Clinical Oncology and the American Academy of Hospice and Palliative Medicine.

Headlines: Physician Ebola Survivor Describes Lasting Effects
Teaser: The virus was found teeming in a chamber of Dr Crozier's eye months after his hospital discharge, which raises questions about the ability of the virus to hide in 'sanctuary' spaces.

Headlines: Infant Stool Exposes Maternal Drug Use During Pregnancy
Teaser: The first feces from a newborn can reveal maternal illicit drug use as far back as the twelfth week of gestation. A 'significant' number of women tested positive in a recent pilot study.

Headlines: HRT Guidelines Favor Individualized Approach to Menopause
Teaser: The US Endocrine Society's new guidelines on the treatment of menopausal symptoms favors HRT in carefully selected women who are both bothered by their     symptoms and who want to take it.

Headlines: Ankle Fracture: No Added Value With Supervised Exercise Rehab
Teaser: After ankle fracture, a supervised exercise program does not improve recovery of activity limitation or quality of life compared with advice alone, according to a new randomized trial.

Headlines: Shiga Toxin-Producing E. coli (STEC) O157:H7 Outbreak in Vermont
Teaser: The New Hampshire Division of Public Health Services provides guidance for health professionals in the wake of a STEC outbreak in Vermont and New Hampshire.

Headlines: First Guideline on Ankylosing Spondylitis Issued by ACR
Teaser: The American College of Rheumatology has issued evidence-based treatment recommendations for ankylosing spondylitis and nonradiographic axial spondyloarthritis.

Headlines: Social Media Shaping How Drugs Are Made, Monitored
Teaser: One year of social media postings yield more information on adverse events than the entire US Food and Drug Administration database, say industry insiders.

Headlines: No Benefit From Ischemic Preconditioning at Cardiac Surgery
Teaser: It may fascinate, but two large randomized trials say it doesn't work. In them, remote ischemic preconditioning prior to on-pump cardiac surgery made no     clinical difference compared with a sham procedure.

Headlines: Bone Marrow Collection Plan Prevents Avoidable Redraws
Teaser: It's win-win when a pathology department implements a standardized protocol to improve specimen collection and facilitate communication among the healthcare team.

Headlines: New Drug Shows Benefit in NET Carcinoid Syndrome
Teaser: Telotristat etiprate is the first drug developed specifically for carcinoid syndrome, which occurs in patients with metastatic neuroendocrine tumors (NETs).

Headlines: MVD Bests Gamma Knife for Pain in Trigeminal Neuralgia
Teaser: Statistically significant differences on four parameters favored microvascular decompression over gamma knife surgery for pain relief, according to a new meta-analysis.

Headlines: Placebo Effect a Major Factor in Antidepressant Response
Teaser: The endogenous mu-opioid system is involved in inducing a placebo response in depressed patients and likely accounts for a significant proportion of the treatment response to antidepressant drugs.

Headlines: Mindfulness-Based Therapy Promising for Resistant Epilepsy
Teaser: A new study shows that adding a form of mental meditation to the care of those with resistant epilepsy improved quality of life, seizure frequency, and other measures.

Headlines: Physicians Vote to Ease Marijuana Laws, Advance Research
Teaser: Family physicians also voted to reclassify marijuana from schedule 1 to schedule 2 to make it easier to conduct such studies.

Headlines: Mandate to Curb Methadone Overdose Rejected
Teaser: Although family physicians agree that methadone overdose is a problem, they did not support a resolution calling for restrictions on the prescribing of this drug.

Headlines: Pharmacists Can Improve Palliative Care
Teaser: Adding a pharmacist to the palliative care team can help patients achieve pain goals and reduce costs by eliminating unnecessary medications, a new study shows.

Headlines: Steroid Reduces Flare After Radiation for Bone Metastases
Teaser: A few doses of steroid reduces the risk for and severity of pain flares that can occur immediately after radiation therapy, before the pain starts to recede.

Headlines: Green Light for Less Therapy for HPV Oropharyngeal Cancer
Teaser: Mounting evidence suggests that deintensification is feasible and that it reduces toxicity without compromising survival.

Headlines: Alvimopan Reduces Hospital Cost, Length of Stay
Teaser: The opioid receptor antagonist speeds recovery of bowel function after colorectal surgery and is cost-effective, a new study indicates.

Headlines: Opioid Abuse a Public Health, Not Law Enforcement, Issue
Teaser: Most adults in the US view prescription opioid abuse as a public health problem rather than a law enforcement issue, new research shows.

Headlines: AAOS: Orthopaedic Surgeons Can Help Stem Opioid Epidemic
Teaser: Orthopaedic surgeons, the third-highest prescribers of opioids, can sidestep misuse by rethinking how they prescribe, limiting opioid prescriptions before surgery, and improving prescription tracking.

Headlines: Most Patients Forget Colonoscopy Results as Time Goes By
Teaser: Physicians performing colonoscopy should take the time to examine findings from the patient's previous procedure, because patient recall is poor, new research indicates.

Headlines: Online Fatigue Self-Management Program Promising in MS
Teaser: Web-based cognitive-behavioral therapy reduces fatigue and improves activity levels in patients with multiple sclerosis.

Headlines: Complications of Anesthesia for Cataract Surgery: Rare But Possible
Teaser: Although rates are trending down, serious complications remain possible with local anesthesia for cataract surgery, according to a new study.

Headlines: Hospital Job May Hold Rude Shocks for Physicians
Teaser: Doctors can experience 'postintegration trauma syndrome' when they sell their practice and lose independence, say two hospital executives.

Headlines: US Prescription Opioid Epidemic Escalating
Teaser: New data show a slight decline in misuse of prescription opioids, but an increase in prescription opioid use disorders, frequency of use, and related deaths.

Headlines: Risk Calculator Does Not Alter Surgeons' Choice to Operate
Teaser: A surgeon's prediction of surgical risk is more accurate when an online calculator is used, but the decision to recommend surgery is unaffected, according to a new study.

Headlines: Low Back Pain: Early Physical Therapy of Modest Benefit
Teaser: Treatment of recent-onset low back pain with early physical therapy resulted in statistically significant improvement in disability, but not overall improvement at the patient level.

Headlines: 'Choosing Wisely' Reduces Some Unnecessary Testing
Teaser: The initiative, targeting overuse of certain medical procedures, led to significant declines in headache and cardiac stress imaging, but not other low-value procedures.

Headlines: UK Nurse With Ebola Critically Ill Again
Teaser: Pauline Cafferkey, the Scottish nurse who survived the Ebola virus and was thought to have made a full recovery, is now critically ill, officials say.

Headlines: Treatment Rates for Opioid Use Disorders Remain Low
Teaser: Rates of treatment for opioid use disorders haven't improved over the decade despite a dramatic increase in deaths related to prescription drugs.

Headlines: Rare but Serious Injuries With Epinephrine Autoinjectors
Teaser: Seventeen children in whom an EpiPen epinephrine autoinjector was used in response to an allergic reaction experienced preventible leg lacerations, and four needles were lodged in children's limbs.

Headlines: Refractory Dry Eye Linked With Neuropathic or Systemic Pain
Teaser: Subjective responses to artificial tears for dry eye differ based on the presence of neuropathic ocular and systemic pain, according to researchers.

Headlines: Teen Smoking May Cause Enduring Attention Problems
Teaser: Smoking in adolescence may cause attention problems that persist to adulthood, a new study of identical twins shows.

Headlines: No Benefit for High-Dose Vitamin D in Postmenopausal Women
Teaser: A randomized trial finds 1 year of high-dose vitamin D had no clinical benefit in postmenopausal women with vitamin D insufficiency, nor did a lower dose     of vitamin D, compared with placebo.

Headlines: Researchers Question Ban on Solid Food During Labor
Teaser: Some women should be allowed to eat during labor, according to a new study that challenged 70 years of medical orthodoxy.

Headlines: Low-dose Ketamine Eases Pain, Reduces Opioid Use in ED
Teaser: Studies have already shown an analgesic benefit for the sedative at higher doses, but with more serious adverse events, investigators say.

Headlines: CMSC Wants Control of MS Treatment to Stay With Prescribers
Teaser: A new position statement from the Consortium of Multiple Sclerosis Centers concludes that prescribers, not insurers, should drive decisions about disease-modifying and symptomatic treatments.

Headlines: Constipation Drug Extends Survival in Palliative Cancer Care
Teaser: A drug approved for opiate-related constipation might improve the survival of patients with advanced cancer.

Headlines: Evidence for IBS Diets Tough to Swallow
Teaser: Forget the dietary fads; gastrointestinal nutrition experts are applying scientific methods to tease out whether specific foods really do influence the course of irritable bowel syndrome (IBS).

Headlines: CDC Warning: Fentanyl-Related Fatalities Rising
Teaser: The CDC has released an alert related to a recent significant spike in fentanyl drug seizures by law enforcement and possible related fatalities.

Headlines: FDA Okays Buccal Buprenorphine (Belbuca) in Chronic Pain
Teaser: Endo Pharmaceuticals announces FDA approval for buprenorphine buccal film for the treatment of chronic pain.

Headlines: Young People Receive More Pain Relievers Than They Need
Teaser: Physicians are prescribing too many opioids for children, and families don't know what to do with the medication that doesn't get used, researchers say.

Headlines: Etiology of Ischemic Stroke Differs in Marijuana Users
Teaser: Whereas the main cause of ischemic stroke in nonusers was cardiogenic embolism, intracranial stenosis was responsible for nearly 50% of ischemic strokes in     those who smoked marijuana regularly.

Headlines: Drug-Naive Teenagers at Greater Risk for Opioid Misuse
Teaser: Risk after opioid prescription increased threefold among teenagers who had little drug experience or who disapproved of illegal drug use.

Headlines: FDA Okays Asfotase Alfa (Strensiq) for Rare Bone Disorder
Teaser: It is the first FDA-approved therapy for an inherited metabolic condition that in its most severe form can lead to respiratory failure and premature death.

Headlines: Marijuana Use, Disorders Double in US Adults
Teaser: Rates of marijuana use disorder also nearly double, but a decline is posted in prevalence of marijuana use disorder among marijuana users.

Headlines: Schizophrenia Genes Worsen Effects of Early Cannabis Use
Teaser: A new study suggests genetic risk for schizophrenia influences the impact of early cannabis use on brain maturation.

Headlines: FDA Approves First HIFU Device for Prostate Tissue Ablation
Teaser: After being nixed by their advisory committee last year, Sonablate 450, for use in prostate tissue ablation, has now received the green light from the FDA.

Headlines: Geriatrics Society Offers Alternatives to Beers Drugs
Teaser: The American Geriatrics Society is offering an evidence-based selection of alternatives to the Beers Criteria list of drugs that are problematic in the elderly.

Headlines: Dual Therapy No Better Than NSAIDs Alone for Low Back Pain
Teaser: In patients with acute nontraumatic lower back pain, adding cyclobenzaprine or oxycodone/acetaminophen to naproxen alone did not improve functional outcomes or pain at 1 week.

Headlines: Obama Plan for Opioid Abuse Stresses Prescriber Training
Teaser: The new initiative also encourages the use of buprenorphine and other forms of medication-assisted treatment for prescription drug abuse.

Headlines: Knee Replacement Improves Pain, Ups Complications in RCT
Teaser: A randomized controlled trial has confirmed greater improvement in pain and functioning but more complications for total knee replacement compared with nonsurgical treatment.

Headlines: Pharmacists Prescribe Naloxone to Prevent Overdose Deaths
Teaser: Pharmacists can play a vital role in identifying high-risk patients susceptible to opioid overdose, and more states are giving them the authority to prescribe naloxone rescue kits.

Headlines: Partial as Good as Whole-Breast Irradiation -- Clear Result
Teaser: A technique of temporary implanting of catheters to deliver radiotherapy for 4 to 5 days was as effective as whole-breast irradiation for 5 weeks.

Headlines: Anesthesia Brochures Improve Patient Engagement
Teaser: Patients are more involved in decisions about anesthesia when they know their options ahead of time, report researchers.

Headlines: Europe Concludes Syndromes Are Not Caused by HPV Vaccine
Teaser: The European Medicines Agency has concluded its safety review of the HPV vaccines, and says the evidence does not support causation of syndromes.

Headlines: FDA Approves Mepolizumab (Nucala) for Severe Asthma
Teaser: The FDA has approved mepolizumab (Nucala, GlaxoSmithKline) in combination with other asthma medications for maintenance treatment of patients aged 12 years or older with severe asthma.

Headlines: Mirror Therapy Needs Time to Work in Severe Phantom Pain
Teaser: Mirror therapy can rapidly relieve many amputees' phantom limb sensations, but the more severe the initial pain, the more time may be required for the therapy to work, new research shows.

Headlines: Parenting Magazine Ads Promote Off-Label Remedies
Teaser: The magazines in doctors' offices are endorsing more than many pediatricians realize, a new study warns, including therapies and diagnostics not approved by the US Food and Drug Administration.

Headlines: PTSD May Signal Special Sedation for Mechanical Ventilation
Teaser: For patients with pre-existing post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD), mechanical ventilation in the intensive care unit can be particularly traumatizing, new research shows.
