Headlines: Knee Lesions on MRI Likely to Worsen Into OA
Teaser: Knee lesions likely to develop into symptomatic osteoarthritis were identifiable as MRI changes in nonsymptomatic but high-risk subjects.

Headlines: Blacks, Hispanics Less Likely to Receive Regional Anesthesia
Teaser: Black and Hispanic patients who undergo hip or knee replacement are less likely than white patients to receive regional anesthesia, new research indicates.

Headlines: Acupuncture, Alexander Technique Effective in Neck Pain
Teaser: Adding acupuncture or Alexander Technique exercises to usual care reduced pain and disability in chronic neck pain in a randomized controlled trial.

Headlines: Prescription Drug Use Climbs Over 10 Years, but Cause Unclear
Teaser: Eleven drug classes saw a jump in use, but researchers say the patterns of use and polypharmacy are not explained by an aging population.

Headlines: Laryngeal Mask for Keratoplasty Anesthesia Safe, Effective
Teaser: A laryngeal mask for keratoplasty under general anesthesia appeared to be safe, lowered risk for potential ocular hypertension during recovery, and saved recovery time compared with endotracheal tube.

Headlines: Perioperative Surgical Home Improves Quality, Reduces Costs
Teaser: The careful management of a patient's surgical experience can lead to a reduction in cost and improvement in outcomes, a study of the perioperative surgical home model shows.

Headlines: Biosimilars, Tech Advances, Chikungunya Among ACR Highlights
Teaser: More than 16,000 attendees at the American College of Rheumatology (ACR) meeting will hear about the latest technology and resources to make their practices more efficient.

Headlines: Congress Passes Budget Bill That Cuts Medicare Pay in 2025
Teaser: 'It was easier to go after the doctors,' said one veteran executive of organized medicine about lawmakers paying for the 2-year budget deal in part by reducing Medicare reimbursement 10 years from now.

Headlines: Concurrent PPIs With NSAIDs May Lower Bleeding Risk Post-MI
Teaser: One expert notes that physicians should discuss whether NSAIDs are really needed for patients with a prior MI and on antiplatelet therapy. And if so, "why     not also prescribe prophylactic PPI?"

Headlines: Depression Common in Patients Awaiting Lung Transplant
Teaser: More than half of patients waiting for a lung transplant suffered from psychologic stress in a new study, which might be serious enough to affect transplant outcomes.

Headlines: FDA Clears New Combo Inhaler, Utibron Neohaler, for COPD
Teaser: Utibron Neohaler (Novartis) combines the long-acting beta2-adrenergic agonist indacaterol and the long-acting muscarinic antagonist glycopyrrolate for long-term COPD maintenance therapy.

Headlines: Oct 30 Cardiology News
Teaser: Dabigatran in women, advance practice practitioners in cardiology, burst exercise for type 2 diabetes, cannabis and ischemic stroke, and Science of the Art of Medicine are reviewed by Dr Mandrola.

Headlines: In L.A., Community Health Workers Are Part of Medical Team
Teaser: Health officials across the country face a vexing quandary â€“ how do you help the sickest and neediest patients get healthier and prevent their costly visits to emergency rooms?

Headlines: Fungal Infections From Contaminated Steroids May Recur
Teaser: The CDC has issued an update on 2012 to 2014 outcomes of the multistate outbreak of fungal infections associated with contaminated methylprednisolone injections, including recurrence.

Headlines: Tai Chi Compares to Physical Therapy for Knee Osteoarthritis
Teaser: Tai chi matched standard physical therapy for improvement in pain and physical function and showed superior improvement in overall health and emotional well-being.

Headlines: Limb Pain May Be Unrecognized Manifestation of Migraine
Teaser: Children and adults may have limb, chest, or other pain as a manifestation of migraine syndrome. A recent study shows an autosomal dominant inheritance pattern of the condition in one extended family.

Headlines: Ozone Injections Promising in Knee Osteoarthritis
Teaser: Help for people with knee osteoarthritis could come from a surprising treatment: injections of ozone gas.

Headlines: Drug Monitoring Program Could Curb Prescription Drug Abuse
Teaser: Indiana's prescription drug monitoring program has changed the way some pharmacists dispense controlled substances, results from a new survey show.

Headlines: Chronic Symptoms After HPV Vaccination: Danes Start Study
Teaser: Danish specialists are investigating more than 1300 girls with chronic symptoms after HPV vaccination.

Headlines: Suicide, Addiction Prime Drivers of Rising US Mortality
Teaser: Deaths among white middle-aged Americans increased significantly between 1999 and 2013, with much of the increase driven by suicide and addiction disorders, new research shows.

Headlines: Customized Physical Therapy May Ease Lower Back Pain
Teaser: Customized physical therapy may provide more relief for lower back pain than general advice on the best ways to remain active, an Australian study suggests.

Headlines: Deeper Grasp of Chemotherapy-Induced Peripheral Neuropathy
Teaser: Two unrelated studies provide deeper insights into chemotherapy-induced peripheral neuropathy.

Headlines: Food Allergy Connected to Irritable Bowel Syndrome
Teaser: For some patients with irritable bowel syndrome, new research suggests that atopy and food allergy could be related to the stomach irritation.

Headlines: Perioperative Medication Errors Plague Surgeries
Teaser: Previous literature on perioperative medication error rates underestimated true error rates, according to a new prospective study.

Headlines: Chondroitin Rivals Celecoxib for Osteoarthritis Symptoms
Teaser: Chondroitin, often considered more a nutritional supplement than a treatment option, reduces cartilage loss in patients with osteoarthritis, and symptom relief matched celecoxib, report researchers.

Headlines: New Study Homes in on Joint Improvements Post Bariatric Surgery
Teaser: A 3-year study provides insight into which patients are likely to have less joint pain and more mobility after bariatric surgery.

Headlines: Off-Label Drug Use Linked to More Adverse Events
Teaser: This is 'the most extensive and informative study to evaluate the safety of off-label drug use in an adult population to date,' experts said.

Headlines: RA: No 'Sound Evidence' to Support Use of Cannabinoids
Teaser: Available studies do not support the use of medical marijuana in rheumatic disorders, although there is merit to further research, authors of a  systematic review concluded.

Headlines: FDA Gives 'Tentative' Approval to Abuse-Deterrent Xtampza ER
Teaser: Final approval of the extended-release chronic pain medication is pending the outcome of patent litigation, the company reports.

Headlines: Parents Influence Children's Drinking and Drug Use
Teaser: Most adolescents who use alcohol or other drugs at home report negative consequences of their substance use, a new survey indicates.

Headlines: NY Docs Must Complete 4-Hour CME to Prescribe Marijuana
Teaser: Advocates said that the cost and time of the required course will dampen enthusiasm.

Headlines: Adverse Reaction to Aspirin Often Misdiagnosed as Allergy
Teaser: Many physicians erroneously label adverse reactions to aspirin as allergic, depriving cardiology patients of access to cost-effective therapy.

Headlines: FDA Panel Backs Sugammadex for Neuromuscular Blockade Reversal
Teaser: An FDA panel voted unanimously to recommend sugammadex for reversal of moderate or deep neuromuscular blockade induced by rocuronium or vecuronium during surgery.

Headlines: Mexico Court Ruling Sparks High Hopes for Marijuana Legalization
Teaser: Mexico's Supreme Court on Wednesday gave the green light to growing marijuana for recreational use in a landmark decision that could lead to legalization in a country with a bloody history of conflict with drug cartels.

Headlines: Biosimilars, Antiplatelets, Oncolytics in Spotlight at ASHP
Teaser: More than 20,000 pharmacy professionals from 100 countries will gather in the Big Easy to discuss ways to improve patient care and medication safety with cutting-edge drug options.

Headlines: Appendicitis: Longer Antibiotic Treatment May Not Help
Teaser: Appendectomy patients should know that extended treatment with antibiotics may not improve outcomes.

Headlines: Cardiac Sonographers Extra Prone to Back, Neck, Wrist Pain
Teaser: Staff in the echo lab were even more likely to have work-related musculoskeletal pain than technicians in the cath lab, in a new study.

Headlines: No FDA Nod for Second Nasal Naloxone in Opioid Overdose
Teaser: The FDA has declined approval for an intranasal naloxone spray for the emergency treatment of opioid overdose.

Headlines: Mindfulness Meditation 'Better Than Placebo' for Pain Relief
Teaser: Pain relief through mindfulness meditation not only is significantly greater than that achieved by placebo but also utilizes different neural mechanisms, say US researchers.

Headlines: FDA Approves Nivolumab for Renal Cell Carcinoma
Teaser: The immunotherapy is the first treatment to show a survival benefit as a second-line therapy in patients with advanced disease.

Headlines: Stroke Risk Factors Differ Between Younger Men and Women
Teaser: Modifiable risk factors for ischemic stroke in younger patients differ between men and women and may be important for secondary prevention. Nonetheless, both sexes generally have favorable outcomes.

Headlines: Public Health Group Calls for Action to Curb Opioid Abuse
Teaser: A new policy statement from the American Public Health Association outlines a comprehensive approach to fighting prescription drug abuse.

Headlines: EMA Panel Backs Episalvan for Partial-Thickness Wounds
Teaser: Made from birch bark extract, Episalvan can reduce the healing time of wounds in which the upper layers of the skin have been damaged, for example by a burn or during surgical skin grafting.

Headlines: New Dry Eye Gel Improves Some, but Not All, Symptoms
Teaser: A carbomer-based lipid-containing artificial tear formulation improved patients' ocular surface staining grades and ocular irritation symptom scores and decreased symptoms in patients with dry eye.

Headlines: First Enbrel Biosimilar Recommended for Approval in Europe
Teaser: The EMA has recommended Benepali, an etanercept biosimilar for the treatment of rheumatoid arthritis, psoriatic arthritis, axial spondyloarthritis, and plaque psoriasis.

Headlines: As Rx Prices Rise, More Say Meds Are Affordable
Teaser: -- Medications are becoming more expensive for the sickest people, but at the same time, theyâ€™ve never been more affordable for the majority of Americans.

Headlines: Cataract Surgery Has Benefits in Patients With Dementia
Teaser: Cataract surgery improves vision, cognitive function, and neuropsychiatric symptoms in patients with dementia, a new study shows.

Headlines: Amphetamine Doesn't Make a Terrorist, but It Contributes
Teaser: Is captagon the terrorist's amphetamine of choice? In any case, the name crops up all too often.

Headlines: Upsurge in Female Opioid Addiction Tied to Prescribed Pain Meds
Teaser: Women are disproportionately affected by opioid addiction from prescription painkillers, new research shows.

Headlines: FDA Approves Narcan Nasal Spray to Treat Opioid Overdose
Teaser: The FDA approved a nasal spray form of naloxone, a drug that immediately stops or reverses the effects of opioid overdose.

Headlines: Drug Use Disorders Go Untreated in Millions of Americans
Teaser: Recent and lifetime drug use disorder affects millions of Americans and is associated with a wide range of other comorbidities, including alcohol and nicotine abuse.

Headlines: New Approach to Fibromyalgia Tackles Poor-Quality Sleep
Teaser: For patients with fibromyalgia, improving the quality of sleep can help improve other features of the syndrome, including pain, new analyses show.

Headlines: Dexamethasone Plug Improves Postsurgical Pain, Inflammation
Teaser: The hydrogel plug implanted after cataract surgery has a strong safety profile, lasts for about 30 days, dissolves on its own, and eliminates issues of compliance with eyedrops, new research shows.

Headlines: Report Calls for Far-reaching Reforms to Stem Opioid Abuse
Teaser: A comprehensive report calls for mandatory prescription monitoring programs, expanded naloxone access, tamper-resistant drug packaging, and other measures to tackle the problem.

Headlines: Prevent Addiction in Pediatric IBD Patients at High Risk
Teaser: Some children and adolescents with inflammatory bowel disease are at higher risk for chronic narcotic use and dependence. Evidence-based clinical strategies for prevention and treatment can help.

Headlines: Alectinib Approved in US for Refractory ALK-Positive NSCLC
Teaser: Another ALK-targeted therapy has been approved for use in patients who no longer respond to crizotinib, but this one is also active on brain metastases.

Headlines: Gabapentin New Drug of Abuse?
Teaser: The nonmedical use of gabapentin is on the rise, particularly among substance abuse patients in rehabilitation programs, researchers say.

Headlines: Disaster Medicine: Dealing With the Paris Terror Attacks
Teaser: The Surgeon General Henri Julien, president of the French Society for Disaster Medicine, gave his analysis of the care given to the victims of the attacks of November 13.

Headlines: Inflammation Plays an Unsuspected Role in Knee OA Pain
Teaser: Inflammation was more important than mechanical stress for causing the progressive, centrally mediated pain associated with knee osteoarthritis.

Headlines: Wearable Seizure Detection Devices Promising
Teaser: New portable devices that monitor for seizures are lighter, smaller, and better than before, researchers say.

Headlines: ER Naltrexone Halts Opioid Relapse in At-Risk Population
Teaser: In a large, randomized trial, extended-release naltrexone prevented opioid relapse among adults in the criminal justice system.

Headlines: Slower Knee Cartilage Degeneration Seen After Weight Loss
Teaser: New research suggests that losing weight can slow the progression of knee cartilage degeneration in overweight and obese adults - and the more pounds shed, the better.

Headlines: Laws Viewing Opioids as Prenatal Child Abuse Impede Care
Teaser: The criminal justice system underutilizes medication-assisted treatment for pregnant women with opioid use disorders, especially in states with prenatal child abuse laws, a new study suggests.

Headlines: ASCO and ACS Issue Guideline on Breast Cancer Survivor Care
Teaser: Recommendations in five key posttreatment areas do not support for routine lab and imaging tests for asymptomatic patients.

Headlines: U.S. Salmonella Outbreak Across Nine States Investigated
Teaser: A salmonella outbreak that has sickened 11 people in nine states could be linked to a line of nut butter spreads that were recalled this week, a U.S. health agency said on Thursday.

Headlines: MRI Incompletions Drop After Comfort Training
Teaser: When MRI technicians are trained to choose their words carefully and to be aware of their body language, incomplete imaging and no-show rates decline, a new study shows.

Headlines: FDA Nod for Algovita Spinal Cord Stimulator in Chronic Pain
Teaser: The FDA has approved the Algovita spinal cord stimulation system for patients with chronic, intractable pain.

Headlines: Human Tularemia Cases Rising in Some States, CDC Reports
Teaser: The CDC reported a dramatic increase in human tularemia cases from January to September 2015 in Colorado, Nebraska, South Dakota, and Wyoming.

Headlines: EMA OKs Nucala for Severe Refractory Eosinophilic Asthma
Teaser: The European Medicines Agency has approved mepolizumab as an add-on treatment for severe refractory eosinophilic asthma in adults.

Headlines: Treatment Innovations to Headline Bowel Diseases Conference
Teaser: Biosimilar drugs, new approaches to complex patients, and discussions about challenging inflammatory bowel disease will be highlighted at the Crohn's and Colitis Foundation of America meeting.

Headlines: Asthma Appears to Double Chronic Migraine Risk
Teaser: A history of asthma doubled the risk for episodic migraine progressing to chronic migraine, but absolute risk remains low.

Headlines: Readers Name Biggest Medical Stories of 2015
Teaser: The debut of the ICD-10 diagnostic codes topped the list, followed by California's approval of physician-assisted suicide. The end of the 10-year MOC exam ranked as the most exciting piece of news.

Headlines: Opioid Abuse and the Media: Attitude Adjustment Required
Teaser: News reports depict opioid abuse as a criminal issue rather than as a public health problem or treatable health condition, but times are changing.

Headlines: AAP Guidelines Address Perioperative Anesthesia Environment
Teaser: New guidelines from the American Academy of Pediatrics on the pediatric perioperative anesthesia environment identify key components to optimize anesthetic care and reduce adverse events.

Headlines: Psychiatry 2015 News Quiz: Test Your Smarts
Teaser: Got a nose for news? Test your knowledge of the top news in psychiatry this year.

Headlines: Sadness-Induced Inflammation May Up Comorbid Disease Risk
Teaser: Sadness increases levels of inflammatory proteins in the blood in healthy and depressed persons, suggesting it may up the risk for medical comorbidities, including diabetes and heart disease.

Headlines: Opioid Overdose Deaths Hit Record High
Teaser: In 2014, opioid overdose deaths hit record levels with an 'alarming' 14% increase in a single year, say federal health officials.

Headlines: EMA Panel Backs Two Octocog Alfa Products for Hemophilia A
Teaser: Iblias and Kovaltry from Bayer Pharma AG are indicated for treatment and prevention of bleeding in patients with hemophilia A.

Headlines: CDC Opioid Guideline Lands, Controversy Continues
Teaser: A new group tasked with revising the guideline will include pain patients.

Headlines: FDA Approves Fecal Incontinence Treatment Device
Teaser: The Fenix Continence Restoration System is indicated for patients in whom other treatments have failed or are not possible.

Headlines: American Teeth no Healthier Than English Counterparts
Teaser: Contrary to the popular stereotype, English grins are toothier than American ones, a new study showed.

Headlines: Shingles Increases Risk for Stroke and Myocardial Infarction
Teaser: Two studies found an association between shingles and stroke, but only the one using self-controls over time identified an increased risk for heart attack.

Headlines: Many Kids With Uncomplicated Appendicitis Can Skip Surgery
Teaser: Most children and their families who opted for nonoperative management of uncomplicated appendicitis avoided surgery at 1 year, supporting the idea of patient choice.

Headlines: Symptoms Persist Despite Recovery From Ebola Virus
Teaser: Survivors of Ebola virus disease may still experience persistent clinical symptoms, according to new data from the CDC.

Headlines: Opioid Overprescribing Not Limited to a Few Bad Apples
Teaser: The bulk of prescriptions for opioid painkillers are written by the broad swath of general practitioners, not by a limited group of specialists, new Medicare data suggest.

Headlines: Testosterone Levels May Play Part in Uterine Fibroid Risk
Teaser: The "male" hormone has been underestimated in women's health, lead author says. Findings may inspire physicians to look beyond estrogen and progesterone to     find what's causing these benign tumors.

Headlines: FDA Clears Sugammadex for Neuromuscular Blockade Reversal
Teaser: Sugammadex injection is for reversal of moderate or deep neuromuscular blockade induced by rocuronium or vecuronium during surgery.

Headlines: The Vicious 'Sleep-Seizure' Cycle in Epilepsy
Teaser: Researchers are making headway in pinpointing factors involved in the interaction between sleep and epilepsy.

Headlines: High-Potency Cannabis Linked to Brain Damage, Experts Warn
Teaser: High-potency cannabis damages the white matter in the corpus callosum independently of psychosis risk, say researchers, who warn of the urgent need to educate healthcare professionals and the public.

Headlines: Ketamine for Refractory Status Epilepticus?
Teaser: Ketamine, used for analgesia and sedation, is increasingly being used to treat refractory status epilepticus, but only for the most critically ill children, a new study suggests.

Headlines: Dramatic Rise in Older Adults Seeking Opioid Addiction Tx
Teaser: There has been a marked demographic shift in adults aged 50 years and older seeking opioid addiction treatment, new research shows.

Headlines: Prescription Drug Abuse Raises Suicide Risk in Teens
Teaser: A new study ties nonmedical use of prescription pain relievers, stimulants, and depressants to increased risk for suicidal ideation in adolescents.

Headlines: Pharmacists Play Key Role in Mitigating Medication Errors
Teaser: Human and system errors during code situations are frequent, but pharmacists can have a protective effect.

Headlines: Adhesion Barrier Linked to Immediate Postoperative Complications
Teaser: The use of adhesion barrier in hysterectomy and myomectomy is associated with a higher incidence of immediate postoperative complications, including fever and ileus and bowel obstruction.

Headlines: After Great Pain, a Cold Cap for Chemo Hair Loss Came
Teaser: Refrigeration expertise and anguish from the adverse effects of breast cancer chemotherapy came together in a British family, and gave rise to technologic innovation.

Headlines: Intravaginal DHEA Eases Postmenopausal Vaginal Dryness, Pain
Teaser: Daily intravaginal DHEA suppositories give relief to postmenopausal women for whom sex is painful, but who cannot or do not want to use estrogen treatments.

Headlines: Shingles Risk 70% Higher for Adults With Asthma
Teaser: Researchers suggest considering zoster vaccine for those aged 50 years and older with asthma. Their findings build on their previous work showing a link between childhood asthma and shingles.

Headlines: Powered Intracapsular Tonsillectomy Improves Obstructive Sleep Apnea in Kids
Teaser: Powered intracapsular tonsillectomy and adenoidectomy (PITA) improves measures of obstructive sleep apnea (OSA) in children, according to a retrospective case series.

Headlines: 'Liquid Biopsy' May Help Guide Treatment in Prostate Cancer
Teaser: Single CTC morphology, protein, and genomic characterization are feasible and can be used to assess tumor heterogeneity and potentially guide treatment decisions.

Headlines: Primary School Kids 'Eat Own Weight in Sugar'
Teaser: Parents are being urged to get to grips with how much sugar their kids are eating and drinking as new figures show that young children are consuming the equivalent of 5,543 sugar cubes each year.

Headlines: Dry Eye Disease Does Not Worsen With Time in Most Patients
Teaser: Early presentation with severe symptoms is the strongest predictor of progression.

Headlines: Secukinumab Effective for Ankylosing Spondylitis in Phase 3 Trials
Teaser: A 150-mg subcutaneous monthly secukinumab dose achieved the best results, but there was no added benefit from an intravenous loading dose in ankylosing spondylitis, according to interim phase 3 data.

Headlines: Survey: Doctors, Patients Concerned About Opioid Dangers
Teaser: New Medscape and WebMD surveys show most doctors and patients first try alternatives to opioids because of safety concerns, but providers don't always discuss safe storage and patients report keeping their extra pills for future use.

Headlines: Nonfatal Opioid Overdose No Bar to Further Prescriptions
Teaser: The vast majority of patients continue to receive opioid prescriptions after overdosing on the medications, a finding one doctor called 'astonishing.'

Headlines: Peyronie's Disease: Surgical Technique Improves Outcomes
Teaser: 'Sliding' technique helped some men with severe Peyronie's disease.

Headlines: Misperceptions Drive Pot Use Among Patients With Glaucoma
Teaser: Patients with glaucoma are more likely to use marijuana for treatment if they believe it is safe and effective, according to a new study.

Headlines: Most Lumbar MRI Referrals Show Abnormalities in Scans
Teaser: More than half the patients reported sciatica symptoms for at least 6 weeks, and a majority of patients had disc herniation and/or nerve root compression, a study has found.

Headlines: FDA Approves Zurampic for Patients With Gout
Teaser: Zurampic (lesinurad) is approved to treat hyperuricemia associated with gout in combination with a xanthine oxidase inhibitor.

Headlines: California Details 59 Cases of Rare Polio-like Syndrome
Teaser: Most cases of a rare polio-like syndrome have occurred in children and young adults and the precise cause remains unclear, although a viral cause is highly suspected.

Headlines: FDA Clears Selexipag for Pulmonary Arterial Hypertension
Teaser: The oral IP prostacyclin receptor agonist is indicated to delay disease progression and reduce the risk for hospitalization in adults with PAH.

Headlines: Quiz: New Rheumatology Guidelines, Names, Warnings in 2015
Teaser: With 2015 coming to a close, here is a chance to look back and see how well you remember the news from this year. Our most popular stories in rheumatology included policy news, as well as drug approvals, drug warnings, and even a new name for a common illness.

Headlines: 2015 Ob/Gyn News Quiz
Teaser: With 2015 coming to a close, here's a chance to look back and see how well you remember the obstetrics and gynecology news from this year.

Headlines: Quiz: Top Neurology News of 2015
Teaser: Test your knowledge on some of the stories most read by neurologists on Medscape over the last 12 months.

Headlines: News Quiz: Top Pediatrics Stories From 2015
Teaser: Allergies, vaccines, strep throat, and bronchiolitis were among the most popular topics in pediatrics news in 2015. How well do you remember the news from stories most read by pediatricians? Find out with the short quiz below.

Headlines: Skip Step 2, Use Low-Dose Morphine for Moderate Cancer Pain
Teaser: The WHO three-step analgesic ladder should be switched to a two-step approach that bypasses weak opioids and goes straight to low-dose morphine for moderate cancer pain, Italian researchers suggest.

Headlines: New PAI Guidelines Stress Importance of Treating Adrenal Crisis
Teaser: The first-ever Endocrine Society clinical-practice guidelines on diagnosis and management of primary adrenal insufficiency in adults and children stress     the urgency of treating adrenal crisis.

Headlines: Physician Who Ran Pill-Mill 'Zoo' Gets 12 Years in Prison
Teaser: Kevin Lowe, MD, watched the chaos created by addicts, fake patients, and oxycodone traffickers on surveillance cameras, and collected millions of dollars in the process, prosecutors said.

Headlines: Hyperbaric Oxygen Does Not Help Chronic Diabetic Foot Ulcers
Teaser: Diabetic patients with chronic foot ulcers who received hyperbaric oxygen therapy had the same amputation risk and no better wound healing than those who     received sham therapy in a new study.

Headlines: CDC, ACP Issue Guideline on Antibiotic Use for RTIs
Teaser: 'Providers should apply strict criteriaâ€¦to determine when antibiotics are needed,' a guideline author said.

Headlines: Who Is Caring for Cancer Survivors: Oncologists or PCPs?
Teaser: Even in an integrated healthcare model, there is still uncertainty and disagreement about the optimal model of care for cancer survivors.

Headlines: Medical, Behavioral Intervention Improves Arthritis Care
Teaser: A low-intensity combined osteoarthritis patient and provider intervention modestly improved self-reported functional outcome.

Headlines: Exercise Reduces Risk for Low Back Pain
Teaser: Exercise, alone or in combination with education, may reduce the risk for low back pain, according to a new systematic review and meta-analysis.

Headlines: FDA Panel Gives Cautious Thumbs Up to Opioid Delivery System
Teaser: An FDA advisory committee recommends approval of implant that promises to reduce problem of diversion and abuse.

Headlines: Frozen, Thawed Fecal Microbiota Effective for C difficile
Teaser: Frozen and thawed fecal microbiota transplantation successfully treats Clostridium difficile infections.

Headlines: CDC Opioid Guideline Panel Set to Review Draft
Teaser: A newly appointed panel of experts will meet later this month to review the proposed opioid prescribing guidelines.

Headlines: Wider Eligibility for Heart Transplantation in New Guidelines
Teaser: The ISHLT's 10-year guidelines overhaul relaxes restrictions on weight, age, comorbidities, and other criteria and make a broader-than-ever range of patients eligible for wait listing.

Headlines: Steep Rise in Opioid Use in Pregnancy, Infants Pay the Price
Teaser: High opioid prescribing rates have likely contributed to a recent rise in neonatal abstinence syndrome, NIDA director says.

Headlines: Emergency Care Drug Shortages Rose 435% in 2008-2014
Teaser: 'Many of those medications are for life-threatening conditions, and for some drugs no substitute is available,' the senior author said.

Headlines: Scrambler Therapy Benefit in Cancer-Related Neuropathic Pain
Teaser: Noninvasive scrambler therapy is emerging as a potential option for the treatment of cancer-related neuropathic pain, although uptake remains limited in the absence of major clinical trials.

Headlines: Joint Guideline Addresses Geriatric Perioperative Care
Teaser: The American College of Surgeons and American Geriatrics Society have issued joint best practice recommendations for geriatric perioperative care.

Headlines: Motor Control Exercises Help Ease Lower Back Pain
Teaser: This type of exercise, which strengthens muscles supporting the spine, reduces pain but is not superior to other exercise interventions.

Headlines: Hypnosis During Awake Surgery for Glioma Has Positive Impact
Teaser: In most patients undergoing awake surgery for low-grade glioma resection, hypnosis allows for the safe surgical removal of the tumor and has a positive psychologic impact.

Headlines: FDA Approves Diabetic Foot Ulcer Indication for Omnigraft
Teaser: Previously licensed for burn treatment, the dermal matrix is now approved for treatment of certain nonhealing diabetic foot ulcers, in conjunction with     standard treatment.

Headlines: Recro Pharma's Lead Painkiller Succeeds in Mid-Stage Trial
Teaser: Recro Pharma Inc said its lead painkiller reduced pain in post-operative orthopedic surgery patients and was safe and well tolerated, in a mid-stage trial.

Headlines: Headaches in Women With Migraine Rise in Perimenopause
Teaser: It's official: women with migraine experienced more frequent headaches during perimenopause than at other times, a new study shows.

Headlines: Califf for Commish? Opposition Rocks Senate Confirmation Process
Teaser: Among the issues: Does Robert Califf's past work involving industry disqualify him for the top FDA post? Depends on who is asked; some say yes, and others say the relationships may be an asset.

Headlines: Nonadherence to ADHD Meds: Red Flag for Illicit Drug Use?
Teaser: Urine samples from ADHD patients show higher rates of illicit drug use among those nonadherent to prescribed stimulant medications.

Headlines: Tiny but Dangerous: The Mosquitoes Spreading Zika
Teaser: Theyâ€™re tiny. They attack with supreme stealth, biting in full daylight with no buzz and no sting. And they carry viruses that can be lethal to their preferred food source: us.

Headlines: Prenatal Exposure to Household Chemicals Hurts Kids' Cognition
Teaser: Prenatal exposure to common household chemicals, such as those used in upholstery and nonstick cookware, appears to increase the risk for cognitive and behavioral problems in children, new research shows.

Headlines: AHA Releases First Scientific Statement on Acute MI in Women
Teaser: The association reports that instead of a "Hollywood heart attack," more women than men present with atypical symptoms, such as shortness of breath, which     can affect both diagnosis and treatment.

Headlines: CHMP Recommends Coagadex for Factor X Deficiency
Teaser: The medicine can be used as treatment for acute bleeding or as prophylaxis in patients with hereditary factor X deficiency.

Headlines: FDA Okays Onzetra Xsail Intranasal Migraine Medication
Teaser: The product, a low-dose sumatriptan powder delivered intranasally, promises to provide targeted and efficient delivery with the potential for 'fast, consistent relief.'

Headlines: Trump Drug Cost Comments Raise New Risks for Pharma Stocks
Teaser: Comments from Republican presidential front-runner Donald Trump that Medicare could reap huge savings by negotiating with drugmakers raise new risks for the biotech and pharmaceutical industries, whose shares have been pressured by criticism from Democrats.

Headlines: Endoscopic Sleeve Gastroplasty May Be a New Tool for Obesity
Teaser: A promising small study in 25 moderately obese patients suggests that this less costly potential alternative to bariatric surgery could provide a new tool     to tackle obesity, say researchers.

Headlines: Eribulin Approved for Liposarcoma, Improves Survival
Teaser: Already approved for use in breast cancer, eribulin is the first drug to show an improved overall survival in patients with liposarcoma.

Headlines: Updated AAP Guidelines Address Procedural Pain in Newborns
Teaser: The American Academy of Pediatrics has published an updated policy statement summarizing current evidence on the prevention, assessment, and management of pain in newborns.

Headlines: U.S. Senator Markey Places Hold on Obama's Nominee to Lead FDA
Teaser: Democratic U.S. Senator Edward Markey of Massachusetts said on Monday he has placed a hold on President Barack Obama's nominee to head the Food and Drug Administration until the agency agrees to reform its process for approving opioid painkillers.

Headlines: Mixed Opioid Agent Adds to Growing List of Therapies for IBS-D
Teaser: Studies suggest a new oral agent with mixed opioid effects may be a promising new option for irritable bowel syndrome with diarrhea; its approval adds to the growing list of options for the disorder.

Headlines: Topiramate for Substance Use: Upside/Downside
Teaser: Topiramate, which has shown promise as a treatment for substance use disorders, reduces the amount of cannabis users consume, but at the cost of increased adverse effects.

Headlines: Anesthesia and Cognitive Decline: No Link?
Teaser: There is no significant link between anesthesia and mild cognitive impairment, according to a large, population-based study.

Headlines: Abrupt Dip in Hydrocodone Prescriptions After Rescheduling
Teaser: Primary care doctors and surgeons account for most of the change in prescription of hydrocodone combination products, new data suggest.

Headlines: FDA Approves Botox for Lower Limb Spasticity
Teaser: The FDA has approved a new indication for Allergan's Botox (onabotulinumtoxinA): lower limb spasticity seen after stroke and in other neurologic disorders.

Headlines: Skin Glue Reduces IV Failure Rate in the Emergency Department
Teaser: Securing peripheral intravenous catheters with skin glue in the emergency department leads to lower failure rates, according to a new randomized trial.

Headlines: Debate Over Physician-Assisted Dying at 'Turning Point'
Teaser: Several editorials in the special JAMA issue dedicated to death and dying point to a climate change in opinions about physician-assisted dying.

Headlines: Eribulin Makes 3: Changing Treatment Landscape for Sarcoma
Teaser: After a 40-year dearth of new treatments, three new drugs have been approved for soft-tissue sarcomas.

Headlines: Cutting Cancer Drug Costs: No Pain, No Gain
Teaser: Public policy changes could help control the escalating cost of cancer drugs, but not without making tradeoffs in the process, say some experts.

Headlines: New Consumer Advice on Prostate Cancer Includes 'Value'
Teaser: New consumer advice guides include information on the 'relative value of treatments,' but the guide on prostate cancer has been met with criticism.

Headlines: Venlafaxine Tied to Increased Postpartum Hemorrhage Risk
Teaser: Serotonin-norepinephrine reuptake inhibitor exposure in the last 4 weeks of pregnancy increased postpartum hemorrhage odds in multiple analyses before and after adjustment.

Headlines: Local Zika Transmissions Confirmed in a US Territory
Teaser: A CDC report noted that because the mosquito carrying the virus lives throughout Puerto Rico, the 3.5 million residents on the island, including about 37,000 pregnant women a year, are at risk.

Headlines: EMA on Lowering Risk of Diabetic Ketoacidosis With SGLT2 Inhibitors
Teaser: The EMA completes review of risk of diabetic ketoacidosis with the use of SGLT2 inhibitors in type 2 diabetes and urges medics to look out for atypical     presentation with only mildly elevated glucose levels.

Headlines: Oral Opioids No Better Than NSAIDs for Knee OA Pain
Teaser: A new systematic review has challenged the assumption that oral opioids provide stronger pain relief than NSAIDs in knee osteoarthritis.

Headlines: Biggest Ever Infectious Disease Survey to Speed End of Trachoma
Teaser: The scale and quality of the survey mean trachoma, an extremely painful disease which causes blindness, could be eliminated by 2020.

Headlines: Meniscus Surgery Criteria Called Into Question
Teaser: Catching and locking may not provide reliable indications that arthroscopic partial meniscectomy is warranted.

Headlines: Physician Gets 30-Year Sentence for Overdose Murders
Teaser: Hsiu Ying 'Lisa' Tseng was the first physician convicted of murder for overprescribing drugs that led to a patient's death, according to the DEA.

Headlines: AAPM Pain Meeting Puts Focus on Primary Care
Teaser: The upcoming meeting of the American Academy of Pain Medicine promises 'something for everyone,' says the meeting's program chair.

Headlines: Physicians, Brett Favre Figure Into Pain Cream Scandal
Teaser: Some pharmacies that compound pain creams similar to the kind touted by the retired quarterback have bribed physicians to write the prescriptions, federal prosecutors say.

Headlines: Self-harm in Teens: Rapid Response With Novel Behavior Therapy
Teaser: A form of behavioral therapy adapted for adolescents significantly reduces self-harm and leads to earlier improvements in psychiatric outcomes, results of a Norwegian study indicate.

Headlines: Ketoacidosis Is Bariatric Surgery Risk in Type 1 Diabetes
Teaser: A Cleveland Clinic case series identifies DKA following bariatric surgery in 25% of type 1 and 0.2% of insulin-treated type 2 patients.

Headlines: Side Effects With Sorafenib More Pronounced in Thyroid Cancer
Teaser: The incidence of side effects from the oral multikinase inhibitor sorafenib appears to be considerably higher among patients with differentiated thyroid cancer than those with renal cell or hepatocellular carcinoma.

Headlines: Marijuana Use Impairs Verbal Memory
Teaser: Long-term marijuana use may significantly impair verbal memory by middle age, warn researchers, who found that other aspects of cognitive function were unaffected.

Headlines: FDA Expands Use of Single-Use Antiemetic Fosaprepitant
Teaser: The FDA has approved single-dose fosaprepitant dimeglumine to prevent delayed nausea and vomiting in patients who receive moderately emetogenic chemotherapy.

Headlines: Increase in Norovirus Activity in New Hampshire
Teaser: With 16 reports of acute gastroenteritis outbreaks in institutional settings, 7 outbreaks reported in the last week alone, the state is recommending policies for the prevention of norovirus outbreaks.

Headlines: Amgen on GAUSS-3: Evolocumab Meets LDL-Based Primary End Points
Teaser: Teasing with top-line results, the company says the PCSK9 inhibitor dropped LDL-C vs ezetimibe at 24 weeks in patients intolerant of statins, similar to     what was shown in the 12-week GAUSS-2 trial.

Headlines: FDA Unveils Sweeping Changes to Opioid Policies
Teaser: The FDA will reassess their approach to opioid medications, including the review and approval process and postmarket requirements.

Headlines: Medical Marijuana and Driving
Teaser: A pain expert cautions about the medical and potential legal risks of patients driving under the influence of medical marijuana.

Headlines: Injectable HIV Prevention Drug Well Tolerated in Early Study
Teaser: Long-acting cabotegravir, developed to increase adherence, is a safe and effective pre-exposure prophylaxis for men at low risk for HIV, but most reported injection-site pain.

Headlines: How Should Physicians Respond to Racist Patients?
Teaser: A framework for assessing and responding to a patient's request on the basis of race or ethnicity can help clinicians navigate a painful, yet often inevitable, experience.

Headlines: Ultra-Low-Dose Opioid May Quash Severe Suicidal Ideation
Teaser: Short-term use of ultra-low-dose buprenorphine may reduce suicidal ideation in severely depressed patients, new research shows.

Headlines: State, City Officials Seek Boxed Warning for Opioids, Benzos
Teaser: The officials said they aim to reduce coprescribing because of a rise in overdose from concurrent use.

Headlines: Smokers Warned of Amputation Risk
Teaser: Smokers are being warned that they are at higher risk of amputation because the habit can cause a vascular disease.

Headlines: FDA Call to Action on Opioids Met With Skepticism
Teaser: Reaction to the agency's recent announcement introducing sweeping changes to opioid policies is a little skeptical of both the motives behind it and what can realistically be achieved.

Headlines: Positive Long-term Results for Back Pain Procedure
Teaser: A study of patients undergoing intradiscal biacuplasty that uses radiofrequency ablation found positive results for pain, function, and quality of life at 12 months.

Headlines: Opioids for Depression: Novel Treatment Tested
Teaser: The combination of buprenorphine and samidorphan shows some efficacy as an adjunctive therapy for treatment-resistant major depression.

Headlines: Ganglion Block Beats Blood Patch for Dural Puncture Headache
Teaser: This approach should be the first-line therapy for obstetric patients experiencing postdural puncture headache, researchers say.

Headlines: Meditation Provides Short-Term Relief of Back Pain in Seniors
Teaser: A new study has found that although short-term improvements may be noted among older adults using meditation to help manage lower back pain, the effects are not long-lasting.

Headlines: Oral Steroids, NSAIDs Equally Safe, Effective for Acute Gout
Teaser: A large, multicenter randomized trial found that oral prednisolone and oral indomethacin were equally effective at reducing acute gout pain in patients presenting to emergency departments.

Headlines: US Senate Clears Way for Vote on Califf FDA Nomination
Teaser: Today's cloture vote on the confirmation process for Dr Robert Califf as FDA chief clears holds and a threatened filibuster, making way for a final vote scheduled for later this week.

Headlines: Wide Variation Seen in Medicare Inpatient Cholecystectomy Outcomes
Teaser: Outcomes of inpatient laparoscopic cholecystectomy in Medicare patients vary widely among hospitals, and most adverse outcomes occur well after patients have been discharged, new findings show.

Headlines: Mentoring May Help Teens Cope With Chronic Pain
Teaser: Adolescents dealing with chronic pain may benefit from the advice and support of a young adult who has learned to manage similar symptoms, a Canadian pilot study suggests.

Headlines: Are Smoking, Obesity Risky With Spinal Stimulation for Pain?
Teaser: A new study has shown that being overweight or a smoker does not affect efficacy or increase complication rates associated with implanted spinal cord stimulators.

Headlines: Epidural Steroid Injections Cut Spending for Low Back Pain
Teaser: The reduced medical costs were especially apparent for patients with radiculitis, researchers say.

Headlines: Adding an Antipsychotic Helps Treat Pain
Teaser: A literature review finds that the atypical antipsychotic olanzapine has the most evidence supporting its use in various pain syndromes.

Headlines: Electronic Health Record Data May Sharpen Diabetes Screening
Teaser: A "big-data" study finds potentially new risk factors for type 2 diabetes that could improve patient detection without increasing costs.

Headlines: New AES Guideline on Status Epilepticus
Teaser: The guideline recommends a benzodiazepine as the first drug treatment and, if that doesn't work, moving on to a second therapy.

Headlines: U.S. Deaths From Guns, Cars And Run-Ins With Law Vary By State
Teaser: Injuries that kill people across the U.S. vary widely from one state to the next, with certain regions far exceeding the national average for fatalities tied to guns and cars, a recent study suggests.

Headlines: Migraine Linked to Irritable Bowel Syndrome
Teaser: A study supports phenotypic and genotypic associations between IBS and primary headache disorders, particularly migraine.

Headlines: Have Difficult-to-Treat Pain Patients? Try Genetic Testing
Teaser: Genetic testing might help sort out which medications to prescribe to pain patients, new research suggests.

Headlines: ADHD Diagnostic Scales: Which Test Is Best?
Teaser: A new meta-analysis examines ADHD diagnostic scales to determine which are the most sensitive and specific for detecting the disorder in children.

Headlines: Psoriasis: Joint Inflammation, Pain May Predict PsA
Teaser: Psoriatic arthritis risk was nearly four times higher for patients with cutaneous psoriasis who had subclinical, MRI-detectable joint inflammation and arthralgia vs other patients with psoriasis.

Headlines: Elvis Presley's Personal Physician, 'Dr Nick,' Dead at 88
Teaser: George Nichopoulos, MD, was accused of contributing to Presley's death by overprescribing prescription drugs.

Headlines: EHRs in the ED: Concerns Emerge About Medical Errors
Teaser: As hospitals adopt electronic health record systems, some emergency rooms are experiencing new patterns of medical errors.

Headlines: FDA Proposes Boxed Warning for Essure
Teaser: The agency also proposed a patient checklist for better informed consent and ordered a postmarket safety study for the permanent contraceptive device, which has sparked thousands of complaints.

Headlines: Surgeons Benefit From Short Intraoperative Stretching Breaks
Teaser: Targeted intraoperative stretching "micro-breaks" reduce surgeon fatigue, strain, and injury, researchers report.

Headlines: Global Opioid Use Continues to Be 'Feast or Famine'
Teaser: World opioid use has doubled in the past few years, and yet three quarters of the global population have limited access or no access to pain medication.

Headlines: Multimodal Care Reduces All-Cause Mortality in Opioid Users
Teaser: Those patients who received mental health, addiction, or rehabilitative treatment were 40% less likely to die within 6 months of starting on opioids than those who did not.

Headlines: Developing Countries Lag in Opioid Use for Pain Relief
Teaser: Low and medium income countries face many hurdles in providing opioids for pain relief and palliative care, a new analysis found.

Headlines: Another Option for Opioid-Induced Constipation?
Teaser: A new drug in development is superior to placebo in treating opioid-induced constipation and doesn't interfere with analgesic effect.

Headlines: Rural Regions at Risk for Injection-Drug HIV Crisis
Teaser: The epidemic of HIV infections last year in Indiana was a signal of the increase in opioid addiction in the region, and was foreshadowed by a rise in hepatitis C infections.

Headlines: EU Panel Likes Nivolumab for Kidney Cancer, Other Drugs
Teaser: A European advisory committee has recommended extending the indication for immunotherapy to include the treatment of advanced renal cell carcinoma.

Headlines: Telephone Triage Deflects ED Visits to Oncologists' Offices
Teaser: A novel telephone triage system helped deflect a significant number of ED visits by oncology patients into physicians' offices instead, saving the healthcare system considerable amounts of money.

Headlines: New APS Guideline on Postoperative Pain
Teaser: In a new American Pain Society guideline on postoperative pain management in children and adults, an expert panel recommends a multimodal approach.

Headlines: FDA Advisers Back Mesh for Fecal Incontinence
Teaser: The committee expressed some concern about long-term safety but voted unanimously to support approval.

Headlines: Sedation, Anesthesia Risk Doubled for Children Born Preterm
Teaser: Preterm children were almost twice as likely as those born at term to experience adverse events related to sedation and anesthesia, and the elevated risk persists into adulthood.

Headlines: Crohn Disease: Narcotics Linked to More Complications
Teaser: Patients with Crohn disease who use narcotics before surgery experienced greater morbidity and longer hospital stays than those who do not use narcotics.

Headlines: Methadone Tx Rates Tumble After Medicaid Funding Is Pulled
Teaser: Utilization of opioid agonist therapy -- mainly methadone maintenance treatment -- for the management of opioid addiction substantially drops when Medicaid coverage is pulled.

Headlines: New Maternal Early Warning Tool Reduces Maternal Morbidity
Teaser: A new maternal early warning tool has identified four common causes of maternal morbidity and outlined assessment and management recommendations, significantly improving maternal morbidity.

Headlines: Morcellation, Cancer, and Loss of Women's Choice
Teaser: Experts argue that the FDA used flawed evidence to issue a black-box warning on morcellation, and that a woman's autonomy in making her own choices has been taken away by reactionary decision-making.

Headlines: Topical Anticholinergic Reduces Underarm Hyperhidrosis
Teaser: An investigational anticholinergic gel noninvasively reduces excess sweating with minimal adverse effects, a phase 2b study suggests.

Headlines: Aggressive Rehab Safe After Knee Replacement
Teaser: High-intensity rehabilitation programs do not affect range of motion after total knee arthroplasty, report researchers, but surgeons are wary.

Headlines: Vitamin D Did Not Reduce Knee OA Pain, Cartilage Loss in RCT
Teaser: Vitamin D supplementation for patients with knee OA with low vitamin D levels found no reduction in knee pain or slowing of disease progression, in a major randomized, placebo-controlled trial.

Headlines: Buprenorphine May Beat Opioids for Triad of Pain, PTSD, SUDs
Teaser: Can a single medication relieve the pain of injury and the added insults of PTSD and opioid dependency?

Headlines: Cannabis in First-Episode Psychosis Linked to Poor Outcomes
Teaser: Cannabis use in early psychosis is linked to higher hospital admission risk, prolonged stays, and antipsychotic drug failure.

Headlines: Neurofibromatosis â€” Best Data Yet on Risks for Cancer
Teaser: Patients with neurofibromatosis 1 have been reported to be at an increased risk for several malignancies. A Finnish study refines this risk and reports the risk for breast cancer. Survival is also worse for these patients.

Headlines: Naloxone Prescribed With Every Opioid?
Teaser: As opioid-related emergencies and deaths rise, experts discuss whether to routinely prescribe naloxone along with an opioid, at least for high-risk patients.

Headlines: Diagnostic Missteps Kindle Claims Against Hospitalists
Teaser: Systemic factors could put hospitalists at a higher legal risk than other physicians, but the problems are fixable.

Headlines: After Nation's First, More US Uterus Transplants Planned
Teaser: The nation's first recipient asked for privacy at a news conference about her procedure.

Headlines: Childhood Emotional Abuse Linked to Later Migraine
Teaser: Chronic stress could be the mechanism by which emotional abuse later leads to migraine headaches, new research suggests.

Headlines: Increased Symptoms in Cancer Patients With Limited Finances
Teaser: Patients who are already struggling financially at the time of their cancer diagnosis have a greater symptom burden and poorer quality of life.

Headlines: Joint Replacement Payment Plan Favors Risk-Free Patients
Teaser: A bundled payment model that takes effect in a few weeks uses readmission rates as a measure of quality of care, and some experts worry that high-risk patients will pay the price.

Headlines: Presurgical Opioids Heighten Addiction Risk, Complications
Teaser: Patients who use opioids before total knee arthroplasty are more likely to continue using them after surgery and to have postoperative complications, warn researchers.

Headlines: Alvimopan Reduces Length of Stay and Hospital Costs After Colorectal Surgery
Teaser: Alvimopan, by hastening the recovery of bowel function, reduces length of stay and hospital costs for patients undergoing colorectal surgery, according to a retrospective study of registry data.

Headlines: Steroids Before Hip Arthroplasty Increase Infection Risk
Teaser: The injection of intra-articular steroids in the 3 months before total hip arthroplasty can lead to higher rates of periprosthetic joint infection, new research has confirmed.

Headlines: Reader Poll: Treating Racist Patients
Teaser: A new perspective on dealing with racist patients outlines five factors for physicians and hospitals.

Headlines: Ankylosing Spondylitis: Data Support 6-Month Trial of TNFis
Teaser: The effect of TNF inhibitors on ankylosing spondylitis reached maximum efficacy and stabilized only after 6 months of treatment, twice the time recommended in widely followed guidelines.

Headlines: Photovaporization Benefits Elderly With Prostate Hyperplasia
Teaser: Outcomes in men older than 80 years are good with the treatment, according to two new studies, and complications are minimal.

Headlines: Risky Drug Prescriptions Cut by Multipronged Intervention
Teaser: Primary care prescribing of NSAIDs and antiplatelet agents for high-risk patients dropped with education, informatics, and financial incentives.

Headlines: For Arthritis Pain: Diclofenac Best, Acetaminophen Worst
Teaser: Diclofenac was most effective and acetaminophen least effective for relieving pain in knee or hip osteoarthritis.

Headlines: Death in French Drug Trial: Family Demands Answers
Teaser: New developments in the investigation into the phase 1 trial that went terribly wrong for five participants includes a formal complaint from the family of the man who died during the trial.

Headlines: Marijuana for Cancer: No Benefit, but Don't Tell Patients
Teaser: As more states approve medical marijuana, oncologists should be prepared to field questions from patients, but the available scientific data are limited.

Headlines: Rhode Island Hep C Complications Projected to Continue
Teaser: High rates of liver complications will persist if Rhode Island's Medicaid program continues to limit coverage of antiviral medications on the basis of fibrosis stage, experts warn.

Headlines: Legalized Cannabis and the Brain: NIDA Sounds the Alarm
Teaser: NIDA researchers sound the alarm over a possible increase in unknown harms brought on by the wave of cannabis legalization now sweeping the US.

Headlines: Dengue Vaccine 100% Effective in Human Challenge Study
Teaser: Using a human challenge model lets researchers test vaccine efficacy without the risk involved in larger phase 3 trials in dengue-endemic regions and offers a path for Zika vaccine development as well.

Headlines: Persistent Neurologic Symptoms Common in Ebola Survivors
Teaser: Ebola survivors often report headaches, memory loss, depressed mood, muscle pain, and vision problems months after recovery, researchers are finding.

Headlines: Opioid Substitutes Do Not Impede Hep C Combo Drugs
Teaser: Outcomes are unaffected in patients with hepatitis C who are treated with opioid substitutes while they are taking the combination of sofosbuvir plus ledipasvir, a new analysis suggests.

Headlines: 'Difficult' Patients More Likely to Be Medically Misdiagnosed
Teaser: Patients who engage in disruptive behaviors may distract physicians, at the expense of important clinical details, new research shows.

Headlines: Few Ob/Gyns Counsel Pregnant Patients About Marijuana Use
Teaser: Nearly half of pregnant women who disclosed current or past marijuana use with their obstetrician received no information related to its possible risks or support for quitting.

Headlines: CDC Issues Opioid Guidelines for 'Doctor-Driven' Epidemic
Teaser: Saying opioids were not a first-line therapy for chronic pain, the agency suggested limits for dosage and duration that have drawn objections from some medical societies.

Headlines: Methadone in Palliative Care? This Guidance Will Aid Use
Teaser: To minimize overdose risks, panel recommends adherence to multispecialty guidelines and careful use of methadone in palliative care.

Headlines: Smartphone Responses on Health and Safety Need Major Upgrade
Teaser: Some computerized conversational agents failed to recognize 'I was raped' or 'I am having a heart attack,' a study found.

Headlines: Soaring Rates of Opioid Addiction Challenge Hospitalists
Teaser: There were 4400 deaths related to opioid overdose in 2000; in 2013, there were 16,000. To address this increase, hospitalists need strategies to manage patients with addiction and treat withdrawal.

Headlines: Cord-Cutting Technique Smooths Cellulite for 3 Years
Teaser: A one-time subcision treatment, in which fibrous septae underlying the characteristic cellulite dimples are cut, is effective and safe, 3-year data show.

Headlines: Bill to Combat Opioid Epidemic Passes Senate
Teaser: The Comprehensive Addiction and Recovery Act will help address the prescription opioid and heroin epidemic gripping the US, supporters say.

Headlines: Fight Turns Personal for a Man at War With Zika
Teaser: Heâ€™s most often on call when weather disasters strike. But since February, when Puerto Ricoâ€™s governor declared a public health emergency because of the Zika virus, it has been his job to try to reduce the local mosquito population.

Headlines: Severe Psoriasis Amplifies Immunoglobulin A Nephropathy Risk
Teaser: Renal function should be monitored in patients with severe psoriasis because of the association between the disease and kidney complications, new research shows.

Headlines: Acupuncture May Ease Hot Flashes in Women With Breast Cancer
Teaser: Acupuncture may help ease hot flashes in women with breast cancer who often can't take traditional hormone treatments, according to a new study from Italy.

Headlines: Diclofenac Best Treatment in ED for Renal Colic: Study
Teaser: The most effective sustained emergency department (ED) analgesia for renal colic is intramuscular (IM) diclofenac, not intravenous (IV) morphine, according to results from a randomized controlled trial.

Headlines: Headache Specialists Have High Rates of Headache
Teaser: A new survey shows in particular that headache specialists report rates of episodic migraine far exceeding that seen in the general population.

Headlines: The ACC 2016 Scientific Sessions and All That Jazz: A Preview
Teaser: You can bet your bottom dollar you'll lose the blues in Chicago, and maybe even have the time of your life, as Sinatra might have said, at this year's     American College of Cardiology Scientific Sessions.

Headlines: Ketamine Linked to Bladder Toxicity
Teaser: Recreational use of ketamine has been linked to bladder toxicity, raising concerns that this may affect its clinical potential as a rapid-acting treatment for depression and other disorders.

Headlines: Men With Psoriasis May Be More Prone to Erectile Dysfunction
Teaser: Men with psoriasis may be more prone to erectile dysfunction (ED) than their peers without the skin disease, and their odds of sexual difficulties are even higher if they are depressed or have other health problems like diabetes or hypertension, a Chinese study suggests.

Headlines: People With Sleep Apnea More Likely to Get Injured at Work
Teaser: Obstructive sleep apnea, which wakes people many times a night, could also raise the risk of getting hurt during the day at work, a small Canadian study suggests.

Headlines: New York e-Prescribing Law Goes Into Effect This Sunday
Teaser: Easter Sunday will see the rollout of the law that requires all New York physicians to prescribe electronically and register their e-prescribing devices with the state.

Headlines: FDA Issues Draft Guidance for Abuse-Deterrent Opioid Generics
Teaser: New FDA guidance is intended to support and encourage drug companies to develop generic opioids that are no less abuse-deterrent than brand-name opioids.

Headlines: Dual-Drug Strategy Reduces Carpet of Polyps in FAP Patients
Teaser: Colon carpeted with polyps in FAP patients can be favorably affected with a novel dual-drug strategy that offers the first really tenable treatment for this condition.

Headlines: Reslizumab (Cinqair) Approved to Treat Severe Asthma
Teaser: Patients receive this add-on treatment by infusion every 4 weeks to stave off severe asthma attacks. The most common adverse events seen in clinical trials include anaphylaxis and cancer.

Headlines: Botox Alleviates Neuropathic Pain
Teaser: A series of two doses of botulinum toxin A relieved neuropathic pain better than did placebo, new randomized findings show.

Headlines: Medical Marijuana Advocates Rally to Loosen Restrictions
Teaser: Medical marijuana advocates are hoping Congress will approve reclassification of the drug from schedule I to schedule II, but legislation to do that has not gained much traction on Capitol Hill.

Headlines: Mindfulness and CBT Effectively Treat Chronic Back Pain
Teaser: Clinically meaningful improvements in daily function and pain relief remained 6 months after participants completed 8-week training sessions for mindfulness-based stress reduction.

Headlines: New FDA Safety Warnings on Immediate-Release Opioids
Teaser: The agency has added a new boxed warning about the risks for misuse, abuse, addiction, overdose, and death and changes the indication to treatment of severe pain with no alternatives.

Headlines: Number of Elderly at Risk for Major Drug-Drug Event Doubles
Teaser: Two-thirds of elderly are taking five or more prescription/nonprescription medications, a new study showed. Experts calls for better monitoring systems, more patient input in drug lists.

Headlines: Exercise Prescriptions for Chronic Conditions: A How-to Guide
Teaser: A new guide seeks to increase physicians' awareness about the effectiveness of different types of exercise in the treatment of specific chronic diseases.

Headlines: Colitis Improves in Multidonor Fecal Transplant Trial
Teaser: Fecal microbiota transplantation can induce remission in patients with treatment-resistant ulcerative colitis, but there are still some concerns about safety, according to experts.

Headlines: Reader Poll: Will You Adopt New CDC Opioid Guidelines?
Teaser: CDC Director Dr Tom Frieden said the opioid epidemic is "doctor-driven" and can partly be reversed by doctors. Tell us whether you intend to follow the new prescribing guidelines.

Headlines: Cannabis Use Linked to Better Social Skills in Psychosis
Teaser: Individuals with psychosis who have used cannabis have greater premorbid social skills than persons with psychosis who have never used the drug, the results of multinational study reveal.

Headlines: ASCO Urges Aggressive Efforts to Increase HPV Vaccination
Teaser: Despite many American medical professional bodies strongly recommending HPV vaccination, uptake remains low. Now oncologists are being told to get involved.

Headlines: Surgeon General to Urge Prescribers to Fight Opioid Epidemic
Teaser: This spring, doctors, dentists, and nurses will receive a letter from US Surgeon General Vivek Murthy urging them to help fight the country's opioid epidemic.

Headlines: Hydromorphone Shows Benefit for Severe Opioid Dependence
Teaser: Supervised hydromorphone injections show noninferiority to diacetylmorphine in reducing severe opioid abuse, suggesting a potentially effective alternative treatment for refractory patients.

Headlines: Hospital Software Often Doesn't Flag Unsafe Drug Rx
Teaser: A survey conducted by the Leapfrog Group finds that though many hospitals have computer-based medication systems in place to protect against errors, many still fall short in highlighting possible problems.

Headlines: HHS Releases National Pain Strategy
Teaser: The national strategy is the first such coordinated plan to reduce the burden of chronic pain, focusing on education and prevention.

Headlines: EU Expands Nivolumab Approval for Lung and Kidney Cancer
Teaser: Nivolumab is now approved in Europe for both nonsquamous- and squamous-type non-small-cell lung cancer, as well as for use in renal cell carcinoma.

Headlines: Marijuana Use Before Acute MI May Give Survival Edge in Hospital
Teaser: The composite outcome was not met, but several individual components were. And although marijuana users had more mechanical ventilation risk, one expert     blames the smoke rather than the substance.

Headlines: NCCN Takes New Look at Vulvar Cancer
Teaser: Vulvar cancer is rare. Even oncologists who specialize in gynecologic cancers might only see one or two cases a year, so randomized trials are difficult to conduct.

Headlines: Impaired Cognition in Early Psychosis Linked to Inflammation
Teaser: Inflammatory markers could eventually be used to target personalized treatment in first-episode psychosis, say Spanish scientists, who found a link between inflammation and cognition in psychosis.

Headlines: FDA Approves Remicade Biosimilar (Inflectra)
Teaser: The second biosimilar approved in the United States, this version of infliximab is indicated for Crohn's disease, rheumatoid arthritis, and almost all other conditions listed for the original.

Headlines: Physician Aid in Dying: Oncologists Grapple With New Law
Teaser: California's new law allowing physician aid in dying opens access to one in 10 Americans to this end-of-life option, and oncologists are testing the waters.

Headlines: New FDA Chief Tops Most Influential Physicians List
Teaser: Robert Califf, MD, could 'redefine how drugs, medical devices, tobacco, food safety and controlled substances are regulated in the 21st century.' He is a newcomer to the Modern Healthcare list.

Headlines: Medical Students: False Beliefs About Blacks' Biology Common
Teaser: Believing false biological differences between black and white patients led students to perceive a lower pain experience in blacks and issue less appropriate medical recommendations to them.

Headlines: Morphine at Acute MI May Blunt Short-Term Antiplatelet Response
Teaser: "Once morphine is given, we may consider giving other IV agents that bypass the gastric emptying, such as GP IIb/IIIa inhibitors or bivalirudin," propose investigators after their prospective study.

Headlines: GAUSS-3: Evolocumab Cuts LDL-C in Statin-Intolerant Patients
Teaser: UPDATED // "We have established that you can use PCSK9 inhibitors successfully" in this patient population, said the lead author. "And that has regulatory and     practice implications."

Headlines: EMA Panel Likes Daratumumab for Multiple Myeloma
Teaser: The European Medicines Agency (EMA) has recommended granting conditional marketing authorization for daratumumab for the treatment of adults with relapsed and refractory multiple myeloma.

Headlines: HPV Vaccine Side-Effects Class-Action Suit Planned in Japan
Teaser: Lawyers representing girls with adverse effects after HPV vaccination are preparing a lawsuit against the government and the manufacturers.

Headlines: Baricitinib Offers Promise of Remission in Refractory RA
Teaser: The oral Janus kinase 1 and 2 inhibitor baricitinib significantly increased ACR20 response rates and improved physical function in patients with rheumatoid arthritis for whom other therapies had failed.

Headlines: Utah Governor Signs Anesthesia Requirement for Some Abortions
Teaser: Utah's governor on Monday signed a bill requiring doctors to administer anesthesia to women receiving an abortion at the 20th week of gestation, his office said.

Headlines: Obama Seeks to Expand Opioid Addiction Treatment
Teaser: President Barack Obama traveled to Atlanta on Tuesday to shine a light on the nationâ€™s opioid abuse epidemic, which continues to get worse.

Headlines: Maine Mandates e-Prescribing of Controlled Substances
Teaser: Maine has become the second state after New York to include EPCS in legislation dealing with the opioid epidemic; the state medical association supported the bill.

Headlines: FDA Seeks to Ban Certain Electrical Stimulation Devices
Teaser: The FDA has proposed a ban on certain electrical stimulation devices, saying they pose an 'unreasonable and substantial risk to public health.'

Headlines: Peginterferon Beta-1a Efficacy in MS Sustained Long-term
Teaser: An extension study of the pivotal ADVANCE trial demonstrates sustained efficacy of peginterferon beta-1a with long-term treatment in relapsing MS.

Headlines: FDA Backs Cartiva Implant for Osteoarthritis in the MTP Joint
Teaser: An FDA panel has voted to recommend premarket approval of the Cartiva Synthetic Cartilage Implant for use in patients with osteoarthritis in the first metatarsophalangeal joint.

Headlines: Cannabis Compound May Augment Antipsychotic Meds
Teaser: Schizophrenia patients treated with antipsychotics may benefit from adjunctive therapy with cannabidiol, which is found in cannabis, new research suggests.

Headlines: Repeated Ketamine May Sustain Antidepressant Effect
Teaser: Repeated administration of ketamine may help prolong the antidepressant effect in patients with treatment-resistant depression.

Headlines: Part B Drug Proposal Has Winners and Losers Alike
Teaser: Primary care physicians would receive more Medicare revenue from drugs they administer, and oncologists, ophthalmologists, and rheumatologists would receive less.

Headlines: Review Calls for More Research on Transgender Hormone Therapy
Teaser: A new review details the benefits, risks, and effects of testosterone therapy in transgender men, highlighting the lack of long-term data and calling for     more research that can help guide patient care.

Headlines: Many Patients Triaged as 'Nonurgent' May Need Urgent Care
Teaser: US emergency departments end up treating and even admitting many of the patients they initially triage as nonurgent, researchers found in a new study.

Headlines: Migraine Linked to Increased Birth Complications
Teaser: Active migraine in pregnant mothers may lead to increased preeclampsia and premature delivery, a new study suggests.

Headlines: FDA Advisory Panel Backs OTC Adapalene Gel 0.1% for Acne
Teaser: An FDA panel voted to recommend over-the-counter marketing of adapalene gel 0.1% for persons aged 12 years or older with acne.

Headlines: First Male-to-Male Sexual Transmission of Zika Reported
Teaser: The discovery announced by the CDC was the latest in a string of dismal announcements about the virus.

Headlines: Neonatal Circumcision Does Not Reduce Sensitivity in Men
Teaser: Circumcised and uncircumcised men did not differ in penile sensitivity, and the foreskin was not the most sensitive part of the penis, a new study showed.

Headlines: Nonspecialists Can Expand Treatment Access for Hepatitis C
Teaser: For patients with chronic hepatitis C, success is not affected by the type of provider administering treatment, which could help ease the bottleneck caused by a lack of specialists, research shows.

Headlines: End-of-Life Conversation Stoppers Revealed in New Survey
Teaser: Most physicians think end-of-life discussions are important, but many are not exactly sure how best to start these conversations, a new poll has found.

Headlines: Concurrent Cocaine, Alcohol Use Linked to Suicidality
Teaser: A large study of suicidal emergency department patients shows a link between combined alcohol and cocaine use and future suicide attempt.

Headlines: New Tick Vector for Rickettsiosis Found; Range Spreads
Teaser: A second tick vector for Rickettsia parkeri rickettsiosis has been identified in southern Arizona, indicating the disease range has spread.

Headlines: Fusion Adds Little to Laminectomy for Lumbar Stenosis
Teaser: Adding spinal fusion to decompression laminectomy did not improve outcomes for patients with lumbar spinal stenosis, even if they also had degenerative spondylolisthesis.

Headlines: Most Physicians Lean Toward Adopting CDC Opioid Guidelines
Teaser: However, physicians see barriers to scaling back opioid prescribing, and they resent the claim that the epidemic of addiction and overdose deaths is 'doctor driven.'

Headlines: Patients Often Unaware of ICD Issues Near End of Life
Teaser: Two new studies suggest that many patients don't realize that ICD deactivation is even an option in the final days, because frank talks between patients     and cardiologists "remain limited."

Headlines: Seeing Your Patients in a Group
Teaser: With â€œshared appointments,â€ patients can get more time with less-harried providers, enjoy mutual support and see better outcomes. But the approach has its skeptics.

Headlines: 'Major' Ketamine Discovery May Lead to New Antidepressants
Teaser: A 'major' discovery that explains how ketamine produces its swift antidepressant effect may lead to the development of rapid-onset agents that have none of the harms typically linked to the drug.

Headlines: FDA Panel Votes for IR Opioid but Without Abuse Labeling
Teaser: Despite the drug company's presentations, FDA advisory committee members didn't find enough evidence to recommend abuse-deterrent labeling for the new immediate-release product.

Headlines: PharMEDium Recalls Compounded Bupivacaine Products
Teaser: The nationwide recall involves hundreds of sterile preparations compounded with a single recalled lot of Fresenius Kabi Sensorcaine-MPF (bupivacaine HCl).

Headlines: Zika Will Headline Obstetricians and Gynecologists Meeting
Teaser: Clinicians attending the American Congress of Obstetricians and Gynecologists will learn about the management of Zika, the role of flibanserin in sexual desire, and the future of the Pap test.

Headlines: HCV Killed Nearly 20,000 Americans in 2014
Teaser: The HCV mortality numbers hit an all-time high in the United States in 2014, and in 2013, data show HCV mortality exceeded the combined total for 60 other reportable infectious diseases.

Headlines: No Increased Toxicity Seen With TKI, Stereotactic Radiosurgery
Teaser: TKIs used as radiosensitizers are believed to offer a synergistic effect with radiosurgery in treatment of spine metastases with renal cell carcinoma.

Headlines: FDA Panel: Physician Opioid Training Should Be Mandatory
Teaser: A 2-day FDA advisory panel meeting this week focused on ways to modify the opioid analgesic Risk Evaluation and Mitigation Strategies.

Headlines: Schizophrenia Not One Disease, New Genetic Evidence Shows
Teaser: Schizophrenia is not a single disease but rather is a group of distinct subtypes with varying symptoms based on a set of genes harboring novel or rare disruptive variants, a new study suggests.

Headlines: ROADMAP: LVAD Implantation Drives Improved Quality of Life
Teaser: The detailed results "can improve patient understanding of treatment choices and facilitate shared patient-provider decision making in advanced heart     failure," notes one of the study investigators.

Headlines: Ixazomib in First All-Oral Triplet for Multiple Myeloma
Teaser: The trial showing efficacy for ixazomib in the first oral triplet regimen for the treatment of relapsed, refractory multiple myeloma has now published.

Headlines: FDA Expands Breath-Actuated Inhaler Use to Kids as Young as 4
Teaser: The rescue inhaler ProAir RespiClick offers a new option for younger patients that eliminates the need for hand-breath coordination during inhalation.

Headlines: FDA Gives Final Approval to Abuse-Deterrent Xtampza ER
Teaser: The approval of the abuse-deterrent oxycodone formulation follows 'tentative' approval last fall for management of chronic pain requiring daily, around-the-clock opioid treatment.

Headlines: Endophthalmitis Rare in Intravitreal Injections
Teaser: Endophthalmitis occurs infrequently after intravitreal injection, and vision can usually be preserved if physicians are vigilant, researchers found.

Headlines: Intradermal Varicella-Zoster Vaccine Elicits Greater Antibody Response
Teaser: Intradermal administration of varicella-zoster virus vaccine elicits a greater antibody response in older adults than does subcutaneous administration at comparable doses, researchers have reported.

Headlines: Heavy Cannabis Use in Adolescence Linked to Premature Death
Teaser: Adolescents with a history of heavy cannabis use are at higher risk for early death than nonusers.

Headlines: FDA Panel Finds Evidence Inadequate for Eteplirsen in DMD
Teaser: Despite emotional testimony from patients and families, an FDA advisory panel concluded evidence for an investigational drug in Duchenne muscular dystrophy was not sufficient to recommend approval.

Headlines: Healthcare Transformation Focus of Internal Medicine Meeting
Teaser: The American College of Physicians meeting will help internists adapt to the rapid changes in healthcare and provide information about emerging and challenging clinical areas.

Headlines: Small-Fiber Neuropathy in Prediabetes Less Benign Than Believed
Teaser: Nerve-fiber length is not a predictor of which neurons will degrade first in diabetic neuropathy, new data hint. Nor is prediabetes as benign as thought.     But editorialists question the findings.

Headlines: Off-Label Ketamine Prescribing: US Psychiatrists Troubled
Teaser: With limited evidence ketamine is effective for the short-term treatment of depression and almost no long-term safety and efficacy data, US psychiatrists are troubled by off-label prescribing.

Headlines: Tai Chi May Be as Good as PT for Knee Arthritis Pain
Teaser: Tai chi and conventional physical therapy were equally good at relieving pain associated with knee osteoarthritis in a randomized trial.

Headlines: APS Issues New Guidance on Medical Marijuana for Pain
Teaser: With patients increasingly turning to herbal cannabis for chronic pain -- legally or not --  the American Pain Society white paper offers clinical guidance and strong suggestions on the need for more research.

Headlines: One Third of Physician Faculty Members Report Sexual Harassment
Teaser: Almost 10% reported coercive advances. One author noted that findings are a 'sobering reminder' of the work ahead to achieve gender equity.

Headlines: Promising Data With Ketamine in Chronic and Phantom Limb Pain
Teaser: The key to avoiding adverse effects with ketamine is to start at a low dose, says one clinician.

Headlines: CRC Return Often Tipped by Symptoms at 'Interval' Visits
Teaser: Recurrent colorectal cancers are detected as a result of patients experiencing symptoms in almost half of cases, leading to significantly worse survival, conclude Dutch investigators.

Headlines: FDA Approves Lenvatinib for Advanced Renal Cell Carcinoma
Teaser: The drug is to be used in combination with everolimus, and improves progression-free survival, overall response rate, and overall survival compared with everolimus alone.

Headlines: 'Awake' Lumbar Fusion Offers Eye-Opening Recovery Improvement
