Teaser: In a small case series, the innovative approach shortened hospital stay and narcotic use while offering significant improvement in disability.

Headlines: Position-Related Neurapraxia Prediction Not Always on Target
Teaser: Intraoperative monitoring for neurapraxia shown to have low sensitivity in predicting nerve deficit.

Headlines: Short-Term Fibromyalgia Program Met Needs of Most Women
Teaser: A 2-day program of education, exercise, and cognitive behavioral therapy reduced pain and improved health status in women with fibromyalgia; elements of the cognitive behavioral therapy may be key.

Headlines: Abuse of OTC Antidiarrheal Meds Linked to Cardiac Deaths
Teaser: Abuse of over-the-counter, opioid-based antidiarrheal drugs is a growing problem that has been linked to cardiac dysrhythmia and death, new research shows.

Headlines: Just 20% of Hysterectomies for Pelvic Pain Find Endometriosis
Teaser: Those found to have endometriosis are twice as likely to undergo oophorectomy at the time of surgery.

Headlines: Symptom Duration Matters in Degenerative Cervical Myelopathy
Teaser: Patients treated with decompressive surgery within 4 months of symptom presentation show improved outcomes for degenerative cervical myelopathy.

Headlines: TAVR With Moderate Sedation Up, Results Better: US Registry
Teaser: Are gains due to less general anesthesia or to other progress in "minimalist" transcatheter aortic-valve replacement? Either way, TAVR outcomes are getting better with experience, experts say.

Headlines: Second ESO Stroke Conference Gets Off to Flying Start
Teaser: A host of major new -- and possibly practice-changing -- randomized trials were presented at the first day of the European Stroke Organisation's second conference, being held in Barcelona this week.

Headlines: What's Hot: Your Guide to APA 2016 Annual Meeting
Teaser: The largest psychiatric conference in the world, the 2016 American Psychiatric Association 2016 Annual Meeting will feature 450 scientific sessions and new, innovative learning formats for clinicians.

Headlines: Yellow Fever Concerns Grow, WHO Urged to Set Up Emergency Panel
Teaser: A growing yellow fever epidemic in Africa and Latin American led to calls for the WHO director-general to convene an emergency response committee, partly because of an anticipated vaccine shortage.

Headlines: Fibromyalgia Brings High Societal and Personal Costs
Teaser: Diagnosing earlier and educating both physicians and patients about the disorder are key in reducing costs, experts say.

Headlines: No Benefit From Macitentan Seen in Systemic Sclerosis
Teaser: No differences in reduction of new digital ulcers occurred among groups receiving 3 mg macitentan, 10 mg macitentan, or placebo in two international, multicenter trials.

Headlines: IPD Reoperation Rates Still Hamper Benefit in Spinal Stenosis
Teaser: The latest randomized trial again shows similar outcomes to surgery with a percutaneous interspinous process device in patients with lumbar spinal stenosis, but with increased reintervention.

Headlines: Bullying: Serious, Lasting Psychological Consequences
Teaser: Bullying has long been tolerated as a rite of passage for children and adolescents, but it has lasting, negative consequences and can no longer be ignored, a new report says.

Headlines: VA Plan for Independent Advanced Practice RNs Riles Physicians
Teaser: Proposed regulations would let advanced practice nurses work without physician oversight at VA facilities regardless of state law. Anesthesiologists in particular are steamed.

Headlines: Gastric Endoscopic Myotomy Showing Promise for Gastroparesis
Teaser: For patients with refractory disease, gastric peroral endoscopic myotomy (G-POEM) can reduce hospitalizations, improve symptoms, and normalize gastric emptying time, early research suggests.

Headlines: ASCO Issues First Practice Guideline for Cervical Cancer
Teaser: ASCO has issued a 'resource-stratified' guideline for cervical cancer that offers treatment recommendations tailored to resource availability.

Headlines: Buprenorphine: Long-term Efficacy for Opioid Dependence
Teaser: First extension trial showed that many patients were no longer opioid dependent, but some had turned to heroin.

Headlines: Pregabalin Linked to Major Birth Defects
Teaser: Exposure to pregabalin, an antiepileptic also prescribed for pain and psychiatric disorders, during pregnancy is linked to a 3-fold increased risk for major birth defects, a new study suggests.

Headlines: Lyme and Other Tickborne Diseases in New Hampshire
Teaser: New Hampshire continues to have one of the highest rates of Lyme disease in the nation. The state's Division of Public Health Services provides advice on diagnosis and treatment.

Headlines: Skin Cancer Patients Face Deadly Risk Using 'Black Salve' Home Remedy
Teaser: People who fear they have skin cancer, or know it, and decide to try an unapproved product called "black salve" may face infection, scarring and worse cancer outcomes, doctors warn.

Headlines: Endoscopic Approaches for Weight Loss Gaining Traction
Teaser: Endoscopic gastric sleeve and the articulated circular stapler help moderately obese individuals lose weight and keep it off up to 2 years, researchers report.

Headlines: Education, Reminders Reduce Risky Prescriptions for Elders
Teaser: Education and electronic reminders can reduce the prescription of potentially inappropriate medication to older patients discharged from the emergency department, new research shows.

Headlines: Buprenorphine 'Underused' in Primary Care as Opioid Abuse Soars
Teaser: Only a small percentage of clinicians in primary care use one of the most important weapons against opioid abuse in the setting of chronic pain, experts say.

Headlines: Injury Compensation Fund Could Reduce Cesarean Rates
Teaser: Litigation concerns have limited the number of vaginal births after cesarean delivery since the mid-1990s, but there is a solution, says one expert.

Headlines: Dengue Spread From Mexico to Arizona; Local Transmission Feared
Teaser: Most dengue fever cases reported in Yuma, Arizona, in late 2014 were traced to travelers who had visited Sonora, Mexico, during an outbreak there.

Headlines: Conscious Sedation Same as Anesthetic for Stroke Thrombectomy
Teaser: SIESTA, the first randomized trial comparing general anesthesia and conscious sedation, has shown similar short-term outcomes in stroke patients undergoing endovascular treatment.

Headlines: Emotional Expression Shows Benefits vs CBT for Chronic Pain
Teaser: A therapeutic approach encouraging expression of emotions shows improvements in some outcomes over cognitive-behavioral therapy for fibromyalgia and chronic pain in the PAST-FM trial.

Headlines: Self-injury Linked to Altered Pain Processing in Autism
Teaser: Individuals with autism who engage in self-injurious behavior are more likely to be lower functioning and display aberrations in pain processing.

Headlines: Comfort Managing End-of-Life Pain Does Not Match Training
Teaser: Nurses report being comfortable managing end-of-life pain, but many are not following evidence-based hospital guidelines on how it should be done, new research shows.

Headlines: Postural Therapy May Help Eliminate Residual Renal Stones in Children
Teaser: Postural therapy appears to help eliminate residual renal stones in children, researchers from France report.

Headlines: Failure to Deprescribe Docusate Common on Hospital Discharge
Teaser: The stool softener docusate sodium is frequently prescribed to treat constipation, although there is little evidence that it works, and it is often not deprescribed on hospital discharge, Canadian researchers have found.

Headlines: Disrupted Sleep Linked to Lower Pain Tolerance, Impulsivity
Teaser: Healthy individuals subjected to forced awakenings similar to those commonly experienced with chronic pain show significant reductions in pain tolerance and other notable changes.

Headlines: Adding Family to Bundle Can Help Ventilated Patients
Teaser: A nurse-led program that added a family component to the ABCDE bundle helped improve outcomes for patients being managed with mechanical ventilation.

Headlines: Rubber Band Ligation May Be Best for Low-Grade Hemorrhoids
Teaser: Rubber band ligation (RBL) is associated with less pain and lower costs than hemorrhoidal artery ligation (HAL) in patients with low-grade hemorrhoids, according to the HubBLe trial.

Headlines: Warn Patients About Risk From Antacids With Aspirin, FDA Says
Teaser: The FDA has long warned about the risk for serious bleeding with OTC aspirin-containing antacids, but it still receives reports about this adverse event.

Headlines: Prescription Monitoring Programs Curb Opioid Prescribing
Teaser: Prescription drug monitoring programs are associated with a sizable reduction in prescribing of Schedule II opioids by healthcare providers, according to a new study.

Headlines: Immunotherapy Shows Encouraging Results in Neuroblastoma
Teaser: An experimental monoclonal antibody, added to chemotherapy, achieved an 89% response rate in a small early study.

Headlines: Initiative Curbs ED Urinary Catheterization in Febrile Kids
Teaser: Screening of urine bag specimens for urinary tract infections (UTIs) can obviate catheterization in many very young febrile emergency department (ED) patients, according to Pennsylvania-based researchers.

Headlines: Prince Died From Fentanyl Overdose
Teaser: Pop superstar Prince, found dead more than a month ago at his estate outside Minneapolis, died from an overdose of the powerful opioid fentanyl, authorities said Thursday.

Headlines: Marijuana Use by Adults Tied to Few Physical Health Problems
Teaser: Other than being at an increased risk of periodontal disease, people who smoked marijuana for up to 20 years during adulthood were generally as healthy as people who didn't light up, according to a new study.

Headlines: Opioid Analgesics Subpar for Chronic Back Pain
Teaser: Opioid analgesics are commonly prescribed but fail to have a significant effect, a meta-analysis has found. A pain medication specialist says even with low effect, it should remain a tool in the arsenal.

Headlines: Practice-Changing Lessons for Colonoscopy From NordICC Study
Teaser: A European study has lessons for the United States, which has embraced the procedure. Use of sedation and air during the procedure are questioned.

Headlines: Acceptance, Flexibility Key in Chronic Pain Battle
Teaser: Acceptance and commitment therapy take on catastrophizing thought patterns that undermine chronic pain.

Headlines: Quick Screen May Flag Opioid Abuse Risk
Teaser: Two new reports outline measures that may help quickly identify pain patients at risk for longer-term opioid use or for opioid abuse.

Headlines: FDA Clears Obeticholic Acid for Primary Biliary Cholangitis
Teaser: The first new treatment in almost 20 years for the condition, Ocaliva is for use in combination with UDCA in adults with poor response to UDCA or as a single therapy in adults unable to tolerate UDCA.

Headlines: Cannabis Extract Spray Reduces Spasticity in Patients With MND
Teaser: Italian researchers report positive results from a phase 2 randomized controlled trial of patients with motor neuron diseases, including ALS.

Headlines: Social Media and the Impact of the 'Caitlyn Jenner Effect'
Teaser: The transformation of Bruce to Caitlyn Jenner publicized on social media has had a negative as well as positive impact on the transgender community.

Headlines: Parental Catastrophizing Worsens Sickle Cell Disability
Teaser: The effect isn't seen with protective parenting alone -- only when catastrophizing also occurs.

Headlines: Off-Label Antidepressant Prescribing Increasingly Common
Teaser: Off-label prescribing of antidepressants is increasing, particularly for insomnia and pain, even though their efficacy has not been established for these conditions, new research shows.

Headlines: Stem Cells, B Cells, and T Cells in Focus at CMSC
Teaser: Presentations at the upcoming Consortium of Multiple Sclerosis Centers meeting will also shed light on working with patients using alternative treatments, such as medical marijuana and dietary supplements.

Headlines: Tools Refined to Assess Catastrophizing in Chronic Pain
Teaser: The response to a key catastrophizing measure can predict the risk for opioid misuse, a new study suggests.

Headlines: Virtual Reality Ventures Into Real World of Chronic Pain
Teaser: With benefits seen in acute pain and technology becoming more accessible, researchers see encouraging, albeit early, signs of use in chronic pain.

Headlines: FDA OKs Buprenorphine Implant (Probuphine) for Opioid Dependence
Teaser: The new buprenorphine subdermal implant could be 'game changer' in the battle to combat opioid use disorder.

Headlines: DTC Stem Cell Marketing Common in US in 'Cowboy Culture'
Teaser: Study authors found a virtual 'cowboy culture' of unregulated, direct-to-consumer marketing of questionable treatments.

Headlines: Doctors Wrestle With Mixed Messages on Opioid Prescribing
Teaser: Though the CDCâ€™s new prescribing guidelines follow a theme of less is more, another federal agencyâ€™s patient satisfaction surveys include questions about pain management that some say encourage doctors to prescribe the highly addictive medicines.

Headlines: Coprescribing Naloxone With an Opioid Aids Chronic Pain
Teaser: Coprescribing naloxone to primary care patients who take opioid analgesics for chronic pain is feasible and may reduce opioid-related trips to the emergency department, new research suggests.

Headlines: Migraine in Men Not Uncommon but Not Always Diagnosed
Teaser: New research helps dispel the prevailing myth that migraine is only a women's disease, researchers say.

Headlines: SPECT/CT Improves Back Pain Management
Teaser: Treating chronic back pain can be complex, but SPECT/CT can help clinicians clearly identify the site of pain to improve the precision of nerve block injections, a new study suggests.

Headlines: Your Doctor Will See You in This Telemedicine Kiosk
Teaser: Employers and insurers are installing sophisticated kiosks in more workplaces so that workers can quickly consult a doctor offsite when they take ill at work.

Headlines: Georgia Caps Number of Opioid Treatment Clinics
Teaser: Georgia has stopped licensing new clinics that provide medication-assisted treatment for opioid addiction. Some call the stateâ€™s move irresponsible. Others say the clinics arenâ€™t regulated enough.

Headlines: Nonmotor Parkinson's Symptoms Commonly Unreported
Teaser: Several barriers cause patients with Parkinson's often to underreport nonmotor symptoms, which affect almost all patients, a study showed. Quality of life may be diminished, when it could be improved.

Headlines: Mortality Increased With Long-Acting Opioids
Teaser: Noncancer pain patients treated with long-acting opioids face a significantly increased risk for all-cause mortality, particularly during the first 30 days of starting therapy, warn US researchers.

Headlines: New AHS Consensus on Emergency Migraine Management
Teaser: Intravenous metoclopramide and prochlorperazine, and subcutaneous sumatriptan, get the highest level of recommendation from a panel on acute treatment of migraine in the emergency department

Headlines: Etanercept Showing Promise in Erosive Hand Osteoarthritis
Teaser: Cytokine-directed therapy can ameliorate pain and structural damage in some patients with erosive osteoarthritis of the hands, new research shows.

Headlines: Most Snakebites Are Truly Accidental
Teaser: Most snakebites are not the result of humans confronting the snake, a new study suggests.

Headlines: Monitoring Doctors Cuts Opioid Prescriptions
Teaser: Doctors in states that track painkiller prescriptions were nearly one-third less likely to offer patients dangerously addicting opioids, a new study found.

Headlines: Opioids Common After Hospital Discharge; Storage Knowledge Poor
Teaser: About 15% of Medicare patients filled opioid prescriptions within a week of hospital discharge, and more than a third of them did so again after 90 days.

Headlines: CV-Event Risk Climbs in Women With Migraine: NHS II
Teaser: "It is time to add migraine to the list of early-life medical conditions that are markers for later-life cardiovascular risk," says an editorial on an analysis that raises questions about treatment.

Headlines: Benefits of Medical Marijuana May Outweigh Risks
Teaser: For pain, medical marijuana appears to be more effective than conventional medications, with few, and very minor, adverse effects, new research shows.

Headlines: Impact of Osteoarthritis Underrated by Rheumatologists
Teaser: Rheumatologists are more likely to underestimate the impact of osteoarthritis than rheumatoid arthritis, even though patients with osteoarthritis often have more pain and a greater burden of disease.

Headlines: FDA Committee Supports Approval of Vantrela ER
Teaser: An FDA committee supports approval of Vantrela ER, an extended-release hydrocodone product for pain management. It also recommends that the labeling for the drug reflect its abuse-deterrence properties.

Headlines: Adding Electroacupuncture to Splinting for Carpal Tunnel Pain
Teaser: Combining electroacupuncture with splinting may help relieve pain from chronic carpal tunnel syndrome (CTS), according to a new trial.

Headlines: Abuse, Misuse of Antidiarrheal Linked to Serious Heart Problems
Teaser: Abuse and misuse of the commonly available antidiarrheal medication loperamide has been linked to life-threatening cardiac events, according to a warning issued by the US Food and Drug Administration.

Headlines: Neuropathy Pain Strongest Predictor of Depression in Diabetes
Teaser: Painful diabetic polyneuropathy, unlike other diabetes comorbidities and complications, is associated with a marked increase in the risk of depression, say     Italian researchers.

Headlines: Scientists Identify Brain Areas Altered During Hypnosis
Teaser: Distinct areas of the brain show altered activity when a person is in a hypnotic state, Stanford researchers have discovered.

Headlines: Nepafenac Prevents Macular Edema Associated With Cataract Surgery
Teaser: Nepafenac, administered topically as eyedrops, prevents macular edema after cataract surgery in patients with diabetic retinopathy, researchers report.

Headlines: Conjugated Estrogens-Bazedoxifene Combination Reduces Postmenopausal Bone Loss
Teaser: The combination of conjugated estrogens with bazedoxifene (CE/BZA) significantly improves bone mineral density (BMD) and bone turnover, according to pooled results from the SMART-1 and SMART-5 trials.

Headlines: USPSTF's Final Word on Skin Cancer Exams in Primary Care
Teaser: New guidance from the US Preventive Services Task Force is a lot like the old guidance, but not everyone agrees with it.

Headlines: New Opioid Use in Older Patients With COPD: Higher Risk of Death
Teaser: Older adults with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) who receive a new opioid prescription face an increased risk of negative respiratory outcomes, including death, according to a large new study.

Headlines: First ASCO Guidelines for Chronic Pain in Cancer Survivors
Teaser: New ASCO guidelines describe how to create a comprehensive pain management plan for cancer survivors, including use of opioids and how to get patients off them.

Headlines: CHMP Backs Eluxadoline (Truberzi) for IBS With Diarrhea
Teaser: The Committee for Medicinal Products for Human Use of the European Medicines Agency recommended approval after reviewing data showing pain relief and more diarrhea-free days.

Headlines: FDA Okays Oral Relistor for Opioid-Induced Constipation
Teaser: The agency has approved a more convenient tablet form vs subcutaneous injections for patients with noncancer pain who have opioid-induced constipation.

Headlines: Exercise as Effective as Surgery for Meniscal Tears
Teaser: Middle-aged patients had the same knee function whether they had arthroscopy or supervised exercise. Editorialists say this is more proof that the surgeries are 'potentially nothing but medical waste.'

Headlines: Opioid Addiction Drug Underutilized in Medicare Patients
Teaser: Medicare physicians, particularly nonspecialists, are prescribing opioid agonist therapy to only a fraction of patients affected by opioid use disorder, results of a claims data analysis reveal.

Headlines: Buprenorphine Implant May Boost Opioid Abstinence
Teaser: More opioid-dependent patients whose conditions were stabilized with sublingual buprenorphine maintained abstinence over 6 months when switching to buprenorphine implants.

Headlines: Will Physicians Get Relief on Medicare's Pain Questions?
Teaser: Medicare said it wouldn't calculate hospital payments using pain-management survey questions, widely seen as pressuring physicians to prescribe opioids. Some physicians want more relief.

Headlines: Special Footwear May Not Improve Knee Arthritis
Teaser: Shoes with modified midsoles designed to relieve pressure on the knee joint don't improve pain and function for people with knee osteoarthritis any more than a new pair of regular walking shoes, according to an Australian study.

Headlines: Far-Reaching Opioid Bill Goes to Obama for Signature
Teaser: The bipartisan bill aims to combat the epidemic of opioid addiction and overdose deaths, but Congressional action is still needed to fund it.

Headlines: PRAC to Review Risks of Modified-Release Paracetamol
Teaser: The agency will consider measures to minimize risk and reduce harm of overdose with modified- and prolonged-release paracetamol products.

Headlines: SAMHSA Expands Access to Buprenorphine for Opioid Dependence
Teaser: As part of a strategy to combat the US opioid epidemic, the SAMHSA finalized a rule this week to increase access to buprenorphine for individuals being treated for opioid addiction.

Headlines: Seniors With Access to Medical Marijuana Use Fewer Prescription Drugs
Teaser: Physicians wrote significantly fewer prescriptions for painkillers and other medications for elderly and disabled patients who had legal access to medical marijuana, a new study finds.

Headlines: Fibromyalgia: CBT/Exercise Training May Get Teens Moving
Teaser: A program that combines cognitive behavioral therapy and neuromuscular exercise training improved physical function and reduced fear of movement in teenagers with fibromyalgia.

Headlines: Gastric Bypass Superior to Medical Management of Diabetes But With Side Effects
Teaser: Gastric bypass is more effective than lifestyle-medical management alone in achieving diabetes treatment goals, but the effect of surgery diminishes over time and is associated with more adverse events, researchers report.

Headlines: Illegally Manufactured Fentanyl Linked to Rise in Overdoses
Teaser: Research showed a sharp increase in production and distribution of illegally manufactured fentanyl that tracks with increases in overdose deaths; fentanyl prescriptions remained stable.

Headlines: Brain Stimulation Effective for Phantom Limb Pain
Teaser: Patients with amputations from land mine explosions show analgesic improvement 15 days after treatments with repetitive transcranial magnetic stimulation, a new trial shows.

Headlines: Opioids, Obesity Among the Topics in Series of Newly Released AAP Clinical Reports
Teaser: The American Academy of Pediatrics (AAP) today released six clinical reports and one policy statement covering a range of timely topics relevant to the health and care of children. Here is a snapshot.

Headlines: FDA Okays Abuse-Deterrent Troxyca ER for Severe Pain
Teaser: The abuse-deterrent capsule, formerly known as ALO-02, consists of an outer 'pellet' of extended-release oxycodone around a naltrexone core and is for severe pain when other options are ineffective.

Headlines: Acetaminophen Overdose Antidote Cetylev Recalled
Teaser: Arbor Pharmaceuticals recalls three lots of acetylcysteine (Cetylev) effervescent tablets for oral solution because of an inadequate seal of the blister pack.

Headlines: Stigma 'Killing' South Africans Living With HIV
Teaser: Scientists are testing an experimental drug that's designed to have the painkilling power of morphine without some of the side effects that can lead to overdose deaths.

Headlines: A Morphine Alternative With Less Overdose Risk?
Teaser: Surescripts attributes the increase to prescribers sending more scripts online and to a groundswell in electronic prescribing of controlled substances.

Headlines: Volume of Electronic Prescriptions Continues to Rise
Teaser: Suicide is a leading cause of death for teens worldwide, and the odds of suicide attempts may be higher when adolescents abuse prescription drugs, a Chinese study suggests.

Headlines: Prescription Drug Abuse Tied to Increased Risk of Teen Suicide
Teaser: From 1999 to 2013, NAS rates tripled in the 28 states that have data. Some states now have more than 30 cases per 1000 live births.

Headlines: Neonatal Abstinence Syndrome up 300% in States With Data
Teaser: A home-based strategy drawn on cognitive-behavioral therapy (CBT) gave some relief to women with severe chronic pain allegedly related to the HPV vaccine.

Headlines: CBT-Based Approach Helps Ease HPV Vaccine Symptoms in  Japan
Teaser: The doctor's practice partner -- her husband -- was not accused of anything illegal but was censured by two medical boards.

Headlines: Pill Mill Doctor to Serve Jail Time
Teaser: Timely treatment of coccidioidomycosis is often hampered by clinicians overlooking the fungal infection as a possible cause of pneumonia or ongoing flu-like symptoms in patients who live in or visit the southwestern U.S., according to an updated practice guideline from the Infectious Diseases Society of America (IDSA).

Headlines: Updated Guideline Seeks to Improve Early Diagnosis of Valley Fever
Teaser: Successful treatment of HCV with elbasvir-grazoprevir in patients undergoing opioid agonist therapy suggests access to curative therapies should not be restricted in these patients.

Headlines: HCV Drug Effective in Patients With Drug Addiction
Teaser: Practicing surgery on a piece of pork â€” thatâ€™s how some doctors are learning to implant a new drug that curbs opioid cravings. Itâ€™s not a skill set typically used in addiction medicine.

Headlines: Doctors Need a New Skill Set for This Opioid Abuse Treatment
Teaser: There might be independent gut-to-brain and brain-to-gut pathways in patients with irritable bowel syndrome (IBS), researchers from Australia report.

Headlines: Independent Pathways Connect Brain and Gut in Irritable Bowel Syndrome
Teaser: Counterfeit alprazolam tablets containing the highly potent opioid fentanyl have been behind a series of cases of central nervous system depression and death in California.

Headlines: Counterfeit Alprazolam Poses a 'Major Public Health Threat'
Teaser: Two advisory committees voted 18-1 that the new drug should be approved. They also voted overwhelmingly for labeling it as an abuse deterrent by oral, nasal, and intravenous routes.

Headlines: FDA Panels Back Abuse-Deterrent Arymo ER for Severe Pain
Teaser: For diabetes patients with moderate-to-severe neuropathic pain, those who can tolerate the treatment often experience significant relief.

Headlines: Transdermal Buprenorphine May Ease Neuropathic Pain, With Caveat
Teaser: Americans are overdosing at epidemic rates on opioids, and the nation's doctors are inadequately prepared to help, according to some public health experts. They say the shortfall begins in medical school.

Headlines: FDA Advisory Committee Reviews Opioids in Kids
Teaser: Children may be undertreated, say experts, as clinicians tackle epidemic of misuse and abuse of opioid drugs across the country.

Headlines: FDA Contest Seeks App to Fight Opioid Overdose
Teaser: The FDA is sponsoring a contest to come up with an app that will quickly bring naloxone to individuals who are overdosing on prescription or illicit opioids.

Headlines: Most Mental Illnesses, Substance Use Disorders Go Untreated
Teaser: Millions of Americans struggle with mental illness and substance use disorders, yet most remain untreated, according to a new report.

Headlines: AAP: Stop Giving Codeine to Children
Teaser: The American Academy of Pediatrics urges parents and healthcare providers to stop giving codeine to children and calls for formal restrictions on its use.

Headlines: AAFP to Tackle Climate Change, Drug Prices, Pain in Orlando
Teaser: A resolution calling for a Surgeon General's report on gun violence and another on remaining neutral about physician-assisted suicide will be among the issues considered at the Congress of Delegates.

Headlines: Time to Abandon the Digital Rectal Exam?
Teaser: Data from the PLCO trial show that routine DRE screening for prostate cancer yields minimal gain at maximal discomfort, suggesting the DRE should be abandoned. Some experts disagree.

Headlines: Study: Spending on Opioid Treatment Rose More Than 1300%
Teaser: Based on an analysis of insurance company payments, emergency room visits and lab tests were responsible for much of the overall spending.

Headlines: Soccer Injuries Surge as More Kids Play
Teaser: As soccer has soared in popularity in recent decades, injury rates for youth players have also surged, a U.S. study suggests.

Headlines: Six in 10 Diabetes Patients Get a Statin, but Should They All?
Teaser: Clinicians who treat diabetes patients who are free of CVD should ensure they receive a statin, says a study author; but another expert argues it is not     necessary to put every diabetes patient on one.

Headlines: Top Medical Leaders Debate Nation's Public Health Progress
Teaser: The speakers shared views on Zika, disease prevention, funding for emergency outbreaks, social determinants of health, and FDA priorities.

Headlines: Starting Tests in the Waiting Room Helps Shorten ED Stays
Teaser: Adults who came to a Los Angeles County emergency department (ED) complaining of abdominal pain had shorter stays if tests were started while they were still in the waiting room, investigators say.

Headlines: Medical Marijuana: Role in Oncology?
Teaser: A review finds evidence for a potential role for marijuana in oncology but insufficient evidence to recommend it as a first-line treatment.

Headlines: Endocarditis Hospitalizations of IV Drug Abusers Jump
Teaser: The trend in hospitalizations of injection-drug users for infective endocarditis mirrors the trends of the opioid, heroin, HCV, and overdose epidemics.

Headlines: Vast Majority of Depressed Patients Go Untreated
Teaser: More 75% of individuals with depression receive no treatment for the disorder, new research shows.

Headlines: Injury Risk Rises Just Before and After a Cancer Diagnosis
Teaser: People who are undergoing tests to determine whether they have cancer, or those who receive a cancer diagnosis, are at increased risk for injuries.

Headlines: Limit Prescribing Opioids, Benzos Together, FDA Warns
Teaser: Both classes of drugs depress the central nervous system, and combining them has helped cause a spike in overdose deaths.

Headlines: 'America's Other Drug Problem': High Volume of Prescriptions for Elderly
Teaser: Older people are often given a huge number of medications, and many of them are unnecessary or even harmful.

Headlines: Tennis-Players May Be Risking Health by Popping Pain Pills
Teaser: For all the talk of banned performance-enhancing drugs in sport, mundane over-the-counter anti-inflammatory pain medications may be more of an issue on the tennis tour, according to numerous players.

Headlines: Why Childhood Celiac Disease Should Be Checked With Lab Tests
Teaser: Even though many children with celiac disease can ease symptoms by going on a gluten-free diet, kids should still get blood tests and other exams to confirm whether they actually have the disease, some doctors argue.

Headlines: Men Get More Pain Relief From Smoking Pot Than Do Women
Teaser: In a study in which participants served as their own controls, men derived greater pain relief than women after smoking marijuana.

Headlines: Pain Experts Want Better Coverage for Alternative Therapies
Teaser: While prescribing of opioids is being discouraged, alternatives such as acupuncture and biofeedback aren't being reimbursed.

Headlines: DEA Delays Kratom Ban
Teaser: Despite an earlier announcement that it intends to ban the over-the-counter herbal supplement kratom and make it a schedule I drug by September 30, the DEA has not gone ahead.

Headlines: FDA Okays New SCS Technology for Chronic Pain
Teaser: The physician-designed BurstDR spinal cord stimulation technology uses intermittent 'burst' pulses, which were created to 'mimic the body's natural nerve impulse patterns,' reports the manufacturer.

Headlines: Abuse-Deterrent Hydrocodone ER Safe, Effective in Back Pain
Teaser: An extension study shows that patients receiving an investigational abuse-deterrent hydrocodone (Vantrela ER) maintained pain relief for 6 months and that the drug was still safe.

Headlines: No FDA Approval for Abuse-Deterrent Oxycodone (Remoxy ER)
Teaser: The agency is asking for additional new trials on this abuse-deterrent extended-release oxycodone product.

Headlines: Intractable Pain Linked to Low Cortisol
Teaser: A pain expert recommends clinicians check cortisol levels in patients with intractable pain before prescribing opioids.

Headlines: Opioid Prescribing Varies Even Within Single Institution
Teaser: Researchers find markedly different opioid prescribing trends at two facilities of single institution in Boston.

Headlines: Fungus May Be 'Key Factor' in Crohn's Disease
Teaser: A fungus in the gut could be a key factor in the development of Crohn's disease, according to an investigation by an international team of researchers.

Headlines: Yoga as Good as Physical Therapy for Back Pain
Teaser: A new study showed that weekly structured yoga classes have the same effect on chronic low back pain as does conventional physical therapy.

Headlines: Food and Pain: The 'Essentials'
Teaser: During the next year, pain management experts aim to develop dietary recommendations for pain patients, and they review here the 'essentials' of what is already known.

Headlines: Congress Members Call for Halt on DEA Kratom Ban
Teaser: A bipartisan group of US Congress members is calling on the Obama Administration to halt a federal plan to make the herbal supplement kratom a schedule I substance.

Headlines: Ketamine May Be Useful in Migraine, Chronic Pain
Teaser: New evidence suggests patients with refractory migraine or complex regional pain syndrome may benefit from treatment with ketamine.

Headlines: Magic Mouthwash Really Works, Says Phase 3 Trial
Teaser: The mouth rinse is widely used but has not been robustly studied. That is now changed, and the news is good.

Headlines: DEA Sounds Alarm on Elephant Tranquilizer Carfentanil
Teaser: The DEA is warning the public and police nationwide about the risks of carfentanil, an analogue of the synthetic opioid analgesic fentanyl, which is 100 times more potent than fentanyl.

Headlines: Drop Pain as the Fifth Vital Sign, AAFP Says
Teaser: American Academy of Family Physicians (AAFP) Congress of Delegates attendees complained that undue emphasis on pain scores has pressured physicians to overprescribe opioids.

Headlines: American Academy of Pain Management Gets a New Name
Teaser: The American Academy of Pain Management has now become the Academy of Integrative Pain Management, to better reflect the direction pain medicine is taking.

Headlines: Buprenorphine Prescribers Treat Far Below Legal Patient Limits
Teaser: Physicians with waivers to prescribe buprenorphine for opioid addiction have the capacity to treat more patients, and efforts are needed to get more patients treated, research shows.

Headlines: A Different Kind of Opioid Crisis in Cancer Patients
Teaser: Opioid prescribing has skyrocketed in many countries, but dying cancer patients are being undertreated with the powerful drugs, a new study from the UK finds. An expert said the same applies in the US.

Headlines: Death With Dignity in Oregon: No Evidence of Abuse or Misuse
Teaser: Oregon has been the model for 'physician aid in dying' laws, and data collected during the past 20 years show little evidence of abuse.

Headlines: Does Adding Epidural to General Anesthesia Improve Survival in AAA Repair?
Teaser: Combining epidural and general anesthesia for abdominal aortic aneurysm repair is associated with improved survival and lower risk of complications, according to a recent study. But the associations may not hold up in the real world, other researchers suggest.

Headlines: 'Unprecedented' Rise in Pediatric Opioid Poisonings
Teaser: Hospitalizations for pediatric opioid poisonings rose sharply from 1997 to 2012, and the largest increase was among toddlers and preschoolers, a new study has found.

Headlines: Knowingly Taking a Placebo May Decrease Chronic Back Pain
Teaser: Patients taking open-label placebo added to their usual care for 3 weeks had greater reductions in pain and disability than those receiving usual care only, reports a new study.

Headlines: Terminally Ill Don't Use Aid-in-Dying Laws to Relieve Pain
Teaser: The latest research shows that terminally ill patients who seek out aid-in-dying aren't primarily concerned about pain. Those who've actually used these laws thus far have been far more concerned about controlling the way they exit the world than controlling pain.

Headlines: Should Kratom Be Banned?
Teaser: The DEA has held off pulling the herbal pain reliever off the market until the public and others have had a chance to weigh in on its use.

Headlines: Physician Charged in Pill Mill Scheme Found Dead
Teaser: Psychiatrist Alfred Ramirez, MD, went to prison in the 1980s for Medicaid fraud but got out to practice in medicine again -- and prescribe painkillers from his gold Lexus, prosecutors said.

Headlines: Myth Busted: ED Docs Not a Prime Source of Opioid Prescriptions
Teaser: Heavy opioid users received the majority of their prescriptions from primary care physicians, not emergency department physicians, as is commonly believed.

Headlines: Heavy Cannabis Use Reduces Bone-Mineral Density
Teaser: People who are heavy, regular smokers of cannabis have a lower bone-mineral density and twice the fracture rate of smokers who do not use the drug, say     UK researchers.

Headlines: Postoperative Delirium, Cognitive Changes Theme of ASA 2016
Teaser: New data from major clinical trials, the effect of anesthesia on the brain, and chronic opioid use will be addressed at Anesthesiology 2016.

Headlines: Remimazolam Allows Speedy Recovery After Colonoscopy
Teaser: For outpatient colonoscopy, the new benzodiazepine provides adequate sedation, and recovery is faster than with the alternative, owing to its short half-life, new research shows.

Headlines: FDA Places Regeneron and Teva's Pain-Drug Study on Hold
Teaser: Regeneron Pharmaceuticals Inc and partner Teva Pharmaceutical Industries Ltd said the U.S. health regulator placed a clinical hold on a mid-stage study of their experimental drug for chronic lower back pain.

Headlines: Imaging for Low Back Pain Unnecessary, but Hard to Avoid
Teaser: Despite near-unanimous agreement on the need to avoid imaging for low back pain, physicians reported several barriers to following recommendations.

Headlines: Clinicians Urged to Manage HIV-Infected Elders Differently From Younger People
Teaser: Differences in immune response to antiretroviral therapy, multimorbidity and antiretroviral toxicities are among the factors that differentiate older adults with HIV from their younger counterparts, and should influence care plans, researchers suggest.

Headlines: Alternative Health Strategies Common for Musculoskeletal Pain
Teaser: Almost twice as many individuals with as without musculoskeletal pain use complementary health approaches, including natural products or mind-body strategies, says a new NCHS report.

Headlines: Support for Marijuana Legalization Rises Among U.S. Adults: Poll
Teaser: Support for legalization of marijuana has risen to nearly 60 percent among U.S. adults, according to a study published on Wednesday, marking a near reversal of attitudes held only a decade ago.

Headlines: Celecoxib, Nonselective NSAID CV Risk Similar: SCOT Published
Teaser: "It is probably acceptably safe to take many of the NSAIDs," said researchers based on their trial of patients at low cardiovascular risk, whose follow-up was cut short after funding was pulled.

Headlines: What Is Kratom? Why Has the DEA Wanted to Ban It?
Teaser: Advocates say the herb kratom offers relief from pain, depression, and anxiety. Scientists say it may hold the key to treating chronic pain and may even be a tool to combat addiction to opioid medications.

Headlines: Pregabalin Relieves Pain in Some Patients With Fibromyalgia
Teaser: About 1 in 10 will get benefit from the antiepileptic drug, a new Cochrane review concludes, but their response is strong.

Headlines: Former Prosecutor Profiles the Criminal Physician
Teaser: Gejaa Gobena, who once directed a healthcare fraud unit at the Department of Justice, knows how and why a tiny minority of physicians are breaking bad.

Headlines: FDA Warns Against Homeopathic Teething Tablets, Gels
Teaser: Homeopathic teething tablets and gels, used by some parents to relieve teething pain and symptoms, may pose risks to infants and children, the FDA says.

Headlines: FDA Panel Supports Greater Community Access to Naloxone
Teaser: A joint FDA advisory committee voted to increase community access to, and boost doses of, naloxone for the reversal of opioid overdose.

Headlines: Cannabis Helpful for Drug Addiction, Mental Health Disorders?
Teaser: A new review suggests cannabis may be useful in the treatment of substance use disorders and anxiety disorders, particularly PTSD. However, more research is needed.

Headlines: ED Visits for Adverse Drug Reactions Common and Rising
Teaser: Four of every 1000 individuals will go to the emergency department for an adverse drug reaction each year, and that number is rising in older adults, a new study has found.

Headlines: Topical Apraclonidine Lessens Pain After Intravitreal Therapy
Teaser: Topical apraclonidine before intravitreal injection reduced pain, but may not decrease the risk for subconjunctival hemorrhage in all patients, a new study has found.

Headlines: Long-term Use of Opioid Patches Common in Alzheimer's Patients
Teaser: Long-term use of transdermal opioids is twice as common in community- dwelling Alzheimer's patients than in their counterparts without the disease.

Headlines: Can Breastfeeding Reduce Babies' Pain During Vaccinations?
Teaser: Infants who nurse during vaccinations may cry less and feel less pain than babies who are soothed in other ways, a research review suggests.

Headlines: Should Recreational Marijuana Use Be Legalized?
Teaser: Four additional states legalized recreational marijuana on election day. What are your thoughts?

Headlines: PRECISION: Differences Emerge Between RA and OA Patients
Teaser: Patients with rheumatoid arthritis (RA) and osteoarthritis (OA) respond differently to NSAIDs and COX-2 inhibitors, according to a subanalysis of data from the PRECISION trial.

Headlines: Abortion by Mail Allows Better Access But Political Questions Remain
Teaser: The experiment â€” involving 50 women in Hawaii, Oregon, New York and Washington â€” breaks ground by letting women get an abortion without visiting a clinic.

Headlines: Deadly Synthetic Opioid 'Pink' Now a Schedule I Drug
Teaser: Deaths linked to novel synthetic opioid U-47700 in six states have prompted emergency action by the US Drug Enforcement Agency.

Headlines: Doctors May Significantly Underestimate Kids' Pain
Teaser: Outpatient assessment of pediatric pain differs between children, parents, and physicians, with pain significantly underestimated by emergency department doctors, researchers say.

Headlines: Surgeon General Urges MDs to Help End US Opioid Epidemic
Teaser: US Surgeon General Vivek Murthy discusses the rationale for sending an 'unprecedented' letter to medical professionals urging them to help end the country's opioid epidemic.

Headlines: Evidence Scant on Nutraceuticals for Neuropathy in Diabetes
Teaser: There is no strong, randomized controlled trial evidence that nutraceuticals may benefit patients with diabetic neuropathy, and longer, placebo-controlled     trials of such agents are needed, say experts.

Headlines: WHO Doubles Recommended Number of Health Visits During Pregnancy
Teaser: The World Health Organization revised guidelines on antenatal care on Monday, saying pregnant women should have twice as many contacts with health providers - eight - as it recommended previously.

Headlines: Self-Harm Is Leading Cause of Pregnancy-Related Deaths
Teaser: Most of the self-inflicted deaths occurred in the first postpartum year, and one in five mothers had no identifiable risk factors, according to a study of Colorado women.

Headlines: Top 10 List of Health Tech Hazards for 2017
Teaser: Infusion errors, poorly cleaned reusable instruments, missed ventilator alarms, and undetected opioid-induced respiratory depression top the ECRI Institute's annual list of tech hazards.

Headlines: Childhood Trauma Linked to Substance Abuse Later in Life
Teaser: Risk for the misuse of prescription pain pills and injectable drugs increases with the number of types of trauma experienced during childhood, new research shows.

Headlines: More Children With Headaches Visiting EDs
Teaser: The number of children brought to emergency departments because of headaches appears to be increasing.

Headlines: More Information on Adverse Effects in Tragic French Trial
Teaser: Clinical details on four of the volunteers who received the drug that caused severe neurologic reactions -- including death in one case -- have now been published in NEJM.

Headlines: Defendant in US Opioid Kickback Case Claims Constitutional Right to Smoke Pot
Teaser: A U.S. ex-pharmaceutical sales representative accused of paying kickbacks to induce doctors to write prescriptions for an opioid drug is asserting he has a constitutional right to continue smoking marijuana so he can remain clear-headed for his defense.

Headlines: Carb-Related Symptoms in IBS Due to Colon Hypersensitivity to Distention
Teaser: Carbohydrate-related symptoms in irritable bowel syndrome (IBS) result from colon hypersensitivity to distention, not from excessive gas production, researchers from the U.K. report.

Headlines: Needling the Pain of Peripheral Neuropathy
Teaser: Pilot study suggests acupuncture gets somewhere other therapies have not in patients with breast cancer.

Headlines: Risk Factors for Overdose in Youth Identified
Teaser: Among persons aged 16 to 26 years who have substance use disorders and psychiatric comorbidities, rates of overdose, both intentional and unintentional, are high.

Headlines: Prescribing Benzodiazepines 'As Needed' May Promote Misuse
Teaser: Prescribing benzodiazepines on an 'as-needed' basis may increase the risk for misuse, new research shows.

Headlines: What Your Patients Searched for Most in 2016
Teaser: The Zika virus surprised everybody in 2016 and sent people searching for more information about its symptoms and how to prevent it. Surprising side effects of common medications and high drug prices also earned spots on the list of year's top searches.

Headlines: Habitual Cannabis Use May Slow Visual Perception
Teaser: An electrophysiology study of retinal cell function finds altered processing with substantial delay in the transmission of action potentials by the ganglion cells in regular cannabis users.

Headlines: Soaring Prices Limit Access to Lifesaving Drug, Experts Say
Teaser: Ongoing efforts to develop policies that increase access to the lifesaving opioid overdose drug naloxone must address skyrocketing price increases, experts say.

Headlines: Phantom Movements in Virtual Reality Ease Phantom Limb Pain
Teaser: A novel treatment using augmented virtual reality and a race car video game reduced chronic phantom limb pain by half in a small study.

Headlines: Congress Passes 21st Century Cures Bill
Teaser: The Senate joined the House in approving the omnibus healthcare bill that speeds up drug approvals, funds research, strengthens mental healthcare, and combats opioid abuse.

Headlines: Medical Marijuana Dispensaries Offer Insight in Patient Care
Teaser: Patients are turning to medical marijuana dispensaries for great service, education, and control over their treatments, which might be a wake-up call for the healthcare system.

Headlines: Low-Value Treatments, Prescriptions Common, Survey Finds
Teaser: Antibiotics top the list of low-value treatments cited by physicians in an ACP survey; others include nonpalliative end-of-life care, dietary supplements, and opioids and narcotics for chronic pain.

Headlines: Colorectal Cancers on the Rise in Younger Adults
Teaser: Cases of colon and rectal cancer are on the rise in people under the age of 50, a group thatâ€™s rarely screened for them.

Headlines: Novel Agent Reduces Pain Crises in Sickle Cell Anemia
Teaser: First-in-class investigational agent crizanlizumab reduced the rate of sickle-cell-related pain crises by nearly half compared with placebo.

Headlines: Bad Economic Times Driving Growing Marijuana Use?
Teaser: Marijuana use is increasing in men and women but particularly among men with low incomes, which may suggest it may be a way of coping with job loss and long-term unemployment.

Headlines: Should Pain Scores No Longer Be Vital?
Teaser: Asking patients how severe their pain is on a scale of 1 to 10 isn't vital to pain management, the AAFP says. What do you think?

Headlines: Bipartisan 'Cures' Bill Easily Passes in House
Teaser: Besides speeding up FDA approval of drugs and medical devices, the 21st Century Cures Act would pour billions of dollars into research, mental health, and prevention and treatment of opioid abuse.

Headlines: New Part B Drug Proposal Deemed Dead in the Water
Teaser: Oncologists, ophthalmologists, and rheumatologists who stood to receive smaller payments from Medicare for the drugs they administer appear to have dodged a bullet.

Headlines: Don't Rush to Ban or Use Kratom, Expert Says
Teaser: A new review contends the herbal remedy kratom has some beneficial properties, suggesting a Drug Enforcement Administration proposal to make it illegal could bring legitimate research to a standstill.

Headlines: What's Hot at ASH 2016 Meeting?
Teaser: New data to be presented at the upcoming American Society of Hematology (ASH) annual meeting will likely change clinical practice for some patients with lymphoma.

Headlines: 21st Century Cures: A Frenzy of Lobbying
Teaser: The 21st Century Cures Act set for a House vote Wednesday is one of the most-lobbied health care bills in recent history, with nearly three lobbyists working for its passage or defeat for every member on Capitol Hill.

Headlines: FDA Flags Recall of Products Containing Belladonna Extract
Teaser: An FDA MedWatch report flags a voluntary recall by Raritan Pharmaceuticals of homeopathic products containing belladonna extract because of potential variation in content.

Headlines: Neurology News Quiz 2016: Test Your Knowledge
Teaser: Physicians gone bad, fighting the opioid epidemic, and approval of a device to treat insomnia were among the most read stories by neurologists this year. Test your news knowledge.

Headlines: Marijuana Use Jumps in Pregnant Women
Teaser: More pregnant women in the US are using marijuana than ever before, prompting experts to warn that such use could lead to adverse outcomes for mothers and infants.

Headlines: Most Psychiatric Drug Use Is Long-term With Few Safety Data
Teaser: One in six adults report psychiatric drug use. Rates are significantly higher in older adults, and long-term use is reported in the majority of cases, despite a lack of evidence of long-term safety.

Headlines: Docs May Endorse Medical Marijuana Use Whether Legal or Not
Teaser: Many US adults who use marijuana do so for medical reasons, but a large proportion of them do so in states where medical marijuana is not legal.

Headlines: Awareness of Sensory Stimuli During Anesthesia
Teaser: About one in 20 patients might be aware of sensory stimuli during anesthesia, a rate lower than previously reported, according to an international, multicenter study.

Headlines: Quiz Yourself: Top Medical News of 2016
Teaser: How well did you keep up with the news this year? Test your knowledge with this short quiz.

Headlines: Cardinal Health in $10 mln U.S. settlement over painkiller orders
Teaser: A drug distributor owned by Cardinal Health Inc has agreed to pay $10 million to resolve claims that it failed to alert the U.S. Drug Enforcement Administration to suspicious orders of addictive painkillers by New York-area pharmacies.

Headlines: High Pain Tolerance May Explain Many Unrecognized MIs
Teaser: Especially in women, suggests an observational study: "It might be that it takes more symptoms/pain to have your heart attack recognized if you are a woman."

Headlines: Low-Price Drug Cocktail Could Tamp Down Death-With-Dignity Cost
Teaser: As Colorado's aid-in-dying law takes effect this month, proponents say they'll make sure terminally-ill patients have access to a new, affordable drug concoction that will avoid the $3,000 cost of a common lethal sedative.

Headlines: Fentanyl Overdose Deaths Double in a Single Year
Teaser: A new report from the CDC's National Center for Health Statistics provides a detailed picture of the drugs most frequently involved in US overdose deaths, which rose 23% from 2010 to 2014.

Headlines: Psychiatry News Quiz 2016: Test Your Smarts
Teaser: Re-emergence of research into psychedelics for mental illness, doctors gone bad and MACRA's potential impact on incomes were among the most read stories by psychiatrists this year. Test your news knowledge.

Headlines: News Quiz: Top Pediatrics Stories From 2016
Teaser: Zika virus, vaccines, new pediatric guidelines, and autism were among 2016's most popular topics in pediatrics news. Test your memory with this short quiz.

Headlines: Common Analgesics May Increase Risk for Hearing Loss
Teaser: Use of NSAIDs and acetaminophen, but not aspirin, was associated with increased risk of hearing loss among participants in the Nurses' Health Study.

Headlines: CDC: Painkillers Not Driving Spike in Fatal Opioid Overdoses
Teaser: The chief culprits are heroin and illegally manufactured fentanyl, although their use is 'intertwined' with abuse of prescription opioids such as oxycodone, the CDC reports.

Headlines: Urine Testing of Prescribed Psychotropics in Addicts Warranted?
Teaser: Patients on opioid replacement therapy and prescribed psychotropic medications had less consistent test results for their prescribed medications than patients who were on psychotropic drugs only.

Headlines: No More Placebos: Sweet Solutions Control Pain in Infants
Teaser: Sweet solutions clearly help mitigate pain in infants; the authors of a meta-analysis concluded that further placebo-controlled trials would be unethical.

Headlines: Urgent Need for More, Better Medical Marijuana Research
Teaser: Support for legalization of marijuana, also known as cannabis, for both medical indications and recreational use, is increasing in the US, but there is scant evidence from RCTs that it actually works.

Headlines: FDA Clears Novel Scaffold for Knee Cartilage Repair
Teaser: Maci, from Vericel Corp, is the first tissue-engineered autologous cellularized scaffold product for repair of symptomatic cartilage defects of the knee.

Headlines: Neonatal Abstinence Syndrome Rising Sharply in Rural Areas
Teaser: Neonatal abstinence syndrome is on the rise among infants in rural areas, a recent study has shown.

Headlines: Teen Drug Use Down, but No Time for Complacency
Teaser: With the exception of marijuana, new data show significant reductions in all major drugs of abuse among US teenagers.

Headlines: Biologics, Diabetes Meds Top 2016 Spending: Express Scripts
Teaser: The nation's largest drug management company, Express Scripts, also said that contraceptives and antidepressants saw an uptick in spending last year.

Headlines: Similar Outcomes With Early Or Late Mobilization After Rotator Cuff Repair
Teaser: Early or late mobilization after rotator cuff surgery appears to yield similar outcomes, according to a new meta-analysis.

Headlines: Role for Cannabis in Treatment for Opioid Addiction?
Teaser: With the widespread loosening of marijuana laws, researchers should step up efforts to consider the potential for cannabinoids in the treatment of addiction, experts say.

Headlines: Playtime and Pasta-Making Ease Psychological Wounds Inflicted by Nigeria's Boko Haram
Teaser: A naltrexone-assisted detoxification program for patients dependent on opioids improves transition to extended-release naltrexone over a buprenorphine-based regimen, new findings suggest.

Headlines: Naltrexone Detoxification Improves Opioid Transition
Teaser: The device, known as Evzio, administers just enough naloxone to stabilize someone who has overdosed on drugs. But its manufacturer, Kaleo, may be positioning itself to find profits in a dire health care crisis.

Headlines: Getting Patients Hooked on an Opioid Overdose Antidote, Then Raising The Price
Teaser: Israel plans to decriminalize personal marijuana use, Internal Security Minister Gilad Erdan said on Thursday, adopting an approach similar to some U.S. states and European countries.

Headlines: Israel Acts to Decriminalize Small-Scale Marijuana Use
Teaser: Study found that almost half of women treated for early-stage invasive breast cancer experience severe or very severe side effects.

Headlines: Severe Side Effects Higher Than Expected in Breast Cancer
Teaser: The US Food and Drug Administration has approved a 2-mg intranasal spray of naloxone hydrochloride for opioid overdose.

Headlines: Second Narcan Nasal Spray for Opioid Overdose Gets FDA Nod
Teaser: Potential biomarkers have been identified whichthat may be able to predict response to celecoxib when used as chemoprevention for colorectal cancer (CRC).

Headlines: Biomarkers Identified for Celecoxib Chemoprevention in CRC
Teaser: The agency has approved an extended-release hydrocodone product (Vantrela ER) formulated with abuse-deterrent technology, Teva announced.â€¨â€¨

Headlines: Another Abuse-Deterrent Opioid (Vantrela ER) Gets FDA Nod
Teaser: Three days per week, a group of women gather at a sport center in the Iraqi Kurdish city of Sulaimaniya for aerobic classes.

Headlines: Iraqi Hospital Offers Aerobics for Female Cancer Patients
Teaser: An online behavioral program for people with substance use disorder has been shown to be effective in clinical trials and could become the first prescription digital therapy.

Headlines: Digital Addiction Therapy Could Be First FDA-Approved App
Teaser: Travis Rieder spent more than four weeks in hospitals and nearly lost his foot after a van ran a stop sign and struck his motorcycle on Memorial Day weekend in 2015.

Headlines: A Scientist Shares His Battle to Withdraw From Painkillers
Teaser: Yoga may improve function and lessen pain in patients with chronic, nonspecific low back pain, a new Cochrane review suggests.

Headlines: Yoga May Ease Pain, Up Function in Chronic Low Back Pain
Teaser: Substantial evidence suggests cannabis is associated with the development of psychoses and schizophrenia, but it also shows the substance may have substantial benefits, says an expert committee.

Headlines: Cannabis: Expert Report Details Health Effects -- Good and Bad
Teaser: Pro-marijuana activists planning to light thousands of joints at Donald Trump's presidential inauguration in a call for national legalization of the drug fear a reversal of recent gains if his attorney general pick is confirmed in hearings beginning on Tuesday.

Headlines: Washington Pot Protesters Have Wary Eye on Trump's Attorney General Pick
Teaser: The new extended-release morphine sulfate C-II uses novel technology that makes it difficult to misuse and abuse, the company said.

Headlines: FDA Okays Morphine Sulfate (Arymo ER) for Chronic Pain
Teaser: The first American Diabetes Association guidelines in over a decade reflect     lack of treatment options for the underlying condition of diabetic     neuropathy and stress that nonopioids are best for pain relief.

Headlines: New ADA Guidance Charts Success, Failure in Diabetic Neuropathy
Teaser: Repeated or lengthy use of general anesthetic and sedation drugs in infants, toddlers and pregnant women in their third trimester might damage children's developing brains, the U.S. Food and Drug Administration warned this month.

Headlines: New Jersey Passes Nation's Strictest Opioid Prescribing Law
Teaser: New Jersey has passed a law limiting initial opioid prescriptions for acute pain to 5 days. But it also requires insurers to cover treatment for substance abuse without preauthorization.

Headlines: Israel Gives Green Light to Decriminalize Marijuana Use
Teaser: The Israeli government voted on Sunday in favor of decriminalizing recreational marijuana use, joining some U.S. states and European countries who have adopted a similar approach.

Headlines: Neurofeedback Promising in Chemotherapy-Induced Neuropathy
Teaser: Neurofeedback attenuates pain and unpleasantness of chemotherapy-induced peripheral neuropathy compared with usual care, and has virtually no side effects.

Headlines: Remote Electric Stimulation May Ease Migraine Pain
Teaser: A device that provides remote electrical stimulation via a discreet armband and smartphone application safely reduces pain among patients with migraine, according to a new trial.

Headlines: Marijuana Not Benign: Warn Teens, Parents, AAP Says
Teaser: As the legal status of marijuana evolves, pediatricians should counsel teenagers and their parents about its potential for harm, including effects on brain development, a new AAP clinical report said.

Headlines: Slim Evidence for Off-Label Antidepressant Prescribing
Teaser: Antidepressants are often prescribed off label for a variety of indications, including insomnia and pain. But new research suggests much of this prescribing is unsupported by the evidence.

Headlines: Child's Overdose Risk Higher When Mother Is Prescribed Opioids
Teaser: Study also links overdoses in young children and antidepressant prescriptions in mothers. The findings point to need for providers to work with families on storage and disposal of the pills.

Headlines: Prescription-Drug Monitoring Cuts Doctor-Shopping for Painkillers
Teaser: State programs that require physicians to check drug registries before writing prescriptions appeared to slash the odds of doctor-shopping for opioid pain relievers, a new study found.

Headlines: Many Physicians, Nurses Want Pain Removed as Fifth Vital Sign
Teaser: Slightly more than half of Medscape survey respondents also said they often or sometimes felt pressure to prescribe.

Headlines: In the ED, Patient Opioid Abuse May Come Down to the Doctor
Teaser: Researchers find wide variation in opioid prescribing rates in the same emergency department; patients treated by the highest-prescribing physicians are more likely to become long-term opioid users.

Headlines: Intensive Bisphosphonate Therapy Questioned in Paget's Disease
Teaser: The clinical benefit of long-term suppression of bone turnover with     bisphosphonates in Paget's disease is questioned by extension findings from     PRISM.

Headlines: New ACP Guidelines for Nonradicular Low Back Pain
Teaser: New ACP guidelines for treating nonradicular low back pain in primary care emphasize nondrug therapies first, followed by NSAIDs or muscle relaxants, and discourage opioids.

Headlines: Multivariable Score Predicts Ebola Virus Disease Severity
Teaser: A score consisting of factors present at or during the days after triage can predict the severity of Ebola virus disease (EVD) and thereby identify patients most in need of intensive treatment, according to new findings.

Headlines: Single Radiation Dose Improves Pain, QOL in Bone Metastases
Teaser: A single 8-Gy dose of radiation significantly reduces pain and improves quality of life in patients with painful bone metastases from a variety of cancers.

Headlines: False Positives Delay Future Mammograms, Linked to Later Diagnosis
Teaser: Women who are told that their suspicious mammogram was a false alarm are more likely to delay their next scheduled mammogram, or possibly not show up for their next screening at all.

Headlines: U.S. Senators Question Kaleo' $4,500 Tag on Opioid Overdose Treatment
Teaser: U.S. Democrat Senator Claire McCaskill on Thursday asked Kaleo Pharmaceuticals to justify the more than 550 percent surge in the price of its device to treat opioid overdoses, becoming the second senator to question Evzio's $4,500 price tag.

Headlines: Rare Amnestic Syndrome Case Cluster Reported
Teaser: A unique cluster of 14 cases of amnesia with unusual MRI findings that may be related to opioids or other substances is being investigated in Massachusetts.

Headlines: Ropivacaine: Less Pain, Hemorrhage Risk During Vitrectomy
Teaser: Despite a similar effectiveness to bupivacaine, lidocaine, and a solution of both, ropivacaine had lower rates of postoperative pain and lower rates of hemorrhage in a randomized controlled trial.

Headlines: No Extra Risk of Compression Fractures With Vertebral Augmentation
Teaser: Percutaneous vertebroplasty (PVP) and balloon kyphoplasty (BKP) are better for back pain than conventional treatment and may not increase the risk of adjacent vertebra fractures, as has been postulated in some studies, according to a meta-analysis from China.

Headlines: One in 10 Women Fill Opioid Prescription After Vaginal Delivery
Teaser: More than one in 10 Medicaid-enrolled women fill an outpatient opioid prescription after vaginal delivery, a new study showed.

Headlines: No Benefit of Pregabalin in Sciatica
Teaser: The antiepileptic/analgesic drug was no more effective than placebo in reducing leg-pain intensity in patients with moderate-to-severe sciatica in a randomized trial.

Headlines: Outpatient Pain Service Cuts Costs in 'High Utilizers'
Teaser: An intensive outpatient pain management program slashed about 45% in costs incurred annually by high utilizers of the healthcare system, researchers report.

Headlines: Simulation Promising Pain Medicine Teaching Tool
Teaser: New research shows the value of immersion training and using a simulated patient encounter for pain medicine-related education.

Headlines: Trump Warns Republican Lawmakers of Backlash for Healthcare Failure
Teaser: U.S. President Donald Trump warned Republican lawmakers on Tuesday that voters could punish them if they do not approve a plan he favors to dismantle Obamacare, as pressure grew on the businessman-turned-politician to win the first major legislative battle of his presidency.

Headlines: Illicit Fentanyl the 'Third Wave' of US Opioid Crisis
Teaser: A rise in trafficking and use of illicit fentanyl may constitute a 'third wave' of the opioid epidemic in the United States, according to members of Congress and federal officials at a House hearing.

Headlines: Novel Compound Promising Alternative to Current Opioids
Teaser: Early evidence suggests a new kappa opioid receptor agonist reduces pain in some patients.

Headlines: Positive Feedback From Communities Using Naloxone Nasal Spray
Teaser: A survey of community health agencies and first responders shows the nasal formulation of naloxone effectively reverses opioid overdose in the field.

Headlines: Yellow Fever Vaccine Advised for Travel to Brazil's Rio, Sao Paulo States
Teaser: The World Health Organization on Monday recommended that travelers to rural areas in the states of Rio de Janeiro and Sao Paulo get yellow fever vaccinations, as Brazil works to contain an outbreak of the virus in the country's southeast.

Headlines: Single Intradiscal Steroid Shot Provides Short Relief
Teaser: A randomized controlled trial showed no difference in back pain intensity at 12 months between patients who received injections and those who did not.

Headlines: Pediatric Opioid Exposure Declining, but Problem Persists
Teaser: Pediatric opioid abuse is declining, but prescription drugs were often the first exposure for adolescents who use the drugs for nonmedical reasons.

Headlines: Opioids Linked to Hospital-Acquired Pneumonia
Teaser: A new study suggests certain opioids may be associated with a higher risk for hospital-acquired pneumonia.

Headlines: New VA, DoD Opioid Guideline Warns Against Long-Term Use
Teaser: Along with noting that long-term opioid treatment shouldn't be initiated for patients with chronic pain, the guideline emphasizes the importance of tapering for those already receiving long-term therapy.

Headlines: FDA Panels Say Risks of Opana ER Outweigh Benefits
Teaser: Members of the FDA's Drug Safety and Risk Management and Anesthetic and Analgesic Drug Products advisory committees conclude the abuse-deterrent oxymorphone's risks now outweigh its benefits.

Headlines: Rapid Shift to Long-term Opioid Use After Initial Prescription
Teaser: The chances of long-term opioid use start to increase after the third day and rise rapidly thereafter, new data show.

Headlines: Metastases, Not Death, New Benchmark in Prostate Cancer?
Teaser: Prostate cancer experts argue in favor of changing the primary endpoint of active surveillance trials to metastatic disease to reflect what is clinically meaningful to men.

Headlines: Start Palliative Care at Diagnosis for Kids With Cancer
Teaser: Palliative care should be started early for children with cancer, ideally at the time they are diagnosed, experts say.

Headlines: ECRI's 2017 Top 10 Patient Safety Concerns
Teaser: EHR issues, unrecognized patient deterioration, test result reporting, patient identification, and behavioral issues are among the other key challenges.

Headlines: Dangerous Prescribing Practice May Boost Overdose Risk
Teaser: Concurrent prescribing of opioids and benzodiazepines -- a dangerous practice that is associated with a significantly increased risk for overdose -- is on the rise, new research shows.

Headlines: Acupuncture Reduces Two Types of Cancer Pain
Teaser: The largest study of its kind found that the Chinese medicine is effective only for the treatment of two kinds of pain; some US experts disagreed.

Headlines: Simple Steps Reduce Pain During IV Placement in Children
Teaser: Quality improvement methods increased use of jet-injected lidocaine in a pediatric emergency department, with robust results, researchers said.

Headlines: Long-term Opioid Use Major Risk After Surgery
Teaser: Approximately 6% of patients who underwent elective surgery continued filling opioid prescriptions for months after surgery, possibly for reasons independent of postsurgical pain.

Headlines: Spinal Manipulation: Modest Benefit in Acute Low Back Pain
Teaser: Spinal manipulation modestly improved pain and function in low back pain during a follow-up of 6 weeks or less, a systematic review and meta-analysis has found.

Headlines: Hospital-Linked Practices Use More Low-Value Care
Teaser: Primary care physicians in hospital-based practices order more imaging and specialty referrals than those in physician-owned community practices.

Headlines: 'Individualize' Prostate Cancer Screening, Says USPSTF
Teaser: In an update to prostate screening guidance, the task force says that for men from 55 to 69 years of age, the decision to screen must be an individual one.

Headlines: Opioid Crisis in America: Experts Call for Action
Teaser: The head of NIDA and other experts say stigma still prevents many physicians from effectively treating the thousands of Americans suffering from opioid use disorder.

Headlines: FDA Panel Recommends Approval for Abuse-Deterrent IR Opioid
Teaser: If approved, the product would be the first immediate-release opioid analgesic with abuse-deterrent technology.

Headlines: FDA Panel Wary of Analgesic-Antacid Combination Products
Teaser: An FDA advisory panel voted against recommending analgesic-antacid combination products for relief of minor aches and pains associated with upset stomach or hangover.

Headlines: Ketamine for Chronic Pain on the Rise
Teaser: Experts grapple with the 'Wild West' landscape of private clinics providing ketamine to patients seeking relief for a range of pain conditions.

Headlines: White House Establishes New Opioid Commission
Teaser: President Trump has established a White House-level commission to examine the US opioid epidemic, with an eye to determining where the federal government can have the biggest impact.

Headlines: Lawsuits, Congressional Inquiry Plague Opioid Manufacturers
Teaser: Opioid manufacturers are the focus of a flurry of lawsuits and a newly launched Congressional inquiry into whether the companies' business practices have contributed to the US opioid epidemic.

Headlines: Pain Rehab Program Linked to Reduced Central Sensitization
Teaser: Patients completing an outpatient interdisciplinary chronic pain rehabilitation program have significantly reduced self-reported central sensitization scores using a new measurement tool.

Headlines: Veterans Opioid Safety Initiative Reducing Overall Use
Teaser: Researchers have documented significant reductions in veterans using opioids, those receiving long-term opioid therapy, and those receiving combination opioids and benzodiazepines.

Headlines: Dramatic Jump in Heroin Use in US Adults
Teaser: Both use and abuse of heroin have jumped dramatically since the beginning of the millennium across the US. These behaviors are often preceded by the nonmedical use of prescription opioids.

Headlines: FDA Okays Naldemedine (Symproic) for Opioid Constipation
Teaser: The FDA has approved an oral peripherally acting mu opioid receptor antagonist for treatment of opioid-induced constipation.

Headlines: New Drug Target for Opiate Use Disorder Discovered
Teaser: A new study provides the first direct evidence of opiate-related epigenetic alterations in the brain and points to a potential new drug target for opiate use disorder.

Headlines: States Consider Mandatory Treatment for Opioid Abusers
Teaser: Several states are drafting legislation to force those who abuse opioids into treatment. Such proposals are a step in the right direction, but are poorly crafted, say addiction experts.

Headlines: CHMP Backs Pentosan Polysulfate for Bladder Pain Syndrome
Teaser: The orphan drug is for treatment of bladder pain syndrome characterized by glomerulations or Hunner's lesions in adults with moderate to severe pain, urgency and, frequency of micturition.

Headlines: Treat Substance Abuse as Chronic Condition, ACP Says
Teaser: The American College of Physicians has issued a new policy statement with recommendations for preventing and treating substance abuse, emphasizing that it is a chronic condition.

Headlines: Healthcare Reform Will Dominate Internal Medicine Meeting
Teaser: Changes to healthcare will be a hot topic at the American College of Physicians meeting, as internists grapple with the best way to deal with patients who might lose insurance.

Headlines: Childhood Emotional Abuse Tied to Adult Opioid Addiction
Teaser: Why do some people who are abused as children develop substance abuse problems in adulthood whereas others do not? A study suggests that emotional abuse, impulsivity, and PTSD may be missing links.

Headlines: Buprenorphine Halves NAS Treatment Time
Teaser: Among infants with neonatal abstinence syndrome, treatment time was almost halved when infants received sublingual buprenorphine instead of oral morphine, a new study has found.

Headlines: Prostate Cancer Screening Among Hot Topics at AUA 2017
Teaser: Physician response to whether they recommend prostate-specific antigen to family and friends or are tested themselves will inform debate at the upcoming American Urological Association (AUA) meeting.

Headlines: Muscle Pain Reported Mostly by Those Aware They're on Statins
Teaser: Attribute most reported muscle pain on statins to the power of suggestion, says a new analysis of a decade-old trial. An observer says the truth is in middle: often it's a nocebo effect, often it's real.

Headlines: Multidisciplinary Review Reduces Unnecessary Lumbar Surgeries
Teaser: With the input of a multidisciplinary team of specialists, nonsurgical options emerge for the majority of lumbar fusion surgery recommendations.

Headlines: Message Heard? Pain Med Prescribing Down Second Year in Row
Teaser: Researchers say the downturn stems in part from more rigorous prescribing guidelines for opioids, issued in response to an epidemic of addiction and overdoses.

Headlines: Rethinking Pain Can Help Hospitalists Fight Opioid Crisis
Teaser: Changes in the assessment of patients reporting pain, expectations about pain management, and prescribing practices can help curb the opioid crisis, according to experts.

Headlines: FDA OKs Bunavail for Induction of Opioid Addiction Treatment
Teaser: The FDA has broadened the indication for Bunavail (buprenorphine and naloxone) buccal film to include induction of buprenorphine treatment for opioid dependence.

Headlines: NIH and War on Opioid Abuse Fare Well in Spending Bill
Teaser: The NIH would get a $2 billion raise in a spending bill that funds the government through September. Lawmakers also put their money where their mouth is on battling the opioid epidemic.

Headlines: Excitement Builds as ONS Congress Nears Opening Day
Teaser: Members of the Oncology Nursing Society will converge on Denver for the 2017 Annual Congress, where they can immerse themselves in diverse pathways of interest that collectively advance patient care.

Headlines: Opioid Addiction: 'Alarming' Death Rate in Primary Care
Teaser: Opioid-related deaths have been attributed largely to overdoses. This study shows surprisingly high rates of mortality from medical causes that affect opioid addicts in primary care settings.

Headlines: Medical Marijuana Laws Spark Uptick in Illicit Cannabis Use
Teaser: An additional one million more persons may be using cannabis illicitly, and an additional 500,000 cases of cannabis use disorder may be due to medical marijuana laws.

Headlines: Twenty-one Physicians Charged in Kickback Scheme
Teaser: The physicians had signed up with an ambitious practice management firm that promised new revenue streams from ancillary services, such as dispensing pain cream. Now they've got legal pain.

Headlines: Persistent Opioid Use High After Hip or Knee Surgery
Teaser: Study of commercial insurance claims found more than 7% of people who use opioids before hip or knee replacement surgery become persistent users in the year after the procedure.

Headlines: Back Pain: Little Benefit With Mindfulness Stress Reduction
Teaser: Mindfulness-based stress reduction may help patients with back pain in the short-term, but the benefits are not sustained or clinically meaningful in long-term follow-up, a meta-analysis showed.

Headlines: Sleep Studies and VTEs Headline Hospitalists Meeting
Teaser: Curbing interruptions to patient's sleep and a rare look into hospital-associated venous thromboembolism (VTEs) will be among the hot topics at the upcoming Society of Hospital Medicine meeting.

Headlines: Don't Use Tramadol and Codeine in Kids Under 12, FDA Warns
