Teaser: The two opioids pose the risk for potentially fatal respiratory depression in young children. The FDA also is restricting their use in older children.

Headlines: Marijuana Use in Pregnant Teens 'Worryingly' High
Teaser: A large, population-based study found a significantly higher rate of acute adverse events such as sepsis, venous thromboembolism, and fracture, even after a low-dose, short-term steroid treatment.

Headlines: Even Short-term Oral Steroids Carry Serious Risk
Teaser: Following similar action by several states, two US senators have introduced bipartisan legislation that would limit initial opioid prescription for acute pain to 7 days.

Headlines: New Bill to Put 7-Day Limit on Pain Med Prescriptions
Teaser: The FDA has approved a noninvasive vagus nerve stimulation device for the treatment of pain from cluster headache in adults.

Headlines: Trump Budget Revives Malpractice Damage Caps
Teaser: The White House said tough tort reform measures would save the federal government $55 billion over 10 years, part of the $3.6 trillion it's trying to cut.

Headlines: 'Power Over Pain' Intervention Tackles Perception of Cancer Pain
Teaser: The three-component intervention called Power Over Pain - Coaching provides tools to promote the perception of pain control and improve function in African American patients with cancer pain.

Headlines: High Anxiety: Political Turmoil, Health Reform Take Their Toll
Teaser: A new poll shows that political turmoil and concerns about healthcare and health reform are contributing to rising rates of anxiety among Americans.

Headlines: Opioid Oversupply Common After Surgery
Teaser: Most patients have unused opioid pills after treatment of surgical pain, while few report awareness of proper storage or disposal practices.

Headlines: Brain Stimulation Helps Kick Chronic Knee Pain
Teaser: Transcranial direct-current stimulation provides benefit over sham stimulation in reducing pain associated with knee osteoarthritis, randomized results show.

Headlines: What's Hot: Your Guide to APA 2017 Annual Meeting Highlights
Teaser: Among this year's 450 sessions: discussions of the current opioid crisis, healthcare legislature, and teen suicide; celebrity talks; and information on the launch of a national mental health registry.

Headlines: Physician Given Second Chance Gets 10 Years on Opioid Charges
Teaser: Dr Robert Ritchea got out of professional trouble only to operate a pill mill and dispense painkillers directly to addicts.

Headlines: FDA Clears Iovera Cold Treatment Device for Knee OA Pain
Teaser: The iovera technology from Myoscience, Inc, is a nonopioid, nonsystemic treatment for blocking pain signals from peripheral nerves in patients with knee osteoarthritis (OA).

Headlines: Postvasectomy Opioids Not Always Needed for Pain
Teaser: Urologists can play a part in reducing the opioid abuse crisis by curtailing prescriptions after vasectomy, more than half of which are never filled, new data show.

Headlines: Will This Substance-Abuse Patient Relapse? Ask IBM's Watson
Teaser: A population health management company will use the supercomputer's artificial intelligence to spot patients at high risk for abusing again and set the stage for intervention.

Headlines: New Guideline Recommends Opioids Only as a Last Resort
Teaser: Canada has released a new guideline advising physicians to significantly curtail opioid prescribing and only use the drugs as a 'last resort' in patients with chronic noncancer pain.

Headlines: Opioid Makers May Have to Teach Physicians About Yoga
Teaser: The FDA wants opioid Rx education funded by Big Pharma to point clinicians toward nondrug methods of managing pain. "Nobody has overdosed from too much mindfulness," says one expert.

Headlines: Brachytherapy: Alternative to Surgery in Penile Cancer?
Teaser: The largest study to date of the use of brachytherapy in penile cancer showed high rates of survival and allowed men to avoid surgery.

Headlines: Trump May Defund Drug Control Agency During Opioid Crisis
Teaser: The White House says a proposed 94% budget cut for the Office of National Drug Control Policy would eliminate duplicative programs, one of which funds educational events for opioid prescribers.

Headlines: Preop Opioid Use Linked to Worse Spine Surgery Outcomes
Teaser: The cause of worse outcomes after lumbar fusion surgery could be multifactorial, ranging from worse baseline pain to effects of the drugs themselves, researchers speculate.

Headlines: All NSAIDs Linked to Increased MI Risk
Teaser: A new meta-analysis of patient-level data found that the heightened risk for myocardial infarction occurred in the first week with all five commonly used NSAIDs.

Headlines: Skipping Finnegan Score Reduces NAS Treatment, LOS
Teaser: A functional scoring system dramatically reduced morphine treatment and length of stay among infants with neonatal abstinence syndrome compared with the widely used Finnegan scoring system.

Headlines: Avelumab: Another Immunotherapy for Bladder Cancer
Teaser: Avelumab has been approved in the US for second-line use in urothelial cancer, making it the fourth immunotherapy with this indication.

Headlines: No Symptoms, No Thyroid Screening, Says USPSTF
Teaser: In an update of 1996 recommendations, the United States Preventive Services Task Force (USPSTF) delivers the same message: don't screen for thyroid cancer.

Headlines: Statin Use Increases Odds of Back Disorder: Cohort Study
Teaser: "Our results challenge prior work showing a protective effect of statins on musculoskeletal conditions," says the lead author.

Headlines: Chronic Pain Opioid Guidelines Updated for State Medical Boards
Teaser: The Federation of State Medical Boards' updated guidelines on the long-term use of opioid analgesics reflect advisories from the CDC and FDA regarding the opioid epidemic.

Headlines: Societal Cost of Heroin Skyrockets
Teaser: An estimated 1 million people in the US are active heroin users. A new analysis puts the societal cost per heroin user per year at more than $50,000.

Headlines: FDA Announces New Policy Steps to Address Opioid Crisis
Teaser: The agency will be forming a new steering committee, as well as holding a 2-day public workshop next month to discuss whether more can be done with abuse-deterrent properties for opioids.

Headlines: Electronic Prescribing of Controlled Substances Growing
Teaser: A new Surescripts report shows the rate is highest in New York, which mandates it; the number of electronic prescribers is also up.

Headlines: FDA Asks Endo Pharma to Take Opana ER Off the Market
Teaser: For the first time, the FDA has asked a company to remove a currently marketed opioid pain medication from the market because of the public health consequences of abuse.

Headlines: Should You Wait Before Having Surgery for an ACL Tear?
Teaser: For some people, delaying knee surgery after an anterior cruciate ligament (ACL) rupture and trying exercise therapy instead may produce better outcomes over the long term, researchers suggest.

Headlines: WHO's New Essential Medicines List Includes a 40-Year First
Teaser: Experts announce three categories for antibiotics to guide clinicians in their use. The list also contains two new cancer drugs and a combo drug for hepatitis C.

Headlines: 1980 NEJM Letter the Genesis of the Opioid Crisis?
Teaser: A now infamous one-paragraph letter published in the New England Journal of Medicine in 1980 may have been the spark that ignited today's opioid epidemic.

Headlines: Intraoperative Ketamine Does Not Cut Postop Delirium, Pain
Teaser: Guidelines should revisit common practice of giving intraoperative ketamine to surgery patients to reduce postoperative pain and delirium, study suggests.

Headlines: New Model May Increase Access to Addiction Treatment
Teaser: Collaborative care may provide a new supply of clinicians to meet the need for substance use disorder treatment, but the model is just beginning to be tested.

Headlines: Ohio First State to Sue Opioid Manufacturers
Teaser: The state of Ohio, an epicenter of the opioid epidemic, is suing five opioid manufacturers, alleging the companies misled the state, prescribers, and users about the medications' risks and benefits.

Headlines: Surgeon Who Inflated Breast Cancer Risk Jailed for 15 Years
Teaser: British breast surgeon Ian Patterson, who was recently found guilty of carrying out unnecessary operations, has now been sentenced.

Headlines: Quadriceps Strengthening, Blood-Flow Restriction for Patellofemoral Pain
Teaser: Low-load quadriceps strengthening with blood-flow restriction may be more effective than standard quadriceps strengthening for reducing patellofemoral pain, researchers from Australia report.

Headlines: Fiber Rich Diet May Protect Against Arthritis Knee Pain
Teaser: Older people who eat the most fiber are at lower risk of developing knee pain and stiffness due to osteoarthritis (OA), new research shows.

Headlines: AL Doctor Tied to Insys Gets 20 Years for Illegal Prescriptions
Teaser: An Alabama doctor was sentenced on Thursday to 20 years in prison after being convicted with a colleague of prescribing painkillers through two clinics for no legitimate purpose, in a case tied to the U.S. probe of Insys Therapeutics Inc.

Headlines: EEG Measures Pain-Related Brain Activity in Infants
Teaser: Researchers have validated a template of nociceptive brain activity that they say could prove to be valuable for testing analgesic effects in babies.

Headlines: Brazilian Doctors Use Fish Skin to Treat Burn Victims
Teaser: Researchers in Brazil are experimenting with a new treatment for severe burns using the skin of tilapia fish, an unorthodox procedure they say can ease the pain of victims and cut medical costs.

Headlines: Amy Reed, MD, Morcellator Opponent, Dies of Uterine Cancer
Teaser: She and her husband sought to ban the use of power morcellators in laparoscopic hysterectomies as too risky after the device upstaged an occult cancer during her own procedure.

Headlines: Long-Term Opioids for Neuropathy Linked to Adverse Events
Teaser: Long-term opioid therapy for neuropathic pain, defined as opioid use for 90 days or more, is associated with a higher risk for opioid dependency and overdose with no improvement in functional status.

Headlines: 'Dark Web' Offers Easy Access to Illicit Drugs
Teaser: Psychiatrists should be aware their patients may be involved in a flourishing underground pharmacy economy facilitated by the 'Dark Web.'

Headlines: Drug for Nerve Pain Boosts High for Opioid Abusers
Teaser: On April 5, Ciera Smith sat in a car parked on the gravel driveway of the Rural Women's Recovery Program here with a choice to make: go to jail or enter treatment for her addiction.

Headlines: Three Key Factors Significantly Reduce Opioid-Related Deaths
Teaser: A large study of more than 32,000 veterans shows that three key clinical measures can reduce opioid-related deaths by almost one third.

Headlines: Opioid Prescribing Remains High, Varies Widely by County
Teaser: Despite a decline in opioid prescriptions, the amount of opioids prescribed in 2015 remains three times what it was in 1999, the CDC says.

Headlines: Endo Pharma Agrees to Pull Abuse-Deterrent Opioid
Teaser: Following a June request by the FDA, the company will pull its abuse-deterrent extended-release formulation of oxymorphone (Opana ER) from the market.

Headlines: Lower Risk of Total Knee Arthroplasty in Patients on Bisphosphonates
Teaser: Patients with osteoarthritis who take bisphosphonates for their osteoporosis have a reduced risk of total knee arthroplasty, researchers from Taiwan report.

Headlines: Pharmacists May Be Legally Liable for Opioid Overdoses
Teaser: As the US opioid epidemic continues to soar, physicians have been held criminally responsible for patients' overdose deaths. Now, it appears pharmacists may be next to be held legally liable.

Headlines: Opioid Therapy for Chronic Pain:  Where to Draw the Line?
Teaser: In a debate, pain experts addressed the contentious issues surrounding the use of opioids in management of chronic pain.

Headlines: Novel Nondrug Approach May Help Chronic Pain
Teaser: A mindfulness-based intervention teaches deconstruction of pain, diverts attention from 'monolithic' experience of pain.

Headlines: Jury Still Out on Cannabidiol for Psychiatric Disorders
Teaser: There is currently no reliable evidence to support the use of cannabidiol for the treatment of psychiatric disorders, a new review suggests.

Headlines: Missouri Latest State to Sue Opioid Manufacturers
Teaser: Missouri has become the third state to sue opioid manufacturers, claiming drug companies deliberately defrauded consumers.

Headlines: Aspirin After CRC Diagnosis Ups Survival in Select Patients
Teaser: Timing and tumor subtype influence benefit of aspirin and other NSAIDs in colorectal cancer survivors, new research suggests.

Headlines: Value of Opioid Antagonists for Withdrawal Uncertain
Teaser: Combining an opioid antagonist with an adrenergic agonist is feasible for managing opioid withdrawal, but it's unclear whether this approach is better than an adrenergic agent alone.

Headlines: Dramatic Rise in Opioid Hospitalizations Among Women
Teaser: An increase in opioid-related hospitalizations is sharpest among women, and opioid-related emergency department visits almost doubled in 10 years.

Headlines: Surgery May Help in Diabetic Neuropathy With Squeezed Leg Nerves
Teaser: Nerve-decompression surgery in diabetic peripheral neuropathy is considered "unproven" and is not reimbursed, but when these stronger data are published, this may change.

Headlines: Treatment Shortfall for Opioid-Dependent Youth
Teaser: Only a quarter overall receive medication for opioid use disorder, and young patients who are female, younger, black, or Hispanic are even less likely to get pharmacotherapy.

Headlines: SAMURAI: Lasmiditan Reduces Pain in Acute Migraine
Teaser: Patients with acute migraine taking the novel 5HT-1F agonist lasmiditan were more likely to have freedom from pain 2 hours later than those taking placebo, results of a phase 3 trial show.

Headlines: Nurse Practitioners in Primary Care in the Spotlight at AANP
Teaser: Presentations at the upcoming American Association of Nurse Practitioners National Conference will emphasize the growing importance of nurses in day-to-day care in the patient's medical home.

Headlines: Experts Tell Opioid Commission: Back Evidence-Based Treatment
Teaser: Speaking to the Trump-appointed commission's first public meeting, addiction specialists also warned that Medicaid cuts would intensify the epidemic.

Headlines: Prochlorperazine Bests Hydromorphone for Acute Migraine
Teaser: Prochlorperazine was twice as effective as the opioid hydromorphone for treating patients with acute migraine in emergency departments, while the opioid was associated with twice the adverse events.

Headlines: Postcesarean Opioid Prescribing Cut by Intervention
Teaser: Shared decision making halved the number of opioids prescribed to women after cesarean delivery, a new study has found.

Headlines: No Need to Declare National Opioid Emergency, HHS Sec Says
Teaser: President Trump's opioid commission wants him to make such a declaration, but HHS Secretary Tom Price, MD, said the administration could effectively address the opioid abuse epidemic without one.

Headlines: Physician's Murder Highlights Risk of Saying 'No' to Opioids
Teaser: Todd Graham, MD, was shot to death by the husband of a patient after he refused to prescribe her opioid painkillers. It's a risky specialty, say pain-management physicians.

Headlines: Senate Confirms Surgeon General, Other HHS Picks
Teaser: The US Senate has approved Jerome Adams, MD, to be the next surgeon general.

Headlines: Senate Passes Bill Mandating Sharing of Addiction History
Teaser: A history of opioid addiction would be required to be displayed in medical records of people who have consented, according to a bill approved by the US Senate.

Headlines: Unused Opioids Reported by Two Thirds of Surgery Patients
Teaser: After surgery, most patients have leftover opioids and don't store or dispose of them properly, a study has found.

Headlines: Mixing Opioids, Psychotropic Drugs Ups Neonatal Withdrawal Risk
Teaser: Infants exposed to both opioids and psychotropic drugs prenatally have a 30% to 60% increased risk for neonatal withdrawal, a study has found.

Headlines: 'Inadequate' Reporting of Ketamine Side Effects in Trials
Teaser: Active assessment, surveillance, and reporting of side effects during trials of ketamine for patients with depression are inadequate, new research suggests.

Headlines: Trump's Pick for Surgeon General Wins Committee Vote
Teaser: Jerome Adams, MD, says that if confirmed by the full Senate, he will make the nation's opioid abuse epidemic one of his top priorities.

Headlines: FDA Clears Noninvasive Device for Intractable Pain
Teaser: The FDA has cleared a noninvasive neuromodulation device for the relief of chronic intractable pain.

Headlines: Opioid Commission: Declare a State of Emergency, Mr President
Teaser: The White House commission charged with advising the Trump administration on the US opioid epidemic is calling on the president to declare a state of emergency to address this crisis.

Headlines: FDA Committee Nixes Opioid With Blue Dye Deterrent
Teaser: Lack of safety data on the dye and of abuse potential led to the vote against recommending approval of an extended-release oxycodone product intended to deter intravenous abuse.

Headlines: New Drug Testing Guidelines Released
Teaser: The American Society of Addiction Medicine has published a consensus document that rounds up the best evidence on when, where, and how to use drug testing in clinical practice.

Headlines: Guidelines on Opioid Use in Pregnancy Released by ACOG
Teaser: Revised ACOG guidelines for treatment of opioid use during pregnancy continue to recommend medication-assisted treatment but say medically supervised withdrawal can be considered, with stipulations.

Headlines: Opioid Treatment Funds in Senate Bill Would Fall Far Short of Needs
Teaser: The $45 billion for opioid treatment in the Senate bill sounds like a lot of money, but an advocate estimates it would provide $1,000 to $2,000 per year for each person in Pennsylvania who might need treatment. Meanwhile, one year of methadone treatment for opioid addiction costs about $4,700 per year,

Headlines: Emergency Visits Common After Hysterectomy, Study Finds
Teaser: Approximately one in 11 women who undergo hysterectomy for benign disease make potentially avoidable visits to the emergency department within 30 days of the surgery, a new study showed.

Headlines: Positive Topline Results for First-in-Class Opioid
Teaser: Nektar's NKTR-181 is the first full mu-opioid agonist molecule designed to provide potent pain relief without the high levels of euphoria that can lead to abuse.

Headlines: Tramadol May Offer a Better Option for Opioid Withdrawal
Teaser: Extended-release formulations of the analgesic tramadol hydrochloride may provide an attractive alternative to two commonly used medications for opioid withdrawal.

Headlines: US Opioid Policies Need Major Overhaul, Experts Say
Teaser: NASEM is calling on regulators to overhaul opioid policies and give more weight to societal risks and benefits when approving or recalling opioid drugs.

Headlines: Hundreds Charged in $1.3B US Healthcare Fraud/Opioid Scams
Teaser: More than 400 people, upwards of 120 individuals involved in prescribing and distributing narcotics, have been charged in connection with healthcare fraud and opioid scams totaling $1.3 billion in false billing.

Headlines: FDA Institutes REMS for Immediate-Release Opioids
Teaser: The FDA is imposing training requirements for clinicians who prescribe immediate-release opioids -- the same restrictions already in place for extended-release formulations of the drugs.

Headlines: Mental Health, Alcohol Abuse Top Causes of Avoidable ED Visits
Teaser: Mental health problems, alcohol abuse, and dental problems are the main causes of avoidable emergency department visits in the US.

Headlines: Opioid Epidemic Straining Critical Care Resources
Teaser: More patients are ending up in the intensive care unit after overdosing on opioids, straining critical care resources, a new study finds.

Headlines: Opioids Overused in Migraine, Overall Treatment Suboptimal
Teaser: African Americans are more likely than whites to have debilitating migraine. But even though there are no racially based treatment disparities, opioid overuse and overall suboptimal treatment exist.

Headlines: Opioids Overprescribed After Hernia Repair
Teaser: Patients used fewer opioid tablets than prescribed after inguinal hernia surgery, and many used none, a study found. The results prompted the surgeons to prescribe fewer opioids after the procedure.

Headlines: Trump Fails to Declare Opioid Crisis a National Emergency
Teaser: A few weeks after firmly stating his intention to declare the opioid crisis a national emergency, President Donald J. Trump has still not taken the necessary steps to do so.

Headlines: Dying at Home in an Opioid Crisis: Hospices Grapple With Stolen Meds
Teaser: As more patients receive hospice care at home, some of the powerful, addictive drugs theyâ€™re prescribed are ending up in the wrong hands.

Headlines: Express Scripts Limits on Opioids Rankles Physicians
Teaser: The giant pharmacy-benefits manager will restrict patients new to opioid therapy to an initial 7-day supply in a new program modeled after CDC guidelines.

Headlines: IBD Patients Seek More Attention to Their Psychological Health
Teaser: Many patients with inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) perceive physicians as not being interested in the psychological impact of the condition on their lives, while one-third of doctors donâ€™t feel qualified to deal with patientsâ€™ psychological problems, a new survey shows.

Headlines: Medicare Unveils â€˜Skeletalâ€™ Site for Hospice Comparison Shopping
Teaser: A federal pilot program will focus on opioid-related healthcare fraud and identifying and prosecuting individuals who are contributing to the prescription opioid epidemic.

Headlines: ED-initiated Buprenorphine Cost-effective for Opioid Dependence
Teaser: After declining for several years, the rate of deaths due to drug overdose among adolescents aged 15 to 19 years rose by 19% in 2015 and was highest for opioids, specifically heroin.

Headlines: DOJ Launches Pilot Program to Crack Down on Pill Mill Docs
Teaser: Immunotherapy in cancer care has taken off, but recent negative trials and limited success have raised some criticism and concern.

Headlines: Teen Drug Overdose Deaths Rising
Teaser: Mental health organizations are applauding the US Senate's recent confirmation of psychiatrist Dr Elinore McCance-Katz as the first HHS assistant secretary for mental health and substance use.

Headlines: Immunotherapy in Cancer: Hits and Misses, but Charging Ahead
Teaser: Federal prosecutors had sought a 20-year sentence, in keeping with Attorney General Jeff Session's push to crack down on crime, especially drug trafficking.

Headlines: Psychiatrist's Appointment as US 'Mental Health Czar' Praised
Teaser: Dusti Hill scooped her two-year-old daughter, Porter, into her arms one day this June in a room filled with toys and cartoon murals, relishing their reunion after 10 months apart.

Headlines: 93-Year-Old 'Pill Mill' Physician Gets 10 Years in Prison
Teaser: The risk of major non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) toxicity in older adults who take the drugs regularly is higher with naproxen and ibuprofen than with celecoxib, according to a new secondary analysis of PRECISION trial data.

Headlines: As Trumpcare Bill Languishes, Former Opioid Users Cling to Lifeline
Teaser: President Donald J. Trump said he will declare the opioid crisis a national emergency, 2 days after HHS Secretary Tom Price, MD, said the declaration was not necessary.

Headlines: Celecoxib May Be Safest Choice for Older, Chronic NSAID Users
Teaser: The US Drug Enforcement Administration (DEA) is proposing that the amount of opioids produced in 2018 be reduced by 20%, citing declining sales.

Headlines: President Trump to Declare Opioid Crisis a National Emergency
Teaser: Ultramarathoners who manage race day pain with nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs) are a bit more likely to develop kidney injuries than their competitors who donâ€™t use the drug, a small experiment suggests.

Headlines: FDA Clears New Spinal Stimulation Device for Intractable Pain
Teaser: The FDA has approve theÂ Intellis spinal cord stimulation platformÂ for the management of chronic intractable pain of the trunk and/or limbs associated with a variety of conditions.

Headlines: Trigeminal Nerve Stimulation Relieves Migraine Pain
Teaser: One hour of external trigeminal nerve stimulation relieved the pain of episodic or chronic migraine at 1 hour and 24 hours and was well tolerated, a study shows.

Headlines: More Children Entering EDs Are Addicted to Opioids
Teaser: Emergency departments in the United States are seeing a sharp rise in the number of children testing positive for opioid dependence.

Headlines: Physicians Get Too Much Blame for Opioid Crisis, Some Say
Teaser: A resolution at the AAFP delegates meeting proposes a nationwide public relations campaign, as well as more education for all factions. Some delegates were put off by the estimated price and intent.

Headlines: FDA Panel Mulls New Data for Pain Patch in Kids
Teaser: An FDA advisory committee weighed results of new study of Butrans transdermal opioid in pediatric patients and whether label changes should be made.

Headlines: CHMP Backs Two Drugs for Opioid Abuse
Teaser: The EMA committee recommends naloxone nasal spray (Nyxoid) for treatment of opioid overdose and buprenorphine plus naloxone sublingual tablets (Zubsolv) for treatment of opioid dependence.

Headlines: Testing Potential Uses for Light Therapy
Teaser: Green and red light therapies explored to treat migraines and skin conditions.

Headlines: FDA Clears First Mobile App for Substance Use Disorders
Teaser: The prescription-only reSET application is intended for use along with outpatient therapy to treat substance use disorders involving alcohol, cocaine, marijuana, and stimulants.

Headlines: First Comprehensive Guidelines for Chronic Pain in HIV
Teaser: The IDSA issued the first comprehensive guidelines for treating chronic pain in HIV, recommending screening for all people living with HIV and multidisciplinary treatment focused on nondrug therapy.

Headlines: 10% of Opioid Users Receive the Vast Majority of Prescriptions
Teaser: On the basis of findings that prescription opioid use in the US is concentrated among a relatively small group of individuals, a new report argues for focused vs population-wide policies.

Headlines: Has the Opioid Epidemic Affected Your Practice?
Teaser: To what extent has the recent opioid epidemic changed your habits for prescribing or filling prescriptions for opioids?

Headlines: Fentanyl in the Cath Lab: Routine but Risky?
Teaser: New data show the potent intravenous opiate weakens the antiplatelet effects of ticagrelor during PCI, challenging its routine and prophylactic use for cardiac catheterization and PCI in the US.

Headlines: Opioids Not Recommended for Cough Suppression in Kids
Teaser: The FDA's Pediatric Advisory Committee voted that the benefit/risk is not favorable for use of opioids, including codeine, for cough suppression in children.

Headlines: Opioid Misuse Still Largely a Prescription-Related Problem
Teaser: Prescription and illicit opioid use continues unabated in the United States, while treatment rates for opioid abuse and substance use disorders remain staggeringly low.

Headlines: Extended DXA, Risk Factors, Predict AFF With Bisphosphonate Use
Teaser: Two new studies indicate novel ways to help identify or predict the small percentage of osteoporosis patients using bisphosphonates who will be adversely affected by atypical femoral fractures.

Headlines: Posing as Doctor's Staff, Drug Company Fueled Opioid Scripts
Teaser: Insys Therapuetics allegedly employed a variety of schemes to get their opioid for cancer pain to be reimbursed for use in patients who did not have cancer.

Headlines: NSAIDs Safe for Postpartum Use in Women With Preeclampsia
Teaser: Use of NSAIDs does not appear to increase rates of postpartum hypertension in women with preeclampsia with severe features, new data suggest.

Headlines: FDA Warns Opioid Maker Over 'Misleading' Marketing Materials
Teaser: Promotional materials for Cipher's drug ConZip are 'false or misleading' because they omit 'important risk information' and other 'material facts,' the FDA says.

Headlines: Ibuprofen Ups Systolic BP, New-Onset Hypertension Risk
Teaser: The blood-pressure increases were observed in arthritis patients taking prescription-strength doses and may in part explain the elevated cardiovascular risk previously seen with the NSAID.

Headlines: PRAC: Pull Modified-Release Paracetamol From Market
Teaser: The EMA committee cites 'risks to patients from the complex way these medicines release paracetamol into the body after an overdose.'

Headlines: Oral Morphine Plus Ibuprofen Inadequate for Pain in Kids in ED
Teaser: A randomized trial showed oral morphine plus oral ibuprofen is not adequate for relieving musculoskeletal pain in pediatric patients in the emergency department; other options suggested.

Headlines: Ibuprofen Better Than Morphine After Minor Surgery in Kids
Teaser: Study suggests ibuprofen has fewer adverse effects and may be better than oral morphine for pain relief in children after minor orthopaedic surgery; neither drug provided adequate pain relief.

Headlines: Prescribing Pitfalls in Heart Failure With Comorbidities
Teaser: Heart-failure patients often have chronic pain, diabetes, depression, or other med-intensive issues and may not even disclose what OTC drugs they're taking. Experts discuss prescribing cautions in these complex patients.

Headlines: Immunoglobulin No Better Than Placebo for Complex Pain
Teaser: Patients with complex pain who received two infusions of IVIg experienced no greater pain reduction or improved quality of life than those who received placebo.

Headlines: Detroit-Area Physician Pleads Guilty to Medicare Fraud
Teaser: Like some other recent federal cases, this one involves inappropriate prescribing of controlled substances.

Headlines: US Ketamine Clinics Continue to Mushroom With No Regulation
Teaser: Patients could end up the losers if some questionable practices aren't kept in check, say clinicians and medical organizations.

Headlines: Opioid Substitute Tracks Brainwaves, Serves Dancing Potatoes
Teaser: A tablet system that distracts users with individually selected content can help patients in pain feel more comfortable.

Headlines: Gabapentin Plus Opioids a Deadly Combination?
Teaser: The risk for opioid-related death was 49% higher in patients recently exposed to gabapentin and opioids compared to those exposed to opioids alone.

Headlines: Better Outcomes With Quick Interruption of Sedation in Surgical ICU
Teaser: Critically ill postoperative patients fare better when sedation is interrupted as soon as possible after admission to the ICU, compared with usual sedation care, according to results from the SOS-Ventilation trial.

Headlines: Heroin Use in the US Soars
Teaser: New US data show hospital discharges related to prescription opioids are down slightly, while discharges related to heroin have soared.

Headlines: Quarter of Cancer Patients Use Cannabis, Mainly for Pain
Teaser: In a state where cannabis is legal, a sizable proportion of older cancer patients seeking medical care are using it, predominantly to alleviate pain.

Headlines: Top-Selling, Top-Prescribed Drugs for 2016
Teaser: A report by QuintilesIMS found slower growth in spending for medications in 2016 compared with 2015 and predicts spending will moderate for the next 5 years as more generics and biosimilars become available.

Headlines: All Opioids Now Subject to REMS, FDA Says
Teaser: The FDA has made good on its promise to require that immediate-release opioids be subject to the same set of prescribing rules as extended-release formulations of the drugs.

Headlines: Vertebral Fractures Frequently Underreported by Radiologists
Teaser: Vertebral fractures are largely underreported by radiologists, missing an opportunity for patients to be treated for osteoporosis and prevent further fracture.

Headlines: Antibiotics 'Not Needed' for Common Ear Infection
Teaser: Parents who take a poorly child to the GP with a common ear infection should not expect a course of antibiotics, says the UK National Institute for Health and Care Excellence.

Headlines: On Opioids, Physicians Have Opportunities for Good, Says NAM
Teaser: Physicians, nurses, and first responders can, and should, be more proactive, substance use disorder experts said.

Headlines: Vagal Nerve Stimulation Stops Episodic Cluster Headache Pain
Teaser: Noninvasive vagal nerve stimulation provides complete pain relief for patients with episodic cluster headaches -- but not chronic cluster headaches, suggest results from the ACT2 trial.

Headlines: Nerf Guns 'Can Cause Serious Eye Injuries'
Teaser: Doctors are warning that a toy gun popular with children can cause serious eye injuries.

Headlines: AAP Offers First Guidance on Tattoos, Piercings
Teaser: The report from the American Academy of Pediatrics (AAP) is designed to facilitate conversations between providers, parents, and patients about the increasingly common desire for body modifications.

Headlines: Amid Opioid Crisis, Insurers Restrict Pricey, Less Addictive Painkillers
Teaser: Drug companies and doctors have been accused of fueling the opioid crisis, but some question whether insurers have played a role, too.

Headlines: Maternal Use of Acetaminophen Linked to ADHD in Kids
Teaser: The risk is related to duration of use, but the causal relationship is still questionable, authors caution.

Headlines: Acupuncture for Chronic Pain: Unprecedented Advances
Teaser: The opioid epidemic and the growing elderly population underscore the need for effective alternative therapies to treat chronic pain

Headlines: Trump Stops Short of Calling Opioid Crisis a National Emergency
Teaser: President Trump has stopped short of declaring America's opioid crisis a national emergency as his own special commission urged in July.

Headlines: Medical Marijuana Reduces CINV, Seizures in Children
Teaser: Medical marijuana helped reduce seizures and chemotherapy-related nausea and vomiting in children and adolescents, a study found.

Headlines: Heart Rate Variability Biofeedback Promising in Chronic Pain
Teaser: Biofeedback is a portable and relatively inexpensive treatment approach that may reduce opioid use among patients with chronic pain.

Headlines: e-Prescribing Bill for Controlled Substances May Soon Be Law
Teaser: Sponsors of a bill that will require electronic prescribing of controlled substances for Medicare beneficiaries are confident it will soon become law.

Headlines: Pain Experts Push for Coverage of Alternative Therapies
Teaser: Clinicians, health insurers, and other stakeholders are meeting to discuss the possibility of extending health coverage to include complementary and alternative therapies for pain management.

Headlines: Medical Food May Help Control Inflammatory Pain
Teaser: When used as part of the clinical management of chronic inflammatory pain, a medical food appears to reduce pain without the need to increase opioid dosing.

Headlines: Mindfulness Reduces Anxiety Among Medical Students
Teaser: Practicing mindfulness, which can include activities such as yoga, meditation, and breathing exercises, reduces anxiety levels among medical students, new research shows.

Headlines: Opioid Use Down Over 10 Years for Hip and Knee Surgery
Teaser: In-hospital opioid use for hip and knee replacement decreased by one third between 2006 and 2014, researchers reported.

Headlines: Patients Overestimate Postoperative Pain, Study Finds
Teaser: Patients regularly overestimate the amount postoperative pain they will experience after surgery; the overestimate is particularly apparent with regional anesthesia.

Headlines: Is Pelvic Drain Needed After Robot-assisted Radical Prostatectomy?
Teaser: Some patients undergoing robot-assisted radical prostatectomy do not need a pelvic drain, new research suggests.

Headlines: Use of Migraine Drug as First-Line ED Therapy 'Inappropriate'
Teaser: New findings cast doubt on the use of hydromorphone as first-line therapy for acute migraine in the ED setting.

Headlines: FDA Urges Clinicians to Help Limit Opioid Prescriptions
Teaser: The US Food and Drug Administration is asking clinicians to help the agency's efforts to limit both the number of opioid prescriptions and their duration.

Headlines: 'Massive' Suffering: Pain Relief in Less Affluent Countries
Teaser: In much of the world, patients suffering from serious illness and injury have little to no access to palliative care and adequate pain relief.

Headlines: Opioids for C diff Pain Connected to Worse Outcomes
Teaser: Researchers have already linked opioid use to longer hospital stays and higher white blood cell counts, and now the same investigators take a deeper dive, looking at C diff severity and mortality.

Headlines: Trump's Pick for Drug Czar Pulls Out After Investigation
Teaser: The decision follows a report by the Washington Post and 60 Minutes that showed Rep. Tom Marino spearheaded legislation that made it harder for the government to police the pharmaceutical industry.

Headlines: Opioids Top List of Malpractice Claims Linked to Medications
Teaser: One problem is that some physicians cave into the requests of persuasive, pill-seeking patients against their better judgement, the medical liability insurer Coverys says in a new study.

Headlines: CDC Considers Expanding Hepatitis C Testing
Teaser: The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) is contemplating lowering the age recommendation for hepatitis C screening, and amplifying the criteria to include those with risk factors.

Headlines: An Oral PAMORA Effective for Constipation in Cancer
Teaser: For the first time, there are phase 3 clinical trial data on a peripherally acting mu-opioid receptor antagonist (PAMORA) for opioid-induced constipation in cancer patients.

Headlines: Physician Office Visits for Opioids Drop After Steady Rise
Teaser: Until last year, there was a steady increase in the number of visits to physicians' offices that involve a prescription for opioids, national trend data show.

Headlines: Librarians See New Patron Need: Naloxone
Teaser: Quiet places where community members congregate are the latest casualties in the opioid epidemic that is gripping neighborhoods and inspiring some unconventional interventions.

Headlines: When Dying Becomes Unaffordable
Teaser: Physician-assisted dying is a highly controversial issue, but patients wishing to end their lives have not been immune to inflated drug costs.

Headlines: Opioid Crisis Inflaming Hep C, HIV in Hard-Hit Communities
Teaser: The opioid epidemic is having an effect on hepatitis C and HIV transmissions, new state-by-state data show, but funding shortcomings are translating into treatment gaps that have some experts worried.

Headlines: OTC Painkillers Offer Similar Pain Relief as Opioids in ED
Teaser: A combination of ibuprofen and acetaminophen was as effective as opioid-acetaminophen combinations in patients presenting to the emergency department with acute extremity pain in a randomized trial.

Headlines: Baricitinib Eases Rheumatoid Arthritis Pain
Teaser: The JAK inhibitor reduced pain in rheumatoid arthritis patients refractory to methotrexate more than a TNF inhibitor, a new analysis of RA-BEAM data shows.

Headlines: Time to Have the Talk! Sex and the Cancer Patient
Teaser: Sexuality is not a topic that gets a lot of attention among cancer patients, especially in the palliative care setting.

Headlines: Disease Control Prolongs QoL in Advanced Breast Cancer
Teaser: A new analysis of data from the PALOMA-2 trial in advanced breast cancer shows that quality of life (QoL) was better for a longer period in patients who had increased progression-free survival.

Headlines: Navigating Methadone Treatment for Opioid Use Disorder
Teaser: Methadone can save the lives of patients with opioid use disorder, but it can also destroy those lives, so how do prescribers determine the proper candidates?

Headlines: 10% of Cancer Patients: Persistent Opioid Use After Surgery
Teaser: Some 10% of patients with cancer who are prescribed opioids after they undergo curative-intent surgery are still filling prescriptions for the painkillers up to a year afterward.

Headlines: Opioid Epidemic Alters Prescriber, Pharmacist Habits
Teaser: Many respondents to a Medscape poll also said that they had increasing concern about opioid-related liability.

Headlines: Federal Panel Urges Incentives to Prescribe Opioid Alternatives
Teaser: In its final report, the President's Commission on Combating Drug Addiction and the Opioid Crisis is calling for new federal policies including incentivizing prescribers to prescribe nonopioid and nonpharmacologic alternatives.

Headlines: FDA Cracks Down on Marijuana Cancer Cure Claims
Teaser: Cannabidiol, which is a component of the marijuana plant, may someday have use in the treatment of cancer. But right now, products are being sold online with claims that are not supported by evidence.

Headlines: FDA Panel Backs New Drug for Opioid Use Disorder
Teaser: RBP-6000 (Indivior Plc) is a once-monthly injectable formulation of buprenorphine that demonstrated significantly higher abstinence rates vs placebo in phase 3 testing.

Headlines: Eliminating Opioids for Chronic Pain Unwise?
Teaser: Solid evidence supports the long-term use of opioids in some patients as long as the benefits outweigh the risks, one expert says.

Headlines: Spinal Anesthesia for Spine Surgery Improves Outcomes, Cost
Teaser: Use of spinal anesthesia instead of general anesthesia for spine surgery improved patient recovery and reduced costs by nearly 10%, according to the results of a single-institution study.

Headlines: One in 10 Opioid Users Treated With Naloxone Die
Teaser: These people are at extremely high risk, but a lack of accessible detox and rehabilitation facilities hampers efforts to help them.

Headlines: Unique Drug Combo Promising for Severe, Intractable Pain
Teaser: Low doses of the hormone oxytocin in combination with the anesthetic ketamine may provide a unique and effective therapeutic approach to some patients with severe, intractable pain.

Headlines: Trial Probes Flu Shots in the Immunocompromised
Teaser: A highly anticipated clinical trial to be presented at the upcoming American College of Rheumatology meeting will help clinicians make decisions about vaccinating patients with immune disorders.

Headlines: Trump Opioid Declaration Unsatisfactory, Say US Governors
Teaser: President Trump's declaration of the opioid crisis as a public health emergency is an important first step, but the states need funding for it to have an impact, the National Governors Association says.

Headlines: Drug-Induced Psychosis Ups Schizophrenia, Bipolar Risk
Teaser: In almost 6800 patients with psychosis that was induced by any substance, 32% converted to either schizophrenia or bipolar disorder; 47% converted after cannabis-induced psychosis.

Headlines: Medicare to More Closely Scrutinize Opioid Prescribing
Teaser: Medicare will more closely scrutinize opioid prescribing and dispensing beginning in 2019, following through on a proposal outlined in a major 2016 law aimed at addressing the opioid crisis.

Headlines: Trump Administration Looks to Congress to Fund Opioid Crisis
Teaser: The US Department of Health and Human Services is moving ahead to address the opioid crisis via the power given by the public health emergency declaration issued by Trump in October.

Headlines: PRECISION: Aspirin Undermines Safety Profile of Celecoxib
Teaser: Further analysis from PRECISION shows that although celecoxib may be safer than naproxen or ibuprofen, adding aspirin may undermine that safety advantage.

Headlines: Spinal-Cord Stimulation: Durable Pain Relief for Diabetic Neuropathy
Teaser: Implanting a spinal-cord stimulator can offer long-term pain relief to patients with painful diabetic peripheral neuropathy, with the majority still using their device after 5 years, say Dutch researchers.

Headlines: Concern Over Adverse Events in Prostate Cancer Trial
Teaser: A phase 3 trial investigating the addition of radium-223 to abiraterone acetate plus steroid has been stopped after reports of fractures and deaths.

Headlines: FDA Okays Once-Monthly Shot for Opioid Use Disorder
Teaser: Sublocade is for moderate to severe opioid use disorder in patients who have begun treatment with a transmucosal buprenorphine-containing product followed by dose adjustment.

Headlines: When PSA Is 4-10, phi Test Helps With Biopsy Decision
Teaser: For men whose PSA level is 4-10 ng/mL, the decision to perform a biopsy is tough, because most will not reveal a cancer. The Prostate Health Index (phi) test may help clinicians with the process.

Headlines: Dyspnea in Advanced Cancer: 'Dying Long Before Death'
Teaser: Despite few treatment options and no consensus on standard of care, devastating symptoms of chronic refractory dyspnea can be safely reduced, even at the end of life.

Headlines: Feds Get Tougher on Illicit Opioids
Teaser: The US Department of Justice and the DEA are taking steps to keep prescription and illicit opioids off the streets and more effectively prosecute those who distribute these agents illegally.

Headlines: Cell Therapy Shows 'Hope' for Duchenne Cardiomyopathy
Teaser: In HOPE-Duchenne, patients with Duchenne cardiomyopathy who received an infusion of cardiosphere-derived cells plus usual care had a 7% reduction in myocardial scars 1 year later.

Headlines: CBT for Chronic Pain May Help Fight the Opioid Epidemic
Teaser: Cognitive-behavioral therapy appears to be an effective alternative to opioids for chronic nonmalignant pain, either as a stand-alone treatment or in combination with nonopioid medications.

Headlines: Doctor's Rx for a Stiff Knee:  90 Percocet Pills
Teaser: As public health officials grapple with how to slow the growing opioid epidemic, the over-prescription of narcotics after even minor surgery is coming under new scrutiny.

Headlines: 'Staggering' Number of Drug, Alcohol, Suicide Deaths Projected
Teaser: More than 1.6 million deaths due to drugs, alcohol, and suicide in the United States are projected during next decade, a 60% increase compared to the previous decade.

Headlines: Ready to Join Organized Marijuana Medicine?
Teaser: Physicians who treat patients with marijuana have three societies to choose from, all of them eschewing bikini-clad saleswomen.

Headlines: Ring Block Improves Analgesia for Newborn Circumcision
Teaser: Ring block, EMLA cream, and sucrose were most effective compared with other analgesic combinations at relieving circumcision pain in neonates.

Headlines: Long- and Short-Acting Opioid Addiction Meds Equally Effective
Teaser: Extended-release naltrexone and buprenorphine/naloxone are similarly efficacious in preventing relapse for patients with opioid use disorder, although naltrexone was more difficult to initiate.

Headlines: FDA Clears First Device to Help Curb Opioid Cravings
Teaser: Placed behind the patient's ear, the NSS-2 Bridge stimulates branches of certain cranial nerves, which may provide relief from opioid withdrawal symptoms, the FDA said.

Headlines: FDA Issues Kratom Warning, Cites 36 Deaths
Teaser: On the basis of concerns that it is addictive and potentially life threatening, the FDA has said it will stop kratom, a botanical substance containing opioids, from entering the United States.

Headlines: Liquid Gold: Screening Urine for Drugs
Teaser: The cups of urine travel by express mail to the Comprehensive Pain Specialists lab in an industrial park in Brentwood, Tenn., not far from Nashville. Most days bring more than 700 of the little sealed cups from clinics across 10 states.

Headlines: Pharmacists Slow to Dispense Lifesaving Overdose Drug
Teaser: Laws in California and most other states allow pharmacists to provide naloxone to patients or their friends without a doctorâ€™s prescription. But many donâ€™t do so, citing lack of demand and awareness among patients, their own fears of insufficient compensation and the challenges of treating opioid users.

Headlines: Terrifying Brush With Death Drives Doctor to Fight for Patients
Teaser: Dr. Rana Awdish was completing a fellowship in critical care when she became critically ill herself. Now, she helps other doctors understand the patientâ€™s perspective.

Headlines: Work-Related Musculoskeletal Injury Common in Surgeons
Teaser: The problem is so significant that some experts have referred to it as 'an impending epidemic,' and fear it may contribute to the projected shortage of surgeons in coming years.

Headlines: Arizona Declares Opioid Emergency
Teaser: The rising number of opioid-linked deaths led Arizona to declare a public health emergency in 2017. One needle exchange program in Arizona operates underground.

Headlines: Drug Overdose Deaths Continue to Climb
Teaser: More than 63,000 Americans died from drug overdoses in 2016, an increase of 21% over 2015.

Headlines: Time to Switch to Atraumatic Lumbar-Puncture Needles
Teaser: Atraumatic lumbar puncture needles are safe and effective, and they cause fewer postdural-puncture headaches and returns to the hospital for additional treatment, according to a systematic review and meta-analysis.

Headlines: Second Injectable Buprenorphine Product Shows Promise
Teaser: The subcutaneous injectable form of buprenorphine could offer weekly and monthly formulations for more flexible treatment of opioid use disorder.

Headlines: Patient-Specific Guidance for Opioid Use After Inpatient General Surgery
Teaser: For inpatients having general surgery, receiving opioids the day before hospital discharge best predicts postdischarge use, according to a new guideline from Dartmouth University surgeons.

Headlines: Cannabidiol Should Not Be Listed as a Scheduled Drug, WHO Says
Teaser: A compound found in the cannabis plant is not harmful, has health benefits, and does not have abuse potential, experts at the World Health Organization say.

Headlines: Buprenorphine Use, Methadone Dose Affect Neonatal Outcomes
Teaser: Infants of mothers treated for opioid use disorder with buprenorphine show lower rates of neonatal abstinence syndrome compared to infants whose mothers are treated with methadone, new research shows.

Headlines: Telemedicine for Addiction Treatment?
Teaser: One Indiana addiction specialist doesnâ€™t shy away from telemedicine, but he still requires in-person visits to begin and maintain his patientsâ€™ Suboxone prescriptions.

Headlines: Ob/Gyns Not Well Informed About Opioid Prescribing
Teaser: Obstetricians and gynecologists need to become better informed about prescribing opioids, survey results showed.

Headlines: More Teens Vaping, Fewer Misusing Opioids
Teaser: The latest federal data on adolescent drug use show that both vaping and marijuana are more popular than traditional cigarettes, and abuse of opioid pain relievers is down.

Headlines: Scientists Race to Regrow Lost Knee Cartilage
Teaser: About 14 million Americans have osteoarthritis of the knees severe enough to cause pain and inflammation, according to the Arthritis Foundation, and more people are getting the condition -- also known as OA -- as they age.

Headlines: Older Americans Taking Too Many Unneeded Drugs
Teaser: Researchers estimate that 25 percent of people ages 65 to 69 take at least five prescription drugs to treat chronic conditions. But some doctors are trying to teach others about â€œdeprescribingâ€ or systematically discontinuing medicines that are inappropriate, duplicative or unnecessary.

Headlines: Psychotherapy May Up Buprenorphine Adherence
Teaser: Psychotherapy as an adjunct to buprenorphine maintenance treatment significantly improves long-term treatment retention rates compared with standard counseling provided by prescribing physicians.

Headlines: Stopping Opioid Addiction at One Key Source: The Hospital
Teaser: Based on research conducted at the University of Michiganâ€™s medical center, a group of surgeons developed a strategy to help post-surgical patients from misusing or abusing their prescription painkillers.

Headlines: 2017 Psychiatry News Quiz: Test Your Smarts
Teaser: The safety of antidepressants, corruption in a 'top rated' psychiatric hospital, and the opioid crisis were among the most read news stories by psychiatrists this year. Test your news knowledge.

Headlines: Quiz: Top Medical News from 2017
Teaser: 2017 has been a year of ups and downs for medicine, with new drug approvals and treatment guidelines, turmoil in Washington, and the continuing opioid epidemic. Test your knowledge about the most-read news stories of the year.

Headlines: Acupuncture Helps AI Pain; Insurers Should Cover, Say Trialists
Teaser: In a randomized controlled trial that was praised as well designed, acupuncture improved pain and stiffness among breast cancer patients taking aromatase inhibitors (AIs).

Headlines: Uncle's Overdose Spurs Medicaid Official to Change Course
Teaser: Almost 2 years after his uncle's death, Andrey Ostrovsky was Medicaid's chief medical officer, grappling with an opioid crisis that kills about 115 Americans each day, learned his uncle had died of a drug overdose.

Headlines: FDA Acts to Stem Misuse, Abuse of Antidiarrheal Loperamide
Teaser: The FDA moves to limit the number of loperamide doses per package amid ongoing reports of serious cardiac problems and deaths with misuse and abuse of the antidiarrhea medication.

Headlines: Endocrinologist Accused of Wife's Murder, Pill Mill, Found Dead in Jail
Teaser: New Jersey endocrinologist James Kauffman, who earlier this month was charged with his former wife's murder and running an illegal opioid prescription drugs racket, has killed himself in jail.

Headlines: FDA Clears Vagus Nerve Stimulator for Migraine Pain
Teaser: The FDA has expanded the label for the gammaCore vagus nerve stimulator to include treatment of acute pain from migraine in addition to the previously cleared treatment of episodic cluster headache.

Headlines: DEA Expands Access to Opioid Addiction Treatment via NPs, PAs
Teaser: Nurse practitioners (NPs) and physician assistants (PAs) are now permitted to prescribe and dispense FDA-approved opioid treatment medications, the DEA rules.

Headlines: CHMP Backs Shingles Vaccine Shingrix for Adults 50 and Older
Teaser: The European Medicines Agency's CHMP voted to grant marketing authorization for the Shingrix vaccine to prevent herpes zoster and postherpetic neuralgia.

Headlines: Bariatric Surgery May Reduce Central Pain Sensitization
Teaser: Pain reduction in obese patients after bariatric surgery may be a result of reduced central pain sensitization as well as reduced mechanical load, and IL-10 might play a role.

Headlines: Four Treatments for Mastectomy Pain, but 'No Magic Drug'
Teaser: Postmastectomy pain syndrome is common after the surgery. There are treatments, but they all come with caveats. In the end, some patients feel the pain is a 'lost cause.'

Headlines: Plecanatide Gets FDA Nod for IBS With Constipation in Adults
Teaser: Plecanatide, already approved for chronic idiopathic constipation in adults, gets FDA approval for treatment of irritable bowel syndrome (IBS) with constipation in adults.

Headlines: APA Mulls Proposed Changes to DSM-5
Teaser: The American Psychiatric Association (APA) is considering five revisions to the DSM-5 following the first use of a new process that allows any physician to suggest evidence-based changes to the manual.

Headlines: Stop Selling Illegal Opioid Addiction Treatments, Feds Warn
Teaser: Two federal agencies are warning makers of a dozen unapproved opioid addiction treatments that their products are being illegally marketed and sold.

Headlines: Tamper-Resistant Opioids No Panacea for Opioid Crisis
Teaser: Tamper-resistant oxycodone pills are misused less often by injection drug users but have had little effect at a population level on opioid use or harm, a study from Australia finds.

Headlines: Heated Intraperitoneal Chemo for Ovarian Cancer Ups Survival
Teaser: A single administration of hyperthermic intraperitoneal chemotherapy at the end of cytoreductive surgery improves overall survival in women with advanced ovarian cancer.

Headlines: A Nudge May Be Enough to Change Healthcare Behavior
Teaser: The nation's first research unit devoted to healthcare nudges has created methods to reduce opioid numbers and encourage use of generics. Experts are finding other uses and unintended consequences.

Headlines: Can Crystals Heal? Separating Facets from Facts
Teaser: Do alternative therapies really work?

Headlines: Hospitals Hone New Message in Wake of Opioid Epidemic: Expect Pain
Teaser: â€œWe really do have a lot of responsibility and culpability,â€ says one hospital official who is part of a working group trying to address the opioid epidemic. Patients have to expect more pain after surgery and understand the risk of addiction, says another doctor.

Headlines: No Opioid Cough Meds in Children Under 18, FDA Says
Teaser: Prescription cough and cold medicines containing codeine or hydrocodone are no longer indicated in any pediatric population and will be labeled for use only in adults aged 18 years and older, the FDA says.

Headlines: Endocrinologist Allegedly Ran Pill Mill, Murdered His Wife
Teaser: An endocrinologist has been charged with the murder of his wife almost 6 years after she was shot dead. Prosecutors say he was embroiled in a scheme with a motorcycle gang to illegally prescribe opiates.

Headlines: Opioids Associated With Higher Satisfaction With Care
Teaser: Among people with musculoskeletal conditions, those who received opioids were more satisfied with their care, a study found.

Headlines: Topiramate Dose in Mom Affects Oral Cleft Risk in Child
Teaser: Higher doses of the drug taken early in pregnancy by women with epilepsy were associated with higher risk for oral clefts in offspring; lower doses used for other indications showed a weaker link.

Headlines: Pain Hits After Surgery When a Patient Faces $17K Urine Test
Teaser: Elizabeth Moreno got hit with a $17,850 bill from a Texas lab after leaving a urine sample at her doctorâ€™s office.

Headlines: FDA Panel Gives Exparel Thumbs Down as Regional Nerve Block
Teaser: An FDA advisory committee voted 6 to 4 against recommending bupivacaine liposomal injectable suspension as a nerve block for regional, postsurgical analgesia.

Headlines: American Pain Society Slams McCaskill Report on Opioids
Teaser: The APS says the report's conclusions are 'simplistic, misleading and insulting' and damage their reputation for scientific integrity and advocacy on behalf of pain management doctors and patients.

Headlines: FDA Advisory Committee Nixes Novel Pain Drug
Teaser: Committee members expressed concern about insufficient study data on older patients and lack of clarity on plans for an abuse-deterrent program.

Headlines: Cold Water Plunge a Natural Remedy for Postop Pain?
Teaser: A patient with constant postoperative intercostal neuralgia finds immediate, complete, and sustained relief after an open-water swim in cold water.

Headlines: Orthopedic Issue in Kids? Skip These Tests, Experts Say
Teaser: The American Academy of Pediatrics and the Pediatric Orthopaedic Society of North America identified five procedures that may not be necessary in evaluating young patients with orthopedic conditions.

Headlines: Jury Still Out on CES for Depression, Anxiety, Pain, Insomnia
Teaser: There is sparse evidence supporting the efficacy of cranial electric stimulation (CES) for the treatment of chronic pain, depression, anxiety, and insomnia, new research shows.

Headlines: Trump Budget Ups Funds to Fight Opioids, Cuts HHS
Teaser: The budget takes a four-pronged approach, according to the new HHS secretary, with the fight against opioid abuse gaining some funding, while other departments may take some hits for 2019.

Headlines: Prescription Opioids Increase Risk for Serious Infections
Teaser: Use of prescription opioids, particularly long-acting formulations or high doses, appears to substantially increase the risk of developing invasive pneumococcal disease.

Headlines: PRAC Wants Flupirtine Off the Market in Europe
Teaser: Despite restrictions put in place in 2013, serious liver problems related to flupirtine-containing medicines continue to be reported.

Headlines: Trump Signs Budget Deal, Cuts Medicare Fee in 2019
Teaser: The package also extends many health programs that had expired, repeals the Independent Payment Advisory Board, and adds $6 billion to address the opioid epidemic.

Headlines: Nurse Calls Cops After New Mom Seeks Help for Depression
Teaser: A package of mental health bills in California aims to ensure that all new moms are screened for postpartum depression and that more support is available for those who struggle with the malady.

Headlines: CMS Pushing 7-Day Limit on Initial Opioid Scripts
Teaser: The Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services is proposing that starting in 2019, initial opioid prescriptions for acute pain be limited to 7 days.

Headlines: Hysteroscopic Sterilization Has Higher Risks in First 3 Years
Teaser: For women who had their first sterilization, hysteroscopic sterilization had significantly higher risk for gynecological complications during the first 3 years than laparoscopic sterilization.

Headlines: Kratom Now an Opioid, FDA Says
Teaser: A new analysis by FDA scientists provides strong evidence that compounds in kratom act like prescription-strength opioids.

Headlines: Marijuana May Raise, Not Reduce, Risk for Opioid Use Disorder
Teaser: A new study calls into question the assumption that broader public use of marijuana may lead to a reduction in prescription opioid abuse.

Headlines: FDA Takes New Steps to Mitigate Opioid Overprescribing
Teaser: The the US Food and Drug Administration has released a revised blueprint containing core content for training that drug manufacturers are required to make available to opioid prescribers.

Headlines: Harassment From Patients Prevalent, Poll Shows
Teaser: Harassment is more frequent against nurses than doctors, but doctors get more inappropriate communication from patients. Almost all male nurses say they have been threatened with physical violence.

Headlines: Medical Community Has Sparse Reaction to State of the Union
Teaser: Despite comments from some corners about the opioid epidemic, drug prices, and right-to-try laws, many medical organizations have stayed out of the fray.

Headlines: Severe, Unusual Cases of Memory Loss Tied to Fentanyl Abuse
Teaser: An unusual amnestic syndrome that is linked to the combined use of fentanyl and cocaine and that was first identified in 14 patients in Massachusetts has been documented in a case in West Virginia.

Headlines: Tips From Sports Medicine May Boost Teen Fibromyalgia Treatment
Teaser: An innovative program that combines CBT with neuromuscular training tips from sports medicine is more effective in reducing disability in teens with fibromyalgia than CBT alone, says new research.

Headlines: Much Can Be Done to Ease 'Chronic Fatigue Syndrome' Symptoms
Teaser: In a 2-day summit, clinician experts met to share best practices and to begin developing assessment and treatment guidance for primary care providers and specialists.

Headlines: Medical Cannabis for Pain May Reduce Need for Opioids
Teaser: Appropriate dosing and following of key treatment recommendations for medical cannabis may lead to 'remarkable' improvements in pain and a reduced need for opioids, experts say.

Headlines: Potentially Unsafe Prescribing Common in Patients With CKD
Teaser: Early studies offer insights on correlations between certain brain wave patterns and responses to various types of nonpharmacologic treatments for chronic pain.

Headlines: Brain Activity May Predict Treatment Response in Chronic Pain
Teaser: Surgeons are questioning how necessary opioids are after certain procedures, and are making a case for pain relief with acetaminophen, ibuprofen, and compassion as alternatives.

Headlines: Opioids Unnecessary After Surgery in Some Cases
Teaser: The latest data from US emergency departments are a 'wake-up' call on the fast-moving epidemic of opioid overdoses, the CDC says.

Headlines: US Opioid Overdose Epidemic Getting Worse
Teaser: Opioids were not superior to nonopioids in alleviating chronic back pain or hip or knee pain from arthritis in a randomized controlled trial.

Headlines: More Data Confirm Opioids No Better for Chronic Back, Arthritis Pain
Teaser: Avoiding gluten may not only stop disease progression but also reduce pain in patients with neuropathy due to gluten sensitivity.

Headlines: Gluten-Free Diet Curbs Pain in Gluten Neuropathy
Teaser: Opioid-related pediatric and PICU admissions climbed dramatically, highlighting the far-ranging impact of the opioid crisis; expert asks pediatricians to help fight the epidemic.

Headlines: Pediatric Opioid ICU Admissions Nearly Doubled in 10 Years
Teaser: Rhabdomyolysis is a syndrome involving muscle breakdown and damage. When muscles are injured, they release their contents, including a muscle enzyme, into the bloodstream. The disorder is dangerous but rare. In one study, 22 people out of 100,000 were known to have it.

Headlines: Exercising to Death: The Rare Risk of Rhabdo
Teaser: President Donald Trump, First Lady Melania Trump, administration cabinet leaders, and persons affected by the opioid epidemic shared their stories, struggles, and solutions at the White House summit.

Headlines: White House Opioids Summit Highlights Plans to Fight Crisis
Teaser: Previous research suggests medical marijuana may raise risks for recreational use in adolescents but may lower risks for opioid-related deaths. A study challenges these hypotheses.

Headlines: Legalized Marijuana: Fewer Risks, Fewer Benefits
Teaser: A novel genetic variant has a 'robust' association with opioid dependence and may be a target for the development of novel therapies to treat the disorder.

Headlines: New Gene Variant Robustly Linked to Opioid Addiction
Teaser: The surgeon's role in the opioid crisis and the use and abuse of biologics will be accentuated at the upcoming American Academy of Orthopaedic Surgeons (AAOS) meeting.

Headlines: Misuse of Opioids, Biologics Emphasized at AAOS 2018
Teaser: The collaboration known as ALTO, Alternatives to Opioids, set out to reduce opioid doses in the emergency room by 15 percent. It managed a 36 percent reduction instead.

Headlines: 10 ERs Tried to Curtail Opioids and Did Better Than Expected
Teaser: The insurer says it is not usually medically necessary to have an anesthesiologist or nurse anesthetist on hand during the common surgery.

Headlines: Anthem Calls on Eye Surgeons to Monitor Anesthesia During Cataract Surgery
Teaser: International survey shows modest reductions among people aged 65 years or older, but rates of use in this population are still too high, authors say.

Headlines: Benzodiazepine Harms Overlooked, Especially in Older Adults
Teaser: Compared to all other cancer types, with one exception, the risk for suicide is significantly higher among survivors of head and neck cancer (HNC).

Headlines: Suicide Among Cancer Survivors -- Highest Risk in HNC
Teaser: Metabolomics study identifies 'unexpected effects of a commonly used drug, acetaminophen, on hormone metabolism. Closer scrutiny of this commonly used medication is warranted.'

Headlines: Medicare Changes Opioid, Generic Policies for Part D Plans
Teaser: CMS proceeds with new policies for Part D pharmacy plans to try to combat opioid addiction while continuing to look into how it can help senior citizens share in savings provided by rebates.

Headlines: FDA Recalls Kratom Food Products Owing to Salmonella Risk
Teaser: The FDA has recalled all food products containing powdered kratom manufactured, processed, packed, or held by Triangle Pharmanaturals after several were found to contain Salmonella.

Headlines: Individual Docs Underestimate Their Opioid Prescribing Habits
Teaser: Many emergency department clinicians underestimated the number of opioid prescriptions they wrote, but prescribed fewer once they had the information, a new study showed.

Headlines: How Many Opioid Overdoses Are Suicides?
Teaser: Opioid overdoses and related deaths are still climbing, U.S. statistics show. Teasing out which overdoses are intentional can be hard, but is important for treatment, doctors say.

Headlines: FDA Panel Backs Approval of Lofexidine for Opioid Withdrawal
Teaser: An FDA advisory committee has recommended approval of lofexidine hydrochloride, a nonopioid, for the mitigation of symptoms in the setting of abrupt opioid withdrawal.

Headlines: Embolization Procedure Reduces Osteoarthritis Knee Pain
Teaser: Embolization of capillaries in the knee through use of microspheres reduces pain, inflammation in patients with osteoarthritis of the knee, a small study found.

Headlines: Shingrix Approved in Europe and Japan for Prevention of Shingles
Teaser: In clinical testing, Shingrix demonstrated over 90% efficacy against herpes zoster in adults aged 50 years or older, with efficacy sustained during the 4-year follow-up period.

Headlines: Trump Signs 2018 Budget, With Some Big Wins for Healthcare
Teaser: Many programs and agencies got boosts this year, despite earlier calls for some cuts. The legislation provided no new funding for the Affordable Care Act, though.

Headlines: Tai Chi Beats Aerobic Exercise for Fibromyalgia
Teaser: Compared with aerobic exercise, the traditional martial art of tai chi is as good as, or better than, aerobic exercise for improving the overall severity of fibromyalgia symptoms, new research shows.

Headlines: DPP-4 Inhibitors May Increase Risk for IBD in Diabetes Patients
Teaser: The oral, incretin-based hypoglycemic agent was associated with a 75% increased risk for inflammatory bowel disease in adults with type 2 diabetes in a population-based study.

Headlines: Parental Behavior Significantly Influences Kids' Pain Outcomes
Teaser: Parental behavior has a major impact on a child's experience of chronic pain and associated mental health outcomes. New research shows catastrophizing and exhibiting negative emotions, such as anxiety and guilt, affect kids' response to chronic pain.

Headlines: Trump Vows to Seek Death Penalty for Opioid Dealers
Teaser: President Donald J. Trump's latest plan to stem the US opioid crisis includes stricter law enforcement, interruption of the drug supply, and seeking the death penalty for dealers.

Headlines: For Cancer, Cannabis Has Many Virtues, Says Large Study
Teaser: It's an observational study and cannot demonstrate causality, but new data from Israel indicate that cannabis may improve a range of common symptoms among cancer patients.

Headlines: Abortion Care Varies Highly Across the US, New Report Says
Teaser: An updated report from the National Academies of Sciences, Engineering, and Medicine found the quality of abortion care in the United States varies greatly depending on where a woman lives.

Headlines: MRI Before Biopsy Better Than TRUS in Prostate Cancer
Teaser: PRECISION shows that MRI before biopsy in men suspected of having prostate cancer picks up more significant cancer, and less insignificant cancer, with fewer biopsy cores than standard TRUS biopsy.

Headlines: Kratom-Related Salmonella Outbreak Spreads to 35 States
Teaser: Government agencies reported that 87 people have been sickened.

Headlines: Q&A: What Are We Doing About the Opioid Crisis?
Teaser: Francis Collins, MD, director of the NIH talked about the roots of this epidemic, promising research into both addiction and the treatment of pain, and President Donald Trump's budget proposal for 2019.

Headlines: Low-dose Naltrexone Explored as Option for Chronic Pain
Teaser: A panel of clinicians who treat myalgic encephalomyelitis/chronic fatigue syndrome selected low-dose naltrexone as one of their top choices of drugs with potential benefit in that population.

Headlines: Failed Arthritis Drug May Help Treat Opioid Addiction
Teaser: A cannabinoid type 2 receptor agonist may help prevent opioid tolerance and dependence when used in combination with opioid-based pain medications.

Headlines: Opioid Maker Funds Efforts to Fight Addiction
Teaser: Purdue Pharma, whose signature product helped fuel the opioid epidemic, now wants to help treat it â€” or at least salvage its own reputation.

Headlines: Senate Panel Advances Sweeping Opioid Bill to Full Senate
Teaser: A Senate panel on Tuesday unanimously approved a wide-ranging package of legislative proposals to address the opioid crisis. Its House counterpart is slated to consider on Wednesday more than 60 separate bills addressing painkillers and substance abuse.

Headlines: FDA Panel Gives Partial Nod to RA Drug Baricitinib
Teaser: Agency officials will need to sort through the competing messages from their advisers as they weigh whether to allow a competitor to Pfizer's Janus kinase drug tofacitinib on the US market.

Headlines: ACHIEVE I: Ubrogepant Meets Endpoints for Acute Migraine
Teaser: Phase 3 trial results show that two doses of oral ubrogepant, a novel CGRP-targeting medication, met the primary endpoints of decreasing acute migraine pain and symptoms compared with placebo.

Headlines: Many MIPS Measures Not Valid, ACP Finds
Teaser: More than half of MIPS measurements analyzed were deemed either not valid or of uncertain validity in an analysis published in the New England Journal of Medicine.

Headlines: Alarming Increase in Adolescent Suicides, Substance Use
Teaser: A new report reveals disturbing increases in youth substance abuse and suicide during the past decade and particularly the past year.

Headlines: Painkillers in Pregnancy May Affect Fertility of Offspring
Teaser: Experimental studies show total germ cell number dropped significantly and pluripotency gene expression changed after one day of acetaminophen use.

Headlines: Opioid Prescriptions See Largest Annual Drop in 25 Years
Teaser: Factors driving the decline in opioid prescriptions include major clinical guideline shifts, payer reimbursement controls, and regulatory and legislative restrictions; meanwhile, overall use of medications continued to rise in 2017, a new report shows.

Headlines: What's Hot at AAN 2018?
Teaser: 'Interaction and innovation' is the theme of this year's AAN Annual Meeting, says the vice chair of the meeting's science committee, who hints of other hot topics to be presented.

Headlines: Opioid Overprescribing Down, but Still Room for Improvement
Teaser: Opioid prescribing rates dropped during a 5-year period. Nevertheless, these drugs continue to be overprescribed in high-risk patients, and naloxone coprescription is suboptimal.

Headlines: 2018 March for Science Focused on Public Health Advocacy
Teaser: At the second annual March for Science in Washington, speakers called for greater use of science to inform rational health-related public policies.

Headlines: Bedtime Ritual Improves Sleep, Keeps Hospital Rooms Quiet
Teaser: The Sleep Hygiene in the Hospital Project (SHH!) significantly improves the quality of rest experienced by hospitalized patients, new research shows, and can be easily replicated at minimal cost.

Headlines: Limits on Medical Marijuana Research Hinder Patients' Relief
Teaser: Because the federal government classifies marijuana a Schedule 1 drug, research on marijuana or its active ingredients is highly restricted and even discouraged in some cases.

Headlines: Surgeon General's Naloxone Advisory Fuels Passionate Debate
Teaser: The advisory calling for more Americans to carry the opioid overdose antidote naloxone has struck a nerve  among healthcare providers.

Headlines: Disaster Medicine in Eye of Storm at IM Meeting
Teaser: Lessons learned after deadly hurricanes will be shared at the upcoming Internal Medicine (IM) Meeting, along with updates on hypertension, medical marijuana, and wearables.

Headlines: Congress Aiming to Advance More Opioid-Related Legislation
Teaser: A Senate committee compiled a new wish list but did not discuss how to pay for the new legislation.

Headlines: FDA OKs Exparel for Pain Relief After Shoulder Surgery
Teaser: Clinical trial data do not support the general use of Exparel for regional nerve blocks for analgesia after procedures other than shoulder surgery, the FDA said.

Headlines: FDA Approves Rucaparib as Maintenance Therapy for Ovarian Cancer
Teaser: The new FDA action does not require biomarker testing prior to prescribing.

Headlines: Surgeon General Urges More Americans to Carry Overdose Antidote
Teaser: The surgeon general wants more individuals, including those who are personally at risk for an opioid overdose as well as their family and friends, to keep naloxone on hand.

Headlines: Experts Warn of Emerging 'Stimulant Epidemic'
Teaser: With the nation still reeling from the opioid crisis, drug forecasting experts say a new wave of addiction is coming and the United States isn't ready for it.

Headlines: Prescribers, Pharmacists Arrested in DEA Opioid Crackdown
Teaser: The US Drug Enforcement Administration (DEA) ramps up pressure on prescribers and pharmacies that it believes 'dispensed disproportionately large amounts' of controlled substances.

Headlines: Preprocedural Fasting Not Necessary for Children in ED
Teaser: A large study found preprocedural fasting does not decrease adverse events in the pediatric emergency department; the results suggest adherence to fasting guidelines is not warranted in this setting.

Headlines: Spinal Cord Injury Improves With New Scaffold Device
Teaser: For patients with complete paraplegia, implantation of an investigational scaffold device improved the odds of converting to incomplete injury, a new trial shows.

Headlines: Surge in 'Deaths of Despair' Hits the US
Teaser: Despite progress in overall US health system performance, states are losing ground on key measures affecting life expectancy, a new Commonwealth Fund report shows.

Headlines: Rates of HCV Screening Low Among Children Exposed in Pregnancy
Teaser: Hepatitis C virus (HCV) infection is on the rise among pregnant women due to the opioid epidemic, yet most perinatally infected children are flying under the radar due to insufficient screening, warn researchers from Pennsylvania in a new paper.

Headlines: JIA: Not All Criteria Equal for Predicting Long-Term Outcomes
Teaser: Long-term outcome in juvenile idiopathic arthritis was best predicted by clinically inactive disease as defined by the cJADAS10, rather than by the Wallace preliminary criteria.

Headlines: Spinal Cord Stimulation Beats Medication for Pain
Teaser: Stimulation is superior to medical therapy in reducing pain, newer modes may be better than traditional approaches, but the technology likely remains underused.

Headlines: Disabled Patients Face Barriers to Nonopioid Pain Meds
