Teaser: Patients with disabilities such as spinal cord injury or stroke who need nonopioid pain medications face increasing financial and regulatory barriers to these first-line treatments, new research suggests.

Headlines: Novel Prevention Program May Reduce Opioid Overdose Risk
Teaser: A novel program at an inpatient pain rehabilitation unit decreased opioid prescriptions for discharged patients and increased prescriptions for naloxone.

Headlines: Integrated Approach for Low Back Pain May Shift Standard of Care
Teaser: A 12-week rehabilitation program that offers cognitive-behavioral therapy in addition to physical therapy is proving beneficial for patients with chronic low back pain.

Headlines: Key Factors Determine Success of Epidural Patch for CSF Leaks
Teaser: Researchers are gaining more insight into the factors that best predict the efficacy of an epidural blood patch in patients with spontaneous cerebrospinal fluid hypovolemia.

Headlines: Mental Health Services Key to Effective Pain Management
Teaser: A growing body of evidence suggests that including mental health services in a pain care program significantly improves patient outcomes.

Headlines: Synthetic Opioids Now Most Common Drugs in Overdose Deaths
Teaser: A study has found that synthetic opioids are now the key contributors to opioid-related overdose deaths, especially when combined with other illicit or prescription drugs.

Headlines: Ubrogepant Safe, Effective for Migraine in Second Phase 3 Trial
Teaser: Mirroring recently released data from the ACHIEVE-I trial, ACHIEVE-2 trial results also show that oral ubrogepant, a novel CGRP-targeting medication, is safe and effective for treating acute migraine.

Headlines: What's Hot: Your Guide to APA 2018 Annual Meeting
Teaser: This year's theme -- Building Well-Being Through Innovation -- addresses two key issues psychiatrists face today: burnout, and the role of technology and innovation in mental health care.

Headlines: Education, Slow Approach Help Patients Successfully Taper Opioids
Teaser: The key to success in cutting opioid doses or getting patients off the drug completely is providing education and tailored slow tapering.

Headlines: Pain Rehab Program Signals 'Profound' Treatment Shift
Teaser: A comprehensive, multidisciplinary pain rehabilitation program for patients with chronic pain is effective and appears to reduce patients' need for healthcare resources.

Headlines: Sufentanil Hybrid Gets Nod in EU for Moderate to Severe Pain
Teaser: The new product, Dzuveo, is similar to another sufentanil-containing pain reliever that has been available in the European Union since 1978.

Headlines: House Subcommittee Approves Opioid Package
Teaser: Among the proposals with bipartisan support was a bill to create a loan repayment program for healthcare professionals willing to work in substance abuse treatment in regions hard hit by the opioid crisis.

Headlines: FDA Panels Vote to Add Aspirin Warning to Naproxen Label
Teaser: Two FDA panels voted to include a warning against concomitant aspirin use on the naproxen nonprescription Drug Facts label, and to make no such changes to the current ibuprofen label.

Headlines: Acetaminophen Use in Pregnancy Tied to Higher Autism, ADHD Risk
Teaser: Prolonged use of acetaminophen during pregnancy is associated with an increased risk for autism spectrum disorder and attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder, new research shows.

Headlines: Chiropractic Care Improves Usual Management for Low Back Pain
Teaser: Adding chiropractic care to usual management for low back pain provided more relief than usual care alone in a multisite trial among active-duty US service members.

Headlines: Opioid Overprescription Targeted by New Plans
Teaser: After finding that many of the opioid tablets prescribed by urologists go unused, researchers propose new prescription standards for urologic procedures.

Headlines: House Panels Approve Another Batch of Opioid-Epidemic Bills
Teaser: A measure to allow broader sharing of substance-abuse records in the healthcare community sparked fierce debate at a Thursday markup, whereas most bills moved through easily on voice votes.

Headlines: For Infants of Opioid Crisis, Best Care May Be Mom's Recovery
Teaser: Research is just beginning on infants born with neonatal abstinence syndrome, and doctors are optimistic that normal development is possible. Monitoring the families and making sure parents are treated for addiction is key.

Headlines: California Hospital Giant Faces Heavy Backlash on Prices
Teaser: In a case with possible national repercussions, the stateâ€™s attorney general has sued over alleged price gouging, and other legal and legislative challenges are afoot. Sutter is pushing back hard, denying anticompetitive behavior.

Headlines: Insomnia in Cancer Patients: Interventions That May Help
Teaser: Both cognitive-behavioral therapy and acupuncture can significantly reduce insomnia and improve quality of life of cancer patients, the results of a US randomized trial indicate.

Headlines: Remote Tracking Reduces Symptoms in Head and Neck Cancer
Teaser: Remote monitoring of symptoms using mobile technology appeared to reduce the severity of symptoms in patients with head and neck cancer treated with radiation.

Headlines: Inappropriate, Omitted Rx Common at Discharge for Older Adults
Teaser: Four in five older hospitalized adults received at least one potentially inappropriate prescription at discharge, putting them at increased risk for rehospitalization and death, a study found.

Headlines: FDA Approves First Nonopioid Drug for Opioid Withdrawal
Teaser: Lofexidine reduces symptoms such as diarrhea, nausea, vomiting, anxiety, and an overall feeling of sickness that often keeps patients from successfully withdrawing from opioids.

Headlines: Docs Pen More Opioid Scripts When Pharma Reps Provide Perks
Teaser: Physicians who accept free meals and other small perks from companies that manufacture opioids are more likely to prescribe these drugs to their patients, a new study suggests.

Headlines: Residents Eager for More Training on Opioid Addiction
Teaser: Incoming residents in psychiatry and other fields lack experience and knowledge to address the opioid epidemic and want more training, a new survey shows.

Headlines: Advanced Cancer Screening Garnering Attention at AUA
Teaser: New diagnostic and predictive techniques for prostate and other cancers will figure prominently at the upcoming American Urological Association (AUA) 2018 Annual Meeting.

Headlines: Most US Oncologists Discuss Medical Marijuana With Patients
Teaser: Most oncologists in the US have at least discussed medical marijuana with their patients, although only a minority of them feel knowledgeable enough to do so with confidence.

Headlines: Vertebroplasty No Better Than Local Anesthetic for Pain
Teaser: The results 'do not support...vertebroplasty as standard pain treatment in patients with acute osteoporotic vertebral compression fractures,' say researchers. Local anesthetic seems just as good.

Headlines: House Panel Approves Over 20 Bills to Fight Opioid Abuse
Teaser: The House Energy and Commerce Committee on Wednesday approved more than 20 opioid measures in a series of voice votes. More controversy is likely when it takes up another set of these bills on May 17.

Headlines: Lawmakers Mull Privacy Rules for Substance Abuse Records
Teaser: Members of both parties expressed concerns about jeopardizing people's employment through broader disclosure, while also seeing a need for more tools to fight the national opioid crisis.

Headlines: Should Marijuana Be Legalized Nationally?
Teaser: There may soon be legislation that will allow more states to legalize the drug.

Headlines: Obamacare Menu Labeling Rules Ushered In
Teaser: Restaurants, convenience stores, vending machines and pizza delivery services are among the businesses that will have to provide calories counts to consumers.

Headlines: Opioid Prevalence in Suicide Victims Skyrockets
Teaser: The presence of opioids in the blood of suicide victims more than doubled from 2006 to 2017.

Headlines: Reduced Opioids After Spinal Surgery With ERAS Protocol
Teaser: An 'enhanced recovery after surgery' (ERAS)  protocol at the University of Pennsylvania showed an unexpected benefit in reducing opioid use after spinal or peripheral nerve surgery.

Headlines: Opioid Epidemic Turning Around, AMA Says
Teaser: Physicians are penning fewer opioid prescriptions, more are becoming certified to treat patients with opioid addiction, and access to naloxone is increasing, a new AMA report shows.

Headlines: Restless Legs Syndrome an Independent Suicide Risk Factor?
Teaser: Suicidal behavior is prevalent among people with severe restless legs syndrome, independent of depression, a new study suggests.

Headlines: Safety Concerns Trigger Naloxone Hydrochloride Recall
Teaser: The possible presence of embedded or loose particulate matter on the syringe plunger has triggered a voluntary recall of two lots of naloxone hydrochloride injection.

Headlines: Clostridium difficile Patients on Opioids Fare Much Worse
Teaser: The slowing of gut motility related to opioids might lead to more severe infection, new research shows.

Headlines: Experimental Drug May Protect Celiac Patients From Gluten Exposure
Teaser: An experimental monoclonal antibody (AMG 714) may help protect patients with celiac disease from developing symptoms such as gut pain and diarrhea after inadvertent exposure to gluten, according to a proof-of-concept study.

Headlines: FDA OKs Consensi for Osteoarthritis Pain  and Hypertension
Teaser: The FDA has approved a combination of amlodipine besylate and celecoxib (Consensi, Kitov Pharma) for individuals with osteoarthritis pain and hypertension.

Headlines: New Nonopioid Med Blunts Drug Withdrawal Symptoms
Teaser: Lofexidine has been in use in the UK for more than 20 years and has shown efficacy in managing symptoms of severe opioid withdrawal. It has now been approved in the US.

Headlines: Transcranial DCS May Boost Mood in Chronic Low Back Pain
Teaser: A small, randomized double-blind study suggests that repeated daily sessions of transcranial direct-current stimulation may help improve affective symptoms of chronic low back pain.

Headlines: What Do You Think of Current Opioid Restrictions?
Teaser: Limits on opioids are necessary, but they don't always follow clear-cut guidelines.

Headlines: FDA OKs Novel Enzyme Therapy for Rare Disease Phenylketonuria
Teaser: Pegvaliase-pqpz (Palynziq) helps address a significant, unmet need in phenylketonuria (PKA) patients whose blood levels of PKA cannot be controlled with current treatment options, the FDA says.

Headlines: Renal Denervation in Off-Meds Patients Rivals Drug Control
Teaser: Ultrasound interruption of renal-nerve traffic resulted in significant reductions in ambulatory systolic BP compared with sham treatment in the RADIANCE-HTN SOLO trial.

Headlines: 'Little Merit' in Sublingual Buprenorphine for Pain, Says FDA Panel
Teaser: The FDA advisory committee voted overwhelmingly against the approval of a sublingual form of buprenorphine for treating moderate-to-severe acute pain, citing weak efficacy and safety concerns.

Headlines: Stop Using OTC Benzocaine Teething Products, FDA Says
Teaser: The agency will also increase warnings on all benzocaine-containing over-the-counter and prescription topical anesthetics because of the rare but serious risk for methemoglobinemia.

Headlines: Clinicians Share Agony When Emergency Dialysis Is Only Option
Teaser: Clinicians reported frustration, burnout, and sadness over loss of patient trust from systems that deny regular care to undocumented patients with end-stage renal disease.

Headlines: Bright-Light Rx May Help Alleviate Cancer-Related Fatigue
Teaser: Nonpharmacologic approaches, such as bright-light therapy, can help alleviate cancer-related fatigue, which affects almost all patients with cancer.

Headlines: FDA Warns Kratom Makers Over Illegal Sales, Deceptive Marketing
Teaser: The FDA continues its crackdown on 'unscrupulous vendors' of unapproved products containing kratom, especially those making unproven medical claims.

Headlines: Opioid Overdoses Rising Faster Among Latinos Than Whites or Blacks. Why?
Teaser: Opioid addiction is often portrayed as a white problem, but overdose rates are now rising faster among Latinos and blacks. Cultural and linguistic barriers may put Latinos at greater risk.

Headlines: Patients Suffer as a Renowned Heart Transplant Program Loses Its Luster
Teaser: The hospital and its legendary surgeon Denton Cooley performed some of the worldâ€™s first heart transplants back in the 1960s. In recent years, though, it has had some of the worst heart transplant outcomes in the country.

Headlines: New Guidance on Managing Postpartum Pain
Teaser: ACOG recommends an individualized approach to postpartum pain management that may include nonopioids, opioids, and nonpharmacologic approaches.

Headlines: Sexual Trauma Linked to Depression, PTSD, Chronic Pain
Teaser: A history of trauma, including sexual assault, increases risk for several serious mental health and chronic medical conditions in women, a nearly 400-person study suggests.

Headlines: New EAN Guideline on Palliative Care in MS
Teaser: A new palliative care guideline for patients with multiple sclerosis, many of whom suffer great pain, recommends a multidisciplinary approach and reflects new emphasis in neurology on palliative care.

Headlines: Cancer Patients Face Difficulties in Getting Opioids
Teaser: In the wake of policies meant to stem abuse, cancer patients and survivors report that they are now finding it more difficult to obtain opioid prescriptions.

Headlines: Physician Mocking Patient Draws Suspension
Teaser: Separately, medical groups are calling for altering financial incentives to help prevent drug shortages, among other strategies.

Headlines: FDA, Drugmakers Continue Work to End Critical Drug Shortages
Teaser: Gaia Ethnobotanical LLC has voluntarily recalled all powdered kratom products after the FDA found evidence of Salmonella contamination.

Headlines: More Kratom Products Recalled Owing to Salmonella Risk
Teaser: A proposal spearheaded by Healthcare Leadership Council includes suggestions for leaders within medical organizations and federal agencies as well as for members of Congress.

Headlines: New Opioid 'Roadmap' Offers Suggestions to Combat Abuse
Teaser: Patients revived from an opioid overdose who get methadone or Suboxone treatment for addiction afterward are much more likely to be alive a year later, says a study published in the Annals of Internal Medicine.

Headlines: After Opioid Overdose, Only 30% Get Medicine to Treat Addiction
Teaser: Investigational oral agent, elagolix, shows promise for the treatment of endometriosis-related pain with good efficacy and safety data now out to 12 months in 2 extension studies; drug is awaiting approval.

Headlines: Investigational Oral Medication Promising for Endometriosis Pain
Teaser: Nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs contribute to the elevated risk for cardiovascular disease in people with osteoarthritis, new research shows, but alternatives for pain management are limited.

Headlines: NSAIDs Increase Cardiovascular Risk in Osteoarthritis
Teaser: People with this painful condition that affects the spine are at higher risk of harming themselves, a large study confirms; however, the mental health effects of the disease are often ignored.

Headlines: Ankylosing Spondylitis Patients at Risk for Self-Harm
Teaser: Consensus guidelines provide a framework for use of IV ketamine for acute pain management.

Headlines: First-Ever Ketamine Guidelines for Acute Pain Management Released
Teaser: Generic buprenorphine and naloxone sublingual film may increase access to treatment for opioid dependence, the agency said.

Headlines: FDA Clears First Generic Versions of Suboxone Sublingual Film
Teaser: Omega-3 fatty acids significantly reduced pain among very overweight women who take aromatase inhibitors (AIs) for breast cancer.

Headlines: Omega-3 Fatty Acids Reduce Pain From AIs at BMI of 30 or More
Teaser: The HEAL initiative will focus on improving treatments for patients who misuse or are addicted to opioids and enhancing strategies for effective pain management.

Headlines: NIH Outlines New Game Plan to Combat Opioid Crisis
Teaser: The FDA has cleared an auricular neurostimulation device to help reduce symptoms of opioid withdrawal, including cravings, agitation, anxiety, and depression.

Headlines: FDA Okays Wearable Device for Opioid Withdrawal
Teaser: An expert panel discussed management and strategies for caring for patients and avoiding misuse of opioids, and also touched on growing concerns of limited access.

Headlines: Managing Cancer Pain in the Era of an Opioid Crisis
Teaser: Patients with rheumatoid arthritis who achieve 6 months of remission or low disease activity by taking methotrexate plus tocilizumab can usually stop tocilizumab; restarting is effective if flares occur.

Headlines: Safe Stopping of Tocilizumab in RA: MTX Helps
Teaser: The new president-elect of the American Medical Association will be the fourth psychiatrist, the first female psychiatrist, and the first African American woman to hold the position.

Headlines: First Female Psychiatrist Named President-Elect of the AMA
Teaser: The American Medical Association House of Delegates votes to refer the report for additional information.

Headlines: AMA Will Revisit Stance Against Physician-Assisted Dying
Teaser: Golimumab induced drug-free remission in patients with early peripheral spondyloarthritis; the findings support early treatment, experts agree.

Headlines: Mexico's President-Elect Does Not Rule Out Medical Opium Sales -Aide
Teaser: Mexico's president-elect, Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador, is not closed to the idea of selling opium for pharmaceutical use, a senior aide said on Wednesday, a sign of the deep changes the next government is considering in the war on drugs.

Headlines: Inhaled Heroin Tied to 'Peculiar, Often Catastrophic' Brain Damage
Teaser: Heating heroin and inhaling its fumes is growing in popularity and may lead to peculiar and often catastrophic brain complications.

Headlines: 'Cancer Is Almost Always a Crisis'
Teaser: Cancer patients are particularly vulnerable to psychosocial distress as a result of both the diagnosis and treatment, which can affect treatment decisions. But how can this burden best be tackled?

Headlines: New Scale Measures Sexual Dysfunction in Women With IBD
Teaser: Clinicians now have a validated 15-item scale for assessing sexual dysfunction in women with inflammatory bowel disease (IBD), who face unique sexual health challenges in terms of their illness and treatment.

Headlines: A New Endpoint in Prostate Cancer: Metastasis-Free Survival
Teaser: With overall survival considered an impractical endpoint because survival is so long, metastasis-free survival has emerged as a new endpoint in prostate cancer trials.

Headlines: DMARDs Ineffective Against Osteoarthritis, Study Finds
Teaser: Neither conventional DMARDs nor biologics are effective treatments for osteoarthritis, a meta-analysis of randomized controlled trials has found.

Headlines: Opioid Makers Cut Back on Marketing Payments to Doctors
Teaser: As ProPublica updates Dollars for Docs, we found that drugmakers spent less money to market opioids to doctors in 2016 than in prior years. Studies have shown that payments to doctors by opioid makers are linked to more prescribing of the drugs.

Headlines: FDA Repays Industry by Rushing Risky Drugs to Market
Teaser: As pharma companies underwrite three-fourths of the FDAâ€™s budget for scientific reviews, the agency is increasingly fast-tracking expensive drugs with significant side effects and unproven health benefits.

Headlines: Fed Opioid Takedown Includes Physician Adviser to Pro Fighters
Teaser: At least one fighter has been indicted as part of what the US Department of Justice  called a vast conspiracy, part of a massive crackdown involving over 600 people and $2 billion.

Headlines: Indivior Gets Breather After Court Extends Order Blocking Generic Rival
Teaser: Indivior Plc got a breather on Friday as a U.S. court extended a restraining order blocking a rival from launching a generic version of its bestselling opioid addiction treatment in the United States.

Headlines: Gawandeâ€™s Goal: Provide the â€˜Rightâ€™ Healthcare in New Venture by 3 Firms
Teaser: The surgeon and writer has been named to head a project by Amazon, Bershire-Hathway and JP Morgan to reduce health costs. He said he wants to help doctors â€œdo the right thingâ€ in delivering care.

Headlines: Congress May Soon Make CBD From Hemp Legal
Teaser: Legislation that includes a measure to legalize hemp, rich in the compound used to produce numerous CBD oil products, made significant progress last week.

Headlines: U.S. Fines CVS for Failing to Report Opioid Theft in New York
Teaser: CVS Health Corp agreed to pay a $1.5 million civil fine to resolve U.S. charges that some of its pharmacies in Nassau and Suffolk counties in New York failed to report in a timely manner the loss or theft of prescription drugs, including the opioid hydrocodone.

Headlines: CBT Improves Function, Reduces Fatigue in Muscular Dystrophy
Teaser: A new study shows cognitive-behavioral therapy with optional exercise is associated with reductions in fatigue and increased activity levels, but increased falls are a concern.

Headlines: Kids' Exposure to Buprenorphine Skyrockets
Teaser: More than 11,000 children aged 19 years and younger were exposed to buprenorphine during 2007 to 2016, a study found.

Headlines: 'Image of the Year' Captures Dramatic Cancer Responses
Teaser: The before- and after-treatment images show widespread metastatic prostate cancer and some dramatic responses to a promising new modality.

Headlines: Enzalutamide: Now Also for Earlier Use in Prostate Cancer?
Teaser: Enzalutamide may soon gain approval for men with nonmetastatic castration-resistant prostate cancer on the basis of results from the PROSPER study.

Headlines: Opioids After Surgery: What Is the Right Number of Pills?
Teaser: As the opioid epidemic rages, a Johns Hopkins surgeon and researcher is leading an effort to curb overprescribing by offering procedure-specific guidelines to ensure that post-surgical patients leave the hospital with enough, but not too much, pain medication.

Headlines: Updated Osteoporosis Screening Guidelines Released by USPSTF
Teaser: Recommendations support screening for women older than 65 years and younger women at risk; some argue the recommendations should better reflect the need for more evidence in those younger than 65 years.

Headlines: FDA Panels Nix Approval of Abuse-Deterrent Oxycodone for Pain
Teaser: Two FDA advisory committees voted 14-3 against approval recommendation for Remoxy ER, voicing concerns over the product's claims of abuse deterrence via various routes.

Headlines: Opioid Prescribing in Teens Still High, but Tide May Be Turning
Teaser: Efforts to reduce opioid prescribing do not appear to have affected prescribing among adolescents as much as desired.

Headlines: Research Network Updates Treatment Guidance for Patellofemoral Pain
Teaser: The latest research continues to support six key recommendations on exercise therapy and physical interventions for patellofemoral pain, according to a consensus statement from the 5th International Patellofemoral Pain Research Retreat.

Headlines: Within Opioid Abuse Epidemic, Infectious Disease Epidemic Emerges
Teaser: There is a new epidemic of hepatitis C, HIV, and other infections within the opioid abuse epidemic, according to participants in a National Academies of Sciences, Engineering, and Medicine workshop.

Headlines: Few Studies on Probiotics Assess Potential Harms
Teaser: Despite rapidly increasing research into the use of probiotics and prebiotics to alter the gut microbiome, most trials report safety data inadequately or not at all.

Headlines: Why Canadian Insurers Are Wary of Covering Medical Marijuana
Teaser: Sun Life Financial, Canada's No. 2 insurer, recently started covering medical marijuana in its Canadian health insurance plan - more than 17 years after the country first legalized it.

Headlines: Tracking C-Section Pain Patterns May Benefit Surgical Patients
Teaser: Knowing more about how and when pain starts diminishing after surgery can help doctors and patients understand what's normal and when to expect a full recovery, suggests a small study.

Headlines: Surgeon Gets Life in Prison for Role in Opioid Death
Teaser: The Florida spine surgeon was convicted by a federal jury on charges related to making counterfeit oxycodone in his office, which was linked to the overdose death of a 34-year-old woman.

Headlines: Nevada Execution Blocked After Drugmaker Protests Use of Its Sedative
Teaser: A condemned killer who had given up on any further appeals as he awaited execution in Nevada on Wednesday received an 11th-hour reprieve thanks to a pharmaceutical company suing to block the use of one of its drugs in the lethal injection process.

Headlines: CDC Launches New ME/CFS Guidance for Clinicians
Teaser: New web content addresses diagnosis, management, and additional clinical considerations for managing patients with mylagic encephalomyelitis/chronic fatigue syndrome.

Headlines: Few U.S. Women Have Serious Complications After Abortions
Teaser: U.S. women rarely seek emergency treatment for complications related to an abortion, according to new study that underscores the safety of these procedures.

Headlines: Rheumatologists Cautioned to Avoid Overtreatment
Teaser: Six common approaches to treating inflammatory rheumatic diseases might lead to overdiagnosis and overtreatment, an expert warns. Another expert says overdiagnosis is less common, however.

Headlines: DEA Revises Opioid-Quota Rules, Leaving Out Requested Change
Teaser: The DEA's revised approach for production quotas for addictive drugs left out medical groups' recommendation regarding shortages. Patients used the DEA's rule making  to decry attitudes about chronic pain.

Headlines: Short-Term Acid-Suppression Advised for Pediatric Gastroesophageal Reflux
Teaser: Typical reflux symptoms in children should be treated with four to eight weeks of acid-suppression therapy, and in infants this should occur only after dietary modifications, according to a new Pediatric Gastroesophageal Reflux Clinical Practice Guideline.

Headlines: Israeli Firm Gets U.S. Nod for Advanced Trials for Non-Opiate Painkiller
Teaser: Israeli pharmaceuticals company PainReform has received approval from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) to begin late-stage clinical studies for a pain relief drug that is a departure from opiate-based narcotics, it said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Physical Exam Techniques Clarify Diagnosis of Pelvic Floor Myofascial Pain
Teaser: Careful assessment of pain during palpation of pelvic muscles can help to clarify the diagnosis of pelvic floor myofascial pain, according to a systematic review.

Headlines: Canada Recommends Screening Pregnant Women for Asymptomatic Bacteriuria, With Caveats
Teaser: An updated guideline from the Canadian Task Force on Preventive Health Care recommends first-trimester screening of pregnant women for asymptomatic bacteriuria, affirming routine practice but acknowledging that the evidence is "weak" and the benefit "small but uncertain."

Headlines: Deaths From Fentanyl, Fentanyl Analogs Have Risen Sharply
Teaser: Deaths from fentanyl and fentanyl analogs, such as carfentanil, have more than doubled since 2015, the CDC reports. The increase is a result of increased supply of the drugs and their mixture with heroin.

Headlines: Obesity in Women and Smoking in Men Strongly Predict Lack of Remission in Early RA
Teaser: Obesity in women and current smoking in men appear to be the strongest predictors of lack of remission in early rheumatoid arthritis (RA) within one year, according to new research presented June 13 at EULAR 2018, the annual meeting of the European League Against Rheumatism, in Amsterdam.

Headlines: Moving Opioid Addiction Treatment to Primary Care
Teaser: Moving the management of opioid addiction to the primary care setting offers a feasible and effective way to help fight the worsening opioid crisis, the authors of three perspective articles say.

Headlines: Positive Phase 3 Results for Rimegepant in Acute Migraine
Teaser: The oral calcitonin gene-related peptide (CGRP) rimegepant performed well compared with placebo for treatment of a single acute migraine attack in a double-blind, randomized phase 3 trial.

Headlines: Amgen's New Migraine Drug Hits Insurance Hurdles
Teaser: Amgen Inc's push to get patients on its new $575 a month migraine drug before competition emerges in September is facing barriers from insurers.

Headlines: 'Oxy Doc' Convicted for Prescribing Opioid That Caused OD Death
Teaser: New York physician Martin Tesher -- convicted of prescribing opioids to patients already addicted to the medications -- faces life in prison.

Headlines: Opioids Tied to Bad Sex Life and Lack of Desire
Teaser: Chronic pain patients who take opioids may be less satisfied with their sex life and more likely to experience a lack of desire than people who don't rely on these prescription narcotics, a Danish study suggests.

Headlines: Screening Increases Psychological Referrals for Youth With Abdominal Pain
Teaser: Psychological screening integrated into medical care can significantly increase psychological referral rates for young patients with abdominal pain, researchers report.

Headlines: U.S. to Narrow Opioid Bribe Case Against Insys Founder, Others
Teaser: U.S. prosecutors on Tuesday said they will narrow a case against several former Insys Therapeutics Inc executives accused of bribing doctors to prescribe a potent opioid after a federal judge questioned the scope of the indictment charging them.

Headlines: AbbVie Prices New Endometriosis Drug At $10,000 a Year
Teaser: Drugmaker AbbVie Inc priced its new endometriosis drug Orilissa (elagolix) at around $10,000 a year after receiving approval from U.S. regulators for the treatment on Tuesday.

Headlines: Novel Virtual Reality Technique Improves Pain, Motor Function
Teaser: Patients with complex regional pain syndrome often experience extreme pain when touched. This novel virtual reality technique improves pain without requiring any tactile contact.

Headlines: Automated Bone Scan Index for Prostate Cancer Prognosis
Teaser: The automated bone scan index provides an objective analysis of the burden of bone disease in advanced prostate cancer and thus holds promise as a reliable prognostic tool.

Headlines: FDA Clears Elagolix (Orilissa) for Endometriosis Pain
Teaser: Elagolix is the first oral gonadotropin-releasing hormone antagonist specifically developed for the treatment of moderate to severe pain associated with endometriosis.

Headlines: Americans' View of Marijuana Is Rosy, and Unscientific
Teaser: Americans seem to have developed a very rosy view of marijuana that isn't backed up by science, a new study suggests.

Headlines: Zoster Vaccine Reduces Pain From "Breakthrough" Shingles
Teaser: A literature analysis shows ketamine is as effective as morphine for short-term pain relief in emergency departments but had more nonsevere side effects.

Headlines: Low-Dose Ketamine May Be a Safe Opioid Alternative
Teaser: Bayer will voluntarily halt sales of its controversial Essure permanent birth control implant in the United States at the end of this year, citing business reasons.

Headlines: Bayer to Halt US Sales of Essure Permanent Contraceptive
Teaser: Proponents say the residencies provide help dealing with increasingly difficult cases, but some nursing groups contend that the programs are not necessary.

Headlines: More Nurse Practitioners Pursue Residency Programs to Hone Skills
Teaser: For nonmelanoma skin cancer patients, extra stress-relieving measures did not reduce anxiety better than usual care for excisional surgery under local anesthesia.

Headlines: Stress Ball or Hand-holding During Skin Cancer Surgery
Teaser: London-listed pharmaceutical group Hikma said on Wednesday it was increasing its supply of hydromorphone to U.S. hospitals to help ease a shortage of injectable opioids used to treat patients.

Headlines: Hikma Raising Injectable Opioids Output to Help Ease Shortage at U.S. Hospitals
Teaser: Dropping 10% of body weight reduced pain and improved function in overweight patients with knee OA. Losing an additional 10% further reduced knee joint loading and improved quality of life.

Headlines: More Weight Loss May Be Better for Patients With Arthritis
Teaser: The nationâ€™s effort to combat this public health crisis could get caught in the crossfire of the Trump administrationâ€™s trade policies.

Headlines: What a Trade War Could Mean for Opioid Epidemic
Teaser: US 'mental health czar' Elinore McCance-Katz is pushing forward with her two-pronged platform of substance abuse prevention and severe mental illness, including overseeing a new APA grant.

Headlines: 'Mental Health Czar' Bullish on Prevention, Mental Health Issues
Teaser: An experimental "smart bandage" could monitor wound healing and deliver drugs as needed in a closed-loop fashion, reducing the need for painful dressing changes in patients with chronic wounds.

Headlines: 'No Doubt' Kratom Is an Opioid With High Abuse Potential
Teaser: The main psychoactive ingredient in kratom, 7-hydroxymitragynine, has high abuse potential that may increase the intake of other opiates.

Headlines: Insys to Pay $150 Mln to Settle U.S. Opioid Kickback Probe
Teaser: Insys Therapeutics said on Wednesday it had reached a deal to pay at least $150 million to resolve a U.S. Justice Department investigation into claims that the drugmaker paid doctors kickbacks to prescribe a powerful opioid medication.

Headlines: Opioid Addiction Quadruples in Pregnant Women
Teaser: The first state-based analysis of trends showed a significant increase between 1999 and 2014 in opioid use disorder in pregnant women at labor and delivery in all 28 states studied, according to the CDC.

Headlines: Chikungunya Fever May Trigger Chronic Articular Symptoms
Teaser: More than half of those infected by the mosquito-borne Chikungunya virus will go on to experience chronic articular pain or arthritis, according to Brazilian researchers.

Headlines: Too Many Hot Chips a Recipe for Stomach Trouble?
Teaser: Spicy hot snacks like Flamin' Hot Cheetos are popular with many these days, especially children.

Headlines: FDA Turns Down Abuse-Deterrent Remoxy ER for Pain
Teaser: The FDA has followed its Advisory Committee's earlier recommendation and nixed approval of abuse-deterrent oxycodone extended-release capsules (Remoxy ER) for severe pain.

Headlines: Electroacupuncture Shows Benefits in Diabetic Peripheral Neuropathy
Teaser: Twice-weekly treatments for 8 weeks reduced pain, improved sleep, and posed no safety concerns.

Headlines: Allergan Sues Pfizer Over Costs of Opioid Litigation
Teaser: Allergan Plc on Thursday sued Pfizer Inc to force its larger rival to cover any damages Allergan is forced to pay as a result of hundreds of lawsuits claiming it deceptively marketed an opioid acquired from Pfizer.

Headlines: Physicians More Likely to Prescribe Opioids Later in Day
Teaser: Prior research found a similar trend with antibiotic prescribing for acute respiratory infections. The researchers suggest these results are further evidence of the dangers of decision fatigue.

Headlines: Methadone Programs for Ex-Criminals Tied to Fewer Premature Deaths
Teaser: Opioid addicts with criminal histories may be less likely to die of overdoses or other causes during periods when they're in methadone treatment programs, a Canadian study suggests.

Headlines: Missed Visits, Uncontrolled Pain, and Fraud: Report Says Hospice Lacks Oversight
Teaser: A new government watchdog report outlines vulnerabilities in Medicareâ€™s $17 billion hospice program, pointing to inadequate services, inappropriate billing and outright fraud.

Headlines: Leftover Opioids? Most Older Adults Hang On to Them
Teaser: Older adults support opioid prescribing limits and the need for better counseling and disposal options for leftover pills, yet most prefer to keep them, just in case.

Headlines: Anxiety, Depression May Help Predict Outcome Of Low Back Pain Treatment
Teaser: Subacromial decompression is no better than diagnostic arthroscopy for treating shoulder impingement, according to the FIMACT study.

Headlines: Acromioplasty No Better Than Sham Surgery for Shoulder Impingement Pain
Teaser: Indivior said on Monday a U.S. Court expedited a generic rival's appeal against a preliminary injunction that blocked the sale of a copycat version of the British drugmaker's blockbuster opioid addiction treatment, Suboxone Film (buprenorphine and naloxone).

Headlines: U.S. Court Expedites Appeal to Re-Launch Generic Opioid Addiction Drug
Teaser: The FDA has received numerous reports of vaginal burns, scarring, pain during sexual intercourse, and recurring or chronic pain following unapproved use of laser devices for 'vaginal rejuvenation'.

Headlines: FDA Warning About Laser Devices for 'Vaginal Rejuvenation'
Teaser: Lowering the default number of pills in a healthcare system's electronic medical record (EMR) may reduce opioid prescribing, researchers say.

Headlines: Lowering Default Pill Count in EMR Could Curb Opioid Prescribing
Teaser: The recombinant zoster vaccine Shingrix prevents shingles, and if people do contract the virus, it reduces the severity of illness, two company-funded studies suggest.

Headlines: Shingrix Vaccine Makes Shingles Less Severe, Disruptive to Quality of Life
Teaser: Phytoestrogens, such as those from soy and red clover, might contribute to unwanted weight gain in some postmenopausal women, according to a new review of previous clinical trials.

Headlines: Weight Effects of Plant-Estrogens May Vary After Menopause
Teaser: Today the FDA turned down approval of Buvaya, a buprenorphine sublingual spray for moderate to severe pain because of reported safety concerns.

Headlines: Warnings About Benzodiazepine Use in the Elderly Go Unheeded
Teaser: Despite years of warnings about the hazards of prescribing benzodiazepines in the elderly, these drugs continue to be used at a higher rate than what is considered appropriate in older Americans.

Headlines: FDA OKs First Twice-Daily Steroid for Postsurgery Eye Pain
Teaser: The nanoparticle formulation of loteprednol etabonate ophthalmic suspension (Inveltys, Kala Pharmaceuticals) is dosed two times daily rather than four times daily, with similar efficacy and safety.

Headlines: Purdue Pharma's Sales Pitch Downplayed Risks of Opioid Addiction
Teaser: Two decades ago, Purdue Pharma produced thousands of brochures and videos that urged patients with chronic pain to ask their physicians for opioids such as OxyContin, arguing that concerns over addiction and other dangers from the drugs were overblown.

Headlines: Babies Dependent on Opioids Need Touch, Not Tech
Teaser: In Kansas, treatment of neonatal abstinence syndrome treatment may include keeping mothers and their infants together in the hospital and making sure babies are held and comforted.

Headlines: DOJ Blocks Two 'Reckless' Ohio Docs From Prescribing Opioids
Teaser: The temporary restraining order against the two physicians accused of selling and prescribing opioids for 'no legitimate medical purpose' has never been used against prescribers before.

Headlines: Paracervical Block Reduces Pain of IUD Insertion
Teaser: Art museums may have an analgesic effect on chronic pain, a small study suggests.

Headlines: Art Tours May Have Analgesic Effect for Chronic Pain Patients
Teaser: The Trump administration on Thursday said it was proposing that U.S. pharmaceutical companies cut production of the six most abused opioids by 10 percent next year, in an effort to reduce the number of drugs potentially diverted for trafficking.

Headlines: Trump Administration Seeks Cuts in Production of Abused Opioids
Teaser: The Brainsway deep transcranial magnetic stimulation system is an option for patients with obsessive-compulsive disorder (OCD) who have not responded to traditional treatments.

Headlines: FDA Clears Brain Stimulation Device for OCD
Teaser: President Trump directed Attorney General Jeff Sessions to file a federal lawsuit, separate from state lawsuits, against opioid manufacturers in an effort to help stem an epidemic of addiction in the United States.

Headlines: Trump Wants Opioid Manufacturers to Face a Federal Lawsuit
Teaser: Samples sent to the DEA contained potent synthetic marijuana. A local man was arrested and is considered a person of interest regarding at least some of the overdoses, most of which happened in a park near Yale.

Headlines: Over 75 People in Connecticut Park Overdosed on K2 in a Day
Teaser: The system is the only percutaneous PNS system cleared by the FDA and is indicated for up to 60 days in the back and/or extremities for both chronic and acute pain.

Headlines: FDA Clears Peripheral Nerve Stimulator for Pain Management
Teaser: New York state on Tuesday said it has sued Purdue Pharma LP, accusing the OxyContin (oxycodone hydrochloride) maker of widespread fraud and deception in the marketing of opioid products, contributing to a nationwide epidemic that has killed thousands.

Headlines: New York Sues OxyContin Maker Purdue Pharma Over Opioids
Teaser: Peer comparison letters sent to high-volume quetiapine prescribers led to a significant reduction in the number of prescriptions written for elderly patients.

Headlines: High Pain Levels Linked With Impaired Memory in Older Adults
Teaser: The American Cancer Society Cancer Action Network's annual report examines all 50 states.

Headlines: Peer Pressure Tactic Successfully Curbs Overprescribing
Teaser: Medications used to treat alcohol and opioid use disorder reduce arrest rates, suicidal behavior, and accidental overdose.

Headlines: California, Massachusetts Best at Preventing, Treating Cancer
Teaser: Annovera (segesterone acetate and ethinyl estradiol vaginal system) is the first vaginal ring contraceptive approved that provides a full year of protection against unintended pregnancy.

Headlines: Alcohol, Opioid Addiction Meds Reduce Crime, Suicidality
Teaser: Patients with newly diagnosed head and neck cancer who used marijuana reported strikingly less pain and anxiety than well-matched nonusers. They also reported a greater sense of well-being.

Headlines: Cannabis for Chronic Nerve Pain: Mechanism Revealed?
Teaser: New imaging findings show the potential mechanism of medical marijuana in providing effective relief from chronic neuropathic pain.

Headlines: New Recommendations for Hand Osteoarthritis Released
Teaser: The 2018 EULAR update on management of hand OA begins with education, exercise, orthoses, and topical NSAIDs as first-line pharmacological treatment. Use of acetaminophen is discouraged.

Headlines: CDC Reports 30 More Illnesses Related to Kellogg's Tainted Cereal
Teaser: A total of 30 more cases of illnesses linked to Salmonella contamination of Kellogg Co's Honey Smacks cereal have been reported, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) said, bringing the total to 130 cases across 36 states.

Headlines: Nalbuphine May Be Option for Opioid-Induced Urine Retention
Teaser: Clinicians should consider nalbuphine for patients with opioid-induced urine retention who do not respond to alpha-1 blockers or who want to stop bladder catheterization, the authors of a case report suggest.

Headlines: Low Vitamin D Levels in Painful Diabetic Peripheral Neuropathy
Teaser: Vitamin D levels are lower in patients with painful diabetic peripheral neuropathy (DPN) than in those with painless DPN, or other comparators without DPN, shows a small study that controlling for sunlight and physical activity.

Headlines: Yes, Cuddles Can Help Ease Babies' Pain From Needle Sticks
Teaser: Babies have long been offered a bit of sugar water or breastmilk to comfort them during needle sticks, and a new study suggests these methods of pain relief may work even better when babies are also nestled in their mothers' arms.

Headlines: Are Anesthesiologists Always Needed for Routine Colonoscopy?
Teaser: Sedation is commonly used for routine screening colonoscopy in the United States, but is it always necessary and does it always need to be administered by an anesthesiologist?

Headlines: U.S. Deaths From Self-Injury Surpass Those From Diabetes
Teaser: More people in the U.S. are dying from self-inflicted harm, including suicide and drug overdose, than from diabetes, a new study suggests.

Headlines: FDA Warns of Serious Genital Infection With SGLT2 Inhibitors
Teaser: The agency has received reports of 12 cases of necrotizing fasciitis of the perineum in patients taking sodium-glucose cotransporter-2 (SGLT2) inhibitors, including five women.

Headlines: Emergent BioSolutions to Buy Narcan Maker Adapt Pharma
Teaser: Emergent BioSolutions Inc said on Tuesday it would buy privately held Adapt Pharma, beefing up its portfolio with Narcan, the only FDA approved needle-free emergency opioid overdose treatment.

Headlines: Antidepressant Mechanism of Ketamine Revealed?
Teaser: Ketamine's antidepressant effects require activation of the brain's opioid system, new research suggests.

Headlines: Inferior Immunotherapy Response When NSCLC Pts on Steroids
Teaser: In advanced non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC), patients who use steroids when starting single-agent immunotherapy have inferior clinical responses with immunotherapy.

Headlines: CDC Guidelines Tied to Reduction in Opioid Use for Chronic Pain
Teaser: The release by the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) of a 2016 guideline for prescribing opioids for chronic pain was associated with an acceleration in the decline of such prescriptions, researchers say.

Headlines: Three STDs Hit All-Time High in 2017, New CDC Data Show
Teaser: Public health officials blame a lack of investment in sexual education and health infrastructure.

Headlines: Intrathecal Baclofen May Improve Pain, QoL Post-Stroke
Teaser: Post-stroke intrathecal baclofen (ITB) is associated with less spasticity-related pain and improved quality of life on some measures compared to conventional management with oral antispastic drugs, researchers say.

Headlines: Antioxidants Don't Relieve Muscle Soreness After Exercise
Teaser: Consuming lots of antioxidants through foods or supplements may not reduce muscle soreness after exercise, a research review suggests.

Headlines: How Good Is Lebanese Cannabis? Scientists Seek Herbal Remedies
Teaser: Locked away safely in an academic's study in Lebanon is a plant that researchers hope to transform from one of the country's most notorious exports into a lucrative pharmaceutical.

Headlines: Glutamine Supplements Highly Effective in Post-Infectious IBS With Diarrhea
Teaser: Dietary glutamine supplements are an effective treatment for patients who develop irritable bowel syndrome with diarrhea (IBS-D)

Headlines: Prompt Cholecystectomy Might Curb Hospital Stay
Teaser: Cholecystectomy within 48 hours of admission for mild gallstone pancreatitis is associated with reduced hospital stay without an increase in complications

Headlines: With Preparation, Sending Adult Patients Home Alone After Ambulatory Anesthesia Is Safe
Teaser: Adult patients having outpatient procedures with short-acting sedation may be safe going home alone, researchers report.

Headlines: Chronic Pain Now Affects 50 Million US Adults
Teaser: A new CDC report notes that about 50 million Americans are experiencing chronic pain and that 20 million have 'high-impact' chronic pain that interferes with life or work activities.

Headlines: Coke Eyeing Cannabis-Infused Drink Market
Teaser: Coca Cola Co said on Monday it was closely watching the growing marijuana-infused drinks market, responding to a media report that the world's largest beverage maker was in talks with Canada's Aurora Cannabis Inc.

Headlines: Post-Op Opioids Used Far More in US Than Hong Kong
Teaser: Head and neck surgery patients in Hong Kong are far less likely to be prescribed opioids than patients undergoing similar surgeries in the U.S., new research shows.

Headlines: FDA Expands Strategies for Safer Opioid Prescribing
Teaser: The FDA announced today that it will be enlisting several new strategies to improve provider education about opioids as well as informing patients about the risks associated with opioid use.

Headlines: Heroin Use Down, Marijuana Use Up in New SAMHSA Survey
Teaser: Although use of heroin, especially first-time use, decreased in the US in 2017, SAMHSA's annual survey showed concerning patterns of other types of substance use and related disorders.

Headlines: Senate Passes Opioid Bill, Plans to Send to President Next Week
Teaser: US Senators advanced a sweeping bill last night that includes provisions addressing international shipments of illegal drugs and the sharing of patients' substance abuse history among clinicians. A bill also passed to lift so-called gag clauses.

Headlines: Progesterone Best for Preterm Birth in Women With a Short Cervix
Teaser: The PESAPRO study shows cervical pessary is not better than vaginal progesterone for early preterm birth prevention in women with a short cervix and is associated with more adverse events.

Headlines: Laser Treatment Improves Burn Scars of "Napalm Girl"
Teaser: More than four decades after sustaining extensive napalm burns, the Vietnamese woman who became known as "Napalm Girl" experienced significant improvement in her pain and burn scars with laser treatment.

Headlines: Lack of Surgical Care in US Prisons May Cost Lives
Teaser: Poor healthcare in America's prisons may be leading to avoidable deaths, a new study suggests.

Headlines: Slow-Release Morphine May Be Safe for Some OSA Patients
Teaser: A 40-mg dose of slow-release morphine may be safe for non-severely obese patients with obstructive sleep apnea (OSA), researchers in Australia report.

Headlines: Chronic Pain May Contribute to Suicide
Teaser: Nearly one in 10 suicide deaths in the U.S. occurs in people with chronic pain, a new study indicates.

Headlines: Consort, Opiant to Develop Nasal Spray for Opioid Overdose Treatment
Teaser: Britain's Consort Medical Plc said on Monday it had agreed to develop a nasal spray for treating opioid overdoses with specialty pharmaceutical company Opiant Pharmaceuticals Inc.

Headlines: Young People With Opioid Addiction Not Getting Proper Treatment
Teaser: The vast majority of young people addicted to opioids are not receiving medications that have been recommended to treat their disease, a new study shows.

Headlines: Youth Soccer Injury Prevention Program Saves Healthcare Costs
Teaser: An injury prevention program tailored to children's soccer is not only more effective than typical warmups and stretches at keeping players safe, it's also associated with lower healthcare costs, a Swiss study suggests.

Headlines: Opioids Overprescribed for Prostate, Kidney Surgery
Teaser: Opioids are prescribed "far in excess of need" after major open and minimally-invasive urologic procedures, researchers say.

Headlines: Elderly Doctor, Wife Who Ran NYC 'Pill Mill' Headed to Jail
Teaser: Rogelio Lucas and his wife and office manager are sentenced to jail for flooding New York City streets with more than 3 million oxycodone pills worth nearly $80 million.

Headlines: FKBP5 Variant Linked to Chronic Posttraumatic Muscle Pain
Teaser: A variant in the gene encoding FK506 binding protein 51 (FKBP5) increases the risk of developing chronic posttraumatic muscle pain, researchers report.

Headlines: New Illinois Law Encourages Marijuana as Opioid Alternative
Teaser: Opponents say the evidence does not support marijuana as a pain reliever.

Headlines: Factors Predicting Long-term Benzodiazepine Use Identified
Teaser: Poor-quality sleep and prescribing in an extended manner are key factors predicting conversion to long-term benzodiazepine use in the elderly, a practice strongly tied to poor outcomes, including death.

Headlines: Maryland Charges Insys With Engaging in Deceptive Opioid Scheme
Teaser: Maryland on Thursday charged Insys Therapeutics Inc with deceptively marketing a powerful opioid pain killer so that it was prescribed inappropriately beyond its intended use with cancer patients.

Headlines: 'Physicians of the Mouth'? Dentists Absorb Medical Billing Drill
Teaser: Dentists and dental staffers are learning to how to bill medical insurers in order to be reimbursed by insurance companies for services that dental insurance plans do not cover.

Headlines: Senate Clears Final Opioid Package for Trump's Signature
Teaser: The bill would expand prescribing authority for certain drugs used in fighting addiction. It also mandates a study on effects of attempts to curb opioid use on patients in serious need of pain relief.

Headlines: Risk for Opioid-Related Death Very Low in Cancer Patients
Teaser: Cancer patients have a far lower risk for opioid-related death compared to the general population.

Headlines: Sutureless Gastroschisis Tied to Significant Benefits but Higher Hernia Risk
Teaser: Compared to sutured closure, sutureless gastroschisis is associated with a significant reduction in pain medication requirements and mechanical ventilation duration but may increase the risk of umbilical hernia, researchers say.

Headlines: Medical-Assisted Opioid Cessation in the Limelight at ACEP
Teaser: A new option to ease the symptoms of opioid withdrawal will be discussed at the American College of Emergency Physicians (ACEP) Scientific Assembly as experts navigate the complexities of treatment.

Headlines: House AdvancesÂ Broad Opioid Package; Senate Vote Next
Teaser: Although there was strong bipartisan support for the opioid package, lawmakers including a Texas physician already are looking for additional ways to combat abuse of drugs such as fentanyl.

Headlines: Alnylam's Gene-Silencing Drug Shows Efficacy in Late-Stage Trial
Teaser: Alnylam Pharmaceuticals Inc said on Thursday its gene-silencing drug for a rare, painful genetic disease was found to be effective in a late-stage trial, putting the firm on track for a faster approval from U.S. regulator.

Headlines: Depression Tied to Arthritis Pain
Teaser: Depressed individuals over age 50 should be screened for arthritis pain because the two conditions often occur together, worsening mental and physical health outcomes, researchers say.

Headlines: Antidepressants, Psychotherapy May Help Ease Irritable Bowel Syndrome
Teaser: People struggling with irritable bowel syndrome (IBS) might feel better with antidepressants or psychotherapy, a recent study suggests.

Headlines: Kids May Pick Up Marijuana at Younger Age if Mom Uses
Teaser: When mom uses marijuana, kids are more likely to try the drug at a younger age, a new study shows.

Headlines: Fewer US Adults Getting Unnecessary Knee Surgery
Teaser: Arthroscopic knee surgery is being done less often in adults with torn cartilage or painful arthritis, as a growing body of evidence shows little benefit from these operations, a U.S. study suggests.

Headlines: Antibiotics Safe for Appendicitis, 5-Year Follow-up Data Show
Teaser: Antibiotics may be a feasible alternative to surgery for uncomplicated acute appendicitis, according to 5-year follow-up data from a randomized trial.

Headlines: Depression Tied to Double the Risk for Lupus in Women
Teaser: A new study adds to the growing evidence that depression may be a causal risk factor for autoimmune disease.

Headlines: New Strategy Almost Halves Opioid Use in Surgical Cancer Patients
Teaser: A two-prong approach was able to reduce opioid use by 46% in post-op surgical patients without increasing pain or anxiety.

Headlines: Walking After Spinal Cord Injury Possible With Rehab Combo
Teaser: Two patients with spinal cord injuries recovered independent "over ground" walking after using intensive locomotor exercises and spinal cord stimulation, new research shows.

Headlines: EU Panel Backs Damoctocog Alfa Pegol for Hemophilia A
Teaser: The EMA's CHMP recommended damoctocog alfa pegol (Jivi, Bayer AG) for the treatment and prophylaxis of bleeding in patients aged 12 years and older who have been previously treated for hemophilia A.

Headlines: Value of Invasive Procedures for Knee, Back Pain Questioned
Teaser: A new meta-analysis provides little evidence to support use of invasive interventional procedures for chronic knee and low back pain, researchers conclude.

Headlines: Lay Patient Navigators a Boon to Latinos With Advanced Cancer
Teaser: Latinos with advanced cancer often counter barriers to palliative care, but community-based patient navigators can help in a culturally sensitive manner.

Headlines: After Florence, Significant Worry Over Infectious Diseases
Teaser: The annual report on the health of the nation finds death rates are up for five of the leading 12 causes of death. Teen birth and smoking rates have been cut in half.

Headlines: Psychogenic Death: Why Do Healthy People Give Up on Life?
Teaser: A new report examines psychogenic death and hypothesizes that it follows a trajectory of progressive demotivation that may end in the death of physically healthy individuals.

Headlines: Centrally Mediated Pain Common in Parkinson's Disease
Teaser: Pain is common in Parkinson's disease, but peripheral factors may not be to blame. Central factors are an important cause of pain so may require centrally acting drugs, a large study suggests.

Headlines: Checkpoint Inhibitors, Wearables Among Hot Topics at ACR
Teaser: Immunotherapy has opened up exciting options for cancer treatment, but it can also lead to significant complications, which specialists will assess at the American College of Rheumatology meeting.

Headlines: FDA Panel Delivers Mixed Reviews for Two New Opioids
Teaser: An FDA advisory committee gives the nod to a sublingual opioid, but amid loud criticism around safety, while narrowly recommending against approval for an intravenous preparation.

Headlines: Do Not Use Decongestants for Colds in Children Younger Than Age 6
Teaser: A new review finds no evidence that decongestants provide any benefit to young children and may cause harm.

Headlines: Nonopioid Approaches to Pain: The Hunt Is On
Teaser: As the US opioid epidemic continues to grow, the need to find safe, effective, nonaddictive, nonopioid strategies for managing pain is increasingly urgent, say experts.

Headlines: CAM Popular, but Cancer Patients Unaware of Risks
Teaser: Two studies involving sarcoma patients show that complementary and alternative medicine (CAM) treatments are popular, and most patients seem to be unconcerned about risks, such as interactions.

Headlines: FDA Staff Raises Safety Issues Over Trevena Opioid Injection
Teaser: Trevena Inc's opioid injection to treat acute pain could be abused and potentially lead to overdose, staff reviewers of the U.S. Food and Drug Administration said on Tuesday, sending the drugmaker's shares down 66 percent.

Headlines: People Rarely Outgrow Seafood Allergies
Teaser: A small study of children and adults in Canada suggests that fish and shellfish allergies don't usually resolve over time.

Headlines: Better Insurance Coverage of Non-Drug Therapies Might Help Ease Opioid Crisis
Teaser: When it comes to non-drug therapies for back pain, U.S. insurance plans vary widely in what they will cover, a new study finds.

Headlines: Epidural Stimulation Boosts CV Function in Spinal Cord Injury
Teaser: Orthostatic hypotension is common in cervical spinal cord injury. In this study, customized epidural stimulation targeting cardiovascular function raised blood pressure, improving quality of life.

Headlines: Ketogenic Diet Helps Nonmotor Symptoms in Parkinson's
Teaser: Both a low fat, high carbohydrate diet and a ketogenic diet improve Parkinson's symptoms, but the ketogenic approach benefited patients' nonmotor symptoms significantly better, a randomized trial shows.

Headlines: Congolese Doctor, Yazidi Activist Win Nobel Peace Prize for Combating Sexual Violence
Teaser: Denis Mukwege, a doctor who helps victims of sexual violence in the Democratic Republic of Congo, and Nadia Murad, a Yazidi rights activist and survivor of sexual slavery by Islamic State, won the 2018 Nobel Peace Prize on Friday.

Headlines: Alert Increased Take-Home Naloxone Prescriptions in ED
Teaser: An electronic medical record alert increased the distribution of take-home naloxone kits in the emergency department and identified a bias in the prescription of the kits.

Headlines: Biologics Less Effective for Ankylosing Spondylitis in Women
Teaser: Women and men with ankylosing spondylitis respond differently to TNF inhibitor therapy, and researchers are trying to determine why that is.

Headlines: Indiana HIV Outbreak Among Drug Users May Have Been Avoidable
Teaser: A years-long HIV outbreak among intravenous (IV) drug users in Indiana might have been avoided if the state's top medical and political leaders had acted sooner on early warnings that the virus was spreading, a recent study suggests.

Headlines: Arthritis Tied to Higher Risk for Anxiety, Depression
Teaser: 'The high prevalence of symptoms of anxiety and depression among adults with arthritis warrants awareness, screening, and subsequent treatment of these conditions,' researchers say.

Headlines: Physical Therapy Noninferior to Surgery for Some Meniscal Tears
Teaser: A physical therapy-based conservative treatment approach was noninferior to arthroscopic repair in patients with nonobstructive meniscal tears, a study found.

Headlines: A Surgeon So Bad It Was Criminal
Teaser: Christopher Duntsch's surgical outcomes were so outlandishly poor that Texas prosecuted him for harming patients.

Headlines: Regular Aspirin Use Curbs Risk of Liver and Ovarian Cancer
Teaser: Two new studies show that regular long-term aspirin use was linked to a lower risk of hepatocellular carcinoma and ovarian cancer

Headlines: Teaching New Moms How to Soothe Infants Might Make Vaccinations Less Stressful
Teaser: When getting their infants vaccinated, mothers were more likely to use proven techniques to ease babies' pain if they had been taught how to do so before taking their newborns home from the hospital, a study found.

Headlines: HHS Secretary Says Opioid Deaths Starting to Plateau
Teaser: Alex Azar cited interim CDC data that show a flattening trend for overdose deaths from opioids and other drugs in the first few months of 2018.

Headlines: Primary Care Doctors 'Not Doing Enough' to Curb STDs
Teaser: As rates of sexually transmitted infections steadily rise nationwide, public health officials and experts say primary care doctors need to step up screening and treatment.

Headlines: Using Technology to Improve Child Health at AAP 2018
Teaser: Issues that affect child health, such as bullying, the opioid epidemic, the criminal justice system, and gun violence, will be discussed at the American Academy of Pediatrics (AAP) Conference.

Headlines: Apps, Wearables Help Physicians and Patients Track Symptoms
Teaser: When patients track symptoms of rheumatoid arthritis in an app that connects to their health record, treatment decisions are better, but technology is not for everyone, a researcher cautions.

Headlines: Incorrect Survival Prediction Ups Aggressive End-of-Life Care
Teaser: Inaccurate survival predictions increase the risk that terminal cancer patients will receive poor-quality end-of-life care, such as whole-brain radiation therapy, from which they derive no benefit.

Headlines: New Health Insurer Policy May Mean Patients Pay for ER Visit
Teaser: With the price of emergency room care going up, U.S. insurance companies have been looking for ways to contain the costs - sometimes by refusing to pay for visits that turn out not to have been emergencies after all.

Headlines: Astronomical Rise in Amphetamine-Related Hospitalizations, Costs
Teaser: Amphetamine abuse is a public health crisis but has been overshadowed by the focus on opioids. This study shows disturbing and dramatic trends in increased amphetamine-related hospitalizations.

Headlines: Physicians Prescribe Too Many Opioids for Osteoarthritis
Teaser: Analysis of an insurance claims database shows that more than half the patients treated with opioids were managed inappropriately, according to investigators developing criteria to flag problems.

Headlines: Kids in Non-Pediatric ED Often Get Subpar Pain Management
Teaser: Children in non-pediatric emergency department (EDs) often don't get adequate pain management, a Canadian study suggests.

Headlines: Thrill Seekers May Be More Pain Tolerant
Teaser: People who seek out thrilling experiences appear to be less sensitive to pain, according to a study by researchers at the University of Tulsa, Oklahoma.

Headlines: October 20 Daily Buzz at ACR 2018
Teaser: Conference attendees have fired off nearly 950 tweets in the past 24 hours, and many specialists are talking about gout.

Headlines: Patient-Reported Oral Cancer Pain Level Predicts Risk Of Metastasis
Teaser: Oral cancer pain level at the primary site may help doctors identify which patients with occult metastases will benefit from neck dissection, according to results of a study by researchers at New York University in New York City.

Headlines: Congo's Ebola Outbreak Bad, but Not Global Emergency, WHO Says
Teaser: The Democratic Republic of Congo's rising number of cases and deaths are concerning, but a committee ruled that the circumstances don't warrant an international emergency declaration.

Headlines: Infertility Linked to Sexual Abuse
Teaser: A high proportion of female veterans have been sexually assaulted, and victims of assault are more likely to be infertile, which can be a marker of overall health, research shows.

Headlines: Cannabinoids Mildly Effective for Multiple Sclerosis Symptoms
Teaser: Many patients with MS try cannabis products to alleviate symptoms of pain, spasticity, and bladder dysfunction. A large meta-analysis suggests that these agents are mildly efficacious.

Headlines: Gabapentin May Top Pregabalin for Sciatica Pain
Teaser: A comparison of the anticonvulsants gabapentin and pregabalin suggests gabapentin may be superior for pain reduction in chronic sciatica. But at least one expert has concerns about this conclusion.

Headlines: Positive Topline Results for Migraine Drug in Two Safety Studies
Teaser: With positive efficacy data, two safety studies show that oral ubrogepant, a novel CGRP-targeting medication, is safe and well tolerated for treating acute migraine.

Headlines: Children With CP May Have Worse Pain, Be Less Active When Parents Catastrophize
Teaser: If their parents catastrophize pain, children with cerebral palsy (CP) have worse pain and more impaired activities of daily living after intrathecal baclofen (ITB) surgery to control spasticity, according to results of a study presented last month at the International Association for the Study of Pain (IASP) World Congress on Pain in Boston.

Headlines: A Child Poisoned in Military Housing, a Family Left in the Dark
Teaser: In August 2016, a National Guardsman's year-old daughter tested high for lead exposure while living at the military post here, amid pecan groves near the Mississippi River.

Headlines: FDA Goes Ahead With Approval of Sufentanil Despite Controversy
Teaser: The FDA's approval of sufentanil, a highly potent opioid for severe acute pain in adults in certified medically supervised healthcare settings, causes controversy with claims that the vote was rigged.

Headlines: FDA Panel Fails to Support Novel Opioid for Depression
Teaser: An FDA advisory panel failed to endorse the approval of a novel opioid to treat major depressive disorder because of insufficient efficacy data.

Headlines: Repeated CBD Doses Required for Effective Pain Relief
Teaser: Repeated administration of cannabidiol (CBD) is needed to treat neuropathic pain and related anxiety, according to new research that shows how the drug acts on specific brain receptors.

Headlines: Women, Men With Schizophrenia Interpret Emotions Differently
Teaser: Although all patients with schizophrenia may have impairments in identifying emotions and intentions of others, cognitive and affective influences are different in men vs women, new research suggests.

Headlines: New Screen Quickly Identifies GI Disorders in Kids With Autism
Teaser: A new 17-item questionnaire that investigates gastrointestinal problems in children with autism is probably the most effective and efficient screen to date.

Headlines: Mindfulness Meditation May Reduce Anxiety With Breast Biopsy
Teaser: A brief session of guided mindfulness-based meditation may help women undergoing a stereotactic breast biopsy to feel less anxious, a small study suggests.

Headlines: As States Chase Sports Betting Gold, Addicts Left in the Cold
Teaser: On the day Jeff Wasserman's decades-long gambling addiction came to a head, the Delaware lawyer found himself parked outside a convenience store with three agonizing options: end his life, flee the country or come clean and get help.

Headlines: FGF23 Inhibitor Effective in Rare Inherited Form of Rickets
Teaser: The drug boosts phosphorous levels and promotes fracture healing in adults with symptomatic X-linked hypophosphatemia, new research shows.

Headlines: Radiotherapy Patients Can Safely Use Lotions for Irritated Skin
Teaser: A new study debunks a common recommendation that patients avoid use of topical agents before daily radiation treatments because it found that these agents have a minimal effect on skin dose.

Headlines: Suicide Risk Factors Differ by Sex Among Opiate Users at High Risk
Teaser: Among opiate users at the highest risk of suicide, the risk factors differ between men and women, according to a new study.

Headlines: Neuropathic Corneal Pain More Common Than Thought
Teaser: Medical treatment would be more widely available to opioid abusers, while mailing illicit drugs would become more difficult under a rare bipartisan measure aimed at tackling the nation's addiction crisis expected to be signed into law on Wednesday by U.S. President Donald Trump.

Headlines: Trump to Sign Anti-Opioid Abuse Package in Rare Bipartisan Step
Teaser: Individuals who struggle to overcome grief caused by the loss of a loved one may experience levels of inflammation high enough to cause heart damage.

Headlines: Grief Tied to Death
Teaser: Where a patient lives and primary care provider characteristics are significantly associated with the intensity of benzodiazepine prescribing for Medicare beneficiaries, a study found.

Headlines: High Benzodiazepine Rx Tied to PCP Characteristics, Geography
Teaser: Women of reproductive age should be screened for intimate partner violence, and those who screen positive should be referred to ongoing support services, according to updated recommendations from the U.S. Preventive Services Task Force (USPSTF).

Headlines: USPSTF Maintains Advice to Screen Women for Intimate Partner Violence
Teaser: Reaction to acute pain in emotion-related areas of the brain was weaker in patients with chronic lower back pain on sick leave than in other patients, functional MRI showed.

Headlines: Neuroplasticity Altered With Chronic Back Pain
Teaser: Patients with osteoarthritis who start opioid treatment at higher doses tend to have higher treatment-failure rates, according to an industry-sponsored study.

Headlines: Osteoarthritis Patients Who Start Opioids at Higher Doses Have Worse Outcomes
Teaser: For one patient, meditation addresses the component of living with polyarthritis that medication does not.

Headlines: Daily Meditation Helps Arthritis Patient With Chronic Pain
Teaser: The myPTM app works with the company's implantable pain pump and allows patients to personalize their chronic pain medication within pre-set therapeutic limits.

Headlines: FDA OKs Personal Therapy App for Implantable Pain Pump
Teaser: New research shows that primary care physicians are prescribing opioids less often, whereas pain medicine specialists and nonphysicians such as nurse practitioners are prescribing these drugs more often.

Headlines: Patient Selection Key in Nonoperative Appendicitis Care
Teaser: A new study finds that nonoperative management of patients with uncomplicated appendicitis can be successful, but the risk for complications and recurrence should be considered.

Headlines: Brain Inflammation Seen for First Time in Fibromyalgia
Teaser: The discovery may open the door to new treatments and bring comfort to those who have been told their symptoms are imaginary.

Headlines: Clinicians Hungry for Education on Diet for Pain Management
Teaser: Clinicians taking the course report that it boosts their comfort level and confidence in discussing nutrition with their pain patients.

Headlines: REGROUP Lifts Cloud Over Endoscopic Vein Harvesting for CABG
Teaser: The less invasive approach is favored by patients, but earlier trials suggested safety concerns with endoscopic vein-graft harvesting.

Headlines: Hepatitis C Medications Effective in People Who Inject Drugs
Teaser: People who inject drugs can take medication consistently enough to be cured of hepatitis C, new research shows.

Headlines: Acupuncture in the ED Cuts Pain, Reduces Stress, Anxiety
Teaser: In the emergency department, acupuncture relieves pain, cuts stress and anxiety, and is acceptable to the majority of patients.

Headlines: U.S. Regulators Snip Red Tape for Medical Devices to Curb Opioid Crisis
Teaser: Laura Perryman expected her medical company, Stimwave Technologies Inc, would have to wait several years for its painkilling device to win U.S. approval as a treatment for chronic migraines.

Headlines: Neonatal Abstinence Syndrome a Risk With Kratom Use in Pregnancy
Teaser: Healthcare providers and parents should begin talking to adolescents in middle school about healthy romantic and sexual relationships and mutual respect for others, a doctors' group urges.

Headlines: Encourage Teens to Discuss Relationships, Experts Say
Teaser: Virtual-reality hypnosis (VRH) can help reduce children's anxiety and pain after surgery and the need for opioid pain medication, according to a new pilot study.

Headlines: Virtual-Reality Hypnosis Eases Kids' Anxiety and Pain After Surgery
Teaser: Providing intensive education to patients with acute low back pain is no better than placebo for easing discomfort, results of a randomized controlled trial show.

Headlines: Intensive Patient Education Fails to Ease Low Back Pain
Teaser: Young children who had surgery under general anesthesia were no more likely than their siblings who weren't exposed to anesthesia to experience developmental challenges that impair school readiness, a Canadian study found.

Headlines: Anesthesia in Early Childhood Not Tied to Developmental Problems
Teaser: The World Health Organization is releasing more than a million doses of yellow fever vaccine from its emergency stockpile after the deadly mosquito-borne disease killed 10 people in southwestern Ethiopia, a WHO report said on Monday.

Headlines: Yellow Fever Kills 10 in Ethiopia, WHO Ships 1.45 Mln Vaccines
Teaser: Patient safety improved in hospitals that enhanced clinical work environments, but many hospitals are not following national recommendations for these changes to reduce patient harm.

Headlines: Inpatient Safety Linked to Nurse Work Environment
Teaser: Even short-term use of opioids may increase the risk for atrial fibrillation in patients in their 30s, suggests an analysis of more than 850,000 veterans.

Headlines: Opioid Use, Not Just Abuse, Linked to Increased AF Risk
Teaser: Rose geranium in sesame oil nasal spray improved patient-reported nasal symptoms associated with chemotherapy in this small, single-center study.

Headlines: Rose Geranium Oil Eases Chemo-Induced Nasal Pain
Teaser: CMS also used the 2019 update of a regular payment rule to try to expand use of telehealth. And the agency is seeking input on potential changes to Medicare pay for substance abuse treatment.

Headlines: Medicare Advances Virtual Check-ins in Physician Pay Rule
Teaser: Endometriosis patients' progesterone receptor (PR) status is "strongly associated" with their response to progestin-based treatment, new research shows.

Headlines: Progesterone-Receptor Status Predicts Response to Endometriosis Treatment
Teaser: The new rule also provides incentives for nonopioid pain treatment and takes aim at the 340B drug program.

Headlines: Groups to Sue CMS Over Site-Neutral Payments
Teaser: The FDA has declined to approve the intravenous opioid for the management of moderate to severe acute pain in adults who require an IV opioid.

Headlines: Tazarotene Gel an Option for Post-Acne Scarring
Teaser: Home treatment with tazarotene gel was as effective as microneedling in improving acne scar severity, in a small trial in India.

Headlines: FDA Warns of High Levels of Heavy Metals in Kratom
Teaser: FDA scientists have found heavy metals including lead and nickel at levels not considered safe for human consumption in some kratom products.

Headlines: Stress Makes Bisexual Women Most Likely to Abuse Deadly Opioids - U.S. Study
Teaser: BioMarin Pharmaceutical Inc is turning to the theater to establish its name with hemophilia patients, long before its experimental cure for the bleeding disorder could reach the market.

Headlines: BioMarin Sets Stage Early for Hemophilia Cure Off-Broadway
Teaser: A randomized trial of the low-dose antidepressant for chronic low back pain showed no significant improvement in the primary outcome, but researchers still conclude it's an 'option' on the basis of secondary measures.

Headlines: Amitriptyline 'Still an Option' for Back Pain
Teaser: The lack of significant differences in blood pressure or adverse outcomes when NSAIDs are given after delivery challenges current ACOG guidelines, could reduce opioid use.

Headlines: NSAIDs OK for Pain After Birth in Gestational Hypertension
Teaser: Dramatically improved artificial intelligence holds promise for making palliative care services available anywhere, anytime for patients with advanced cancer pain.

Headlines: Cancer Pain Control App Works -- Palliative Care for Everyone?
Teaser: Resurrecting an older analgesic and adding high-dose codeine and other drugs to curb side effects reduce opioid intake without withdrawal or increased pain, new research suggests.

Headlines: Novel 'Blended Therapy' May Help Cut High-Dose Opioid Use
Teaser: Users of food banks who also have a pain condition are often concerned about having enough to eat before running out of money, new research suggests.

Headlines: 'Food Insecurity' Linked to Pain Conditions
Teaser: During interviews about opioid overdoses in public restrooms, New York City service industry workers said they supported the idea of supervised injection facilities because such facilities might reduce injection drug use in their workplaces, researchers report.

Headlines: Colombia Acid Attack Survivor Calls for Greater Action to Help Other Victims
Teaser: The occurrence of disabling and potentially permanent side effects associated with quinolone and fluoroquinolone antibiotics has led the European Medicines Agency (EMA) to restrict or suspend their use.
