Headlines: Service Workers Say Supervised Injection Facilities Could Cut Restroom Overdoses
Teaser: Nitroglycerin patches help patients with common injuries to tendons, a research review suggests.

Headlines: EMA Curtails Use of Fluoroquinolone, Quinolone Antibiotics
Teaser: Healthcare providers, policy makers, insurers, and other stakeholders are making progress in ensuring improved access to integrative pain management therapies such as yoga, acupuncture, and massage.

Headlines: Transdermal Nitroglycerin May Help Ease Tendon Pain
Teaser: Pfizer lost the final round in a long-running patent battle in Britain on Wednesday after the country's highest court ruled against it in a case involving its $5 billion-a-year pain drug Lyrica.

Teaser: Cognitive behavioral therapy, offered in-office or online, may reduce pain and opioid use in addition to improving sleep and mood, new research suggests.

Headlines: Pfizer Loses Blockbuster Drug Patent Fight in UK Supreme Court
Teaser: Mobile apps that track pain levels, sleep, mood, and activity are improving patient outcomes, new research shows.

Headlines: CBT May Reduce Pain, Decrease Opioid Use
Teaser: Two FDA advisory committees voted 10-7 for recommending approval for a new abuse-deterrent formulation of immediate-release (IR) oxycodone to treat adult patients with severe pain.

Headlines: Mobile Apps Help Patients Cope With Pain
Teaser: The FDA alerts physicians over the risk for complications when using medications that are not approved for use an implanted intrathecal pump.

Headlines: FDA Panels Recommend Approval of Abuse-Deterrent IR Oxycodone
Teaser: Interactive resource includes group visits and nonpharmacologic options for treating chronic pain in a low-income, medically underserved population.

Headlines: Six Michigan Physicians Charged in $464M Pain Pill Conspiracy
Teaser: Federal prosecutors have charged six Detroit-area physicians with fraudulent billing in connection with a scheme to hook patients on opioids and then force them to undergo unnecessary procedures.

Headlines: CHMP Recommends Approval of Opioid-Induced Constipation Drug
Teaser: The European Medicines Agency's committee recommended approval of the mu-opioid receptor antagonist for treatment of opioid-induced constipation in adults previously been treated with a laxative.

Headlines: Off-Label Drug Research Generates 'Medical Uncertainty'
Teaser: Research that explores/supports off-label use of pregabalin and other medications may be misleading if early promising results are not subsequently validated, investigators suggest in a new review.

Headlines: High Neoplasm Rate Seen After Conservative Treatment of Periappendicular Abscess
Teaser: A trial comparing interval appendectomy to MRI follow-up after nonoperative treatment of periappendicular abscess was stopped prematurely after an interim analysis revealed a high neoplasm rate.

Headlines: Top Ten Drugs Tied to Overdose Deaths
Teaser: US deaths from drug overdose increased 54% from 2011 to 2016, a new report by the CDC shows. Although rankings changed, the top 10 drugs involved remained consistent throughout the study period.

Headlines: Act Now Or Face 100 More Years of Child Marriage, Economists Warn
Teaser: Patients who undergo stereotactic radiosurgery for benign indications do not appear to be at increased risk of malignant transformation, new findings show.

Headlines: Stereotactic Radiosurgery May Not Raise Risk of Intracranial Malignancy
Teaser: The prescription-only reSET-O application is intended for use in conjunction with outpatient therapy to treat opioid use disorder.

Headlines: FDA Clears Mobile App for Opioid Use Disorder
Teaser: A prescription digital therapeutic that can be downloaded to a smartphone is a promising treatment option for opioid addiction when used as an adjunct to usual care.

Headlines: New Digital Therapeutic Shows Promise for Opioid Addiction
Teaser: "I wish I didn't have this hand anymore," my 4-year-old son said as he woke one winter morning.

Headlines: After a Child's Dire Diagnosis, Hope and Uncertainty at the Frontiers of Medicine
Teaser: A growing number of American pregnant women are using opioids and methamphetamines, and drug use is rising fastest among mothers in rural communities, a U.S. study suggests.

Headlines: More U.S. Pregnant Women Using Opioids and Meth
Teaser: As the opioid crisis goes on, cancer patients are increasingly being caught in the crossfire: is this patient population at risk for abuse or misuse of these drugs?

Headlines: Opioid Misuse in Cancer Patients: Fearmongering or Real Risk?

Headlines: Infective Endocarditis: A New Consequence of the Opioid Epidemic
Teaser: In high-risk patients undergoing open abdominal surgery, implanting intraperitoneal mesh before closure may prevent incisional hernia, researchers say.

Headlines: Prophylactic Mesh May Prevent Incisional Hernia in High-Risk Patients
Teaser: Teens and young adults who are prescribed opioids by dental clinicians are at increased risk for persistent use and for abuse in the subsequent year, a retrospective cohort study suggests.

Headlines: Opioids Prescribed by Dentists Tied to Addiction Among Youth
Teaser: The American College of Obstetrics and Gynecology (ACOG) has released new guidance on diagnosing and relieving dysmenorrhea in adolescents.

Headlines: Early Diagnosis Of Dysmenorrhea in Teens Is Key to Effective Management: ACOG
Teaser: The current CDC definition of acute flaccid myelitis may include several other diagnoses and may impede quick identification of this emerging threat to pediatric patients.

Headlines: Key Clinical Features of  Acute Flaccid Myelitis Identified
Teaser: Benzodiazepines and opioids are frequently coprescribed for patients with Alzheimer's disease, putting them at increased risk for osteoporosis, falls, and fractures.

Headlines: Benzodiazepines Plus Opioids, Common Combo in Alzheimer's
Teaser: Driven largely by drug overdose deaths and suicide, life expectancy in the US took a significant plunge from 2016 to 2017.

Headlines: Drug Overdose, Suicide Deaths Cut US Life Expectancy
Teaser: Infants, children and teens who are unexpectedly exposed to radiation from nuclear power plants or improper disposal of medical equipment may be more at risk for health problems than adults, U.S. pediatricians warn.

Headlines: AAP Guideline Urges Prompt Care for Infantile Hemangiomas
Teaser: The American Academy of Pediatrics' clinical guideline for infantile hemangiomas recommends consultation and/or referral to specialty care in the first month of life for infants with high-risk lesions.

Headlines: Keep Off Teething Necklaces, FDA Urges Parents After Reported Death
Teaser: Stay away from necklaces and bracelets used to relieve teething pain in infants, the U.S. health regulator warned parents and caregivers on Thursday, after reports of a death and several serious injuries.

Headlines: Judge Blocks New York From Enforcing Opioid Tax on Companies
Teaser: A U.S. federal judge on Wednesday blocked New York state from enforcing a recently-enacted law that aimed to collect $600 million from drug manufacturers and distributors to defray the costs of combating the opioid addiction epidemic.

Headlines: USPSTF Turns Gaze to Opioid Epidemic
Teaser: As the opioid epidemic deepens, a government-backed panel that routinely draws up guidelines for disease prevention is starting to search for ways to prevent addiction to these drugs in the first place.

Headlines: USPSTF Targets Opioid Abuse Prevention
Teaser: The US Preventive Services Task Force (USPSTF) is reviewing evidence on ways to prevent opioid use disorder as a key first step in a multiyear process of issuing a recommendation statement.

Headlines: Benzodiazepine Use, Misuse Spike in the US
Teaser: Although benzodiazepines are frequently prescribed to older adults, new research shows that midlife adults have surpassed seniors in number of benzodiazepine prescriptions â€” and misuse is common.

Headlines: No Increased Risk of Psychiatric Illness With Naltrexone
Teaser: New findings dispel the prevailing view that blocking opioid receptors with XR-NTX may trigger or worsen symptoms of anxiety, depression, or insomnia.

Headlines: HHS Advises Coprescribing Naloxone and Opioids
Teaser: Coprescribing naloxone to patients at high risk for an overdose is a key element of a national effort to reduce overdose deaths, federal health officials say.

Headlines: Indivior Plans Cheaper Opioid Addiction Drug if Rivals Launch Copycats
Teaser: Indivior Plc said on Tuesday it could launch a cheaper version of its blockbuster opioid addiction treatment, Suboxone, if rivals release generic versions of the drug.

Headlines: U.S. FDA Panel Backs Prescribing Opioid Overdose Reversal Drug Along With Painkillers
Teaser: An advisory panel to the U.S. Food and Drug Administration on Tuesday recommended prescribing the opioid overdose reversal drug, naloxone, along with addictive painkillers.

Headlines: Weekly Full-Body Massage Improves Short-term Knee OA Pain
Teaser: Two months of weekly 1-hour Swedish massage significantly improved pain and function in patients with knee osteoarthritis, a randomized trial showed.

Headlines: Teen Vaping of Nicotine, Marijuana Surge
Teaser: Although teen use of combustible cigarettes and opioids declined over the past year, there's been a massive increase in their use of e-cigarettes, the latest Monitoring the Future survey reports.

Headlines: Opioids for Chronic Pain Only Nominally Better Than Placebo
Teaser: Opioids offer marginal pain-control benefits over placebo for patients with chronic pain and "should not be first-line therapy" for pain management, investigators of a new meta-analysis say.

Headlines: FDA OKs Prucalopride (Motegrity) for Chronic Idiopathic Constipation
Teaser: Prucalopride, a selective serotonin-4 (5-HT4) receptor agonist, enhances bowel motility by stimulating colonic peristalsis.

Headlines: Worth the Sting: Cuba's Scorpion Pain Remedy
Teaser: Once a month for the last decade, Pepe Casanas, a 78-year-old Cuban farmer, has hunted down a scorpion to sting himself with, vowing that the venom wards off his rheumatism pains.

Headlines: Dramatic Surge in Opioid Use Among Cardiac Surgery Patients
Teaser: The number of patients with opioid use disorder prior to undergoing cardiac surgery increased nine-fold in 15 years, with high rates of postoperative complications reported, new research confirms.

Headlines: Alcohol Abuse After Bariatric Surgery Common, Concerning
Teaser: Bariatric surgery, particularly Roux-en-Y gastric bypass, significantly increases the risk of developing alcohol use disorder.

Headlines: Electrical Stimulation May Prevent Opioid-Overdose Death
Teaser: Electrical stimulation, either through an implantable pacemaker-like device or externally via a defibrillator-type of device, shows promise in getting people who overdose on opioids breathing again.

Headlines: Steer Clear of Driving While Taking Prescribed Opioids?
Teaser: Higher-dose opioids impair driving performance to a minor degree, but patients still need to be advised of this risk so they can decide whether to steer clear of driving while taking these meds.

Headlines: Mexican Officials Bust Fentanyl Lab in Mexico City
Teaser: A laboratory in Mexico City suspected of producing the powerful opioid fentanyl was raided on Wednesday, officials said, in a rare case of a bust involving a drug that is increasingly blamed for fueling the opioid crisis in the United States.

Headlines: AHS Releases Updated Guidance on Migraine Treatment
Teaser: In response to recent advances in drug and device technology for treating migraine, the American Headache Society (AHS) has released new guidance on best preventive and acute strategies for clinical practice.

Headlines: Pharma Marketing: Spending Surges, Oversight Lags
Teaser: During the past 2 decades, marketing to healthcare professionals by pharmaceutical companies rose by nearly one third, and direct-to-consumer advertising quadrupled.

Headlines: Intranasal Ketamine as Effective as Fentanyl at Relieving Acute Pain in Kids
Teaser: Intranasal ketamine is noninferior to intranasal fentanyl at relieving pain in children with acute extremity injuries, a new study found.

Headlines: Physicians Urge Caution Regarding Medical Uses of Marijuana and Cannabinoids
Teaser: While advocates of marijuana and cannabinoids promote its use for conditions ranging from nausea to cancer, the paucity of high-quality evidence demands caution regarding the use of these agents, according to 6 brief commentaries from physicians and other providers across the US.

Headlines: Probiotics Effective for Functional Abdominal Pain in Children
Teaser: Probiotics can ease pain short-term in children with recurrent abdominal pain (RAP), according to a new report.

Headlines: Opioid-Related Deaths Up Threefold in Children
Teaser: Almost 9000 children and adolescents died of opioid poisoning over a recent 18-year period, a new report shows.

Headlines: Most With OD Can Be Discharged From ED an Hour After Naloxone
Teaser: Most patients with opioid overdose were safely discharged from the emergency department as early as an hour after prehospital administration of naloxone, a study found.

Headlines: Senate Confirms James Carroll as New Drug Czar
Teaser: James W. Carroll, who has been serving as Trump's acting director for national drug control policy, is an attorney who also served in the Bush administration and worked for Ford Motor Company.

Headlines: Federal Task Force Highlights Ways to Limit Opioid Exposure
Teaser: A draft report urges a look at how reimbursement policies limit access to less addictive pain treatments. It also encourages a review of the potential benefits of physical therapies and meditation.

Headlines: Drug Use During Pregnancy Not Child Abuse -Pennsylvania Top Court
Teaser: A divided Pennsylvania Supreme Court ruled on Friday that mothers who use illegal drugs during their pregnancies are not committing child abuse against their newly-born children.

Headlines: Perioperative Continuation of Buprenorphine Appears Safe
Teaser: Buprenorphine can be safely continued during perioperative pain management in patients taking it for opioid use disorder, researchers report.

Headlines: Risk Clusters May Help Personalize Care After Orthopedic Trauma
Teaser: In the early recovery phase after orthopedic trauma, patients can be stratified into risk and protective clusters that can help individualize care, new research suggests.

Headlines: Cardiac Surgery Not Linked to Cognitive Decline
Teaser: Previous research has suggested high rates of cognitive decline following cardiac surgery, but a new study finds no such association with surgery vs cardiac catheterization.

Headlines: Anxiety, Depression May Predict Poor Physical Health
Teaser: Symptoms of anxiety and depression are as predictive of poor physical health as obesity and smoking, researchers say.

Headlines: Early Physical Therapy May Curb Long-term Opioid Use for Musculoskeletal Pain
Teaser: Receiving at least one physical therapy session within three months of a diagnosis of knee, shoulder, neck or low back pain is associated with less long-term opioid use, researchers say.

Headlines: Mandatory Taper Off Chronic Opioids Might Be Harmful, Experts Say
Teaser: Mandatory opioid tapers could sometimes do more harm than good, international medical experts warn in an open letter to health authorities.

Headlines: First Nations Kids in Canada Have Worse Pain Than Non-indigenous Peers
Teaser: Indigenous children and youth in Canada are diagnosed with greater levels of pain than their non-indigenous peers, a new analysis of healthcare data suggests.

Headlines: EMLA Cream Only Minimally Effective for Venipuncture Pain in Babies
Teaser: For infants younger than 3 months undergoing venipuncture, eutectic mixture of lidocaine (EMLA) cream has only minimal pain relieving effects relative to placebo and no benefit over sucrose and/or breastfeeding, according to a meta-analysis of published studies.

Headlines: Most Drug Treatments Fail to Control Long-term OA Pain
Teaser: Most commonly used drugs for osteoarthritis (OA) did not reliably control pain or improve function when used long term, a meta-analysis found.

Headlines: Rerouting Nerves in Amputees Shows Impressive Pain Reduction
Teaser: Targeted muscle reinnervation that re-routes severed nerves in the amputated limb to other muscle targets is showing dramatic reductions in phantom limb and stump pain in below-knee amputations.

Headlines: Thailand to Revoke Foreign Patent Requests on Marijuana
Teaser: Thailand on Monday effectively revoked all foreign patent requests for the use of marijuana, after fears foreign firms would dominate a market thrown open last month when the government approved the drug for medical use and research.

Headlines: Global Drug Spending Forecast to Hit $1.5 Trillion by 2023
Teaser: The surge in innovation in the pharmaceutical market will continue over the next 5 years with an average of 54 new drugs forecast to hit the market each year until 2023.

Headlines: Benzodiazepines: The Other Prescription Drug Problem
Teaser: Prescriptions for benzodiazepines doubled over roughly the past decade, often in combination with opioids and other sedating drugs and for conditions other than anxiety.

Headlines: Doctors Call California's Probe of Opioid Deaths a 'Witch Hunt'
Teaser: The president of the American Medical Association called the investigation 'terrifying' and said it may discourage physicians from prescribing medications for those who truly need relief from pain.

Headlines: Spinal Fusions Ineffective for Fracture Pain, Says ASBMR
Teaser: Vertebroplasty does not work to relieve pain from a spinal fracture caused by osteoporosis, concludes a new review. Rather, time is a great healer and patients should receive osteoporosis medications.

Headlines: Rotavirus Vaccination Tied to Lower Rates of Type 1 Diabetes
Teaser: Young kids who receive the rotavirus vaccine may be less likely to develop type 1 diabetes than children who don't get this routine childhood vaccination, an Australian study suggests.

Headlines: No Benefit From Endometrial Scratching Before IVF: Global Trial
Teaser: It may be time to stop performing endometrial scratching prior to implanting an embryo as part of in vitro fertilization (IVF), a large global randomized controlled trial suggests.

Headlines: Lidocaine-Prilocaine Cream May Ease IUD Insertion Pain
Teaser: A network meta-analysis suggests that lidocaine-prilocaine is more effective than some other analgesic options for relieving pain during insertion of an intrauterine device (IUD); however, more studies are needed to confirm the cream's effectiveness and safety, researchers say.

Headlines: Bariatric Surgery May Boost Sexual Function in Women
Teaser: Sexual function in severely obese women improves after bariatric surgery, researchers in Brazil say.

Headlines: Study Links Opioid Epidemic to Painkiller Marketing
Teaser: Researchers are reporting a link between doctor-targeted marketing of opioid products and the increase in U.S. deaths from overdoses.

Headlines: Gabapentin Improves Sexual Function in Some With Vulvodynia
Teaser: Gabapentin improves sexual function in women with both vulvodynia and severe pelvic floor muscle pain.

Headlines: Mesh Complications Linked to Greater Depression, Self-Harm Risk
Teaser: Women who suffer from transvaginal mesh complications are at increased risk of new-onset depression and self-harm, according to new research.

Headlines: Family Behind Purdue Pharma Pushed Opioid Marketing, Massachusetts Says
Teaser: Members of the wealthy Sackler family behind Purdue Pharma LP pushed it to boost sales of OxyContin and other opioids even as questions emerged about the extent its painkillers were being abused, Massachusetts' attorney general alleged on Tuesday.

Headlines: FDA Moves to Fast-Track OTC Naloxone for Opioid Overdose
Teaser: The agency announced 'unprecedented' steps to jump-start development of over-the-counter (OTC) naloxone to help reduce opioid overdose deaths.

Headlines: CDC: Rural-Urban Gap Persists in PCP Opioid Prescribing
Teaser: Opioid prescribing is down overall since 2016, but the latest CDC numbers show that rural areas have much higher prescribing rates. Targeting interventions to those communities will be key.

Headlines: FDA Advisers Urge Approval of Romosozumab for Osteoporosis
Teaser: The risk for cardiac events, though not well defined, should not hold up marketing, said the FDA panel members.

Headlines: Persistent Back Pain Common, but Trajectories Vary
Teaser: The findings from a large longitudinal study argue against the idea that most cases of back pain resolve, authors write.

Headlines: Sublingual Sufentanil: A Solution in Search of a Problem?
Teaser: New data support the safety of sublingual sufentanil for moderate-to-severe acute pain used in hospital, but experts say there is no need for it and worry about diversion.

Headlines: 2019 the Year for Validated Digital Tech for Mental Health
Teaser: With several technologies approved for mental health, the way is being paved for the clinical validation of emerging tools.

Headlines: Former Insys CEO to Plead Guilty in Opioid Kickback Case
Teaser: The former chief executive of Insys Therapeutics Inc is expected on Wednesday to plead guilty to participating in a scheme to pay doctors bribes in exchange for prescribing an addictive opioid medication.

Headlines: Guideline Discourages Perioperative Antibiotics, Codeine for Kids Undergoing Tonsillectomy
Teaser: Children undergoing tonsillectomy should not receive perioperative antibiotics and should not receive codeine, but they should receive a single intraoperative dose of intravenous dexamethasone, according to the 2019 updated clinical-practice guideline on tonsillectomy in children from the American Academy of Otolaryngology-Head and Neck Surgery Foundation.

Headlines: Fluoroquinolones Overprescribed Despite Dangers
Teaser: In the past year, more concerns about the drugs' side effects have led the FDA to issue new warnings about their use.

Headlines: With Self-Compression, Women Suffer Less and Mammogram Quality Not at All
Teaser: There are many reasons women dislike mammograms, chief among them the awkward and often painful process of having their breasts squashed by a technician into a machine that flattens them for the images.

Headlines: Expert Panel Advises Against Surgery for Shoulder Pain
Teaser: Surgery for shoulder pain that isn't caused by an injury has no better results than nonsurgical options or placebo surgery, and comes with potential harms, an expert panel has concluded.

Headlines: Hospitals Serving More Minorities May Offer Less Palliative Care
Teaser: Patients may have less access to palliative care at U.S. hospitals that primarily serve minorities, a study suggests.

Headlines: Questions Linger About Steroid Injections and Knee Arthritis
Teaser: A natural history study of knee osteoarthritis suggests that intra-articular steroids might speed joint deterioration.

Headlines: Decompression for Lumbar Stenosis May Also Improve Low Back Pain
Teaser: Treating symptomatic lumbar stenosis with surgical decompression may also relieve associated low back pain (LBP), researchers say.

Headlines: Hospital Radiologists Can Help Detect Domestic Violence, Researchers Say
Teaser: A net increase in recovery rates of hearts from individuals who died from drug intoxication may be responsible for a net decrease in the heart transplant waiting list, new results suggest.

Headlines: Rise in Overdose-related Donor Hearts in US
Teaser: Oral drugs combined with a sensor can alert clinicians and caregivers when medication has been taken; a pilot trial with a digital capecitabine is underway in colorectal cancer patients.

Headlines: Digital Pill May Improve Adherence to Oral Cancer Drugs
Teaser: Drugmaker Indivior Plc said on Monday it is selling its rights related to the opioid addiction treatment drug Sai Bo Song tablet in China to privately-held Zhejiang Pukang Biotechnology Co. Ltd, which focuses on vaccines, for up to $122.5 million.

Headlines: Indivior Sells Rights to Chinese Treatment
Teaser: Republicans and Democrats in Congress have already been targeting drug prices, but almost assuredly won't approve an abortion ban.

Headlines: Trump Tackles Drug Costs, HIV, Abortion in State of the Union
Teaser: The introduction of abuse-deterrent OxyContin may be a factor in the sharp rise in hepatitis C infections in the United States because drug abusers switched to injectable heroin, research suggests.

Headlines: London Mum Guilty of Mutilating Daughter in Landmark FGM Trial
Teaser: A randomized control trial conducted at Walter Reed National Military Medical Center concluded that compounded pain creams lack efficacy and don't warrant the high cost.

Headlines: Abuse-Deterrent OxyContin Tied to Spike in Hepatitis C
Teaser: Most qualifying conditions have substantial or conclusive evidence behind them, but for many conditions, the evidence doesn't support the number of patients receiving a physician's approval.

Headlines: Compounded Pain Creams No Better Than Placebo
Teaser: An identifiable subgroup of patients who underwent total knee arthroplasty were at increased risk for poor outcomes, a study found.

Headlines: Conditions Treated With Cannabis Often Lack Good Evidence
Teaser: Secret portions of a lawsuit allege that Purdue Pharma considered capitalizing on the addiction treatment boom â€” while going to extreme lengths to boost sales of its controversial opioid.

Headlines: Two Outcome Trajectories Identified After Knee Replacement
Teaser: Women with inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) can have healthy pregnancies with proper planning and care, according to a new initiative from a major medical society aimed at dispelling myths surrounding the disease.

Headlines: OxyContin Maker Explored Expansion Into Anti-Addiction Market
Teaser: The one-time billionaire founder of Insys Therapeutics Inc and four other former executives and managers of the opioid drugmaker will face trial over charges they conspired to pay doctors bribes to prescribe patients an addictive fentanyl spray to boost sales.

Headlines: Rheumatoid Arthritis Risk Lower Among Smokers Who Quit
Teaser: Adults who quit smoking decades ago may have a lower risk of rheumatoid arthritis than people who gave up cigarettes more recently, a U.S. study suggests.

Headlines: Vaginal Laser Treatment Tied to Complications Like Scarring
Teaser: Vaginal laser treatments may help relieve problems associated with menopause, like dryness, pain and sexual dysfunction, but the safety of this technique is not clear, suggest the authors of a small study describing complications including scarring and penetration injuries.

Headlines: Mindfulness-Based Stress Reduction May Help Ease Chronic Pain
Teaser: People with chronic pain may experience as much of a decline in symptoms with mindfulness-based stress-reduction training as they do with cognitive behavioral therapy, a small research review suggests.

Headlines: Fentanyl REMS Program Falls Short
Teaser: A large percentage of patients, prescribers, and pharmacists do not understand specifics of using transmucosal immediate-release fentanyl products, analysis of 4000+ pages of FDA documentation shows.

Headlines: FDA OKs Accurian Nerve Ablation Platform for Chronic Pain
Teaser: The minimally invasive ablative procedure destroys small areas of nerve tissue to stop it from sending pain signals, thereby reducing pain, Medtronic says.

Headlines: More Evidence on Environmental Toxins and Breast Cancer
Teaser: Phthalates are not associated with postmenopausal breast cancer but may be a factor in premenopausal breast cancer; exposure to DDT is associated with an increase in breast cancer through age 54 years.

Headlines: Low-Value Procedures Associated With Hospital-Acquired Complications
Teaser: Several low-value procedures are associated with significant hospital-acquired complications and prolonged length of stay, researchers from Australia report.

Headlines: FDA Approves Lotemax SM For Ocular Surgery Pain, Inflammation
Teaser: The FDA has approved a new formulation of loteprednol etabonate ophthalmic gel (Lotemax SM, Bausch + Lomb) 0.38% for postoperative inflammation and pain following ocular surgery.

Headlines: Californian 'Holy Herb' a Potential Treatment for Alzheimer's?
Teaser: An extract from yerba santa, a native Californian plant that has been used for medicinal purposes, may be a promising new compound in the treatment of Alzheimer disease.

Headlines: Pediatric Medical Overuse Persists
Teaser: Evidence of pediatric medical overuse persists, but there are glimmers of progress, according to a new review.

Headlines: Sackler Embraced Plan to Conceal OxyContin's Strength From Doctors
Teaser: Richard Sackler, whose family has reaped billions of dollars from OxyContin, boasted that sales exceeded his 'fondest dreams,' according to a secret court document obtained by ProPublica.

Headlines: More States Say Doctors Must Offer Naloxone Along With Opioids
Teaser: California, Ohio, Virginia and Arizona are among the states requiring physicians to offer patients naloxone when they give them prescriptions for the powerful painkillers.

Headlines: U.S. Top Court Rejects Bid to Block Indivior Opioid Drug Copycat
Teaser: The U.S. Supreme Court dealt a blow to Indivior Plc on Tuesday, clearing the way for a copycat version of the British pharmaceutical firm's lucrative opioid addiction treatment Suboxone Film in a victory for India-based generic drug maker Dr. Reddy's Laboratories.

Headlines: 'It's Not Every Day' This Response Rate Seen in TNBC
Teaser: A novel targeted therapy provided an incremental improvement in response rate among breast cancer patients with poor prognoses -- those with heavily pretreated metastatic triple-negative breast cancer (TNBC).

Headlines: Ibuprofen a 'Reasonable' Option for Early Pain Control After Hip Replacement
Teaser: Combining paracetamol (acetaminophen) with ibuprofen does not cut postoperative use of morphine in a clinically meaningful way relative to ibuprofen alone, in patients undergoing total hip arthroplasty (THA), results of a Danish randomized trial suggest.

Headlines: Opioid Prescriptions, Overdose Deaths Most Common Among Low-Income Whites
Teaser: Of all racial/ethnic groups in the U.S., low-income whites are more likely to receive opioid prescriptions and to die from overdoses, three studies suggest.

Headlines: Postop Complications With Sleep Apnea Seen Even After Regional Anesthesia
Teaser: Patients with obstructive sleep apnea (OSA) have an increased risk of postoperative complications and prolonged hospital stay, even in a setting with near-universal regional-anesthesia use, according to new findings.

Headlines: Endorsing Cannabis as an Opioid Substitute 'Irresponsible'
Teaser: Even as two states have passed laws to encourage clinicians to use cannabis as a substitute for opioids, some experts are warning against this practice.

Headlines: Opioid Prescriptions for Pets Surge, Mirroring Human Crisis
Teaser: Many more Americans may be getting opioids for their pets, and veterinarians appear to be prescribing increasingly potent versions of these drugs to animals, a small study suggests.

Headlines: MRI Monitoring Does Not Improve RA Treat-to-Target Outcomes
Teaser: MRI-guided treat-to-target (T2T) strategies were not more effective than conventional T2T at improving remission rates or reducing radiographic progression for RA patients in clinical remission.

Headlines: Online Activists Are Silencing Us, Scientists Say
Teaser: The emails, tweets and blog posts in the "abuse" folder that Michael Sharpe keeps on his computer continue to pile up. Eight years after he published results of a clinical trial that found some patients with chronic fatigue syndrome can get a little better with the right talking and exercise therapies, the Oxford University professor is subjected to almost daily, often anonymous, intimidation.

Headlines: Back Pain Affects One-third of American Youth
Teaser: American children and adolescents commonly experience back pain, new research shows, but data for this population are lacking.

Headlines: Pain Program Dropouts: Risk Factors Identified
Teaser: Low income, young age, anxiety, and other comorbid mental illnesses are key risk factors for high drop rates from interdisciplinary pain programs, new research suggests.

Headlines: In US, Female Genital Mutilation's Lasting Scars
Teaser: Despite global outrage over the practice, female genital mutilation or cutting is still happening worldwide, including in the United States.

Headlines: Immersive Virtual Reality Eases Trigger-Point Injection Pain
Teaser: Distracting patients from an impending and painful injection with a headset that transports them to a beautiful beach, along with soothing sounds of waves, may ease the pain of trigger-point injections.

Headlines: Novel Approach 'Drastically' Cuts Opioid Use After Surgery
Teaser: A comprehensive protocol that uses a multidisciplinary approach and is focused on the needs of the patient reduces opioid prescriptions after elective total joint arthroplasty.

Headlines: Tramadol Linked to Higher Mortality in Osteoarthritis
Teaser: For older patients with OA, tramadol was associated with significantly higher all-cause mortality compared with NSAIDs, but all-cause mortality was similar to that with codeine.

Headlines: Endometriosis Must Come 'Out of the Shadows': New Review
Teaser: New review addresses lack of awareness, unmet needs, and barriers to care in endometriosis, with the goal of improving research, diagnosis, and treatment.

Headlines: Trump Budget Seeks 12% HHS Cut, Medicaid Work Rules, FDA Boost
Teaser: The White House on Monday unveiled a budget request that proposes changes in Medicare, including its payment approach for physician services provided in offices owned by hospitals.

Headlines: Hip Exercises May Improve Walking, Pain With Knee Arthritis
Teaser: Patients with knee osteoarthritis can add hip-strengthening exercises to their workout to improve the ability to walk and maybe reduce pain, according to a research review.

Headlines: America's Opioid Epidemic: Hardest Hit States Identified
Teaser: Three states have the dubious distinction of having the largest numbers of patients admitted to the hospital and/or seen in the emergency department for opioid-related adverse events.

Headlines: Hidden FDA Reports Detail Harm Caused by Medical Devices
Teaser: The Food and Drug Administration has let medical device companies file reports of injuries and malfunctions outside a widely scrutinized public database, leaving doctors and medical sleuths in the dark.

Headlines: Knee Surgery for Torn Cartilage May Not Be Worthwhile
Teaser: Many middle-aged and older adults with a meniscal tear and knee pain are not likely to benefit from arthroscopic partial meniscectomy (APM), a review of past studies suggests.

Headlines: Allergan Depression Treatment Fails Studies
Teaser: Allergan Plc said on Wednesday its experimental add-on treatment for depression failed three late-stage studies, casting doubts over its drugs pipeline.

Headlines: Virtual Reality Hypnosis Cuts Post-Op Pain, Anxiety in Kids
Teaser: A virtual reality hypnosis technique can reduce the need for postoperative opioids and antianxiety drugs in children.

Headlines: CRC in Young Adults:  Misdiagnosed, Advanced When Found
Teaser: Colorectal cancer (CRC) in young adults is often suspected to be something else, so when it is eventually found, it is already advanced, suggest survey results. But an expert disagrees.

Headlines: OxyContin Maker Purdue Pharma Exploring Bankruptcy -Sources
Teaser: OxyContin maker Purdue Pharma LP is exploring filing for bankruptcy to address potentially significant liabilities from roughly 2,000 lawsuits alleging the drugmaker contributed to the deadly opioid crisis sweeping the United States, people familiar with the matter said on Monday.

Headlines: Explanted Mesh Doesn't Need Microscopic Assessment
Teaser: There is no value to sending a mesh specimen for microscopic pathology evaluation, regardless of the reason for removal, nor can any clinical claims be made based on pathology findings from explanted mesh, researchers say.

Headlines: Back, Neck Pain Increased in Diabetes; Key Culprits Unclear
Teaser: Possible causes may range from obesity to biochemical effects of diabetes on tissue, muscle.

Headlines: Coagulation Markers Linked to Stroke Outcome in Hyperglycemia
Teaser: Alterations in specific markers in the blood coagulation pathway may help explain the worse outcomes often seen in stroke with hyperglycemia, and glucose control could play a role, experts say.

Headlines: Childhood Anxiety Tied to School Absences
Teaser: Children with school attendance or truancy problems might be suffering from anxiety, a research review suggests.

Headlines: Drug Addiction Stigma Is Like Old Cancer Stigma
Teaser: Physicians who judge patients who have substance use disorders might want to reflect on the past stigmatization of cancer, says a cancer specialist.

Headlines: Laser Treatment of Port-wine Stains Feasible Without General Anesthesia in Infants
Teaser: Port-wine-stain birthmarks can be safely and effectively treated in early infancy with pulsed dye laser without the need for general anesthesia, according to new research.

Headlines: Radical Opioid Restriction Works for Postoperative Patients
Teaser: An ultrarestrictive opioid prescription protocol radically reduces postoperative opioid use in patients with gynecological cancer who do not have compromising outcomes.

Headlines: Stop Limiting Access to Opioid Addiction Meds, Experts Say
Teaser: A new report from the National Academies of Science seeks expanded use of methadone, buprenorphine, and naltrexone to help patients combat opioid use disorder.

Headlines: St. Louis Symphony Lowers Blood Pressure, Eases Chemo
Teaser: A cancer center in Missouri has the good fortune to be visited by two professional musicians from a renowned symphony once a month. So they did a study on the effect of the music.

Headlines: No Survival Benefit for Volatile Anesthesia in Elective CABG Surgery
Teaser: In a comparison of gas versus needle, a new pragmatic trial has shown that using a volatile anesthesia agent during elective coronary-artery bypass grafting (CABG) did not produce fewer deaths after one year.

Headlines: Cutbacks by Some Doctors Halved New Opioid Prescriptions Over 5 Years
Teaser: The rate of first-time opioid prescriptions declined 54% between 2012 and 2017 in the U.S., largely because many doctors stopped prescribing the painkillers, according to a study of more than 86 million people covered by private insurance.

Headlines: Physicians, Nurses Prioritize Mindfulness Differently
Teaser: Anxiety and stress were the most common conditions for which providers prescribed mindfulness interventions. Deep breathing and meditation were the top methods of choice.

Headlines: Rise in Pediatric IV Acetaminophen Use Drives Up Costs
Teaser: The annual cost of acetaminophen for hospitalized children increased more than six-fold from 2010 to 2017, largely due to rapid uptake of an intravenous formulation of the decades-old drug, according to new research.

Headlines: Will Curtailing Opioids Increase Violence Against Doctors?
Teaser: As doctors endeavor to comply with CDC guidelines aimed at reducing opioid use in patients experiencing non-cancer pain, it's possible they may encounter an increase in patient violence, two pain experts warn.

Headlines: Chiropractic Care Tied to Significant Reduction in Opioid Scripts
Teaser: Patients who visit a chiropractor for low-back and neck pain are less likely to receive prescription opioids than their counterparts who go to other healthcare providers, new research suggests.

Headlines: Smartphone Mindfulness App May Help Curb Loneliness
Teaser: Adults who spend just 20 minutes a day using a smartphone mindfulness training app may feel less lonely and have more social interactions than people who don't, a small experiment suggests.

Headlines: Partial Fundoplication May Have Edge in Treating GERD
Teaser: In surgical treatment of gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD), partial fundoplication (PF) prompts less dysphagia than total fundoplication (TF), according to randomized trial results reported by Scandinavian researchers.

Headlines: Novel Program Trains Nurse Practitioners to Manage Pain Patients
Teaser: In a unique educational program, nurse practitioners learned how to examine patients with shoulder and knee pain and how to determine which patients require specialist referral.

Headlines: Diagnosis, Treatment of Opioid Use Disorder in Pregnancy Tied to State Laws in US
Teaser: Patterns of diagnosis and treatment of opioid use disorder (OUD) in pregnant women in the U.S. vary significantly by region and by whether the disorder is criminalized by state laws, researchers say.

Headlines: Cuba Says USA, Not Canada, Manipulating Diplomat Health Incidents
Teaser: Cuba denounced the Trump administration on Thursday for continuing to refer to health incidents among their diplomats in Havana as "attacks" without presenting any evidence, saying it was part of a broader campaign to damage bilateral relations.

Headlines: Physicians Getting Inventive on Frontline of Opioid Crisis
Teaser: A multifaceted approach to curb the distribution and consumption of opioids and promote the safe disposal of unused drugs is required to address the largest drug crisis in the nation's history.

Headlines: Emotional Support Key to Unlocking Eating Disorders in T2D
Teaser: Eating disorders, which are common in type 1 and type 2 diabetes and can have devastating consequences, need an emphasis on emotional support if outcomes are to be improved, say UK experts.

Headlines: Novel Program Improves Chronic Pain, Stops Opioid Use
Teaser: Chronic pain patients who participated in a program that incorporates exercise, education, and counseling showed significant improvement in functional ability, pain scores, and cessation of opioids.

Headlines: Hypertonic Dextrose Injection Appears Effective for TMJ Dysfunction
Teaser: Injections of hypertonic dextrose into affected joints may improve jaw pain, function and maximal interincisal opening in patients with temporomandibular joint dysfunction, researchers report.

Headlines: Elite Hospitals Plunge Into Unproven Stem Cell Treatments
Teaser: Critics are concerned about the explosion in controversial stem cell procedures offered by clinics and, increasingly, respected hospitals.

Headlines: Purdue's Sackler Family Fights 'Inflammatory' Massachusetts Opioid Case
Teaser: Members of the Sackler family behind OxyContin maker Purdue Pharma LP have asked a judge to toss a lawsuit by Massachusetts' attorney general claiming they helped fuel the U.S. opioid epidemic, arguing it contains "misleading and inflammatory allegations."

Headlines: Medicaid Expansion Linked With More Drug Addiction Diagnosis, Treatment
Teaser: More low-income people addicted to opioids are getting diagnosed and treated with effective medication as a result of the Affordable Care Act, a new study suggests

Headlines: Woman Who Feels No Pain May Mean a Major Scientific Gain
Teaser: Jo Cameron, 71, has never experienced physical pain. Now scientists have discovered the genetic mutation behind her rare "condition" and hope to harness it in future treatments.

Headlines: New Rules Will Ease Patients' Access to EHRs, Senate Panel Says
Teaser: Sen. Lamar Alexander (R-Tenn.), head of the influential HELP committee, wants to make it easier to share and store detailed medical histories.

Headlines: Most Parents Would Support Age Restrictions for Tackle Football
Teaser: Even though there are no age restrictions on tackling in youth football in the U.S., a new survey suggests most parents would support rules prohibiting this for younger players because of the injury risk.

Headlines: China Expands Curbs on Fentanyl, Blames U.S. for Its Abuse
Teaser: China will expand the range of fentanyl-related substances it defines as controlled narcotics, a Chinese security official said on Monday, blaming U.S. culture for abuse of the drug.

Headlines: U.S. Woman Says Strict Christian Parents Subjected Her to FGM
Teaser: After becoming the first sport to ban Tramadol, cycling is looking to use the same "health reasons" justification to prohibit the use of corticosteroids by 2020, International Cycling Union (UCI) president David Lappartient told Reuters.

Headlines: Cycling-Sport Looking to Ban Corticosteroids in 2020 - UCI Boss
Teaser: A surge in opioid overdose deaths prompted 49 states and the District of Columbia to offer Narcan without a prescription. CDC data showed that nearly 48,000 people died from opioid overdose in 2017.

Headlines: Local Leaders Back Narcan to Stop Overdose Deaths
Teaser: New findings in treating myalgic encephalomyselitis/chronic fatigue syndrome (ME/CFS) contradict previous observations and preliminary trial results; illness heterogeneity was cited as a research challenge.

Headlines: Rituximab Fails to Improve Symptoms in ME/CFS
Teaser: Improvised nasal naloxone devices (INND) commonly used by first responders and the general public deliver significantly less naloxone than regulator-approved devices, according to a study from the National Institute on Drug Abuse (NIDA).

Headlines: Improvised Nasal Naloxone Devices Might Deliver Insufficient Medication
Teaser: Patterns of opioid prescribing in palliative care changed significantly after the parenteral-opioid shortage was announced, and patients were less likely to achieve clinically improved pain, according to new findings.

Headlines: Parenteral-Opioid Shortage Linked to Worse Pain Control in Palliative-Care Patients
Teaser: Purdue Pharma LP fraudulently transferred funds to members of the wealthy Sackler family who control the OxyContin maker despite knowing it faced major liabilities that had made it already insolvent, New York's attorney general alleged on Thursday.

Headlines: N.Y. Accuses Opioid Maker Purdue of Illegal Fund Transfers to Sacklers
Teaser: Uterine-fibroid embolization (UFE) effectively treats uterine fibroids with fewer complications compared with myomectomy, a retrospective study suggests.

Headlines: Fewer Complications With Uterine-fibroid Embolization Vs Surgery
Teaser: Purdue Pharma LP and members of the wealthy Sackler family that own the OxyContin maker have reached a $270 million settlement to resolve a lawsuit by the state of Oklahoma accusing the company of helping fuel an opioid abuse epidemic, a person familiar with the matter said on Tuesday.

Headlines: OxyContin Maker Purdue Reaches $270 Mln Settlement in Oklahoma Opioid Case -source
Teaser: For patients undergoing stem cell transplants for cancer, palliative care should be introduced at diagnosis to provide care focused on the person, argues an expert.

Headlines: Palliative Care Should Start at Diagnosis for HSCT Patients
Teaser: Oklahoma's top court on Monday declined to delay a landmark trial set for May in a multibillion-dollar lawsuit accusing OxyContin maker Purdue Pharma LP and two other drugmakers of helping fuel an opioid abuse and overdose epidemic in the state.

Headlines: U.S. Charges Pummel Drugmaker Indivior, Hurt Reckitt
Teaser: Indivior Plc lost three-quarters of its stock market value on Wednesday and former parent Reckitt Benckiser also fell after the U.S. Justice Department accused the British drugmaker of illegally boosting prescriptions for its blockbuster opioid addiction treatment.

Headlines: 'Prehab,' SSRIs May Reduce Postsurgical Opioid Use
Teaser: A strict preoperative rehabilitation protocol (prehab) may reduce opioid use after spinal surgery, while use of antidepressants is linked to reduced opioid use after knee surgery, new studies suggest.

Headlines: Targeted Drug Delivery for Cancer Pain Cuts Costs, Hospital Time
Teaser: Targeted drug delivery (TDD) reduces costs and healthcare utilization when added to conventional medical management (CMM) for patients with cancer-related pain, according to new findings.

Headlines: Brain Imaging Reveals Neuroinflammation in Migraine With Aura
Teaser: Previous research suggests that neuroinflammation is involved with migraine. A new imaging study identifies its role in migraine with aura as well.

Headlines: Yoga May Help Ease Mood Disorders in Parkinson's Patients
Teaser: People with Parkinson's disease may have less anxiety and depression when they practice yoga focused on mindfulness and breathing exercises, a small experiment suggests.

Headlines: Extensive Peritoneal Lavage Cuts Complications From Gastric-Cancer Surgery
Teaser: Extensive intraoperative peritoneal lavage (EIPL) during resection of peritoneal metastasis from gastric cancer increases safety and reduces short-term complications, according to Chinese researchers.

Headlines: Medical Cannabis Use Differs for Patients With, Without Cancer
Teaser: Medical marijuana users gradually shift to cannabis formulations higher in tetrahydrocannabinol (THC) over time, according to new findings.

Headlines: Marijuana Edibles May Be More Harmful Than Thought
Teaser: In a 2015 study, researchers evaluated 75 marijuana edibles and found only 17% accurately labeled, underlining concerns of patients unknowingly getting too much THC.

Headlines: Novel, 'Non-Habit Forming' Medication May Reduce Low Back Pain
Teaser: Randomized controlled trial findings suggest possible benefits for a pharmaceutical-grade formulation of the neurosteroid pregnenolone as a "non-habit-forming" treatment for chronic low back pain.

Headlines: Acupuncture in the ED a Beneficial Non-Opioid Option for Pain
Teaser: Acupuncture administered in the emergency department is both feasible and beneficial as a non-opioid, non-pharmacologic option for treating patients with less severe pain, new research says.

Headlines: Pain-Care Specialist Agrees to Testify Against Purdue, Other Drug Makers -Court Documents
Teaser: A physician ally of Purdue Pharma LP whose views helped drive the explosive growth in the use of addictive pain relievers for common aches and pains in the United States has agreed to testify against the OxyContin maker and other drug companies, newly disclosed court records show.

Headlines: Abrupt Discontinuation of Opioids Dangerous, FDA Warns
Teaser: Opioid-dependent patients who suddenly stop the medication or rapidly decrease the dose may suffer serious withdrawal symptoms, uncontrolled pain, and psychological distress, the FDA reports.

Headlines: Teaching Patients to Regulate Emotions May Ease Chronic Pain
Teaser: A novel primary care-based program, designed to recalibrate negative emotions associated with chronic pain, shows benefits in older adults with varying levels of cognitive function.

Headlines: Acetaminophen Tied to Stroke Risk in Older Adults With Diabetes
Teaser: Caution urged in interpreting findings, as acetaminophen is still considered safe to use in elderly patients.

Headlines: CDC Clarifies: Okay to Prescribe Opioids for Cancer Pain
Teaser: The CDC has issued a clarification letter about its Guideline for Prescribing Opioids for Chronic Pain and says it does not want to block appropriate use of the powerful analgesics.

Headlines: Disturbed Sleeps Derails Therapy for Complicated Grief
Teaser: Cognitive grief treatment surpasses antidepressants alone for complicated grief, but sleep disturbances, which are common, can derail treatment.

Headlines: Activated Charcoal Bag Tied to Big Rise in Proper Disposal of Unused Opioids After Surgery
Teaser: Post-op patients given an activated charcoal bag upon discharge showed close to a four-fold increase in appropriate disposal of unused opioids, researchers say.

Headlines: Early Treatment of Vulvovaginal Atrophy May Prevent Distressing Symptoms
Teaser: Treatment of vulvovaginal atrophy (VVA) in postmenopausal women should start as early as possible and continue as long as required, researchers say.

Headlines: FDA Warns Lab Against Marketing Tests Linking Genes, Drug Reaction
Teaser: Inova Genomics is cited for illegally marketing MediMap genetic tests that claim to predict a patient's response to antidepressants and other medications.

Headlines: Drug Company Founder Put 'Profits Over Patients' to Push Opioid -U.S. Prosecutor
Teaser: The founder of Insys Therapeutics Inc put profits over patients' safety by bribing doctors to prescribe an addictive fentanyl spray, fueling the U.S. opioid epidemic, a federal prosecutor said Thursday at the end of a landmark trial.

Headlines: Trump Says He Is Holding Big Pharma Accountable in Opioid Fight
Teaser: U.S. President Donald Trump touted progress in the fight against opioid abuse on Wednesday and promised to hold drugmakers accountable for their part in the crisis, a day after his administration brought its first related criminal charges against a major drug distributor and company executives.

Headlines: Drug-Diverting Nurse Blamed for Washington HCV Outbreak
Teaser: In the era of widespread opioid abuse, narcotic diversion by staff highlights need for enhanced drug storage security and monitoring of drug-dispensing systems at hospitals.

Headlines: Docs Fall Short in Following Opioid Prescribing Guidance
Teaser: Recommendations on safer opioid prescribing for chronic pain have not been consistently applied, which could risk patient health, federal health officials say.

Headlines: U.S. Brings First Criminal Case Against Major Drug Distributor Over Opioids
Teaser: The U.S. government on Tuesday filed its first criminal charges against a major drug distributor and company executives over their alleged roles in fueling the nation's opioid epidemic by putting profits ahead of patients' safety.

Headlines: Albuterol Before Tonsillectomy Protects Against Respiratory Problems
Teaser: Preoperative inhaled albuterol can help protect against perioperative respiratory adverse events in young children undergoing anesthesia for tonsillectomy, according to data from the Australian REACT trial.

Headlines: Teva Scraps Cluster Headache Program
Teaser: Teva Pharmaceutical Industries Ltd said on Tuesday it would stop developing its migraine drug, Ajovy, for treating cluster headaches.

Headlines: SCS with Closed-Loop System Superior to Open-Loop
Teaser: The first randomized phase 2 trial to evaluate outcomes for spinal cord stimulation finds an advantage for an investigational closed-loop system over open-loop.

Headlines: Mislabeled Fentanyl Patches Spark Nationwide Recall
Teaser: Two lots of transdermal patches from the Fentanyl Transdermal System for pain management are being voluntarily recalled by the manufacturer because of product mislabeling.

Headlines: Lower Dose of Pfizer-Lilly Painkiller Misses Main Goals in Late Stage Study
Teaser: A lower dose of non-opioid painkiller developed by Pfizer Inc and Eli Lilly and Co failed to meet main goals in a late-stage study in patients with moderate-to-severe osteoarthritis of the hip or knee, the companies said on Thursday in releasing topline results of the study.

Headlines: Catastrophizing May Help Explain Link Between PTSD, Chronic Pain
Teaser: Pain catastrophizing mediates the relationship between post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD) symptoms and chronic pain, according to a new study.

Headlines: HHS Awards Funds to 4 States to Cut Opioid OD Deaths by 40%
Teaser: The money will fund research to test whether hyper-local integrated programs can drastically reduce overdose deaths in those areas within the next 3 years

Headlines: Parent-Child Reminiscing Affects Children's Pain Memories
Teaser: How parents and children reminisce about the child's recent surgery affects the child's pain memory, researchers from Canada report.

Headlines: FDA Okays First Generic Naloxone Nasal Spray for Opioid Overdose
Teaser: The FDA has granted final approval for the first generic naloxone hydrochloride nasal spray for reversing or stopping the effects from an opioid overdose.

Headlines: Thousands Feared at Risk After Mexico Reforms HIV+ Regime
Teaser: Drug testing methods in sport are still rooted in the 1970s and better technology is needed to catch more than "dopey dopers", former World Anti-Doping head David Howman said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Doping-Drug Testing Methods Stuck in the 1970s, Says Former WADA
Teaser: Dozens of medical professionals in Appalachia, a region hard-hit by the U.S. opioid crisis, have been charged with writing hundreds of thousands of illegal prescriptions and committing healthcare fraud, federal prosecutors said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Dozens of Doctors in 7 States Charged in Opioid Fraud Bust
Teaser: Previous research suggests acetaminophen may blunt empathy for others undergoing negative experiences. A new study suggests it may also affect empathy for others who are having positive experiences.

Headlines: Acetaminophen May Blunt Empathy
Teaser: People who regularly use cannabis may need more than twice the usual dose of anesthesia for surgery, a U.S. study suggests.

Headlines: Cannabis Users May Need More Anesthesia for Surgery
Teaser: An intensive, interdisciplinary program focused on self-management of chronic pain is linked to significant symptom improvement and brain volume changes, as shown on objective neuroimaging measures.

Headlines: 'Self-Management' Program Cuts Pain, Increases Brain Volume
Teaser: Amid growing support for cannabis in the treatment of chronic pain, a new study is the latest to show no improvement in pain by adding cannabis to opioid treatment.

Headlines: Topical Anesthetic May Not Reduce Distress From Nasogastric-Tube Insertion in Young Kids
Teaser: A nasal spray containing lidocaine and phenylephrine appears to be no better than placebo in relieving procedure-related distress in infants and young children undergoing nasogastric-tube insertion, Australian researchers have found.

Headlines: Sexual Function and Intimacy Impaired in Inflammatory Arthritis
Teaser: Patients with inflammatory arthritis (IA) report significant impairments in sexual function and intimate relationships, researchers from Australia report.

Headlines: Compounded Bioidentical Hormone Replacement Scrutinized
Teaser: An ad hoc committee of the National Academies of Sciences, Engineering, and Medicine held its second information gathering session on compounded bioidentical hormone replacement therapy.

Headlines: Medical Cannabis Safe, Effective in the Elderly
Teaser: Researchers reported that the drug provided relief from chronic pain, sleep disorders, and anxiety related to a variety of diseases.

Headlines: DUOGLOBE Interim Results: Intestinal Gel Cuts PD 'Off' Time
Teaser: Researchers release additional results looking at levodopa-carbidopa intestinal gel to help lessen motor fluctuations and dyskinesia in people with advanced Parkinson's disease.

Headlines: McKesson to Pay $37 Million to Resolve West Virginia Opioid Lawsuit
Teaser: Drug distributor McKesson Corp has agreed to pay $37 million to resolve a lawsuit by the state of West Virginia seeking to hold it responsible for contributing to the opioid epidemic, the state's attorney general said on Thursday.

Headlines: Drug Company Founder, Execs Convicted of Bribe Scheme That Fueled U.S. Opioid Crisis
Teaser: The founder of Insys Therapeutics Inc and four colleagues were found guilty on Thursday of bribing doctors to prescribe the drugmaker's addictive painkiller, helping to drive the U.S. opioid drug abuse crisis.

Headlines: High-Dose, Single-Fraction SBRT Likely Effective for Non-Spine Bone Metastases
Teaser: Single-fraction stereotactic body radiotherapy (SBRT) seems to be an effective option for patients with painful non-spine bone metastases and achieved higher pain response rates than standard multifraction radiotherapy (MFRT) in a phase 2 noninferiority study.

Headlines: Enhanced Recovery After Surgery Should Be Standard of Care
Teaser: Enhanced recovery after surgery (ERAS) should be the new standard of surgical care in Canada, despite challenges in implementing such programs, researchers report.

Headlines: Diabetic Amputations a 'Shameful Metric' of Inadequate Care
Teaser: In California, people who are black or Latino are more than twice as likely as whites to undergo amputations related to diabetes, a Kaiser Health News analysis found. The pattern is not unique to California.

Headlines: Teens With Chronic Pain May Find Support on YouTube
Teaser: Teens with painful chronic illnesses may find that YouTube can provide a support network, a new study suggests.

Headlines: FDA Approves First Vaccine for Dengue, With Restrictions
Teaser: Dengvaxia is for the prevention of dengue disease caused by all dengue virus serotypes in people aged 9 to 16 years who have previously had laboratory-confirmed dengue infection and who live in endemic areas.

Headlines: 'Whitish Patch': Increase in Oral Dysplasia in Young Adults
Teaser: Dentists report seeing a 'most concerning' increase in asymptomatic young adults who have high-grade precancers and no known risk factors.

Headlines: Food Firms Globally Whip Up Wacky Ways to Battle Bad Diets
Teaser: Alosetron and ramosetron appear to be the best medications for treating irritable bowel syndrome (IBS) with diarrhea (IBS-D) or mixed stool pattern (IBS-M), according to a network meta-analysis.

Headlines: Alosetron, Ramosetron Best Medications for IBS With Diarrhea or Mixed Stool Pattern
Teaser: Longer follow-up of patients with the Mobi-C cervical disc show maintenance of scores for pain, neck disability, and neurologic status, with no worsening of radiographic adjacent segment degeneration.

Headlines: Improvements Sustained 10 Years After Cervical Disc Replacement
Teaser: Findings point to the need to screen adrenal function of chronic opioid users.

Headlines: Hidden in the Epidemic: Opioid-Induced Adrenal Insufficiency
Teaser: After dozens of health care workers were charged with illegally prescribing opioids in Appalachia, local health agencies are trying to make sure chronic pain patients don't fall through the cracks.

Headlines: Amid Opioid Prescriber Crackdown, Officials Reach Out to Pain Patients
Teaser: Environmental factors appear to play a bigger role than genetics in shaping children's risk for cavities, a study of Australian twins suggests.

Headlines: Kids' Cavities Probably Not Caused by Bad Genes
Teaser: Sixmo consists of four small rods implanted in the upper arm that continuously deliver low levels of buprenorphine for 6 months with promises of boosting adherence to treatment.

Headlines: Children of Opioid Users More Likely to Attempt Suicide - U.S. Study
Teaser: The U.S. opioid crisis is taking a toll on children of users as a study published this week showed they were more likely to attempt suicide.

Headlines: Improper Proton Pump Inhibitor Prescriptions Criticized
Teaser: Popularity of the stomach- and intestine-protecting drugs has skyrocketed, but related adverse events, like osteoporotic fractures, C difficile infection, and pneumonia, are problematic.

Headlines: UK Doctors Launch Guide for Syrian Medics Battling to Save Children's Lives
Teaser: In acute pancreatitis, the opioid pentazocine relieves pain better than the nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) diclofenac, a randomized controlled trial from India shows.

Headlines: Opioids Crisis Has Spread Beyond United States - OECD
Teaser: Children and teens who are bullied are more than twice as likely as peers who are not victimized to take painkillers, a study of school kids in Iceland suggests.

Headlines: Pentazocine Cuts Acute Pancreatitis Pain Better Than Diclofenac
Teaser: Migraine patients with dry eye (DE) are more likely to have symptoms suggestive of neuropathy than DE patients who don't have migraines, according to new findings.

Headlines: Bullied Kids More Likely to Use Painkillers
Teaser: The FDA has approved avelumab in combination with the tyrosine kinase inhibitor (TKI) axitinib for the first-line treatment of advanced renal cell carcinoma (RCC).

Headlines: Neuropathy May Drive Dry Eye in Migraine Patients
Teaser: In acute primary angle closure (APAC), subconjunctival dexamethasone injection helps high intraocular pressure (IOP) drop more quickly and improves treatment success rate, researchers in China report.

Headlines: FDA Okays Another Immunotherapy Plus TKI for Advanced RCC
Teaser: Patients with opioid-induced constipation reported similar preference rates and strong preferences for treatment with either naloxegol or PEG 3350.

Headlines: Dexamethasone Injection May Speed IOP Drop in Angle-Closure Glaucoma
Teaser: Opioid use disorder affects whites and people of color equally. However, new findings show large disparities in access to a leading evidence-based treatment.

Headlines: Patients With OIC Prefer Naloxegol, PEG 3350 Equally
Teaser: A united front among members of the billionaire Sackler family behind painkiller OxyContin is showing signs of strain from litigation over who bears responsibility for the deadly U.S. opioid epidemic.

Headlines: Dramatic Racial, Ethnic Disparities in Access to Buprenorphine
Teaser: China has pledged to stem a flood of the synthetic opioid fentanyl onto America's streets, where it kills thousands of people a month, but U.S. security experts are skeptical about whether Beijing is willing, or even able, to follow through.

Headlines: Following Opioid Suits, Family Behind Deadly OxyContin Squabbles
Teaser: In states where pharmacists were allowed to sell the opioid antidote naloxone without a prescription, fewer people died from opioid overdoses, a new U.S. study finds.

Headlines: Trade Frictions Raise Questions About China's Fentanyl Promise
Teaser: Many patients with gallstones and abdominal pain don't feel better after a procedure to remove their gallbladder, and a recent study suggests this surgery may not always be necessary.

Headlines: Opioid Overdose Deaths Decline When Pharmacists Can Dispense Naloxone
Teaser: Denver will become the first city in the United States to decriminalize magic mushrooms, based on final unofficial results on Wednesday of a ballot initiative about the hallucinogenic drug.

Headlines: Gallbladders May Be Removed Too Often
Teaser: Americans filled 5.8 billion prescriptions in 2018, but prescriptions for opioids had the largest single-year drop ever recorded.

Headlines: Denver Votes to Become First U.S. City to Decriminalize 'Magic Mushrooms'
Teaser: Children bleeding from severe traumas like gunshot wounds can be treated with adult-sized tourniquets, a small study suggests.

Headlines: US Prescriptions Hit New High in 2018, but Opioid Scripts Dip
Teaser: A tool called VIONE is helping veterans, families and staff at VA hospitals identify and reduce or discontinue unnecessary, ineffective, and inappropriate medications.

Headlines: Adult Tourniquets Work for School-Age Kids in an Emergency
Teaser: Advertising and social media have led to confusion about the term, and physicians need to educate patients on which procedures are medically necessary, which are cosmetic, and which can be harmful.

Headlines: Jury Still Out on Best Settings, Duration of Ultrasound Treatment for Chronic Joint Pain
Teaser: It is still too early to make definite recommendations on the settings or duration of therapeutic ultrasound for chronic pain in the knee, hip or shoulder, the authors of a systematic review say.

Headlines: Ohio Doctor Charged With 25 Counts of Murder for Giving Fatal Opioid Doses
Teaser: An Ohio doctor was charged with 25 counts of murder for administering high and sometimes fatal doses of opioid painkillers to dozens of very sick patients, prosecutors said on Wednesday.

Headlines: In Sudan Crackdown, Bullets Fly as Doctors Struggle
Teaser: During the chaos of a deadly raid on Sudanese protesters at a pro-democracy sit-in Khartoum on Monday, a man grimaced in pain as doctors sewed his ear back together with no anesthetic.

Headlines: Best Pain Management Practices Outlined in New HHS Report
Teaser: The Pain Management Task Force of HHS released its final report on best practices in pain management, emphasizing a patient-centered, balanced, individualized approach.

Headlines: Diamonds Are Forever, but TKIs in CML Don't Have to Be
Teaser: Patients with chronic myeloid leukemia who undergo lifelong therapy with tyrosine kinase inhibitors have excellent outcomes. But treatment may not have to be forever.

Headlines: Psychiatrists' Acceptance of Medicaid Patients Remains Low
Teaser: Medicaid expansion has done nothing to ease the problem of access to mental health services because few psychiatrists take Medicaid patients.

Headlines: #KuToo No More! Japanese Women Take Stand Against High Heels
Teaser: A social media campaign against dress codes and expectations that women wear high heels at work has gone viral in Japan, with thousands joining the #KuToo movement.

Headlines: In States With Most Overdose Deaths, Poor Patients Struggle to Find Treatment
Teaser: Poor people with opioid use disorders may struggle to find doctors to prescribe the anti-addiction drug buprenorphine in U.S. states with the highest overdose death rates, a new study suggests.

Headlines: Expanding Arthritis Therapies Top Agenda at EULAR
Teaser: Much-needed options for osteoarthritis will be highlighted at the upcoming European League Against Rheumatism (EULAR) Congress.

Headlines: Integrated Care of HIV, Substance-Use Disorder May Be Cost Effective, but Barriers Remain
Teaser: Integrating the care of patients with co-morbid HIV and substance-use disorder could save money, according to a new systematic review.

Headlines: 'We Had No Idea': Overdose Victim's Dad Testifies in J&J Oklahoma Opioid Trial

Headlines: A Doctor Speaks Out About Ageism in Medicine
Teaser: A frank conversation with geriatrician and author Dr. Louise Aronson about medicine's biased treatment of older adults and what needs to change.

Headlines: J&J's Greed Helped Fuel U.S. Opioid Crisis, Oklahoma Claims at Trial
Teaser: Johnson & Johnson's greed led the drugmaker to use deceptive marketing to create an oversupply of painkillers that fueled the U.S. opioid epidemic, the state of Oklahoma alleged at the start of the first trial to result from lawsuits over the drug crisis.

Headlines: BioMarin Says Data Shows Hemophilia Gene Therapy Effects Could Wane
