Headlines: Big Drug Distributor Pays $22 Mln to Settle U.S. Opioid Charges
Teaser: Morris & Dickson Co, one of the largest U.S. wholesale drug distributors, agreed to pay $22 million in civil penalties to settle U.S. government charges that it failed to report thousands of suspicious orders of the opioids hydrocodone and oxycodone.

Headlines: Nonopioids as Effective as Opioids for Some Cancer Patients
Teaser: A large analysis of published studies found that at least for some patients, nonopioid drugs were effective for relieving chronic cancer pain.

Headlines: Oklahoma Takes on Drugmakers J&J, Teva in Landmark Opioid Trial
Teaser: Gail Box vividly remembers the day in May 2011 when she first learned her 22-year-old son Austin, a University of Oklahoma linebacker, was abusing opioid painkillers: It was the day he died of an overdose.

Headlines: FDA Okays Smartphone-Controlled Wearable for Migraine Pain
Teaser: Worn on the upper arm and controlled via a smartphone, the Nerivio Migra utilizes remote electrical neuromodulation to relieve acute migraine pain.

Headlines: JPMorgan Cuts Ties With OxyContin Maker Purdue Pharma -Sources
Teaser: JPMorgan Chase & Co has cut ties with Purdue Pharma LP over the OxyContin maker's alleged role in the U.S. opioid crisis, forcing it to find a new bank to manage cash and bill payments, people familiar with the matter said on Thursday.

Headlines: U.S. Imposes Sanctions on Argentina-Based Online Pharmacies for Opioids
Teaser: The U.S. Treasury Department on Thursday placed sanctions on Goldpharma, an Argentina-based network of online pharmacies that it said contributed to the opioid crisis by selling clandestinely produced narcotics to customers in the United States.

Headlines: Pharmacies May Not Stock Naloxone, Despite Statewide Orders
Teaser: More than three years after Pennsylvania issued a statewide order expanding access to the life-saving opioid antidote naloxone, the product was still hard to purchase in Philadelphia pharmacies, researchers found.

Headlines: Listening to Music May Ease Cancer Patients' Pain
Teaser: Listening to music at home may reduce cancer patients' pain and fatigue and ease symptoms like loss of appetite and difficulty concentrating, according to research from Taiwan.

Headlines: Telehealth Abortion Proves Safe in US Test, Researchers Say
Teaser: A TelAbortion approach can safely help women obtain medical abortions in states where the procedure is legal but have few clinics that provide the service, new data show.

Headlines: Depression Called a 'Core Symptom' of MS
Teaser: MRI studies show multiple sclerosis brain changes linked to depression, but randomized controlled trials of antidepressants in this population are lacking.

Headlines: Trauma Patients at High Risk for Later Social Dysfunction
Teaser: Nearly half of trauma patients experience social deficits that make it harder for them to interact with friends and stay involved in the community, a recent study suggests.

Headlines: Kenyan FGM Survivor's Film Urges Women Not to 'Die in Silence'
Teaser: Military women who are sexually assaulted may be at an especially high risk of developing lasting sexual pain, a U.S. study suggests.

Headlines: For Female Vets, Sex Assault in Military Boosts Odds of Lasting Sexual Pain
Teaser: In March, esketamine was approved by the FDA for the treatment of intractable depression, but critics say the FDA was given little evidence of the drug's efficacy and its safety for long-term use.

Headlines: FDA Overlooked Red Flags in Drugmaker's Testing of New Depression Medicine
Teaser: Deaths from suicide, alcohol, and drug overdoses are reaching crisis levels across the nation, although individual states are affected in dramatically different ways, a new report shows.

Headlines: US Deaths From Suicide, Drugs, Alcohol Reach Crisis Levels
Teaser: Lymphogranuloma venereum proctitis can be mistaken for inflammatory bowel disease (IBD), especially in men who have sex with men (MSM) and others who engage in unprotected anoreceptive sexual intercourse, researchers from Italy report.

Headlines: Lymphogranuloma Venereum Proctitis Can Mimic IBD
Teaser: Drugmaker Insys Therapeutics Inc filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection on Monday, about a week after agreeing to pay $225 million to settle a U.S. probe into bribes it paid to doctors for prescribing a powerful opioid medication.

Headlines: Opioid Drugmaker Insys Therapeutics Files for Bankruptcy
Teaser: Based on previous research, cannabis has been enthusiastically embraced as a means to reduce opioid overdose. That conclusion is mistaken, this study finds.

Headlines: Medical Cannabis No Solution to the Opioid Crisis
Teaser: Declining membership, a reduction in industry support, and opioid lawsuits have all led to the demise of the AIPM, an organization that promoted integrative approaches to pain management.

Headlines: Dwindling Support, Lawsuits Blamed for Pain Society's Demise
Teaser: Starting in January 2020, Medicare will require that providers use a certified clinical decision support system when ordering advanced imaging tests for eight common conditions.

Headlines: Ordering Advanced Imaging? Get Ready for New Medicare Rules
Teaser: Rates of nonsuicidal self-harm have tripled since 2000, especially among adolescent girls and young women.

Headlines: Rates of Self-Harm Soar, Especially Among Girls, Young Women
Teaser: Preliminary data suggest cholinesterase inhibitors may have a therapeutic role in opioid use disorder.

Headlines: Alzheimer's Drug May Help Treat Opioid Addiction
Teaser: A unit of Insys Therapeutics Inc pleaded guilty on Friday to fraud charges as part of an $225 million deal with the U.S. Justice Department resolving claims that the drugmaker bribed doctors to prescribe an addictive opioid medication.

Headlines: Unit of Drugmaker Insys Pleads Guilty to U.S. Opioid Bribe Scheme
Teaser: Opioid prescriptions fell 33% in 5 years and the use of drug monitoring programs by physicians jumped 56% in 1 year. But barriers to care mean that patients will keep dying, an AMA report says.

Headlines: Barriers to Care Threaten Physicians' Progress on Opioids
Teaser: Insys Therapeutics Inc agreed to pay $225 million and an operating unit will plead guilty to fraud to settle probes into their payment of kickbacks to induce doctors to prescribe highly addictive opioids, the U.S. Department of Justice said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Insys to Pay $225 Mln, Plead Guilty in U.S. Over Opioid Kickbacks
Teaser: When a Californian company founded by a U.S. veteran wounded in Afghanistan sought to register a new medical device this year, it turned to Europe before the United States. The European approvals system had long been quicker, the company said, but the introduction of new rules is changing all that.

Headlines: Vaginal Erbium-Laser Treatment May Improve Sexual Function in Women With Breast-Cancer History
Teaser: Vaginal erbium-laser treatment appears to improve vaginal health and sexual function in postmenopausal women with a history of breast cancer, researchers from Brazil report.

Headlines: FDA Approves First Drug for Neuromyelitis Optica
Teaser: The US Food and Drug Administration has approved eculizumab for the first treatment of adult patients with the rare autoimmune disease neuromyelitis optical spectrum disorder (NMOSD).

Headlines: Opioid Use Booming as Tramadol Crisis Emerges in Africa - U.N. Drug Report
Teaser: Synthetic opioid use is booming, the United Nations said on Wednesday in a worldwide drug report that showed deaths in the United States from overdoses still rising and a "crisis" of tramadol use emerging in parts of Africa.

Headlines: Vitamin Deficiencies May Be the Only Sign of Celiac Disease
Teaser: Adults with undiagnosed celiac disease often have nutrient deficiencies as the only sign of the condition, researchers say.

Headlines: Drug-Disposal Bag Helps Families Properly Dispose of Unused Opioids After Kidâ€™s Surgery
Teaser: Providing drug-disposal bags increases the likelihood that families will properly dispose of unused opioids after their children's surgery, researchers report.

Headlines: What's Hot at EAN 2019?
Teaser: Neuroinflammation, an emerging hot topic in the field, is the overarching theme of the European Academy of Neurology, the biggest general neurology conference in Europe.

Headlines: Opioid Overdose More Likely if Family Member Has Prescription
Teaser: Opioid overdoses may be much more likely to happen in families when somebody in the household has been prescribed these drugs, a U.S. study suggests.

Headlines: Team Model, Big Data Bring Precision Medicine to Primary Care
Teaser: Collection of patient data and an eclectic team approach introduced precision medicine into primary care.

Headlines: Hydroxyurea Remains Underused in Children With Sickle Cell Disease
Teaser: Despite recent increases in use of hydroxyurea for sickle cell disease (SCD), only about one in four children with SCD received hydroxyurea in 2015, according to an analysis of Medicaid data.

Headlines: 1 in 3 Survivors Still in Pain Years After Cancer Treatment
Teaser: A year after finishing treatment for their cancer, 1 in 3 survivors â€” which amounts to 5 million Americans â€” report that they are still in pain, some severe enough to limit their lives.

Headlines: Endometriosis: Long-term Opioids, Concomitant Benzos Common
Teaser: Women with endometriosis were more likely to use opioids for a long period and to use benzodiazepines concomitantly compared with women who did not have endometriosis, a study found.

Headlines: CDC Clarifies Diagnostic Testing for Individuals Who Could Have Either Dengue or Zika
Teaser: Nucleic-acid-amplification tests (NAATs) should be used to differentiate dengue from Zika virus infection in most patients with clinical illnesses compatible with either infection, according to a new report from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC).

Headlines: Gynecologic Oncologist Faces Criminal Charges for Sexual Assault
Teaser: A lawsuit has been filed against a UCLA gynecologic oncologist who is also facing criminal charges for sexual assault.

Headlines: Tanezumab Eases Severe Osteoarthritis Pain
Teaser: The monoclonal antibody is a new opioid-sparing strategy in osteoarthritis, delegates heard at the European League Against Rheumatism 2019 Congress, but some cases of joint destruction remain.

Headlines: Refugees Have High Burden of Mental Health Problems
Teaser: Refugees and asylum seekers fleeing conflict in their homeland often have high levels of psychological distress and should undergo routine mental health screening at arrival to a new country, researchers said at the North American Refugee Health Conference held June 14 to 16 in Toronto, Canada.

Headlines: U.S. Teen Suicides Rising, Especially Among Boys
Teaser: For nearly a decade, suicide rates have been climbing among U.S. teens, with an especially pronounced increase in boys recently, a new study suggests.

Headlines: MABs Successfully Treat Immunotherapy-Related Myocarditis
Teaser: Alemtuzumab and abatacept were both successfully used in patients with steroid-refractory myocarditis that developed during treatment with immune checkpoint inhibitors.

Headlines: Mail-Order Medicine: Prescribe With Caution
Teaser: A California physician surrendered his license after prescribing drugs with only the patient information from an online questionnaire, and there are still 'unanswered questions' about regulation.

Headlines: Nurse Accused of Stealing Opioids, Replacing Them With Tap Water
Teaser: At a National Cancer Institute-designated cancer center, a registered nurse allegedly stole opioids and covered up the theft by refilling the depleted syringes with water.

Headlines: Lawyers Pitch Plan to Include Entire U.S. in Opioid Settlement Talks
Teaser: Lawyers representing county and municipal governments accusing drug manufacturers and distributors of fueling the U.S. opioid epidemic proposed a novel plan on Friday that would allow every community nationally to participate in negotiating billions of dollars in settlements.
